original: oṃ namo ratnatrayāya
analyzed: om namaḥ ratnatrayāya
translated: Om, homage to the Three Jewels.

original: p / // /evaṃ mayā śrutam/
analyzed: mayā śrutam
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekasin samaye bhagavān śrāvastyāṃ viharati sma/
analyzed: ekasin samaye bhagavān śrāvastyām viharati sma
translated: At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī,

original: jetavane anāthapiṇḍadasyaārāme/🔽p / // /athaāyuṣmān ānandaḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya śrāvastīṃ mahānagarīṃ piṇḍāya prāvikṣat/
analyzed: jetavane anāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme  ānandaḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya śrāvastīm mahā nagarīm piṇḍāya prāvikṣat
translated: in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.🔽Then the Venerable Ānanda, having dressed in the morning, taking his bowl and robe, entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: athaāyuṣmān ānandaḥ śrāvastīṃ piṇḍāya caritvā kṛtabhaktakṛtyo yenānyatamam udapānaṃ tenaupasaṃkrāntaḥ/
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ śrāvastīm piṇḍāya caritvā kṛta bhakta kṛtyaḥ yena anyatamam udapānam tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda, having wandered for alms in Śrāvastī and returning from his alms round after his meal, approached a certain well.

original: p / // /tena khalu samayena tasminn udapāne prakṛtir nāma mātaṅgadārikā udakam uddharate sma/
analyzed: khalu samayena tasmin udapāne prakṛtiḥ nāma mātaṅga dārikā udakam uddharate sma
translated: At that time, in that well, a Mātaṅga girl named Prakṛti was drawing water.

original: athaāyuṣmān ānandaḥ prakṛtiṃ mātaṅgadārikām etad avocat/
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ prakṛtim mātaṅga dārikām etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti:

original: dehi me bhagini pānīyaṃ pāsyāmi/
analyzed: dehi me bhagini pānīyam pāsyāmi
translated: Give me water, sister, to drink.

original: p / // /evaṃ kite prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikāyuṣmantam ānandam idam avocat/
analyzed: kite prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā āyuṣmantam ānandam idam avocat
translated: Thus addressed, the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti said this to the Venerable Ānanda:

original: mātaṅgadārikāham asmi bhadantānanda/
analyzed: mātaṅga dārikā aham asmi bhadanta ānanda
translated: I am a Mātaṅga girl, Bhadanta Ānanda.

original: naahaṃ te bhagini kulaṃ vā jātiṃ vā pṛcchāmi/
analyzed: na aham te bhagini kulam vā jātim vā pṛcchāmi
translated: Sister, I do not ask you about your family or caste.

original: api tu sacette parityaktaṃ pānīyaṃ dehi pāsyāmi/
analyzed: api tu saced te parityaktam pānīyam dehi pāsyāmi
translated: But if you have given up drinking water, give it to me to drink.

original: p / // /atha prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikāyuṣmantam ānandāya pānīyam adāt/
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā āyuṣmantam ānandāya pānīyam adāt
translated: Then Prakṛti, the Mātaṅga girl, gave water to the Venerable Ānanda.

original: athaāyuṣmān ānandaḥ pānīyaṃ pītvā prakrāntaḥ/
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ pānīyam pītvā prakrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda, having drunk the water, departed.

original: p / // /atha prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikāyuṣmanta ānandsya śarīre mukhe svare sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca nimittam udgṛhītvā yoniśo manasikāreṇāviṣṭā saṃrāgacittam 🔽utpādayati sma/
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā āyuṣmantaḥ ānandsya śarīre mukhe svare sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca nimittam udgṛhītvā yoniśas manasikāreṇa āviṣṭā saṃrāga cittam  utpādayati sma
translated: Then Prakṛti, the Mātaṅga girl, having taken a good and proper sign from the Venerable Ānanda's body, face, and voice, was filled with proper attention and gave rise to a mind of passion,

original: āryo me ānandaḥ svāmī ayād iti/
analyzed: āryaḥ me ānandaḥ svāmī ayāt iti
translated: thinking: The noble Ānanda is my master, he has gone.

original: mātā ca me mahāvidyādharī sā śakṣyaty āryam ānandam ānayitum/
analyzed: mātā ca me mahā vidyādharī sā śakṣyati āryam ānandam ānayitum
translated: And my mother is a great sorceress, she will be able to bring the noble Ānanda.

original: p / // /atha prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikā pānīyaghaṭam ādāya yena caṇḍālagṛhaṃ tenaupasaṃkramya pānīyaghaṭam ekānte nikṣipya svāṃ jananīm idam
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā pānīya ghaṭam ādāya yena caṇḍāla gṛham tena upasaṃkramya pānīya ghaṭam ekānte nikṣipya svām jananīm idam
translated: Then Prakṛti, the Mātaṅga girl, taking a water pot, approached the house of the caṇḍāla, placed the water pot to one side, and said this to her mother:

original: p / // /yat khalv evam amba jānīyā ānando nāma śramaṇo mahāśramaṇagautamasya śrāvaka upasthāyakas tam ahaṃ svāminam icchāmi/
analyzed: khalu evam amba jānīyāḥ ānandaḥ nāma śramaṇaḥ mahāśramaṇa gautamasya śrāvakaḥ upasthāyakaḥ tam aham svāminam icchāmi
translated: Mother, you should know that there is a monk named Ānanda, a disciple of the great monk Gautama, who is my master.

original: śakṣyasi tam amba ānayitum/
analyzed: śakṣyasi tam ambe ānayitum
translated: Mother, will you be able to bring him?

original: p / // /sā tām avocat/
analyzed: tām avocat
translated: She said to her:

original: śaktā ahaṃ putri ānandam ānayituṃ/
analyzed: śaktā aham putri ānandam ānayitum
translated: I am able, daughter, to bring Ānanda.

original: sthāpayitvā yo mṛtaḥ syād yo vā vītarāgaḥ/
analyzed: sthāpayitvā yaḥ mṛtaḥ syāt yaḥ vā vīta rāgaḥ
translated: Except for one who is dead or one who is free from passion.

original: api ca rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ śramaṇagautamam atīva sevate bhajate paryupāsate/
analyzed: api ca rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ śramaṇa gautamam atīva sevate bhajate paryupāsate
translated: Moreover, King Prasenajit of Kosala serves, honors, and attends upon the ascetic Gautama to an extreme degree.

original: yadi jānīyāt so ayaṃ caṇḍālakulasyānarthāya pratipadyeta/
analyzed: yadi jānīyāt saḥ ayam caṇḍāla kulasya anarthāya pratipadyeta
translated: If he knew, he would act to the detriment of this outcaste family.

original: śramaṇaś ca gautamo vītarāgaḥ śrūyate/
analyzed: śramaṇaḥ ca gautamaḥ vīta rāgaḥ śrūyate
translated: And it is heard that the ascetic Gautama is free from passion.

original: vītarāgasya mantrāḥ punaḥ sarvamantrān abhibhavanti/
analyzed: vīta rāgasya mantrāḥ punar sarva mantrān abhibhavanti
translated: The spells of one free from passion surpass all other spells.

original: p / // /evam uktā prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikā mātaram idam avocat/
analyzed: uktā prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā mātaram idam avocat
translated: When this was said, the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti said to her mother:

original: sa ced amba śramaṇo gautamā vītarāgastasyaantikāc chramaṇam ānandaṃ na pratilapsye jīvitaṃ parityajeyaṃ sa cet pratilipsye jīvāmi/
analyzed: sa ced amba śramaṇaḥ gautamāḥ vīta rāgaḥ tasya antikāt śramaṇam ānandam na pratilapsye jīvitam parityajeyam sa ced pratilipsye jīvāmi
translated: Mother, if I do not obtain the ascetic Ānanda from him, then I will give up my life. If I obtain him, then I will live.

original: p / // /mā te putri jīvitaṃ parityajasi ānayāmi śramaṇam ānandam/
analyzed: te putri jīvitam parityajasi ānayāmi śramaṇam ānandam
translated: Do not give up your life, daughter. I will bring the ascetic Ānanda.

original: p / / / /atha prakṛter mātaṅgadārikāyā mātā madhye gṛhāṅganasya gomayenopalepanaṃ
analyzed: atha prakṛteḥ mātaṅga dārikāyāḥ mātā madhye gṛha aṅganasya gomayena upalepanam
translated: Then the mother of the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti, in the middle of the courtyard, smeared it with cow dung,🔽and sprinkled it with water.

original: kṛtvā vedīm ālipya darbhān saṃstīryaagniṃ prajvālyaaṣṭaśatam arkapuṣpāṇāṃ gṛhītvā
analyzed: kṛtvā vedīm ālipya darbhān saṃstīrya agnim prajvālya aṣṭaśatam arka puṣpāṇām gṛhītvā
translated: Having made an altar, smeared it, strewn it with darbha grass, kindled a fire, and taken eight hundred arka flowers,

original: mantrān āvartayamānā ekaikam arkapuṣpaṃ parijapya agnau pratikṣipati sma /
analyzed: mantrān āvartayamānāḥ ekaikam arka puṣpam parijapya agnau pratikṣipati sma
translated: while reciting the mantras, he consecrated each arka flower, and cast it into the fire.

original: tatraiyaṃ vidyā bhavatiḥ
analyzed: tatra eyam vidyā bhavatiḥ
translated: There is this knowledge:

original: p / // /amale vimale kuṅkume sumane/
analyzed: vimale kuṅkume sumane
translated: In the stainless, pure, saffron, good mind,

original: yena baddhā asi vidyut/
analyzed: yena baddhā asi vidyut
translated: by which you are bound, O lightning,

original: icchayā devo varṣati vidyotati gajeti vismayaṃ mahārājasya samabhivardhāyituṃ devebhyo manuṣyebhyo gandharvebhyoḥ śikhigrahā devā viśikhigra
analyzed: icchayā devaḥ varṣati vidyotati gaja iti vismayam mahā rājasya samabhivardhāyitum devebhyaḥ manuṣyebhyaḥ gandharvebhyaḥ śikhigrahāḥ devāḥ viśikhigrahāḥ
translated: the god rains by desire, shines, and roars, to greatly increase the wonder of the great king. To the gods, humans, gandharvas, and the fire-holding gods, the gods holding peacock-feathers,

original: hā devā ānandasyaāgamanāya saṃgamanāya kramaṇāya grahaṇāya juhomi svāhā/
analyzed: hā devāḥ ānandasya āgamanāya saṃgamanāya kramaṇāya grahaṇāya juhomi svāhā
translated: the gods, I offer for the coming, meeting, walking, and grasping of bliss, svāhā.

original: p / // /athaāyuṣmata ānandasya cittam ākṣiptaṃ/
analyzed: ānandasya cittam ākṣiptam
translated: Then the mind of the Venerable Ānanda was disturbed.

original: sa vihārān niṣkramya yena caṇḍālagṛhaṃ tenaupasaṃkrāmati sma/
analyzed: sa vihārāt niṣkramya yena caṇḍālagṛham tena upasaṃkrāmati sma
translated: He went out of the monastery and approached the house of the caṇḍāla.

original: p / // /adrākṣīc caṇḍālī āyuṣmantam ānandaṃ dūrād evaāgacchantaṃ/
analyzed: caṇḍālī āyuṣmantam ānandam dūrāt eva āgacchantam
translated: The caṇḍālī saw the Venerable Ānanda coming from afar.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaḥ prakṛtiṃ duhitaram idam avocat/
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar prakṛtim duhitaram idam avocat
translated: And having seen, she said this to her daughter Prakṛti:

original: ayam asau putri śramaṇa ānanda āgacchati śayanaṃ prajñapaya/
analyzed: ayam asau putri śramaṇaḥ ānandaḥ āgacchati śayanam prajñapaya
translated: This is the ascetic Ānanda coming, my daughter. Prepare a bed.

original: p / // /atha prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikā hṛṣṭatuṣṭā pramuditamanā āyuṣmata ānandasya śayyāṃ prajñapayati sma/
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā hṛṣṭa tuṣṭā pramudita manāḥ āyuṣmataḥ ānandasya śayyām prajñapayati sma
translated: Then the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti, delighted, joyful, and happy, prepared a bed for the Venerable Ānanda.

original: p / // /athaāyuṣmān ānando yena caṇḍālagṛhaṃ tenaupasaṃkrāntaḥ/
analyzed: ānandaḥ yena caṇḍālagṛham tena aupasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda approached the house of the caṇḍāla.

original: upasaṃkramya vedīm upaniśrityā asthāt/
analyzed: upasaṃkramya vedīm upaniśritya asthāt
translated: Having approached, he stood leaning on the altar.

original: ekāntasthitaḥ sa punar āyuṣmān ānandaḥ prārodīd/
analyzed: ekānta sthitaḥ sa punar āyuṣmān ānandaḥ prārodīt
translated: Standing to one side, the Venerable Ānanda wept.

original: aśrūṇi pravartayamāna evam āha/
analyzed: aśrūṇi pravartayamānaḥ evam āha
translated: With tears flowing, he said this:

original: vyasanaprāpto aham asmi na ca me bhagavān samanvāharati/
analyzed: vyasana prāptaḥ aham asmi na ca me bhagavān samanvāharati
translated: I have fallen into misfortune, and the Blessed One does not pay attention to me.

original: p / // /atha bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandaṃ samanvāharati sma/
analyzed: bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam samanvāharati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One paid attention to the Venerable Ānanda.

original: samanvāhṛtya saṃbuddhamantraiś caṇḍālamantrān pratihanti sma/
analyzed: samanvāhṛtya saṃbuddha mantraiḥ caṇḍāla mantrān pratihanti sma
translated: Having paid attention, he repelled the caṇḍāla's spells with the spells of the Fully Enlightened One.

original: tatraiyaṃ vidyāḥ/
analyzed: tatraiyam vidyāḥ
translated: Here is that knowledge:

original: p / / // /sthitir acyutiḥ sunītiḥ/
analyzed: acyutiḥ su nītiḥ
translated: sthiti, acyuti, sunīti.

original: svasti sarvaprāṇibhyaḥ/🔽p / // /saraḥ prasannaṃ nirdoṣaṃ praśāntaṃ sarvato abhayaṃ/
analyzed: svasti sarva prāṇibhyaḥ  prasannam nirdoṣam praśāntam sarvatas abhayam
translated: May there be well-being for all beings.🔽The lake is clear, faultless, peaceful, and safe in every way.

original: p / // /ītayo yatra śāmyanti bhayāni calitāni ca/
analyzed: yatra śāmyanti bhayāni calitāni ca
translated: The dangers there are pacified, and the fears have subsided.

original: p / // /tad vai devā namsyanti sarvasiddhāś ca yoginaḥ/
analyzed: vai devāḥ sarva siddhāḥ ca yoginaḥ
translated: The gods will praise that, and all the perfected beings and yogis.

original: p / // /etena satyavākyena svastyāānandāya bhikṣave//
analyzed: satya vākyena svasti ānandāya bhikṣave
translated: By this true statement, may there be well-being and happiness for the monk.

original: p / // /athaāyuṣmān ānandaḥ pratihatacaṇḍālamantraś caṇḍālagṛhān niṣkramya yena svako vihāras tenaupasaṃkramitum ārabdhaḥ/
analyzed: ānandaḥ pratihata caṇḍāla mantraḥ caṇḍāla gṛhāt niṣkramya yena svakaḥ vihāraḥ tena upasaṃkramitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Ananda, his Chandala spells repelled, left the Chandala's house and started to go to his own monastery.

original: p / // /adrākṣīt prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikā/
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā
translated: The Mātanga girl Prakṛti saw him.

original: ānandam āyuṣmantaṃ pratigacchantaṃ dṛṣṭvā ca punaḥ svāṃ jananīm idam avocat/
analyzed: ānandam āyuṣmantam pratigacchantam dṛṣṭvā ca punar svām jananīm idam avocat
translated: Having seen the Venerable Ananda going, she said this to her own mother:

original: ayam asau mātaḥ śramaṇa ānandaḥ pratigacchati/
analyzed: ayam asau mātar śramaṇaḥ ānandaḥ pratigacchati
translated: Mother, this is the ascetic Ananda going.

original: tām āha mātā/
analyzed: tām āha mātā
translated: Her mother said to her:

original: niyataṃ putri śramaṇena gautamena samanvāhṛto bhaviṣyati/
analyzed: niyatam putri śramaṇena gautamena samanvāhṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Certainly, daughter, he will have been remembered by the ascetic Gautama.

original: tena mama mantrāḥ pratihatā bhaviṣyanti/
analyzed: tena mama mantrāḥ pratihatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Therefore, my spells will be repelled by him.

original: prakṛtir āha/
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ āha
translated: Prakṛti said:

original: kiṃ punar amba balavattarāḥ śramaṇasya gautamasya mantrā naasmākaṃ/
analyzed: kim punar amba balavattarāḥ śramaṇasya gautamasya mantrāḥ na asmākam
translated: But, mother, are the ascetic Gautama's spells more powerful than ours?

original: tām āha mātā/
analyzed: tām āha mātā
translated: Her mother said to her:

original: balavattarāḥ śramaṇasya gautamasya mantrā naasmākaṃ/
analyzed: balavattarāḥ śramaṇasya gautamasya mantrāḥ na asmākam
translated: The ascetic Gautama's spells are more powerful than ours.

original: ye putri mantāḥ sarvalokasya prabhavanti tān mantrān śramaṇo gautama ākāṅkṣamāṇaḥ pratihanti/
analyzed: ye putri mantāḥ sarva lokasya prabhavanti tān mantrān śramaṇaḥ gautamaḥ ākāṅkṣamāṇaḥ pratihanti
translated: Those who know the mantras of the whole world, the ascetic Gautama, if he wishes, can counter them.

original: na punar lokaḥ prabhavati śramaṇasya gautamasya mantrān pratihantuṃ/
analyzed: na punar lokaḥ prabhavati śramaṇasya gautamasya mantrān pratihantum
translated: But the world cannot counter the ascetic Gautama's mantras.

original: evaṃ balavattarāḥ avamaṇasya gautamasya mantrāḥ/
analyzed: evam balavattarāḥ avamaṇasya gautamasya mantrāḥ
translated: Thus the ascetic Gautama's mantras are more powerful.

original: p / // /athaāyuṣmān ānando yena bhagavāṃs tenaupasaṃkrāntaḥ/
analyzed: ānandaḥ yena bhagavān tena aupasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvāekānte asthāt/
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte asthāt
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and stood to one side.

original: p / // /ekāntasthitam āyuṣmantam ānandaṃ bhagavān idam avocat/
analyzed: āyuṣmantam ānandam bhagavān idam avocat
translated: The Blessed One said this to the Venerable Ānanda, who was standing to one side:

original: udgṛhṇa tvam ānanda imāṃ ṣaḍakṣarīvidyāṃ dhāraya vācaya paryavāpnuhi/
analyzed: udgṛhṇa tvam ānanda imām ṣaḍakṣarī vidyām dhāraya vācaya paryavāpnuhi
translated: Ānanda, you should memorize this six-syllable knowledge mantra, keep it, recite it, and master it.

original: ātmano hitāya sukhāya bhikṣūṇāṃ bhikṣuṇīnām upāsakānām upasikānāṃ hitāya sukhāya/
analyzed: ātmanaḥ hitāya sukhāya bhikṣūṇām bhikṣuṇīnām upāsakānām upasikānām hitāya sukhāya
translated: For the benefit and happiness of yourself, the monks, the nuns, the male lay followers, and the female lay followers.

original: iyam ānanda ṣaḍkṣarīvidyā ṣaḍbhiḥ samyak saṃbuddhair bhāṣitā caturbhiś ca mahārājaiḥ śakreṇa devānām indreṇa brahmaṇā ca sahāpatinā/
analyzed: iyam ānanda ṣaḍkṣarī vidyā ṣaḍbhiḥ samyak saṃbuddhaiḥ bhāṣitā caturbhiḥ ca mahā rājaiḥ śakreṇa devānām indreṇa brahmaṇā ca sahā patinā
translated: Ānanda, this six-syllable knowledge mantra has been spoken by the six perfectly enlightened ones, the four great kings, Śakra, lord of the gods, and Brahmā, lord of Sahā,

original: mayā caetarhi
analyzed: mayā ca etarhi
translated: and now by me as well.

original: śākyamuninā samyaksaṃbuddhena bhāṣitā/
analyzed: śākyamuninā samyaksaṃbuddhena bhāṣitā
translated: Spoken by the Perfectly Awakened One, the Śākya Sage.

original: tvam apy etarhy ānanda tāṃ dhāraya vācaya paryavāpnuhi/
analyzed: tvam api etarhi ānanda tām dhāraya vācaya paryavāpnuhi
translated: You too, Ānanda, should now uphold it, recite it, and master it.

original: yad uta tad yathā /
analyzed: yat uta tat yathā
translated: Namely, it is as follows.🔽P.

original: p / // /aṇḍare pāṇḍare kāraṇḍe keyūre arcihaste kharagrīve bandhumati cīramati dharavidha cilimile viloḍaya viṣāṇi loke/
analyzed: pāṇḍare kāraṇḍe keyūre arci haste khara grīve bandhumati cīramati dhara vidha cilimile viloḍaya viṣāṇi loke
translated: Aṇḍare, pāṇḍare, kāraṇḍe, keyūra, arcihasta, kharagrīva, bandhumati, cīramati, dhara-vidha, cilimile, viloda-ya viṣāṇi loke.

original: viṣa cala cala/
analyzed: viṣa cala cala
translated: Viṣa, cala, cala.🔽Golamati, gaṇḍavile, cilimile, sā-atini-mne yathā saṃvibhakta-golamati gaṇḍavilāya svāhā.

original: golamati gaṇḍavile cilimile saatinimne yathā saṃvibhaktagolamati gaṇḍavilāyai svāhā/
analyzed: gola mati gaṇḍavile cilimile sa ati nimne yathā saṃvibhakta gola mati gaṇḍavilāyai svāhā
translated: As the Golamati is divided between the cheeks and the deep hollow, to the Golamati divided between the cheeks, Svâhâ!

original: p / // /yaḥ kaś cid ānandaṣaḍakṣaryā vidyayā paritrāṇaṃ svastyayanaṃ kuryāt sa yadi vadhaarho bhavet daṇḍena mucyate/
analyzed: kaḥ cit ānanda ṣaḍakṣaryā vidyayā paritrāṇam svastyayanam kuryāt sa yadi vadha arhaḥ bhavet daṇḍena mucyate
translated: Whoever, Ānanda, would perform protection and well-being with the six-syllable spell, if they are worthy of death, they are freed by punishment.

original: daṇḍaarhaḥ prahāreṇa prahāraarhaḥ paribhāṣaṇayā paribhāṣaṇaarho romaharṣaṇena romaharṣaṇaarhaḥ punar eva mucyate/
analyzed: daṇḍa arhaḥ prahāreṇa prahāra arhaḥ paribhāṣaṇayā paribhāṣaṇa arhaḥ romaharṣaṇena romaharṣaṇa arhaḥ punar eva mucyate
translated: Worthy of punishment by beating, worthy of beating by reprimand, worthy of reprimand by making the hair stand on end, they are freed again.🔽P.

original: p / / / /naaham ānanda taṃ samanupaśyāmi sadevaloke samāraloke sabrahmaloke saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāṃ
analyzed: na aham ānanda tam samanupaśyāmi sa deva loke sa māra loke sa brahma loke sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyām
translated: I do not see, Ānanda, in the world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, with its kings and men,

original: prajāyāṃ sadevamānuṣikāyāṃ saasurāyāṃ yas tv anayā ṣaḍakṣayaṃ vidyayā rakṣāyāṃ
analyzed: prajāyām sa deva mānuṣikāyām sa asurāyām yaḥ tu anayā ṣaṣ akṣayam vidyayā rakṣāyām
translated: In the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, whoever has had protection performed with this six-syllable knowledge,

original: kṛtāyāṃ rakṣāsūtre bāhau baddhe svastyayane kṛte abhibhavituṃ śakroti varjayitvā
analyzed: kṛtāyām rakṣā sūtre bāhau baddhe svastyayane kṛte abhibhavitum śakroti varjayitvā
translated: with the protection thread bound on the arm, and the rite for well-being done, he cannot be overcome,

original: paurāṇaṃ karmavipākam /
analyzed: paurāṇam karma vipākam
translated: except for the ripening of former karma.

original: p / / / /atha prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikā tasyā eva rātryā atyayāt śiraḥsnātā anāhata🔽dūṣyaprāvṛtā muktāmālyaābharaṇā yena śrāvasto nagarī tenaupasaṃkramya nagaradvāre
analyzed: atha prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā tasyāḥ eva rātryāḥ atyayāt śiraḥ snātā anāhata  dūṣya prāvṛtāḥ muktā mālya ābharaṇāḥ yena śrāvastaḥ nagarī tena upasaṃkramya nagara dvāre
translated: Then the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti, after that night had passed, having bathed her head,🔽clothed in new, unworn garments, adorned with a pearl necklace, approached the city of Śrāvastī, and having gone there,

original: kapāṭamūle niśrityā asthāt /
analyzed: kapāṭa mūle niśrityai asthāt
translated: she stood at the foot of the gate of the city,

original: āyuṣmantam ānandam āgamayamānā/
analyzed: āyuṣmantam ānandam āgamayamānā
translated: waiting for the venerable Ānanda.

original: niyatam anena mārgeṇaānando bhikṣurāgam iṣyatiiti/
analyzed: niyatam anena mārgeṇa ānandaḥ bhikṣu rāgam iṣyati iti
translated: Certainly the monk Ānanda will come by this very path.

original: p / // /athaāyuṣmān ānandaḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya śrāvastīṃ piṇḍāya prāvikṣat/
analyzed: ānandaḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya śrāvastīm piṇḍāya prāvikṣat
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda, having dressed in the morning, took his bowl and robe and entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: dadarśa prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikaāyuṣmantam ānandaṃ/
analyzed: dadarśa prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā āyuṣmantam ānandam
translated: The Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti saw the venerable Ānanda.

original: dūrata eva dṛṣṭvā ca punar āyuṣmantam ānandaṃ pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samanubaddhā gacchantam anugacchati tiṣṭhantam anutiṣṭhati/
analyzed: dūratas eva dṛṣṭvā ca punar āyuṣmantam ānandam pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas samanubaddhā gacchantam anugacchati tiṣṭhantam anutiṣṭhati
translated: And having seen him from afar, she followed Venerable Ānanda from behind, going when he went, standing when he stood,

original: yad yad eva kulaṃ piṇḍāya praviśati tasya tasyaiva dvāre tūṣṇībhūtā tiṣṭhati āyuṣmantam
analyzed: yat yat eva kulam piṇḍāya praviśati tasya tasya eva dvāre tūṣṇībhūtā tiṣṭhati āyuṣmantam
translated: and at the door of whatever family he entered for alms, she stood silently,

original: ānandam āmantrayamāṇā/
analyzed: ānandam āmantrayamāṇā
translated: as if inviting Venerable Ānanda.

original: p / / // /dadarśāyuṣmānānandaḥ prakṛtiṃ mātaṅgadārikāṃ/
analyzed: prakṛtim mātaṅga dārikām
translated: Ānanda saw Prakṛti, the Mātaṅga girl,

original: pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samanubaddhāṃ dṛṣṭvā ca punar jehrīymāṇarūpo apragalbhāyamānarūpo duḥkhī durmanāḥ śīghraṃ śīghraṃ śrāvastyā vinirgamya
analyzed: pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas samanubaddhām dṛṣṭvā ca punar a pragalbhāyamāna rūpaḥ duḥkhī durmanāḥ śīghram śīghram śrāvastyāḥ vinirgamya
translated: and having seen her following from behind, he went out of Śrāvastī quickly and quickly, with a form ashamed, with a form not confident, sorrowful, and dejected.

original: yena jetavanaṃ tanopasaṃkrāntaḥ/
analyzed: yena jetavanam tanā upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: And having gone, he approached Jeta's Grove.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvekānte asthād/
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte asthāt
translated: And having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and stood to one side.

original: ekāntasthita āyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam idam avocat/
analyzed: ekānta sthitaḥ āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: And standing to one side, the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: iyaṃ me bhagavan
analyzed: iyam me bhagavan
translated: This Prakṛti, Blessed One,

original: prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikā pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samanubaddhā gacchantam anugacchati /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas samanubaddhā gacchantam anugacchati
translated: the Mātaṅga girl, follows me from behind, going when I go,

original: tiṣṭhantam anutiṣṭhati/
analyzed: tiṣṭhantam anutiṣṭhati
translated: standing when I stand,

original: yad yad eva kulaṃ piṇḍāya praviśāmi tasya tasyaiva dvāre tūṣṇībhūtā tiṣṭhati/
analyzed: yat yat eva kulam piṇḍāya praviśāmi tasya tasya eva dvāre tūṣṇībhūtā tiṣṭhati
translated: Whatever family I entered for alms, at the very door I stood silently.

original: trāhi me bhagavan trāhi me sugata/
analyzed: trāhi me bhagavan trāhi me sugata
translated: Save me, Blessed One, save me, Sugata.

original: p / // /evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam idam avocat/
analyzed: ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam idam avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the venerable Ānanda:

original: mā bher mā bher iti/
analyzed: mā bheḥ mā bheḥ iti
translated: Do not be afraid, do not be afraid.

original: atha bhagavān prakṛtiṃ mātaṅgadārikām idam avocat/
analyzed: atha bhagavān prakṛtim mātaṅga dārikām idam avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti:

original: hiṃ te prakṛte mātaṅgadārike ānandena bhikṣuṇā/
analyzed: hiṃ te prakṛte mātaṅga dārike ānandena bhikṣuṇā
translated: Prakṛti, the Mātaṅga girl, has been given to you by the monk Ānanda.

original: prakṛtir āha/
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ āha
translated: Prakṛti said:

original: svāminaṃ bhadantam ānandam icchāmi/
analyzed: svāminam bhadantam ānandam icchāmi
translated: I want the venerable Ānanda as my master.

original: bhagavān āha/
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: anujñātāsi prakṛte mātāpitṛbhyām ānandāya/
analyzed: anujñātā asi prakṛte mātā pitṛbhyām ānandāya
translated: Prakṛti, have you been given to Ānanda by your mother and father?

original: anujñātāsmi bhagavann anujñātāsmi sugata/
analyzed: anujñātā asmi bhagavan anujñātā asmi sugata
translated: I have been given, Blessed One, I have been given, Sugata.

original: bhagavān āha/ tena hi
analyzed: bhagavān āha tena hi
translated: The Blessed One said: Well then,

original: sammukhaṃ mamānujñāpayya tvam/
analyzed: sammukham mama anujñāpayya tvam
translated: give your consent in my presence.

original: p / // /atha prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikā bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantaṃ triḥpradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavato antikāt
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ antikāt
translated: Then the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti, having listened to the Blessed One, having bowed her head at the feet of the Blessed One, having circumambulated the Blessed One three times,

original: yena svakau mātāpitarau tenaupasaṃkrāntā/
analyzed: yena svakau mātā pitarau tena upasaṃkrāntā
translated: approached her own mother and father.

original: upasaṃkramya mātāpitroḥ pādān śirasā vanditvāekānte asthād/
analyzed: upasaṃkramya mātā pitroḥ pādān śirasā vanditvā ekānte asthāt
translated: Having approached, she bowed her head at the feet of her mother and father and stood to one side.

original: ekāntasthitā svakau mātā pitarāv idam avocat/
analyzed: ekānta sthitā svakau mātā pitarā idam avocat
translated: Standing to one side, she said this to her own mother and father:

original: sammukhaṃ me amba tāta śramaṇasya gautamasyānandāyotsṛjatam/
analyzed: sammukham me amba tāta śramaṇasya gautamasya ānandāya utsṛjatam
translated: Mother, Father, give me permission to go forth in the presence of the ascetic Gautama.

original: p / // /atha prakṛter mātaṅgadārikāyā mātāpitarau prakṛtim ādāya yana bhagavāms tenaupasaṃkrāntau/
analyzed: prakṛteḥ mātaṅga dārikāyāḥ mātā pitarau prakṛtim ādāya bhagavān tena aupasaṃkrāntau
translated: Then the mother and father of the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti, taking Prakṛti with them, approached where the Blessed One was.

original: uapsaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvāekānte nyaṣīdatāṃ/
analyzed: upa saṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte nyaṣīdatām
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: atha prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā banditvā ekānte asthād/
analyzed: atha prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā banditvā ekānte asthāt
translated: Then the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti bowed her head at the feet of the Blessed One and stood to one side.

original: ekāntasthitā bhagavantam etad avocat/
analyzed: ekānta sthitā bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Standing to one side, she said this to the Blessed One:

original: imau tau bhagavan mātāpitarāv āgatau/
analyzed: imau tau bhagavat mātā pitarau āgatau
translated: These are my mother and father, Blessed One, who have come.

original: p / // /atha bhagavān prakṛter mātaṅgadārikāyā mātāpitarāv idam avoct/
analyzed: bhagavān prakṛteḥ mātaṅga dārikāyāḥ mātā pitarau idam avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to the mother and father of the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti:

original: anujñātā yuvābhyāṃ prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikānandāyeti/
analyzed: anujñātā yuvābhyām prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā ānandāya iti
translated: Have you given permission to the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti to go forth for the sake of joy?

original: tāv āhutuḥ/
analyzed: tau āhutuḥ
translated: They said:

original: anujñātā bhagavann anujñātā sugata/
analyzed: anujñātā bhagavan anujñātā sugata
translated: We have given permission, Blessed One, we have given permission, Well-Gone One.

original: tena hi yūyaṃ prakṛtim apahāya gacchata svagṛham/
analyzed: tena hi yūyam prakṛtim apahāya gacchata sva gṛham
translated: Then, leaving Prakṛti behind, you may go to your own home.

original: p / // /atha prakṛter mātaṅgadārikāyā mātāpitarau bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantaṃ triḥpradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavato antikāt prakrāntau/
analyzed: prakṛteḥ mātaṅga dārikāyāḥ mātā pitarau bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ antikāt prakrāntau
translated: Then, the mother and father of Prakṛti the Mātaṅga girl, having bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and departed from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: p / // /atha prakṛter mātaṅgadārikāyā mātāpitarāv aciraprakrāntau viditvā bhagavān prakṛtiṃ mātaṅgadārikām idm avocat/
analyzed: prakṛteḥ mātaṅga dārikāyāḥ mātā pitarau acira prakrāntau viditvā bhagavān prakṛtim mātaṅga dārikām idm avocat
translated: Then, knowing that the mother and father of Prakṛti the Mātaṅga girl had departed not long ago, the Blessed One said this to Prakṛti the Mātaṅga girl:

original: arthikāsi prakṛte ānandena bhikṣuṇā/
analyzed: arthikā asi prakṛte ānandena bhikṣuṇā
translated: Prakṛti, do you desire to be ordained by the monk Ānanda?

original: prakṛtir āha/
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ āha
translated: Prakṛti said:

original: arthikāsmi bhagavann arthikāsmi sugata/
analyzed: arthikā asmi bhagavan arthikā asmi sugata
translated: I desire it, Blessed One, I desire it, Sugata.

original: tena hi prakṛte ya ānandasya veśaḥ sa tvayā dhārayitavyaḥ/
analyzed: tena hi prakṛte yaḥ ānandasya veśaḥ sa tvayā dhārayitavyaḥ
translated: Then, Prakṛti, you should take on Ānanda's appearance.

original: sā āha/🔽dhārayāmi bhagavan dhārayāmi sugata/🔽pravrājayatu māṃ sugata pravrājayatu māṃ
analyzed: sā āha  dhārayāmi bhagavan dhārayāmi sugata  pravrājayatu mām sugata pravrājayatu mām
translated: She said:🔽I will take it on, Blessed One, I will take it on, Sugata.

original: bhagavān/
analyzed: bhagavān
translated: Let the Sugata ordain me, let the Blessed One ordain me.

original: p / // /atha bhagavān prakṛtiṃ mātaṅgadārikām idam avocat/
analyzed: bhagavān prakṛtim mātaṅga dārikām idam avocat
translated: Then, the Blessed One said this to Prakṛti the Mātaṅga girl:

original: ehi tvaṃ bhikṣuṇi cara brahmacaryam/
analyzed: ehi tvam bhikṣuṇi cara brahmacaryam
translated: Come, bhikṣuṇī, practice the holy life.

original: p / // /evam ukte prakṛtir mātaṅgadārikā bhagavatā muṇḍā kāṣāyaprāvṛtā/
analyzed: ukte prakṛtiḥ mātaṅga dārikā bhagavatā muṇḍā kāṣāya prāvṛtā
translated: When this was said, Prakṛti the Mātaṅga girl, by the Blessed One's words, her head shaved, wearing the ochre robes,

original: atha bhagavān prakṛtiṃ mātaṅgadārikām ehi bhikṣuṇīvādena pravrājayitvā dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati sma /🔽samādāpayati sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān prakṛtim mātaṅga dārikām ehi bhikṣuṇī vādena pravrājayitvā dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati sma  samādāpayati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, having caused the Mātaṅga girl Prakṛti to go forth with the words Come, bhikṣuṇī, instructed her with a talk on the Dharma.🔽He inspired her.🔽He exhorted her.

original: samuttejayati sma /🔽saṃpraharṣayati sma/
analyzed: samuttejayati sma  saṃpraharṣayati sma
translated: He gladdened her.

original: yeyaṃ kathā dīrgharātraṃ saṃsārasamāpannānāṃ pratikūlā śravaṇīyā/
analyzed: yā iyam kathā dīrgharātram saṃsāra samāpannānām pratikūlā śravaṇīyā
translated: This talk on the Dharma, which is for a long time favorable and to be heard by those who have entered saṃsāra,

original: tad yathā/
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: is as follows.

original: dānakathā śīlakathā svargakathā kāmeṣv
analyzed: dāna kathā śīla kathā svarga kathā kāmeṣu
translated: A talk on generosity, a talk on morality, a talk on heaven,

original: ādīnavaṃ niḥsaraṇaṃ bhayaṃ saṃkleśavyavadānaṃ bodhipakṣāṃs tān dharmān bhagvān prakṛtyai bhikṣuṇyai saṃprakāśayati sma/
analyzed: ādīnavam niḥsaraṇam bhayam saṃkleśa vyavadānam bodhi pakṣān tān dharmān bhagvān prakṛtyai bhikṣuṇyai saṃprakāśayati sma
translated: the disadvantages, the defilements, and the escape in regard to sensual pleasures, and those dharmas which are on the side of awakening, the Blessed One explained to the bhikṣuṇī Prakṛti.

original: p / / / /atha prakṛtir bhikṣuṇī bhagavatā dharmyaya kathayā saṃdarśitā samādāpitā
analyzed: atha prakṛtiḥ bhikṣuṇī bhagavatā dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśitā samādāpitā
translated: Then the bhikṣuṇī Prakṛti, having been instructed by the Blessed One with a talk on the Dharma,

original: samuttejitā saṃpraharṣitā hṛṣṭacittā kalyāṇacittā muditacittā vinīvaraṇacittā ṛjucittā
analyzed: samuttejitā saṃpraharṣitā hṛṣṭa cittā kalyāṇa cittā mudita cittā vinīvaraṇa cittā ṛju cittā
translated: having been inspired, exhorted, and gladdened, with a delighted mind, a wholesome mind, a joyful mind, a mind free from hindrances,

original: akhilacittā bhavyā dharmadeśitam ājñātum /
analyzed: akhila cittāḥ bhavyāḥ dharma deśitam ājñātum
translated: a mind inclined to good, a mind capable of understanding the teaching of the Dharma,

original: p / / / /yadā ca bhagavān jñātaḥ prakṛtiṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ hṛṣṭacittāṃ kalyāṇacittāṃ muditacittāṃ
analyzed: yadā ca bhagavān jñātaḥ prakṛtim bhikṣuṇīm hṛṣṭa cittām kalyāṇa cittām mudita cittām
translated: and when the Blessed One knew that the bhikṣuṇī Prakṛti had a delighted mind, a wholesome mind, a joyful mind,🔽a mind free from hindrances, a mind inclined to good, a mind capable of understanding the teaching of the Dharma,

original: vinivaraṇacittāṃ bhavyāṃ pratibalāṃ sāmutkarpikīṃ dharmadeśanām ājñātuṃ tadā yeyaṃ
analyzed: vinivaraṇa cittām bhavyām pratibalām sāmutkarpikīm dharma deśanām ājñātum tadā yā iyam
translated: when her mind was free from hindrances, ready, bright, confident, uplifted, and capable of receiving the teaching,

original: bhagavatāṃ buddhānāṃ caturāryasatyaprativedhikī sāmutkarṣikī dharmadeśanā /
analyzed: bhagavatām buddhānām catur ārya satya prativedhikī sāmutkarṣikī dharma deśanā
translated: then the Blessed One gave to the nun Prakṛti the teaching that is fitting for a noble one, which is the teaching of the four noble truths.

original: yad uta duḥkhaṃ samudayo nirodho mārgaḥ /
analyzed: yat uta duḥkham samudayaḥ nirodhaḥ mārgaḥ
translated: Namely, suffering, its arising, its cessation, and the path.

original: tāṃ bhagavān prakṛter bhikṣuṇyā vistareṇa saṃprakāśayati sma/
analyzed: tām bhagavān prakṛteḥ bhikṣuṇyāḥ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayati sma
translated: The Blessed One taught the nun Prakṛti in detail.

original: p / // /atha prakṛtibhikṣuṇī tasminn evāsane niṣaṇṇā caturāryasatyānyabhijñātāsit/
analyzed: prakṛti bhikṣuṇī tasmin eva āsane niṣaṇṇā catur ārya satyāni abhijñātā asit
translated: Then the nun Prakṛti, sitting right there on that seat, directly knew the four noble truths.

original: duḥkhaṃ sumudayaṃ nirodhaṃ mārgaṃ//
analyzed: duḥkham nirodham mārgam
translated: Namely, suffering, its arising, its cessation, and the path.

original: tad yathā vastām apagatakālakaṃ rajanopagataṃ raṅgaudake prakṣiptaṃ samyag eva raṅgaṃ
analyzed: tat yathā vastām apagata kālakam rajana upagatam raṅga audake prakṣiptam samyak eva raṅgam
translated: Just as a white cloth from Kāsī readily absorbs dye,

original: pratigṛhṇīyād evam eva prakṛtir bhikṣuṇī tasminnevāsane niṣaṇṇā caturāryasatyāni abhisamayati sma /
analyzed: pratigṛhṇīyāt evam eva prakṛtiḥ bhikṣuṇī tasmin eva āsane niṣaṇṇā catur ārya satyāni sma
translated: in the same way, the nun Prakṛti, sitting right there on that seat, directly knew the four noble truths.

original: tad yathā duḥkhaṃ sumudayaṃ nirodhaṃ mārgam/
analyzed: tat yathā duḥkham nirodham mārgam
translated: Namely, suffering, its arising, its cessation, and the path.

original: p / / / /atha prakṛtir bhikṣuṇī kṛṣṭadharmā prāptadharmā viditadharmā akopyadharmā
analyzed: atha prakṛtiḥ bhikṣuṇī kṛṣṭa dharmā prāpta dharmā vidita dharmā a kopya dharmā
translated: Then the nun Prakṛti, having seen the Dharma, having attained the Dharma, having known the Dharma, having fathomed the Dharma, having crossed over doubt, having had no more perplexity, having attained full confidence, having become independent of others in the Teacher's teachings, said this to the Blessed One:

original: paryavasitadharmaadhigataarthalābhasaṃvṛttā tīrṇakāṅkṣāvicikitsā vigatakathaṃkathā
analyzed: paryavasita dharma adhigata artha lābha saṃvṛttā tīrṇa kāṅkṣā vicikitsā vigata kathaṃkathā
translated: having attained the gain of the meaning of the concluded Dharma, having crossed over doubt and uncertainty, being free from perplexity,

original: vaiśāradyaprāptā aparapratyayā ananyaneyā śāstuḥ śāsane anudharmacāriṇī ājāneyamānā
analyzed: vaiśāradya prāptā apara pratyayā an anya neyā śāstuḥ śāsane anu dharma cāriṇī
translated: having attained fearlessness, not relying on others, not to be led by others, in the Teacher's Dispensation, a follower of the Dhamma, a noble disciple,

original: dharmeṣu bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ śirasā nipatya bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: dharmeṣu bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ śirasā nipatya bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: having bowed her head at the feet of the Blessed One in the teachings, she said this to the Blessed One:

original: p / // /atyayo me bhagavann atyayo me sugata/
analyzed: me bhagavan atyayaḥ me sugata
translated: I have erred, Blessed One, I have erred, Well-Gone One.

original: yathā bālā yathā mūḍhā yathā avyaktā yathā akuśalā duṣprajñajātīyā yāham ānandaṃ bhikṣuṃ svāmivādena samudācarṣaṃ/
analyzed: yathā bālāḥ yathā mūḍhāḥ yathā avyaktāḥ yathā akuśalāḥ duṣprajña jātīyāḥ yā aham ānandam bhikṣum svāmi vādena samudācarṣam
translated: As a fool, as a deluded one, as one who is unskillful, as one of bad wisdom, I have addressed the monk Ānanda with the word 'master.'

original: saahaṃ bhadantātyayamatyayataḥ paśyāmi/🔽atyayam atyayato dṛṣṭvā deśayāmi/
analyzed: sa aham bhadanta atyayam atyayataḥ paśyāmi  atyayam atyayataḥ dṛṣṭvā deśayāmi
translated: I, Bhadanta, see that error as an error.🔽Having seen that error as an error, I confess it.

original: atyayam atyayata āviṣkaromi/
analyzed: atyayam atyayataḥ āviṣkaromi
translated: I reveal that error as an error.

original: āyatyāṃ saṃvaram āpadye/
analyzed: āyatyām saṃvaram āpadye
translated: I undertake restraint for the future.

original: atas tasyā mama bhagavann atyayam atyayato jānātu pratigṛhṇātu
analyzed: atas tasyāḥ mama bhagavan atyayam atyayataḥ jānātu pratigṛhṇātu
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, may you know that error of mine as an error, may you accept it

original: anukampām upādāya/
analyzed: anukampām upādāya
translated: out of compassion.

original: bhagavān āha/
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: āyatyāṃ saṃvarāya sthitvā tvaṃ prakṛte atyayam atyayato adhyāgamaḥ/
analyzed: āyatyām saṃvarāya sthitvā tvam prakṛte atyayam atyayataḥ adhyāgamaḥ
translated: Having undertaken restraint for the future, you have confessed that error as an error, O Prakṛti.

original: yathā bālā yathā mūḍhā yathā avyaktā yathā akuśalā duṣprajñajātīya tvam ānandaṃ bhikṣuṃ svāmivādena
analyzed: yathā bālāḥ yathā mūḍhāḥ yathā avyaktāḥ yathā akuśalāḥ duṣprajña jātīya tvam ānandam bhikṣum svāmi vādena
translated: As a fool, as a deluded one, as one who is indistinct, as one who is unskilled, you, Ānanda, address the monk Prāptimati with the words master

original: amudācarasiiti/
analyzed: am udācarasi iti
translated: and you.

original: yataś ca tvaṃ prakṛte atyayaṃ jānāsi atyayaṃ paśyasi āyatyāṃ ca saṃvaram āpadyase /
analyzed: yatas ca tvam prakṛte atyayam jānāsi atyayam paśyasi āyatyām ca saṃvaram āpadyase
translated: And since you know the transgression as it really is, see the transgression, and undertake restraint for the future,

original: aham api te atyayam atyayato gṛhṇāmi/ vṛddhir
analyzed: aham api te atyayam atyayataḥ gṛhṇāmi vṛddhiḥ
translated: I also accept your transgression as a transgression.🔽You should expect growth,

original: eva te prakṛte pratikāṅkṣatavyā kuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ na hāniḥ/
analyzed: eva te prakṛte pratikāṅkṣatavyā kuśalānām dharmāṇām na hāniḥ
translated: not decline, in wholesome qualities.

original: p / // /atha prakṛtir bhikṣuṇī bhagavatāabhinanditā anuśiṣṭā ekāvyapakṛṣṭā apramattā ātāpinī smṛtim atī saṃprajānā prahitāni viviktāni viharati
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ bhikṣuṇī bhagavatā abhinanditā anuśiṣṭā ekā a vyapakṛṣṭā apramattā ātāpinī smṛtim atī saṃprajānā prahitāni viviktāni viharati
translated: Then the nun Prāpti, having been delighted and instructed by the Blessed One, dwelt alone, secluded, heedful, ardent, and resolute.

original: yad arthaṃ kuladuhitaraḥ keśān avatārya kāṣāyāṇi vastrāṇy ācchādya samyag eva śraddhayāāgārād
analyzed: yat artham kula duhitaraḥ keśān avatārya kāṣāyāṇi vastrāṇi ācchādya samyak eva śraddhayā āgārāt
translated: For the sake of which daughters of good family cut off their hair, put on saffron robes, and go forth from the home life into homelessness with perfect faith,

original: anāgārikāṃ pravrajanti tadanuttarabrahmacaryaparyavasānaṃ dṛṣṭa eva dharme svayam🔽abhijñaya sākṣāt kṛtyaupasaṃpadya
analyzed: anāgārikām pravrajanti tad anuttara brahmacarya paryavasānam dṛṣṭe eva dharme svayam  sākṣāt kṛtyā upasaṃpadya
translated: having attained the unsurpassed spiritual life, having directly experienced and attained it in this very life,

original: pravedayate sma/
analyzed: pravedayate sma
translated: and declare it.

original: kṣīṇā me jātir uṣitaṃ brahmacaryaṃ kṛtaṃ karaṇīyaṃ naaparamasmād bhavaṃ prajānāmiiti/
analyzed: kṣīṇā me jātiḥ uṣitam brahmacaryam kṛtam karaṇīyam na aparamasmāt bhavam prajānāmi iti
translated: My births are destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there will be no more of this existence.

original: p / // /aśrauṣuḥ śrāvasteyakā brāhmaṇagṛhapatayo bhagavatā kila canḍāladārikā pravrājiteti/
analyzed: śrāvasteyakāḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatayaḥ bhagavatā kila canḍāla dārikā pravrājitā iti
translated: The Brahmins and householders of Śrāvastī heard that the Blessed One had indeed ordained the outcaste girl.

original: śrutvā ca punar avadhyāyanti/🔽kathaṃ hi nāma caṇḍāladārikā bhikṣūṇāṃ samyakcaryāṃ cariṣyati/
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar avadhyāyanti  katham hi nāma caṇḍāla dārikā bhikṣūṇām samyak caryām cariṣyati
translated: And having heard, they criticized it.🔽How can an outcaste girl practice the right conduct of the monks?

original: bhikṣuṇīnām upāsakānām upāsikānāṃ samyakcaryāṃ cariṣyati/
analyzed: bhikṣuṇīnām upāsakānām upāsikānām samyak caryām cariṣyati
translated: How can she practice the right conduct of the nuns, male and female lay followers?

original: kathaṃ hi nāma caṇḍāladārikā brahmakṣatriyagṛhapatimahāśālakuleṣu pravekṣyati/
analyzed: katham hi nāma caṇḍāla dārikā brahma kṣatriya gṛhapati mahāśāla kuleṣu pravekṣyati
translated: How can an outcaste girl enter the families of Brahmins, Kṣatriyas, and wealthy householders?

original: p / // /aśrauṣīd rājā prasenajit kauśalo bhagavatā caṇḍāladārikā pravrājiteti/
analyzed: rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ bhagavatā caṇḍāla dārikā pravrājitā iti
translated: King Prasenajit of Kośala heard that the Blessed One had indeed ordained the outcaste girl.

original: śrutvā ca punar avadhyāyāti/🔽kathaṃ hi nāma caṇḍāladārikā bhikṣūṇāṃ samyakcaryāṃ cariṣyati/
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar avadhyāyāti  katham hi nāma caṇḍāla dārikā bhikṣūṇām samyak caryām cariṣyati
translated: And having heard, he criticized it.🔽How can an outcaste girl practice the right conduct of the monks?

original: bhikṣuṇīnām upāsakānām upāsikānāṃ samyakcaryāṃ cariṣyati/
analyzed: bhikṣuṇīnām upāsakānām upāsikānām samyak caryām cariṣyati
translated: How can she practice the right conduct of the nuns, male and female lay followers?

original: kathaṃ brāhmaṇakṣatriyagṛhapatimahāśālakuleṣu pravekṣyati/
analyzed: katham brāhmaṇa kṣatriya gṛhapati mahāśāla kuleṣu pravekṣyati
translated: How can she enter the families of Brahmins, Kṣatriyas, and wealthy householders?

original: p / // /vimṛṣya ca bhadaraṃ yānaṃ yojayitvā bhadraṃ yānam abhiruhya saṃbahulaiś ca śrāvasteyair brāhmaṇagṛhapatibhiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ
analyzed: ca bhadaram yānam yojayitvā bhadram yānam abhiruhya saṃbahulaiḥ ca śrāvasteyaiḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatibhiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ
translated: Having reflected, he yoked the excellent chariot, mounted the excellent chariot, and was surrounded and honored by many brahmin householders from Śrāvastī.

original: śrāvastyā niryāti sma/
analyzed: śrāvastyāḥ niryāti sma
translated: He departed from Śrāvastī.

original: yena jetavanam anāthapiṇḍadasyaārāmas tenaupasaṃkrāntaḥ/
analyzed: yena jetavanam anāthapiṇḍadasya ārāmaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: He approached the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: tasya khalu yāvatī yānasya bhūmis tāvad yānena gatvā sa yānād avatīrya pattikāyaparivṛtaḥ pattikāyapuraskṛtaḥ padbhyām evaārāmaṃ prāvikṣat/
analyzed: tasya khalu yāvatī yānasya bhūmiḥ tāvat yānena gatvā sa yānāt avatīrya pattikāya parivṛtaḥ pattikāya puraskṛtaḥ padbhyām eva ārāmam prāvikṣat
translated: Having gone as far as the ground for the chariot would allow, he got down from the chariot, and surrounded and in front of a group of foot soldiers, he entered the park on foot.

original: praviśya yena bhagavāṃs tenaupasaṃkrāntaḥ/
analyzed: praviśya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Having entered, he approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ/
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: te api saṃbahulāḥ śrāvasteyakā brāhmaṇakṣatiryagṛhapatayo bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvāekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ/
analyzed: te api saṃbahulāḥ śrāvasteyakāḥ brāhmaṇa kṣa tirya gṛhapatayaḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: Those many brahmins, householders, and animals from Śrāvastī also bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: apy aikatyā bhagavatā sārdhaṃ saṃmukhaṃ saṃrañjanīṃ saṃmodinīṃ vividhāṃ kathāṃ vyatisāryaekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ/
analyzed: api aikatyāḥ bhagavatā sārdham saṃmukham saṃrañjanīm saṃmodinīm vividhām kathām vyatisārya ekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: Some, after engaging in various delightful and joyful conversations with the Blessed One, sat to one side.

original: apy aikasyā bhagavataḥ purataḥ
analyzed: api ā ekasyāḥ bhagavataḥ puratas
translated: Some, in the presence of the Blessed One,

original: svakasvakāni mātāpaitṛkāṇi nāmagotrāṇi anuśrāvyaekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ/
analyzed: svaka svakāni mātā paitṛkāṇi nāma gotrāṇi anuśrāvya ekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: having announced their own and their parents' names and clans, sat down to one side.🔽Some, having bowed down with their heads at the Blessed One's feet, sat down to one side.

original: apy aikatya yena bhagavāṃs tenaañjaliṃ praṇamyaekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ/
analyzed: api aikatya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya ekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: Some, having raised their hands in respectful salutation to the Blessed One, sat down to one side.

original: apy aikatyās tūṣṇīṃ bhūtā ekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ/
analyzed: api aikatyāḥ tūṣṇīm bhūtāḥ ekānte niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: Some, having sat down in silence, sat down to one side.

original: p / / / /atha bhagavān rājānaṃ prasenajitaṃ kauśalam ārabhya teṣāṃ ca saṃbahulānāṃ
analyzed: atha bhagavān rājānam prasenajitam kauśalam ārabhya teṣām ca saṃbahulānām
translated: Then the Blessed One, having understood the thoughts of King Prasenajit of Kosala and those many

original: śrāvasteyakānāṃ brāhmaṇakṣatriyagṛhapatīnāṃ cetasā cittam ājñāya prakṛter bhikṣuṇyāḥ
analyzed: śrāvasteyakānām brāhmaṇa kṣatriya gṛhapatīnām cetasā cittam ājñāya prakṛteḥ bhikṣuṇyāḥ
translated: Brāhmaṇas, Kṣatriyas, and householders from Śrāvastī, spoke to the monks about the past abodes of the nun Prakṛti,

original: pūrvanivāsam ārabhya bhikṣūnām antrayate sma /
analyzed: pūrva nivāsam ārabhya bhikṣūnām antrayate sma
translated: beginning with her.

original: icchatha yūyaṃ bhikṣavas tathāāgatasya sammukhaṃ prakṛter bhikṣuṇyāḥ pūrvanivāsam ārabhya dharmakathāṃ śrotum/
analyzed: icchatha yūyam bhikṣavaḥ tathāāgatasya sammukham prakṛteḥ bhikṣuṇyāḥ pūrva nivāsam ārabhya dharma kathām śrotum
translated: Monks, do you wish to hear a Dharma discourse from the Tathāgata about the past abodes of the nun Prakṛti?

original: p / // /bhikṣavo bhagavantam āhuḥ /
analyzed: bhagavantam āhuḥ
translated: The monks said to the Blessed One:

original: etasya bhagavan kāla etasya sugata samayo yad bhagavān prakṛter bhikṣuṇyāḥ pūrvanivāsam ārabhya dharmakathāṃ kathāyet/
analyzed: etasya bhagavan kālaḥ etasya sugata samayaḥ yat bhagavān prakṛteḥ bhikṣuṇyāḥ pūrva nivāsam ārabhya dharma kathām kathāyet
translated: This is the time, O Blessed One, this is the occasion, O Sugata, for the Blessed One to speak a Dharma discourse beginning with the past abodes of the nun Prakṛti.

original: yad bhagavataḥ
analyzed: yat bhagavataḥ
translated: For the Blessed One is the knower,🔽the seer,

original: śrutvā bhikṣavo dhārayiṣyanti/
analyzed: śrutvā bhikṣavaḥ dhārayiṣyanti
translated: Having heard it, the monks will retain it.

original: bhagavān āha/
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tena hi bhikṣavaḥ śṛṇuta sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta bhāṣiṣye/🔽evaṃ sādhu bhagavann iti te bhikṣavo bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣuḥ/ bhagavāṃs
analyzed: tena hi bhikṣavaḥ śṛṇuta sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta bhāṣiṣye  evam sādhu bhagavan iti te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣuḥ bhagavān
translated: Therefore, monks, listen well and pay close attention. I will speak.

original: tān idam avocat/
analyzed: tān idam avocat
translated: Very well, Blessed One, those monks replied to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said this to them:

original: p / // /bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo atīte adhvani gaṅgātaṭe atimuktakadalīpāṭalakaāmalakī vanagahanapradeśe tatra triśaṅkur nāma mātaṅgarājaḥ
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ atīte adhvani gaṅgā taṭe atimukta kadalī pāṭalaka āmalakī vana gahana pradeśe tatra triśaṅkuḥ nāma mātaṅga rājaḥ  /
translated: Monks, in the past, on the banks of the Ganges, in a dense forest of atimuktaka, plantain, pāṭala, and āmalakī trees, there lived a mountaineer king named Triśaṅku.

original: prativasati sma/
analyzed: prativasati sma
translated: He resided there.

original: saṃbahulaiś ca mātaṅgasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ/
analyzed: saṃbahulaiḥ ca mātaṅga sahasraiḥ sārdham
translated: And he lived together with many thousands of mountaineers.

original: sa punar bhikṣavas triśaṅkur mātaṅgarajaḥ pūrvajanmaadhītān vedān samanusmarati sma saaṅgaupāṅgān sarahasyān sanighaṇṭakaiṭabhān saakṣaraprabhedān
analyzed: sa punar bhikṣavaḥ triśaṅkuḥ mātaṅga rajaḥ pūrva janma adhītān vedān samanusmarati sma sa aṅga aupāṅgān sa rahasyān sa nighaṇṭa kaiṭabhān sa akṣara prabhedān

analyzed: ca tad pratyayāt saṃjanayitvā lalāṭe tri śikhām bhṛkuṭim kṛtvā kaṇṭham dhamayitvā akṣiṇī
translated: anger, hatred, and resentment. Due to that, he knitted his brow into three furrows on his forehead, puffed out his neck, rolled back his

original: parivartya nakulapiṅgalāṃ dṛṣṭim utpādya triśaṅkuṃ mātaṅgarājam idam avocat /
analyzed: parivartya nakula piṅgalām dṛṣṭim utpādya triśaṅkum mātaṅga rājam idam avocat
translated: eyes, and produced a tawny mongoose-like gaze. He then said this to Triśaṅku, the Mātaṅga king:

original: p / // /dhig grāmyaviṣaya/
analyzed: grāmya viṣaya
translated: Fie on the vulgar realm!

original: caṇḍāla/
analyzed: caṇḍāla
translated: Outcaste!

original: nedaṃ śvapākavacanaṃ yuktaṃ/
analyzed: na idam śvapāka vacanam yuktam
translated: This is not the speech of a dog-cooker.

original: yastvaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ vedapāragaṃ hīnaś caṇḍālayonijo bhūtvā icchasy avamardituṃ/
analyzed: yaḥ tvam brāhmaṇam vedapāragam hīnaḥ caṇḍāla yoni jaḥ bhūtvā icchasi avamarditum
translated: You, who are of the Chandala caste, wish to insult a Brahmin who has mastered the Vedas.

original: bho durmate/
analyzed: bho durmate
translated: O you of evil mind!

original: p / // /prakṛtiṃ tvaṃ na jānāsi /
analyzed: tvam na jānāsi
translated: You do not know your own nature.

original: ātmānaṃ caabhimanyase/
analyzed: ātmānam ca abhimanyase
translated: And you think highly of yourself.

original: p / // /bālaagre sarṣapaṃ mā bho sthāpayamā
analyzed: sarṣapam mā bho
translated: O you who are like a child, do not place a mustard seed on the tip of a blade of grass.

original: kleśam āgamaḥ/
analyzed: kleśam āgamaḥ
translated: You will only bring about your own destruction.

original: p / // /mā prārthayā aprārthanīyāṃ vāyuṃ pāśena bandhaya/
analyzed: prārthaya a prārthanīyām vāyum pāśena bandhaya
translated: Do not desire what should not be desired, try to bind the wind with a noose.

original: p / // / na hi cāmīkaraṃ mūḍha bhaved bhasma kadācana/
analyzed: na hi cāmīkaram mūḍha bhavet bhasma kadācana
translated: O fool, gold can never become ashes.

original: p / // /prakāśe bāndhakāre kiṃ viśeṣo nopalabhyate//
analyzed: bāndhakāre kim viśeṣaḥ na upalabhyate
translated: In light or darkness, what difference is not perceived?

original: p / // /caṇḍālayonijas tvaṃ hi dvijātiḥ punar apy ahaṃ/
analyzed: tvam hi dvijātiḥ punar api aham
translated: You are born from the womb of a Chandala, and I am a twice-born.

original: p / // /hīnaḥ śreṣṭhena sambandhaṃ mūḍha prāthayase kathaṃ//
analyzed: śreṣṭhena sambandham mūḍha prāthayase katham
translated: O fool, how do you desire a connection with the superior?

original: p / // /caṇḍālayonibhūtas tvam aham asmi dvijātijaḥ/
analyzed: tvam aham asmi dvijāti jaḥ
translated: You are born from the womb of a Chandala, and I am born from the womb of a twice-born.

original: p / // /na hi śreṣṭhaḥ prahīnena sambandhaṃ kartum icchati//
analyzed: hi śreṣṭhaḥ prahīnena sambandham kartum icchati
translated: The superior does not wish to have a connection with the inferior.

original: p / // /śreṣṭhāḥ śreṣṭhair hi sambandhaṃ kurvantīha dvijātayaḥ/
analyzed: śreṣṭhaiḥ hi sambandham kurvanti iha dvijātayaḥ
translated: The best of the twice-born here in this world form connections with the best.

original: p / // /vidyayā ye tu sampannāḥ saṃśuddhaś caraṇena ca//
analyzed: ye tu sampannāḥ saṃśuddhaḥ caraṇena ca
translated: Those who are endowed with knowledge and pure conduct,

original: p / // /jātyā caivān abhikṣiptā mantraiḥ paramatāṃ gatāḥ/
analyzed: ca evān abhikṣiptāḥ mantraiḥ parama tām gatāḥ
translated: Those who are not censured by birth and have attained the highest state through mantras,

original: p / // /adhyāpakā mantradharās triṣu vedeṣu pāragāḥ//
analyzed: mantra dharāḥ triṣu vedeṣu pāragāḥ
translated: Those who are teachers, possessers of mantras, and masters of the three Vedas,

original: p / // /nighaṇṭakaiṭabhān vedān brāhmaṇa ye hy adhīyate/
analyzed: vedān brāhmaṇa ye hi adhīyate
translated: Those Brahmins who study the Vedas along with the Nighaṇṭus and Kaiṭabhas,

original: p / // /tais tādṛśair hi sambandhaṃ kurvantīha dvijātayaḥ//
analyzed: tādṛśaiḥ hi sambandham kurvanti iha dvijātayaḥ
translated: It is with such people that the twice-born ones form connections in this world.

original: p / // /na hi śreṣṭho hi hīnena sambandhaṃ kartum icchati/
analyzed: hi śreṣṭhaḥ hi hīnena sambandham kartum icchati
translated: For the best does not wish to form a connection with the inferior,

original: p / // /prārthayase aprārthanīyāṃ vāyuṃ pāśena bandhituṃ//
analyzed: a prārthanīyām vāyum pāśena bandhitum
translated: You seek what is not to be sought, like trying to bind the wind with a noose.

original: p / // /yad asmābhiś ca sambandham iha tvaṃ kartum icchasi/
analyzed: asmābhiḥ ca sambandham iha tvam kartum icchasi
translated: The connection that you wish to form with us here,

original: p / // /jugupsitaḥ sarvaloke kṛpaṇaḥpuruṣādhamaḥ/
analyzed: sarva loke kṛpaṇaḥ puruṣa adhamaḥ
translated: You are despised in all worlds, a miserly wretch of a man,

original: p / // /gaccha tvaṃ vṛṣala kṣipraṃ kim asmān avamanyase//
analyzed: tvam vṛṣala kṣipram kim asmān avamanyase
translated: Go away quickly, O outcaste, why do you insult us?

original: p / // /caṇḍālāḥ saha caṇḍālaiḥ pukkaśāḥ saha pukkaśaiḥ/
analyzed: saha caṇḍālaiḥ pukkaśāḥ saha pukkaśaiḥ
translated: The Chandalas with the Chandalas, the Pukkasas with the Pukkasas,

original: p / // /kurvantīhaiva sambandhaṃ jātibhir jātir eva ca//
analyzed: sambandham jātibhiḥ jātiḥ eva ca
translated: They form connections here in this world with their own kind and with their own caste.

original: p / // /brāhmaṇā brāhmaṇaiḥ sārdhaṃ kṣatriyāḥ kṣatriyaiḥ saha/
analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ sārdham kṣatriyāḥ kṣatriyaiḥ saha
translated: Brahmins with Brahmins, Kshatriyas with Kshatriyas,

original: p / // /sārdhaṃ vaiśyās tathā vaiśyaiḥ śūdrāḥ śūdrais tathā saha//
analyzed: vaiśyāḥ tathā vaiśyaiḥ śūdrāḥ śūdraiḥ tathā saha
translated: Vaisyas with Vaisyas, and Shudras with Shudras.

original: p / // /sadṛśāḥ sadṛśaiḥ sārdham āvahanti parasparaṃ/
analyzed: sadṛśaiḥ sārdham āvahanti parasparam
translated: Those of equal status marry each other.

original: p / // /na hi kurvanti caṇḍālāḥ sambandhaṃ brāhmaṇaiḥ saha//
analyzed: hi kurvanti caṇḍālāḥ sambandham brāhmaṇaiḥ saha
translated: Chandala, you cannot form a relationship with Brahmins.

original: p / // /sarvajātivihīno asi sarvavarṇajugupsitaḥ/
analyzed: asi sarva varṇa jugupsitaḥ
translated: You are devoid of all castes, despised by all classes.

original: p / // /kathaṃ hīnaś ca śreṣṭhena sambandhaṃ kartum icchasi//
analyzed: hīnaḥ ca śreṣṭhena sambandham kartum icchasi
translated: How can you, being inferior, wish to form a relationship with one who is superior?

original: p / // /idaṃ punarvacanaṃ śrutvā brāhmaṇasya puṣkarasāriṇas triśaṅkur mātaṅgarāja idam avocat/
analyzed: punarvacanam śrutvā brāhmaṇasya puṣkarasāriṇaḥ triśaṅkuḥ mātaṅga rājaḥ idam avocat
translated: Having heard this statement of the Brahmin Pushkarasara, King Trisanku of the Matangas said this:

original: p / // /yathā bhasmani sauvarṇe viśeṣa /🔽upalabhyate/
analyzed: bhasmani sauvarṇe viśeṣa  upalabhyate
translated: Just as there is no difference between gold and ashes,

original: p / // /brāhmaṇe vānyajātau vā na viśeṣo asti vai tathā//
analyzed: vā anya jātau vā na viśeṣaḥ asti vai tathā
translated: so there is no difference between a Brahmin and another caste.

original: p / // /yathā prakāśatamasor viśeṣa /🔽upalabhyate/🔽p / // /brāhmaṇe vānyajātau vā na viśeṣo asti vai tathā//🔽p / // /na hi brāhmaṇa /
analyzed: prakāśa tamasoḥ viśeṣa  upalabhyate  vā anya jātau vā na viśeṣaḥ asti vai tathā  hi brāhmaṇa
translated: Just as there is a difference between light and darkness,🔽so there is a difference between a Brahmin and another caste.

original: ākāśān maruto vā samutthitaḥ/
analyzed: ākāśāt marutaḥ vā samutthitaḥ
translated: A Brahmin does not arise from space or the Maruts.

original: p / // /bhitvā vā pṛthivīṃ jāto jātavedā yathāraṇeḥ//
analyzed: vā pṛthivīm jātaḥ jātavedāḥ yathā araṇeḥ
translated: Having split the earth, he is born, like the fire from the friction wood.

original: p / // /brāhmaṇā yonito jātāś caṇḍālā /
analyzed: yonitaḥ jātāḥ caṇḍālā
translated: The Chandālas are born from the womb, like the Brahmins.

original: api yonitaḥ/
analyzed: api yonitaḥ
translated: Even from the womb.

original: p / // /śreṣṭhatve vṛṣalatve ca kiṃ vā paśyasi kāraṇaṃ//
analyzed: vṛṣala tve ca kim vā paśyasi kāraṇam
translated: What do you see as the reason for their superiority and Śūdra status?

original: p / // /brāhmaṇo api mṛtotsṛṣṭo jugupsyo aśucir ucyate/
analyzed: api mṛta utsṛṣṭaḥ jugupsyaḥ aśuciḥ ucyate
translated: Even a dead Brahmin, abandoned, is said to be disgusting and impure.

original: p / // /varṇās tathāeva vāapy anye kā nu tatra viśeṣatā//
analyzed: tathā eva vā api anye kā nu tatra viśeṣa tā
translated: Or are the other castes exactly the same? What is the distinction there?

original: p / // /yat kiñ cit pāpakaṃ karma kilviṣaṃ kalir eva ca/
analyzed: kim cit pāpakam karma kilviṣam kaliḥ eva ca
translated: Whatever sinful deed, evil, and quarrel there is,

original: p / // /sattvānām upaghātāya brāhmaṇais tat prakāśitaṃ//
analyzed: upaghātāya brāhmaṇaiḥ tat prakāśitam
translated: The Brahmins have revealed that for the harm of beings.

original: p / // /iti karmāṇi caetāni prakāśitāni brāhmaṇaiḥ/
analyzed: karmāṇi ca etāni prakāśitāni brāhmaṇaiḥ
translated: Thus, these deeds have been revealed by the Brahmins.

original: p / // /karmabhir dāruṇaiś caapi puṇyo ahaṃ'' brūvate dvijāḥ//
analyzed: dāruṇaiḥ ca api puṇyaḥ aham dvijāḥ
translated: And by these terrible deeds, the twice-born say, 'I am meritorious.'

original: p / // /māṃsaṃ khāditukāmais tu brāhmaṇair upakalpitaṃ/
analyzed: khāditu kāmaiḥ tu brāhmaṇaiḥ upakalpitam
translated: Meat has been prepared by Brahmins who desire to eat it.

original: p / // /mantrair hi prokṣitāḥ santaḥ svargaṃ gacchanty ajaiḍakāḥ//
analyzed: hi prokṣitāḥ santaḥ svargam gacchanti aja eḍakāḥ
translated: Having been sprinkled with mantras, the goats and sheep go to heaven.

original: p / // /yady eṣa mārgaḥ svartāya kasmān na brāhmaṇā hy amī/
analyzed: eṣa mārgaḥ svartāya kasmāt na brāhmaṇāḥ hi amī
translated: If this is the path to heaven, why do not these Brahmins

original: p / // /ātmānam athavā bandhūn mantraiḥ saṃprokṣayanti vai//
analyzed: athavā bandhūn mantraiḥ saṃprokṣayanti vai
translated: Or they sprinkle themselves and their relatives with mantras.

original: p / // /mātaraṃ pitaraṃ caeva bhrātaraṃ bhaginīṃ tathā/
analyzed: pitaram ca eva bhrātaram bhaginīm tathā
translated: They do not sprinkle their mother, father, brother, sister,

original: p / // /putraṃ duhitaraṃ bhāryāṃ dvijā na prokṣayanty amī//
analyzed: duhitaram bhāryām dvijāḥ na prokṣayanti amī
translated: Son, daughter, wife - these Brahmins do not sprinkle.

original: p / // /mitraṃ jñātiṃ sakhīṃ vāapi ye vā viṣayavāsinaḥ/
analyzed: jñātim sakhīm vā api ye vā viṣaya vāsinaḥ
translated: Nor friends, relatives, companions, or those who live in the country.

original: p / // /prokṣitās te api vā mantraiḥ sarve yāsyanti sadgatiṃ//
analyzed: te api vā mantraiḥ sarve yāsyanti sat gatim
translated: Even if they are sprinkled with mantras, all will attain a good state.

original: p / // /sarve yajñaiḥ samāhutā gamiṣyanti satāṃ gatiṃ/
analyzed: yajñaiḥ samāhutāḥ gamiṣyanti satām gatim
translated: All invited with sacrifices will go to the state of the virtuous.

original: p / // /paśubhiḥ kiṃ nu bho yaṣṭair ātmānaṃ kiṃ na yakṣyase//
analyzed: kim nu bho yaṣṭaiḥ ātmānam kim na yakṣyase
translated: What is the use of sacrificing animals? Why not sacrifice yourself?

original: p / // /na prokṣaṇair na mantraiś ca svargaṃ gacchanty ajaiḍakāḥ/
analyzed: prokṣaṇaiḥ na mantraiḥ ca svargam gacchanti aja eḍakāḥ
translated: Goats and sheep do not go to heaven by sprinkling and mantras.

original: p / // /na hy eṣa mārgaḥ svargāya mithyāprokṣaṇam ucyate//
analyzed: hi eṣa mārgaḥ svargāya mithyā prokṣaṇam ucyate
translated: This is not the way to heaven; false sprinkling is said to be.

original: p / // /brāhmaṇair audracittais tu paryāyo hy eṣa cintitaḥ/
analyzed: audracittaiḥ tu paryāyaḥ hi eṣa cintitaḥ
translated: But this alternative was thought of by Brahmins with cruel minds.

original: p / // /māṃsaṃ khāditukāmais tu prokṣaṇaṃ kalpitaṃ paśoḥ//
analyzed: khāditu kāmaiḥ tu prokṣaṇam kalpitam paśoḥ
translated: For those who desire to eat meat, sprinkling of the animal was devised.

original: p / // /anyac caahaṃ pravakṣyāmi brāhmaṇair yat prakalpitaṃ/
analyzed: ca aham pravakṣyāmi brāhmaṇaiḥ yat prakalpitam
translated: And I will speak of another thing devised by Brahmins:

original: p / // /pātakā hi samākhyātā brāhmaṇeṣu caturvidhāḥ//
analyzed: hi samākhyātāḥ brāhmaṇeṣu caturvidhāḥ
translated: The four kinds of mortal sins are declared among Brahmins.

original: p / // /suvarṇacauryaṃ madyaṃ ca gurudārāabhimardanaṃ/
analyzed: madyam ca guru dārāḥ abhimardanam
translated: Stealing gold, drinking alcohol, violating the guru's bed,

original: p / // /brahmāghnatā ca catvāraḥ pātakā brāhmaṇeṣv amī//
analyzed: ca catvāraḥ pātakāḥ brāhmaṇeṣu amī
translated: and killing a Brahmin - these four mortal sins are among Brahmins.

original: p / // /suvarṇaharaṇaṃ varjyaṃ steyam anyanna vidyate/
analyzed: varjyam steyam anyat na vidyate
translated: Stealing gold should be avoided, there is no other theft.

original: p / // /suvarṇaṃ yo hared vipraḥ sa tena abrāhmaṇo bhavet//
analyzed: yaḥ haret vipraḥ sa tena abrāhmaṇaḥ bhavet
translated: A Brahmin who steals gold would thereby cease to be a Brahmin.

original: p / // /surāpānaṃ na pātavyam anyapānaṃ yatheṣṭataḥ/
analyzed: na pātavyam anya pānam yatheṣṭataḥ
translated: Alcohol should not be drunk, other drinks as one wishes.

original: p / // /surāṃ tu yaḥ pived vipraḥ sa tenaabrāhmaṇo bhavet//
analyzed: tu yaḥ pivet vipraḥ sa tena abrāhmaṇaḥ bhavet
translated: But a Brahmin who drinks alcohol would thereby cease to be a Brahmin.

original: p / // /gurudārā na gantavyā /
analyzed: na gantavyā
translated: The guru's wife should not be approached.

original: anyadārā yatheṣṭataḥ/
analyzed: anya dārāḥ yatheṣṭataḥ
translated: Other wives as one wishes.

original: p / // /gurudārāṃ tu yo gacchet sa tenaabrāhmaṇo bhavet//
analyzed: tu yaḥ gacchet sa tena abrāhmaṇaḥ bhavet
translated: But one who approaches the guru's wife would thereby cease to be a Brahmin.

original: p / // /na hanyād brāhmaṇaṃ hy ekaṃ hanyād anyān anekaśaḥ/
analyzed: hanyāt brāhmaṇam hi ekam hanyāt anyān anekaśas
translated: One should not kill a single Brahmin, one may kill many others.

original: p / // /hayātta brāhmaṇaṃ yo vai sa tenaabrāhmaṇo bhavet//
analyzed: brāhmaṇam yaḥ vai sa tena abrāhmaṇaḥ bhavet
translated: But one who kills a Brahmin on a horse would thereby cease to be a Brahmin.

original: p / // /ity ete pātakā hy uktā brāhmaṇeṣu caturvidhāḥ/
analyzed: ete pātakāḥ hi uktāḥ brāhmaṇeṣu caturvidhāḥ
translated: Thus these four kinds of mortal sins are declared among Brahmins.

original: p / // /bhavanty abrāhmaṇā yena tato anye apātakāḥ smṛtāḥ//
analyzed: a brāhmaṇāḥ yena tatas anye a pātakāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: By which one becomes non-Brahmin, therefore others are remembered as non-sinners.

original: p / // /kṛtvā caturṇam ekaikaṃ bhaved abrāhmaṇas tu saḥ/
analyzed: caturṇam ekaikam bhavet abrāhmaṇaḥ tu saḥ
translated: Having committed one of the four, he becomes a non-Brahmin.

original: p / // /labhate na ca sāmīcīṃ brāhmaṇāṇāṃ samāgame/
analyzed: na ca sāmīcīm brāhmaṇāṇām samāgame
translated: He does not obtain the right conduct in the assembly of Brahmins.

original: p / // /āsanaṃ caudakaṃ caeva vyutthānaṃ sa na caarhati//
analyzed: ca audakam ca eva vyutthānam sa na ca arhati
translated: He does not deserve the seat, water, and rising up.

original: p / // /tasya niḥsaranaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ brāhmaṇaiḥ patitasya tu/
analyzed: niḥsaranam dṛṣṭam brāhmaṇaiḥ patitasya tu
translated: The escape of that fallen Brahmin is seen.

original: p / // /vrataṃ vai sa samādāya punar brāhmaṇatāṃ vrajet//
analyzed: vai sa samādāya punar brāhmaṇa tām vrajet
translated: Having taken up that vow, he would again go to Brahminhood.

original: p / // /asau dvādaśavarṣāṇi dhārayitvā kharājinaṃ/
analyzed: dvādaśa varṣāṇi dhārayitvā khara ajinam
translated: Having borne the black antelope skin for twelve years,

original: p / // /khāṭvāṅgam ucchritaṃ kṛtvā mṛtaśīrṣe ca bhojanaṃ//
analyzed: ucchritam kṛtvā mṛta śīrṣe ca bhojanam
translated: having erected the Khaṭvāṅga, and eating from a dead man's head,

original: p / // /etad vrataṃ samādāya niścayena nirantaraṃ/
analyzed: vratam samādāya niścayena nirantaram
translated: having taken up this vow with certainty and continuously,

original: p / // /pūrṇe dvādaśame varṣe punar brāhmaṇatāṃ vrajet//
analyzed: dvādaśame varṣe punar brāhmaṇa tām vrajet
translated: at the end of the twelfth year, he would again go to Brahminhood.

original: p / // /iti niḥsaraṇaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ brāhmaṇais tu tapasvibhiḥ/
analyzed: niḥsaraṇam dṛṣṭam brāhmaṇaiḥ tu tapasvibhiḥ
translated: Thus the escape is seen by the Brahmins and ascetics,

original: p / // /kumārgagāmibhir mūḍhair aniḥsaraṇadarśibhiḥ//
analyzed: mūḍhaiḥ a niḥsaraṇa darśibhiḥ
translated: by the deluded ones going on the wrong path, who do not see the escape.

original: p / // tad idaṃ brāhmaṇa te bravīmi /
analyzed: tat idam brāhmaṇa te bravīmi
translated: This I tell you, Brahmin.

original: saṃjñāmātrakam idaṃ lokasya yad idam ucyate brāhmaṇa iti vā kṣatriya iti vā vaiśya iti vā śūdra ity vā/
analyzed: saṃjñā mātrakam idam lokasya yat idam ucyate brāhmaṇaḥ iti vā kṣatriyaḥ iti vā vaiśyaḥ iti vā śūdraḥ iti vā
translated: This idea of the world, namely that it is called a Brahmin, a Kshatriya, a Vaishya, or a Shudra, is merely a concept.

original: sarvam idam ekam eveti vijñaya putrāya me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtiṃ māṇavikāmanuprayaccha bhāryāarthāya/
analyzed: sarvam idam ekam eva iti vijñaya putrāya me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtim māṇavikām anuprayaccha bhāryā arthāya
translated: Knowing that all this is indeed one, give me your daughter Sharadnakarna as a wife.

original: yāvantaṃ kulaśulkaṃ manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi/
analyzed: yāvantam kula śulkam manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi
translated: I will give you as much dowry as you think fit.

original: idaṃ ca khalu punarvacanaṃ śrutvā triśaṅkor mātaṅgarājasya
analyzed: idam ca khalu punarvacanam śrutvā triśaṅkoḥ mātaṅga rājasya
translated: Having heard these words of King Trisanku,

original: brāhmaṇaḥ puṣkarasārī abhiṣaktaḥ kupitaś caṇḍībhūto anāttamanāḥ kopaṃ ca dveṣaṃ ca catpratyayaṃ janayitvā lalāṭe triśikhāṃ bhṛkuṭiṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ puṣkarasārī abhiṣaktaḥ kupitaḥ caṇḍībhūtaḥ an ātta manāḥ kopam ca dveṣam ca cat pratyayam janayitvā lalāṭe tri śikhām bhṛkuṭim kṛtvā
translated: the Brahmin Pushkarasara became angry, agitated, and displeased. He generated anger, hatred, and resentment, knitted his eyebrows in three furrows on his forehead,

original: dhamayitvā akṣiṇī parivartya nakulapiṅgalāṃ dūṣṭim utpādya triśaṅkuṃ mātaṅgarājam idam avocat/
analyzed: dhamayitvā akṣiṇī parivartya nakula piṅgalām dūṣṭim utpādya triśaṅkum mātaṅga rājam idam avocat
translated: wiped his eyes, and with a harsh and tawny gaze, he said this to King Trisanku:

original: p / // /asamīkṣyaitattvayā hi kṛtā saṃjñeyam īdṛśī/
analyzed: hi kṛtā saṃjñā iyam īdṛśī
translated: Having not considered this, you have made such a designation.

original: p / // /ekaiva jātir loke asmin sāmānyā na pṛthagvidhā//
analyzed: jātiḥ loke asmin sāmānyā na pṛthagvidhā
translated: There is only one caste in this world, common, not of different kinds.

original: p / // /kathaṃ śvapākajātīyo brāhmaṇaṃ vedapāragaṃ/
analyzed: śvapāka jātīyaḥ brāhmaṇam vedapāragam
translated: How can one of the class of a dog-cooker (a Chandala) kill a Brahmana who has mastered the Vedas?

original: p / // /nihīnayonijo bhūtvā vimarditum ihaicchasi//
analyzed: bhūtvā vimarditum iha ecchasi
translated: How can you, who are like a dog-cooker, wish to dispute here with a Brahmin who has mastered the Vedas?🔽 You who are born in a low caste, how can you wish to dispute with one who is born in a high caste?

original: p / // /rājānaḥ khalu vṛṣala prativibhāgajñā bhavanti/
analyzed: khalu vṛṣala prativibhāga jñāḥ bhavanti
translated: O Vrisala, kings are indeed experts in distinguishing between different castes.

original: tad yathā deśadharme vā nagaradharme vā grāmadharme vā nigamadhama vā śulkadharme vā āvāhadharme vā vivāhadharme vā pūrvakarmasu vā/
analyzed: tat yathā deśa dharme vā nagara dharme vā grāma dharme vā nigama dharme vā śulka dharme vā āvāha dharme vā vivāha dharme vā pūrva karmasu vā
translated: For example, in matters of local law, city law, village law, town law, tariff law, marriage law, or in previous deeds.

original: catvāra ime vṛṣala varṇāḥ/
analyzed: catvāra ime vṛṣala varṇāḥ
translated: O Vrisala, there are four castes:

original: yad uta brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyo vaiśyaḥ śūdra iti/
analyzed: yat uta brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyaḥ vaiśyaḥ śūdraḥ iti
translated: namely, Brahmin, Kshatriya, Vaishya, and Shudra.

original: teṣāṃ vivāhadharmeṣu catasro bhāryā brāhmaṇasya bhavanti/
analyzed: teṣām vivāha dharmeṣu catasraḥ bhāryāḥ brāhmaṇasya bhavanti
translated: Among their marriage laws, a Brahmin may have four wives:

original: tad yathā brāhmaṇī kṣatriyā
analyzed: tat yathā brāhmaṇī kṣatriyā
translated: namely, a Brahmin woman, a Kshatriya woman,

original: vaiśyā śūdrī ceti/
analyzed: vaiśyā śūdrī ca iti
translated: a Vaishya woman, and a Shudra woman.

original: tisraḥ kṣatriyasya bhāryā bhavanti/
analyzed: tisraḥ kṣatriyasya bhāryāḥ bhavanti
translated: A Kshatriya may have three wives:

original: kṣatriyā vaiśyā śūdrī ceti/
analyzed: kṣatriyā vaiśyā śūdrī ca iti
translated: a Kshatriya woman, a Vaishya woman, and a Shudra woman.

original: vaiśyasya dve bhārye bhavataḥ/
analyzed: vaiśyasya dve bhārye bhavataḥ
translated: A Vaishya may have two wives:

original: vaiśyā śūdrī ceti/
analyzed: vaiśyā śūdrī ca iti
translated: a Vaishya woman and a Shudra woman.

original: śūdrasya av ekā bhāryā bhavati śūdrī eva/
analyzed: śūdrasya au ekā bhāryā bhavati śūdrī eva
translated: A Shudra may have only one wife, a Shudra woman.

original: evaṃ brāhmaṇasya vṛṣala catvāraḥ putrā bhavanti/
analyzed: evam brāhmaṇasya vṛṣala catvāraḥ putrāḥ bhavanti
translated: O Vrisala, a Brahmin may have four sons:

original: tad yathā brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyo vaiśyaḥ śūdraś ceti/
analyzed: tat yathā brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyaḥ vaiśyaḥ śūdraḥ ca iti
translated: Namely, a Brahmin, a Kshatriya, a Vaishya, and a Shudra.

original: kṣatriyasya trayaḥ putrāḥ /
analyzed: kṣatriyasya trayaḥ putrāḥ
translated: For a Kshatriya, there are three sons:

original: kṣatriyo vaiśyaḥ śūdra iti/
analyzed: kṣatriyaḥ vaiśyaḥ śūdraḥ iti
translated: A Kshatriya, a Vaishya, and a Shudra.

original: vaiśyasya dvau putrau / vaiśyaḥ
analyzed: vaiśyasya dvau putrau vaiśyaḥ
translated: For a Vaishya, there are two sons: a Vaishya

original: śūdra iti/ śūdrasya tv eka eva putro bhavati yad uta śūdra eva/
analyzed: śūdraḥ iti śūdrasya tu ekaḥ eva putraḥ bhavati yat uta śūdraḥ eva
translated: and a Shudra. But for a Shudra, there is only one son, namely a Shudra.

original: p / // /te brāhmaṇāḥ punar vṛṣala brahmaṇaḥ putrāḥ/🔽aurasā mukhato jātāḥ/
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ punar vṛṣala brahmaṇaḥ putrāḥ  aurasāḥ mukhataḥ jātāḥ
translated: Those Brahmins are again the sons of Brahma, O Shudra.

original: urasto bāhutaḥ kṣatriyāḥ/
analyzed: urastaḥ bāhutaḥ kṣatriyāḥ
translated: They are born from his mouth, born from his breast, born from his arms,🔽the Kshatriyas are born from his chest,

original: nābhito vaiśyāḥ/
analyzed: nābhitaḥ vaiśyāḥ
translated: the Vaishyas are born from his navel,

original: padbhyāṃ śūdrāḥ/
analyzed: padbhyām śūdrāḥ
translated: and the Shudras are born from his feet.

original: p / // /brahmaṇāayaṃ khalu vṛṣala lokaḥ sarvabhūtāni nirmitāni/
analyzed: khalu vṛṣala lokaḥ sarva bhūtāni nirmitāni
translated: O Shudra, this world, indeed, was created by Brahma, all beings.

original: p / // /tasya jyeṣṭhā vayaṃ putrāḥ kṣatriyās tad anantaraṃ/
analyzed: jyeṣṭhāḥ vayam putrāḥ kṣatriyāḥ tat anantaram
translated: We are his eldest sons, the Kshatriyas are next to him,

original: p / // /vaiśyāstritīyakā varṇāḥ śūdranāmnā caturthakaḥ// iti//
analyzed: varṇāḥ śūdra nāmnā caturthakaḥ iti
translated: the Vaishyas are the third caste, and the fourth is called the Shudras.

original: p / // /sa tvaṃ vṛṣala caturthe api varṇe na saṃdṛśyase/
analyzed: tvam vṛṣala caturthe api varṇe na saṃdṛśyase
translated: O Shudra, you are not even seen in the fourth caste,

original: ahaṃ caagre varṇe śreṣṭhe varṇe parame varṇe pravare varṇe/
analyzed: aham ca agre varṇe śreṣṭhe varṇe parame varṇe pravare varṇe
translated: and I am in the foremost caste, in the best caste, in the highest caste, in the most excellent caste.

original: paramārthaṃ ca saṃyogamākāṅkṣasi praṇaśya tvaṃ vṛṣala kṣipraṃ /
analyzed: parama artham ca saṃyogam ākāṅkṣasi praṇaśya tvam vṛṣala kṣipram
translated: You desire union with the ultimate truth, perish quickly, O Shudra.

original: mā caasmākam avamaṃsthāḥ/
analyzed: mā ca asmākam avamaṃsthāḥ
translated: And do not despise us.

original: p / // /idaṃ punarvacanaṃ śrutvā brāhmaṇasya puṣkarasāriṇas triśaṅkur mātaṅgarāja idam avocat/
analyzed: punarvacanam śrutvā brāhmaṇasya puṣkarasāriṇaḥ triśaṅkuḥ mātaṅga rājaḥ idam avocat
translated: Having heard this speech again of the brahmin Puṣkarasārin, Triśaṅku, the king of the Mātaṅgas, said this:

original: idam atra brāhmaṇa śṛṇu yad bravīmi/
analyzed: idam atra brāhmaṇa śṛṇu yat bravīmi
translated: Listen to this, O brahmin, to what I say.

original: brahmaṇāayaṃ lokaḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇā ayam lokaḥ
translated: This world was created by Brahmā.

original: sarvabhūtāni nirmitāni/
analyzed: sarva bhūtāni nirmitāni
translated: All beings were created by him.

original: p / // /tasya jyeṣṭhā vayaṃ putrāḥ kṣatriyās tad anantaraṃ/
analyzed: jyeṣṭhāḥ vayam putrāḥ kṣatriyāḥ tat anantaram
translated: We are his eldest sons, the Kṣatriyas are next to us.

original: p / // /vaiśyās trṛtīyakā varṇāḥ śūdranāmnā caturthakaḥ//iti//
analyzed: trṛtīyakāḥ varṇāḥ śūdra nāmnā caturthakaḥ iti
translated: The Vaiśyas are the third caste, and the fourth is called the Śūdra.

original: p / // /sapādajaṅghāḥ sanakhāḥ samāṃsāḥ sapārśvapṛṣṭhāś ca narā bhavanti/
analyzed: sa nakhāḥ sa māṃsāḥ sa pārśva pṛṣṭhāḥ ca narāḥ bhavanti
translated: The men have legs with ankles, with nails, with flesh, with sides and backs.

original: p / // /ekāṃśato nāsti yato viśeṣo varṇāś ca catvāra ito na santi//
analyzed: na asti yatas viśeṣaḥ varṇāḥ ca catvāraḥ itas na santi
translated: There is no difference from one side, and from this the four castes do not exist.
