original: p / // /atho viśeṣaḥ pravatosti kaścit tad brūhi yac caanumataṃ yathā te/
analyzed: viśeṣaḥ pravatoḥ asti kaścid tat brūhi yat ca anumatam yathā te
translated: If there is some difference, tell us what is approved by you.

original: p / // /atho viśeṣaḥ pravaro hi nāsti varṇāś ca catvāra ito na santi//
analyzed: viśeṣaḥ pravaraḥ hi na asti varṇāḥ ca catvāraḥ itas na santi
translated: If there is no excellent difference, the four castes do not exist from this.

original: p / // / yathā hi dāurukā bālāḥ krīḍamānā mahāpathe/
analyzed: yathā hi dāurukāḥ bālāḥ krīḍamānāḥ mahāpathe
translated: Just as naughty children playing on the highway,

original: p / // /pāṃśupuñjāni saṃpiṇḍya svayaṃ nāmāni kurvate//
analyzed: saṃpiṇḍya svayam nāmāni kurvate
translated: Gather heaps of dust and give them their own names,

original: p / // /idaṃ kṣīram idaṃ dadhi /
analyzed: kṣīram idam dadhi
translated: This is milk, this is curd.

original: idaṃ māṃsam idaṃ ghṛtaṃ/
analyzed: idam māṃsam idam ghṛtam
translated: This is meat, this is ghee.

original: p / // /na ca bālasya vacanāt pāṃśavo annaṃ bhavanti hi//
analyzed: ca bālasya vacanāt pāṃśavaḥ annam bhavanti hi
translated: And by the word of a child, sand does not become food.

original: p / // /varṇās tathāiva catvāro yathā brāhmaṇa bhāṣase/
analyzed: tathā iva catvāraḥ yathā brāhmaṇa bhāṣase
translated: Just as you, Brahmin, speak of the four castes,

original: p / // /pāṃśupuñjābhidhānena yogo yaḥ ko py eṣa na vidyate//🔽p / // /na keśena na karṇābhyāṃ na śīrṣaṇa na cakṣuṣā/🔽p / // /na mukhena na nāsayā na grīvaya na bāhunā//
analyzed: yogaḥ yaḥ kaḥ api eṣa na vidyate  keśena na karṇābhyām na śīrṣaṇā na cakṣuṣā  mukhena na nāsayā na grīvayā na bāhunā
translated: There is no connection whatsoever with the designation of a heap of sand.🔽Not by hair, not by ears, not by head, not by eyes,🔽Not by mouth, not by nose, not by neck, not by arms,

original: p / // /norasāpyatha pārśvābhyāṃ na pṛṣṭhenaudareṇa ca/
analyzed: pārśvābhyām na pṛṣṭhena audareṇa ca
translated: Not by chest, not by sides, not by back, not by belly,

original: p / // /norubhyām atha jañṅhābhyāṃ pāṇipādanakhena ca//
analyzed: atha jañṅhābhyām pāṇi pāda nakhena ca
translated: Not by thighs, not by calves, not by nails of hands and feet,

original: p / // /na svareṇa na varṇena na sarvāṃśair na maithunaiḥ/
analyzed: svareṇa na varṇena na sarva aṃśaiḥ na maithunaiḥ
translated: Not by voice, not by color, not by all parts, not by sexual intercourse,

original: p / // /nānāviśeṣaḥ sarveṣu manuṣyeṣu hi vidyate//
analyzed: sarveṣu manuṣyeṣu hi vidyate
translated: There is no difference in all humans.

original: p / // /yathā hi jātiṣv anyāsu liṅgaṃ yoniḥ pṛthak pṛthak/
analyzed: hi jātiṣu anyāsu liṅgam yoniḥ pṛthak pṛthak
translated: Just as in other species, the sex organ is separate for each,

original: p / // /sāmānyaṃ kāraṇaṃ tatra kiṃ vā jātiṣu manyase//
analyzed: kāraṇam tatra kim vā jātiṣu manyase
translated: What is the common cause there? What do you think in the case of species?

original: p / // /saśīrṣakāś caatha narāsthiyuktāḥ sacarmakāḥ sendriyasodarāś ca/
analyzed: ca atha nara asthi yuktāḥ sa carmakāḥ sa indriya sodarāḥ ca
translated: Those with heads, and then human bones, along with skin, with senses, and siblings,

original: p / // /ekāṃśato nāsti yato viśeṣo varṇā na yuktāś caturo abhidhātuṃ//
analyzed: na asti yatas viśeṣaḥ varṇāḥ na yuktāḥ caturaḥ abhidhātum
translated: Since there is no difference in one aspect, it is not proper to speak of four castes.

original: p / // /athāsti kaścit pravaro viśeṣas tad brūhi yaccānumataṃ yathā te/
analyzed: kaścid pravaraḥ viśeṣaḥ tat brūhi yat ca anumatam yathā te
translated: If there is some superior difference here, tell that which is approved by you.

original: p / // /atho viśeṣaḥ pravaro atra nāsti varṇā na yuktāś caturobhidhātuṃ//
analyzed: viśeṣaḥ pravaraḥ atra na asti varṇāḥ na yuktāḥ
translated: If there is no superior difference here, it is not proper to speak of four castes.

original: p / // /doṣo hy ayaṃ caatra bhaved ayukto yad yat tvayā caabhihitaṃ nidāne/
analyzed: hi ayam ca atra bhavet ayuktaḥ yat yat tvayā ca abhihitam nidāne
translated: This fault would be improper here, which you have stated in the diagnosis.

original: p / // /śrutvā tu mattaḥ pratipadya saumya yac caatra manye śṛṇucodyamānaṃ//
analyzed: tu mattaḥ pratipadya saumya yat caatra manye śṛṇu codyamānam
translated: Having heard from me, O gentle one, understand what I think here, and listen to the accusation.

original: p / // /yac caatra yuktaṃ viṣamaṃ samaṃ vā tāt te pravakṣyāmi niyujyamānaḥ/
analyzed: ca atra yuktam viṣamam samam vā tāt te pravakṣyāmi niyujyamānaḥ
translated: And what is proper here, whether uneven or even, I will tell you when employed, O father.

original: p / // /doṣo hi yaś caapi bhaved ayukto vakṣyāmi te hy uttaratauttaraṃ ca/
analyzed: hi yaḥ ca api bhavet ayuktaḥ vakṣyāmi te hi ca
translated: And whatever fault there may be, which is improper, I will tell you the reply and the subsequent reply.

original: p / // /śrutvā tu mattaḥ pratipadya saumya karmaadhipatyaprabhavā manuṣyāḥ//🔽p / // /anumānam api te brāhmaṇa yadi pramāṇaṃ /
analyzed: tu mattaḥ pratipadya saumya karma adhipatya prabhavāḥ manuṣyāḥ 🔽api te brāhmaṇa yadi pramāṇam
translated: Having heard from me, O gentle one, understand that humans are born from the power of karma.

original: tatra yad bravīṣi brahmā eka iti tasmāt prajā api ekajātyā eva/
analyzed: tatra yat bravīṣi brahmā ekaḥ iti tasmāt prajāḥ api eka jātyāḥ eva
translated: Regarding that, what you say - that Brahman is one - therefore, the people are also of only one caste.

original: vayam apy ekajātyā bhavāmaḥ/
analyzed: vayam api eka jātyāḥ bhavāmaḥ
translated: We also become of one caste.

original: yac ca vravīṣi brahmaṇāayaṃ lokaḥ sarvabhūtāni ca nirmitāniiti/
analyzed: yat ca vravīṣi brahmaṇā ayam lokaḥ sarva bhūtāni ca nirmitāni iti
translated: And what you say - that this world and all beings were created by Brahman -

original: sa cette brāhmaṇa idaṃ pramāṇaṃ /
analyzed: sa ced te brāhmaṇaḥ idam pramāṇam
translated: If that is your authority, O Brahmin,

original: tad idaṃ te brāhmaṇa ayuktaṃ yad bravīṣi catvāro varṇā brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyā vaiśyā śūdrāś ceti/
analyzed: tat idam te brāhmaṇa ayuktam yat bravīṣi catvāraḥ varṇāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyāḥ vaiśyā śūdrāḥ ca iti
translated: then this is improper for you, O Brahmin, that you say there are four castes: Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras.

original: p / // /api tu brāhmaṇa mithyā mama vaco bhavet yadi brāhmaṇa saṃvādena munuṣyajāter nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: tu brāhmaṇa mithyā mama vacaḥ bhavet yadi brāhmaṇa saṃvādena munuṣya jāteḥ nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: Moreover, O Brahmin, my words would be false if, by the agreement of Brahmins, a difference in human birth is not recognized.

original: yad uta śīrṣato vā mukhato vā karṇato vā nāsikāto vā
analyzed: yat uta śīrṣataḥ vā mukhataḥ vā karṇataḥ vā nāsikātaḥ vā
translated: That is to say, whether from the head, the face, the ears, the nose,

original: bhrūto vā rūpato vā saṃsthānato vā varṇato vā ''kārato vā yonito vā ''hārato vā sambhāvato vā nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: bhrūtaḥ vā rūpataḥ vā saṃsthānataḥ vā varṇataḥ vā kārataḥ vā yonitaḥ vā hārataḥ vā sambhāvataḥ vā nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: the eyebrows, form, shape, color, appearance, womb, food, or development, a difference is not recognized.

original: p / // /tad yathāapi bhoḥ puṣkarasārin gavāś ca gardabho ṣṭramṛgapakṣyajaiḍakānāmaṇḍajajarāyujasaṃsvedajaupapādukānāṃnānākaranaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: yathā api bhoḥ puṣkarasārin gavāḥ ca gardabha u ṣṭra mṛga pakṣya ja eḍakānām aṇḍa ja jarāyu ja saṃsveda ja upapādukānām nānā karanam prajñāyate
translated: Just as, good sir Puṣkarasārin, a distinction is recognized among cows, donkeys, camels, deer, birds, goats, and sheep, born from eggs, wombs, moisture, or spontaneously,

original: yad uta pādato api mukhatopi varṇato api saṃsthānato api āhārato api yonisambhavato api nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate nacaevaṃ teṣāṃ caturṇāṃ
analyzed: yat uta pādataḥ api mukhataḥ api varṇataḥ api saṃsthānataḥ api āhārataḥ api yoni sambhavataḥ api nānākaraṇam prajñāyate na ca evam teṣām caturṇām
translated: namely in terms of feet, face, color, form, food, and mode of birth, a distinction is recognized. But no such distinction is recognized among those four

original: varṇānāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: varṇānām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: varṇas.

original: tat tasmāt sarvam idam ekam iti/
analyzed: tat tasmāt sarvam idam ekam iti
translated: Therefore, all this is one.

original: p / // /api ca/ brāhmaṇāmīṣāṃ phalguvṛkṣāṇāmāmrātakajambukharjūrapanasadālāvanatindukamṛdvīkabījapūrakakapitthākṣoḍanārikelatiniśakarañjaādīnāṃ
analyzed: ca brāhmaṇa amīṣām phalgu vṛkṣāṇām āmrātaka jambu kharjūra panasa dālāvana tinduka mṛdvīka bījapūraka kapittha akṣoḍa nārikela tiniśa karañja ādīnām
translated: Moreover, among these worthless trees, such as mangoes, rose apples, jujubes, breadfruit, dāḍima, tinduka, grapes, betel, coconuts, tilaka, karanja, and so on,

original: nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: a distinction is recognized.

original: yad uta mūlataś ca skandhataś ca tvagbhāgataś ca sārataś ca patrataś ca puṣpataś ca phalataś ca nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: yat uta mūlataḥ ca skandhataḥ ca tvac bhāgataḥ ca sārataḥ ca patrataḥ ca puṣpataḥ ca phalataḥ ca nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: Namely in terms of root, trunk, bark, heartwood, leaves, flowers, and fruits, a distinction is recognized.

original: na caevaṃ caturṇāṃ varṇānāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: na ca evam caturṇām varṇānām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: But no such distinction is recognized among the four varṇas.

original: p / // /tad yathā brāhmaṇāmīṣāṃ sthalajānāṃ vṛkṣāṇāṃ sāratamālanaktamālakarṇikārassaptaparṇaśirīṣakovidārasyandanacandanaśiṃśapairaṇḍakhadiraādīnāṃ
analyzed: yathā brāhmaṇa amīṣām sthala jānām vṛkṣāṇām sāra tamāla naktamāla karṇikāra saptaparṇa śirīṣa kovidāra syandana candana śiṃśapā eraṇḍa khadira ādīnām
translated: Just as, Brahmin, for these land-grown trees, the best are the aśoka, naktamāla, karṇikāra, saptaparṇa, śirīṣa, kovidāra, syandana, sandalwood, śiṃśapā, eranda, khadira, and so on.

original: nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: Their differences are known.

original: p / // /yad uta mūlataś ca skandhataś ca tvagbhāgataś ca gulmataś ca sārataś ca patrataś ca puṣpataś ca phalataś ca viśeṣa upalabhyate/
analyzed: uta mūlataḥ ca skandhataḥ ca tvac bhāgataḥ ca gulmataḥ ca sārataḥ ca patrataḥ ca puṣpataḥ ca phalataḥ ca viśeṣaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Just as, for example, their differences are known in terms of root, trunk, bark, bush, heartwood, leaf, flower, and fruit.

original: na caevaṃ caturṇāṃ varṇānāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/🔽p / // /tad yathā bhoḥ puṣkarasārinn amīṣāṃ kṣīravṛkṣāṇām udumbaraplakṣāśvatthanyagrodhavalgukety evam ādīnāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: na ca evam caturṇām varṇānām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate  yathā bhoḥ puṣkarasārin amīṣām kṣīravṛkṣāṇām udumbara plakṣa aśvattha nyagrodha valgukā iti evam ādīnām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: But no difference is known for the four social classes.🔽Just as, good sir Puṣkarasārin, for these milk-producing trees, the udumbara, plakṣa, aśvattha, nyagrodha, and valguka, and so on, their differences are known.

original: yad uta mūlataś ca skandhataś ca tvag bhāgataś ca sārataś ca patrataś ca puṣpataś ca phalataś ca nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: yat uta mūlataḥ ca skandhataḥ ca tvac bhāgataḥ ca sārataḥ ca patrataḥ ca puṣpataḥ ca phalataḥ ca nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: Just as, for example, their differences are known in terms of root, trunk, bark, bush, heartwood, leaf, flower, and fruit.

original: na tv eva caturṇāṃ varṇānāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: na tu eva caturṇām varṇānām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: But no difference is known for the four social classes.

original: p / / / /tad yathā puṣkarasārinn amīṣām api phalabaiṣajyavṛkṣāṇām āmalakīharītakīvibhītakī
analyzed: tat yathā puṣkarasārin amīṣām api phala baiṣajya vṛkṣāṇām āmalakī harītakī vibhītakī
translated: Just as, O Puṣkarasārin, of these fruit and medicinal trees, the emblic myrobalan, the yellow myrobalan, the beleric myrobalan,

original: pharasakaādīnām anyāsām api vividhānām oṣadhīnāṃ grāmajānāṃ pārvatīyānāṃ tṛṇavanaspatīnāṃ
analyzed: anyāsām api vividhānām oṣadhīnām grāma jānām pārvatīyānām tṛṇa vanaspatīnām
translated: the pharasa and others, and of various other herbs, those from villages, those from the mountains, grasses and trees,

original: nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: a distinction is recognized.

original: yad uta mūlataś ca skandhataś ca
analyzed: yat uta mūlataḥ ca skandhataḥ ca
translated: Namely, by way of root, trunk,

original: gulmataś ca sārataś ca patrataś ca puṣpataś ca phalataś ca nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/🔽na tv eva caturṇāṃ varṇānāṃ
analyzed: gulmataḥ ca sārataḥ ca patrataḥ ca puṣpataḥ ca phalataḥ ca nānākaraṇam prajñāyate  na tu eva caturṇām varṇānām
translated: branches, pith, leaves, flowers, and fruits, a distinction is recognized.

original: nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: But no distinction is recognized among the four castes.

original: p / // /tad yathā sthalajānāṃ puṣpavṛkṣāṇām atimuktakacampakapāṭalānāṃ sumanā vārṣikādhanaṣkārikaādīnāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: yathā sthala jānām puṣpa vṛkṣāṇām atimuktaka campaka pāṭalānām sumanāḥ vārṣika dhanaṣkārika ādīnām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: Just as, O Puṣkarasārin, of the terrestrial flowering trees, the atimuktaka, the champak, the pāṭala, the jasmine, the vārṣika, the dhanuṣkārika and others, a distinction is recognized.

original: yad uto rūpato api varṇato api gandhato api saṃsthānato api nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: yat uta u rūpataḥ api varṇataḥ api gandhataḥ api saṃsthānataḥ api nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: Namely, by way of form, color, smell, and shape, a distinction is recognized.

original: na tv eva caturṇāṃ varṇānāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: na tu eva caturṇām varṇānām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: But no distinction is recognized among the four castes.

original: p / // /tad yathā brāhmaṇām īṣām api jalajānāṃ puṣpāṇāṃ padmautpalasaugandhikamṛdugandhikaādīnāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: yathā brāhmaṇām īṣām api jala jānām puṣpāṇām padma autpala saugandhika mṛdugandhika ādīnām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: Just as there is a difference known among the Brahmins, the lotus flowers of the water-born, such as the lotus, blue lotus, and fragrant lotus, etc.,

original: yad uta rūpataś ca gandhataś ca saṃsthānataś ca vaṇataś ca nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: yat uta rūpataḥ ca gandhataḥ ca saṃsthānataḥ ca vaṇataḥ ca nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: namely, a difference is known in form, smell, shape, and color.

original: natveva varṇānāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate/
analyzed: na tu eva varṇānām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate
translated: But no difference is known among the colors.

original: tad yathā puṣkarasārin amī brāhmaṇā iti kṣatriyā iti vaiśyā iti śūdrā iti/
analyzed: tat yathā puṣkarasārin amī brāhmaṇāḥ iti kṣatriyāḥ iti vaiśyāḥ iti śūdrāḥ iti
translated: Just as, O Puṣkarasārin, these are Brahmins, these are Kṣatriyas, these are Vaiśyas, these are Śūdras.

original: tasmād ekam evaidaṃ sarvam iti/
analyzed: tasmāt ekam eva edam sarvam iti
translated: Therefore, this whole (world) is one.

original: p / // /apy anyat te pravakṣyāmi brāhmaṇaiḥ kalpitaṃ yath/ā/
analyzed: anyat te pravakṣyāmi brāhmaṇaiḥ kalpitam yathā
translated: I will tell you something else, as it was imagined by the Brahmins.

original: p / // /śiraḥ satāraṃ gaganam ākāśam udaraṃ tathā//
analyzed: sa tāram gaganam ākāśam udaram tathā
translated: The head is the sky with the stars, and the belly is the same as the sky.

original: p / // /parvatāś caapy ubhāv ūrū pādau ca dharaṇītalaṃ/
analyzed: ubhau ūrū pādau ca dharaṇī talam
translated: The mountains are both thighs, and the feet are the surface of the earth.

original: p / // /sūryācandramasau netre roma tṛṇavanaspatī//🔽p / // /aśrūṇy avocad varṣā asya nadyaḥ prasrāvam eva ca/
analyzed: netre roma tṛṇa vanaspatī  avocat varṣāḥ asya nadyaḥ prasrāvam eva ca
translated: The sun and moon are the eyes, and the hair is the grass and trees.🔽The rains are said to be his tears, and the rivers are his urine.

original: p / // /sāgarāś caapy amedhyaṃ vai /
analyzed: ca api amedhyam vai
translated: And the oceans are his impure discharge.

original: evaṃ brahmā prajāpatiḥ//
analyzed: evam brahmā prajāpatiḥ
translated: Thus Brahmā is Prajāpati.

original: p / // /parīkṣasva tvaṃ brahmaṇaḥ svalakṣaṇaṃ/
analyzed: tvam brahmaṇaḥ sva lakṣaṇam
translated: Examine the specific characteristics of Brahman yourself.

original: yasmād brahmaṇo brāhmaṇā utpannās tasmāt kṣatriyā api vaiśyā api śūdrā apy utpannāḥ/
analyzed: yasmāt brahmaṇaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ utpannāḥ tasmāt kṣatriyāḥ api vaiśyāḥ api śūdrāḥ api utpannāḥ
translated: Since Brahmins have arisen from Brahman, therefore Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras have also arisen.

original: p / // /evaṃ prasūtir yadi tatvataḥ syāt tato hi syād varṇakṛto viśeṣaḥ/
analyzed: prasūtiḥ yadi tatvataḥ syāt tatas hi syāt varṇa kṛtaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: If this origin were truly so, then there would be a distinction based on caste.

original: p / // /yadi brāhmaṇā brahmalokaṃ vrajeyus trayaś ca varṇā na vrajeyuḥ svargaṃ/
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ brahma lokam vrajeyuḥ trayaḥ ca varṇāḥ na vrajeyuḥ svargam
translated: If Brahmins would go to Brahma's world, and the three other castes would not go to heaven,

original: p / // /evaṃ bhaved varṇakṛto viśeṣo na cenna catvāro bhavanti varṇāḥ//
analyzed: bhavet varṇa kṛtaḥ viśeṣaḥ na ced na catvāraḥ bhavanti varṇāḥ
translated: then there would be a distinction based on caste. If not, then there are not four castes.

original: p / // /yasmād dhi varṇaś caturtha evaṃ prayāti svargaṃ svakṛtena karmaṇā/
analyzed: dhi varṇaḥ caturthaḥ evam prayāti svargam sva kṛtena karmaṇā
translated: Since one of the four castes thus goes to heaven by one's own actions,

original: p / // /yatas tapaś caārṣam iha praśastaṃ tasmād dvijāter na viśeṣaṇaṃ syād//
analyzed: tapaḥ ca ārṣam iha praśastam tasmāt dvijāteḥ na viśeṣaṇam syāt
translated: since austerity and the life of a sage are praised here, therefore there would be no distinction based on twice-born status.

original: p / // /yadi brāhmaṇaḥ syād ihaika eva dvijihvaś catuḥśravaṇas tathāeva/
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ syāt iha ekaḥ eva dvi jihvaḥ catur śravaṇaḥ tathā eva
translated: If there were only one Brahmin here, with two tongues and four ears,

original: p / // /caturviṣāṇo bahupād dviśīrṣa evaṃ kṛte varṇakṛto viśeṣaḥ//
analyzed: bahu pād dvi śīrṣaḥ evam kṛte varṇa kṛtaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: and with four horns, many feet, and two heads, then there would be a distinction based on caste if created thus.

original: p / // /rāgaiś ca nāma paraghātanaṃ ca evaṃ prakāraṃ ca viheṭhanaṃ ca/
analyzed: ca nāma para ghātanam ca evam prakāram ca viheṭhanam ca
translated: And with passions, and the killing of others, and such a kind of harm,

original: p / // /sattvasya vai karmaṇo dhvaṃsanaṃ ca etāny akalyāṇakṛtāni vipraiḥ//
analyzed: vai karmaṇaḥ dhvaṃsanam ca etāni akalyāṇa kṛtāni vipraiḥ
translated: The destruction of the good deeds of beings - these are the inauspicious acts done by the Brahmins.

original: p / // /yuddhaṃ vivādṃ kalahāny abhīkṣṇaṃ goprokṣaṇaṃ cintitaṃ brāhmaṇair hi/
analyzed: vivādam kalahāni abhīkṣṇam go prokṣaṇam cintitam brāhmaṇaiḥ hi
translated: The frequent fighting, disputes, quarrels, and sprinkling of cows - these were thought of by the Brahmins.

original: p / // /atharvaṇaḥ karmaṇā trāsanaṃ ca etāni mantrāṇi kṛtāni vipraiḥ//
analyzed: karmaṇā trāsanam ca etāni mantrāṇi kṛtāni vipraiḥ
translated: The terrifying acts through the Atharva Veda - these mantras were created by the Brahmins.

original: p / // /pāpecchatā bahujanavañcanaṃ ca śāṭhyaṃ ca dhaurtyaṃ ca tathāeva kalpaṃ/
analyzed: bahu jana vañcanam ca śāṭhyam ca dhaurtyam ca tathā eva
translated: The desire for sin, the deception of many people, deceit, cunning, and likewise the vow -

original: p / // /evaṃ pareṣām ahitaṃ vicintya kadā ca te svargam ito vrajeyuḥ//
analyzed: pareṣām ahitam vicintya kadā ca te svargam itas vrajeyuḥ
translated: Having thus contemplated the harm of others, when will they go to heaven from here?

original: p / // /ye brāhmaṇā ugratapā vinītā vratena śīlena sadā hy upetāḥ/
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ ugra tapāḥ vinītāḥ vratena śīlena sadā hi upetāḥ
translated: Those Brahmins who are of fierce austerities, humble, always endowed with vows and good conduct,

original: p / // /ahiṃsakā ye dama saṃyame ratās te brāhmaṇā brahmapuraṃ vrajanti//
analyzed: ye saṃyame ratāḥ te brāhmaṇāḥ brahma puram vrajanti
translated: Those who are non-violent, devoted to self-control and restraint, they, the Brahmins, go to the city of Brahman.

original: p / // /sahaasthimāṃsaḥ sanakhaḥ sacarmā duḥkhaṃ sukhaṃ mūtrapurīṣam ekaṃ/
analyzed: sa nakhaḥ sa carmā duḥkham sukham mūtra purīṣam ekam
translated: The body with bones, flesh, nails, and skin, the same suffering and happiness, urine and feces -

original: p / // /pañcaindriyair nāsti yato viśeṣas tasmān na vai varṇacatuṣka eṣaḥ//
analyzed: na asti yatas viśeṣaḥ tasmāt na vai varṇa catuṣkaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: Since there is no distinction due to the five senses, therefore this is not the fourfold caste system.

original: p / // /tad yathā nāma brāhmaṇa kasyacit puruṣasya catvāraḥ putrā bhaveyuḥ/
analyzed: yathā nāma brāhmaṇa kasyacid puruṣasya catvāraḥ putrāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Just as, Brahmin, a certain man might have four sons,

original: sa teṣāṃ nāmāni kuryān nandaka iti vā jīvaka iti vā aśoka iti vā śatāyur iti vā /
analyzed: sa teṣām nāmāni kuryāt nandakaḥ iti vā jīvakaḥ iti vā aśokaḥ iti vā śatāyuḥ iti vā
translated: and he would give them names, such as Nanda, Jīvaka, Aśoka, or Śatāyu.

original: iṣṭāś ca punar bho etasya puruṣasya putrā bhaveyuḥ/
analyzed: iṣṭāḥ ca punar bho etasya puruṣasya putrāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And again, Brahmin, those sons would be dear to that man,

original: tatra yo nandakaḥ sa nandet/
analyzed: tatra yaḥ nandakaḥ sa nandet
translated: and there, the one who is Nanda would rejoice,

original: yo jīvakaḥ sa īvet/
analyzed: yaḥ jīvakaḥ saḥ īvet
translated: the one who is Jīvaka would live,

original: yo aśokaḥ sa na śocet/
analyzed: yaḥ aśokaḥ sa na śocet
translated: the one who is Aśoka would not grieve,

original: yaḥ śatāyuḥ sa varṣaśataṃ jīvet/
analyzed: yaḥ śata āyuḥ sa varṣa śatam jīvet
translated: and the one who is Śatāyu would live for a hundred years.

original: p / // /nāmataḥ punar brāhmaṇa teṣāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ prajñāyate na jātitaḥ/
analyzed: punar brāhmaṇa teṣām nānākaraṇam prajñāyate na jātitaḥ
translated: But again, Brahmin, their difference is known by name, not by birth.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ/
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: iha khalu punar brāhmaṇa pitṛtaḥ putro jāyte/
analyzed: iha khalu punar brāhmaṇa pitṛtaḥ putraḥ jāyte
translated: Here, Brahmin, a son is born from the father,

original: tasmāc ca tatredaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tasmāt ca tatra idam vyākaraṇam bhavati
translated: and therefore this is the explanation there:

original: p / // /mātā bhastrā pituḥ putro yena jātaḥ sa eva saḥ/
analyzed: bhastrā pituḥ putraḥ yena jātaḥ saḥ eva saḥ
translated: The mother is the womb, the father's son, by whom he is born, he is that.

original: p / // /yady evaṃ bho vijānāsi na te putrā
analyzed: evam bho vijānāsi na te putrā
translated: If you know this, Brahmin, then your sons

original: parabhūtāḥ kvacit//
analyzed: para bhūtāḥ kvacid
translated: are not at all dependent on others.

original: p / // /parīkṣasva brāhmaṇa saṃyageva ko atra brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyo vaiśyaḥ śūtra iti/
analyzed: brāhmaṇa kaḥ atra brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyaḥ vaiśyaḥ śūtraḥ iti
translated: Examine this, Brahmin, right here: who here is a Brahmin, a Kshatriya, a Vaishya, or a Shudra?

original: p / // /sarve kāṇāś ca kubjāś ca sarve apasmāriṇopi vā/🔽p / // /kilāsinaḥ kuṣṭhinaś ca gaurāḥ kṛṣṇāḥ pṛthak pṛthak//
analyzed: kāṇāḥ ca kubjāḥ ca sarve apasmāriṇaḥ api vā  kuṣṭhinaḥ ca gaurāḥ kṛṣṇāḥ pṛthak pṛthak
translated: All were squint-eyed and hunchbacked, all were epileptic.🔽All were pale, lepers, fair and dark, each separately.

original: p / // /pratiṣṭhitāḥ samamajjānakhatvacapārśvaudaravaktrāḥ prajā hi tāḥ svakarmaṇā/
analyzed: sama majjā nakha tvaca pārśva audara vaktrāḥ prajāḥ hi tāḥ sva karmaṇā
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, the people were established with equal ankles, nails, skin, sides, bellies and faces, due to their own actions.

original: evaṃ gate brāhmaṇa naiva bhavati viśeṣaḥ/
analyzed: evam gate brāhmaṇa na eva bhavati viśeṣaḥ
translated: When this is so, O Brahmin, there is no distinction at all.

original: ko jātikṛto viśeṣaḥ/
analyzed: kaḥ jāti kṛtaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: What is the distinction made by birth?

original: p / // /yasmān na jāter viśeṣaṇo asti tasmān na vai varṇacatuṣka eva/
analyzed: na jāteḥ viśeṣaṇaḥ asti tasmāt na vai varṇa catuṣkaḥ eva
translated: Since there is no distinction based on birth, therefore there is no caste-system at all.

original: p / // /tasmāt te brāhmaṇa bravīmi saṃjñāmātram idaṃ lokasya yad idaṃ brāhmaṇa iti vā kṣatriya iti vā vaiśya iti vā śūdra iti vā caṇḍāla iti
analyzed: te brāhmaṇa bravīmi saṃjñā mātram idam lokasya yat idam brāhmaṇaḥ iti vā kṣatriyaḥ iti vā vaiśyaḥ iti vā śūdraḥ iti vā caṇḍālaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, O Brahmin, I tell you that this is merely a designation in the world, namely Brahmin, Kshatriya, Vaishya, Shudra, Chandala.

original: ekam idaṃ sarvam idam ekaṃ/
analyzed: ekam idam sarvam idam ekam
translated: This is one, this is all one.

original: putrāya me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtiṃ duhitaram utsṛja bhāryāarthāya yāvantaṃ kulaśulkaṃ manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi/
analyzed: putrāya me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtim duhitaram utsṛja bhāryā arthāya yāvantam kula śulkam manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi
translated: To my son Sharadnakla, give your daughter Prakiti as a wife, and I will give you as much dowry as you think fit for your family.

original: p / // /idaṃ punarvacanaṃ śrutvā triśaṅkor mātaṅgarājasya brāhmaṇaḥ puṣkarasārīdam avocat/
analyzed: punarvacanam śrutvā triśaṅkoḥ mātaṅga rājasya brāhmaṇaḥ puṣkarasārīdam avocat
translated: Having heard this speech of King Trisanku, the Brahmin Pushkarasari said this:

original: kiṃ punarbhavatā ṛgvedo adhītaḥ /
analyzed: kim punar bhavatā ṛgvedaḥ adhītaḥ
translated: What more have you studied?

original: yajurvedo adhītaḥ /🔽sāmavedo adhītaḥ /
analyzed: yajurvedaḥ adhītaḥ  sāmavedaḥ adhītaḥ
translated: The Yajur Veda has been studied by me.🔽The Sama Veda has been studied by me.

original: atharvavedo adhītaḥ /
analyzed: atharvavedaḥ adhītaḥ
translated: The Atharva Veda has been studied by me.

original: āyurvedo adhītaḥ kalpādhyāyo pi/
analyzed: āyurvedaḥ adhītaḥ kalpa adhyāyaḥ pi
translated: The Ayurveda and the Kalpa section have been studied by me.

original: adhyātmam api mṛgacakraṃ vā nakṣatragaṇo vā tithikramagaṇo vā tvayādhītaḥ/
analyzed: adhyātmam api mṛga cakram vā nakṣatra gaṇaḥ vā tithi krama gaṇaḥ vā tvayā adhītaḥ
translated: Have you studied the inner science, the deer wheel, the collection of stars, or the collection of lunar mansions?

original: karmacakraṃ vā tvayādhigataṃ/🔽athavā aṅgavidyā vā vastravidyā
analyzed: karma cakram vā tvayā adhigatam  athavā aṅga vidyā vā vastra vidyā
translated: Have you mastered the wheel of karma?🔽Or have you studied the science of limbs, the science of cloth,

original: vā śivāvidyā śakunividyā vā tvayādhītā/
analyzed: vā śivā vidyā śakuni vidyā vā tvayā adhītā
translated: the science of auspiciousness, or the science of birds?

original: athavā rāhucairtaṃ vā śukracaritaṃ vā grahacaritaṃ vā tvayādhītaṃ/
analyzed: athavā rāhu cairtam vā śukra caritam vā graha caritam vā tvayā adhītam
translated: Or have you studied the movements of Rahu, Shukra, or the planets?

original: athavā lokāyateṃ bhavatā bhāṣyapravacanaṃ vā pakṣādhyāyo vā nyāyo vā tvayādhītaḥ/
analyzed: athavā bhavatā bhāṣya pravacanam vā pakṣādhyāyaḥ vā nyāyaḥ vā tvayā adhītaḥ
translated: Or have you studied the Lokayata philosophy, the commentary, the section on arguments, or logic?

original: p / // /evam ukte triśaṅkur mātaṅgarāhaḥ puṣkarasāriṇaṃ brāhmaṇam etad avocat/
analyzed: ukte triśaṅkuḥ mātaṅga rāhaḥ puṣkarasāriṇam brāhmaṇam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Mātanga Rāhula Triśaṅku said this to the Brahmin Puṣkarasārin:

original: etac ca mayā brāhmaṇādhītaṃ bhūyaś cauttaraṃ /
analyzed: etat ca mayā brāhmaṇa adhītam bhūyas ca auttaram
translated: This and more have been studied by me, O Brahmin.

original: yad api te brāhmaṇa evaṃ syād aham asmi mantreṣu pāraṃ prāpta iti/
analyzed: yat api te brāhmaṇaḥ evam syāt aham asmi mantreṣu pāram prāptaḥ iti
translated: If you, O Brahmin, were to think thus: 'I have reached the end in the mantras,'

original: tatra te brāhmaṇa saha dharmeṇānumānaṃ pravakṣyāmi/
analyzed: tatra te brāhmaṇa saha dharmeṇa anumānam pravakṣyāmi
translated: then, O Brahmin, I will explain to you the inference in accordance with the Dharma.

original: na khalv evaṃ brāhmaṇa prāthamakalpikānāṃ sattvānām etad abhavat/
analyzed: na khalu evam brāhmaṇa prāthamakalpikānām sattvānām etat abhavat
translated: O Brahmin, it did not occur to the primordial beings in this way:

original: yad uta brāhmaṇa iti vā kṣatriya iti vā vaiśya
analyzed: yat uta brāhmaṇaḥ iti vā kṣatriyaḥ iti vā vaiśya
translated: This one is a Brahmin, this one is a Kshatriya, this one is a Vaishya,

original: iti vā śūdra iti vā/
analyzed: iti vā śūdraḥ iti vā
translated: this one is a Shudra.

original: ekam idaṃ sarvam idam ekaṃ/
analyzed: ekam idam sarvam idam ekam
translated: This is one, this is all one.

original: p / // /atha brāhmaṇa sattvānāmasadṛśānāṃ caubhayathā sadṛśānāṃ tato anye sattvāḥ śālikṣetrāṇi kelāyanti gopāyanti vāpayanti vā/
analyzed: brāhmaṇa sattvānām asadṛśānām ca ubhayathā sadṛśānām tatas anye sattvāḥ śāli kṣetrāṇi kelāyanti gopāyanti vāpayanti vā
translated: Then, O Brahmin, among those beings who were dissimilar, some were similar in both ways. From that, other beings began to cultivate, guard, and sow rice fields.

original: te amī kṣatriyā iti saṃjñā udapādi/
analyzed: te amī kṣatriyāḥ iti saṃjñā udapādi
translated: They are called Kshatriyas.

original: athātra brāhmaṇa tad anyatamānāṃ sattānām etad abhavat/
analyzed: atha atra brāhmaṇa tat anyatamānām sattānām etat abhavat
translated: Then, O Brahmin, some of those beings had this thought:

original: parigraho rogaḥ parigraho gaṇḍaḥ parigrahaḥ śalyaḥ/
analyzed: parigrahaḥ rogaḥ parigrahaḥ gaṇḍaḥ parigrahaḥ śalyaḥ
translated: Possession is a disease, possession is a boil, possession is a dart.

original: yannu vayaṃ svaparigraham apahāyāraṇyāyatanaṃ gatvā
analyzed: yat nu vayam sva parigraham apahāya araṇya āyatanam gatvā
translated: What if we, having abandoned our possessions, went to a forest hermitage,

original: tṛṇakāṣṭhaśākhāparṇapalāśakānupasaṃhṛtya tṛṇakuṭikāṃ vā parṇakuṭikāṃ vā kṛtvā praviśya dhyāyena iti/
analyzed: tṛṇa kāṣṭha śākhā parṇa palāśakān upasaṃhṛtya tṛṇa kuṭikām vā parṇa kuṭikām vā kṛtvā praviśya dhyāyena iti
translated: gathered grass, wood, branches, leaves, and foliage, made a grass hut or a leaf hut, entered it, and meditated?

original: p / // /atha te sattvās taṃ svakaṃ parigraham apahāyāraṇyāyatanaṃ gatvā tṛṇakāṣṭhaśākhāpatraparṇapalāśakais tṛṇakuṭiṃ vā parṇakuṭikāṃ vā
analyzed: te sattvāḥ tam svakam parigraham apahāya araṇya āyatanam gatvā tṛṇa kāṣṭha śākhā patra parṇa palāśakaiḥ tṛṇa kuṭim vā parṇa kuṭikām vā
translated: Then those beings, having abandoned their own possessions, went to a forest hermitage, and having made a grass hut or a leaf hut with grass, wood, branches, leaves, and bark,

original: kṛtvā tatraeva praviśya dhyāyanti sma/
analyzed: kṛtvā tatra eva praviśya dhyāyanti sma
translated: they entered there and meditated.

original: te tatra sāyam āsanahetoḥ prāntavāṭikāṃ prātaraśanahetoś ca grāmaṃ piṇḍāya praviśanti sma/
analyzed: te tatra sāyam āsana hetoḥ prānta vāṭikām prātaraśana hetoḥ ca grāmam piṇḍāya praviśanti sma
translated: In the evening, for the sake of a seat, they entered the outskirts of the village, and in the morning, for the sake of alms, they entered the village.

original: p / // /atha teṣāṃ grāmavāsināṃ sattvānām etad abhavat/
analyzed: teṣām grāma vāsinām sattvānām etat abhavat
translated: Then it occurred to those village-dwelling beings:

original: duṣkarakārakā vata bhoḥ sattvā ye svakaṃ parigraham utṛjya grāmanigamajanapadebhyo bahir nirgatās teṣāṃ bahirmanaskā brāhyaṇā iti saṃjñā
analyzed: duṣkara kārakāḥ vata bhoḥ sattvāḥ ye svakam parigraham grāma nigama janapadebhyaḥ bahis nirgatāḥ teṣām bahis manaskāḥ brāhyaṇāḥ iti saṃjñā
translated: Oh, these beings who practice austerities, having abandoned their own possessions, have gone out from the villages, towns, and regions. They are called Brahmins because they have their minds turned outward.

original: te ca punar grāmavāsinaḥ sattvās tān atīva satkurvanti sma/
analyzed: te ca punar grāma vāsinaḥ sattvāḥ tān atīva satkurvanti sma
translated: And those village-dwelling beings greatly honored them,

original: teṣāṃ ca dātavyaṃ manyante sma/
analyzed: teṣām ca dātavyam manyante sma
translated: and they thought that they should be given [alms].

original: p / // /atha teṣām eva sattvānām anyatame sattvās tāni dhyānāny asaṃbhāvayanto grāmeṣv avatīrya mantrapadān svādhyāyanti sma/
analyzed: teṣām eva sattvānām anyatame sattvāḥ tāni dhyānāni a saṃbhāvayantaḥ grāmeṣu avatīrya mantra padān su ādhyāyanti sma
translated: Then among those very beings, some beings, not being able to practice those meditations, having descended into the villages, recited the mantra words.

original: tāṃs te grāmanivāsina āhuḥ na levalam ime sattvā ime adhyāpakāḥ /
analyzed: tān te grāma nivāsinaḥ āhuḥ na levalam ime sattvāḥ ime adhyāpakāḥ
translated: Those who lived in villages called them not level, these are teachers.

original: teṣām adhyāpakā iti loke saṃjñā udapādi/
analyzed: teṣām adhyāpakāḥ iti loke saṃjñā udapādi
translated: For them, the designation teachers arose in the world.

original: p / // /ayaṃ hetur ayaṃ pratyayo brāhmaṇānāṃ loke prādurbhāvāya/
analyzed: hetuḥ ayam pratyayaḥ brāhmaṇānām loke prādurbhāvāya
translated: This is the cause and condition for the appearance of Brahmins in the world.

original: athānyatame sattvā vivekakālapratisaṃyuktān karmaantān vividhān arthapratisaṃyuktān kurvanti sma/
analyzed: atha anyatame sattvāḥ viveka kāla pratisaṃyuktān karma antān vividhān artha pratisaṃyuktān kurvanti sma
translated: Then, some beings engaged in various activities related to solitude and wealth.

original: teṣāṃ vaiśyā iti saṃjñā udapādi/
analyzed: teṣām vaiśyāḥ iti saṃjñā udapādi
translated: For them, the designation Vaishyas arose.

original: p / // /athānyatame sattvāḥ kṣudreṇa karmaṇā jīvikāṃ kalpayanti sma/
analyzed: sattvāḥ kṣudreṇa karmaṇā jīvikām kalpayanti sma
translated: Then, some beings made a living through minor activities.

original: teṣāṃ śūdrā iti saṃjñā udapādi/
analyzed: teṣām śūdrāḥ iti saṃjñā udapādi
translated: For them, the designation Shudras arose.

original: p / // /bhūtapūrvaṃ brāhamṇa anyatamaḥ sattvo vadhūm ādāya ratham āruhyānyatam asminn araṇyapradeśe gataḥ/
analyzed: brāhamṇaḥ anyatamaḥ sattvaḥ vadhūm ādāya ratham āruhya anyatam asmin araṇya pradeśe gataḥ
translated: Brahmin, it happened in the past that a certain being, taking his wife, mounted a chariot and went to a certain place in this wilderness.

original: tatra ca ratho bhagnaḥ/
analyzed: tatra ca rathaḥ bhagnaḥ
translated: There, the chariot broke.

original: tasmān mātaṅgama mā tvaṃ gamaḥ iti saṃjñā udapādi/
analyzed: tasmāt mātaṅgama mā tvam gamaḥ iti saṃjñā udapādi
translated: Therefore, the designation don't go to the Matanga arose.

original: p / // /kṣetraṃ karṣanti ye teṣāṃ karṣakā iti saṃjñā prvṛttā/
analyzed: karṣanti ye teṣām karṣakāḥ iti saṃjñā prvṛttā
translated: Those who plow the fields, for them the designation farmers arose.

original: bhāṣyeṇa ca parṣadaṃ rañjayati dharmeṇa śīlabratasamācāreṇa samyak /
analyzed: bhāṣyeṇa ca parṣadam rañjayati dharmeṇa śīla brata samācāreṇa samyak
translated: And he delighted the assembly with his speech, properly with his conduct of morality and vows.

original: tasya rājā iti saṃjñā abhūt/
analyzed: tasya rājā iti saṃjñā abhūt
translated: He became known as the king.

original: p / // /tato anye sattvā vāṇijyayā jīvikāṃ kalpayanti teṣāṃ vaṇija iti saṃjñā udapādi/
analyzed: anye sattvāḥ vāṇijyayā jīvikām kalpayanti teṣām vaṇijaḥ iti saṃjñā udapādi
translated: Then other beings made their living through trade, and they became known as merchants.

original: tataś caanye sattvāḥ pravrajanti sma/
analyzed: tatas ca anye sattvāḥ pravrajanti sma
translated: And then other beings went forth.

original: pravrajitvā parān jayanti kleśān jayantiiti teṣāṃ pravrajitā iti loke saṃjñā udapādi/
analyzed: pravrajitvā parān jayanti kleśān jayanti iti teṣām pravrajitāḥ iti loke saṃjñā udapādi
translated: Having gone forth, they conquered others and conquered their defilements, and in the world they became known as renunciants.

original: p / // /api tu brāhmaṇa ekaiva saṃjñā loka udapādi/
analyzed: tu brāhmaṇe ekā eva saṃjñā loke udapādi
translated: But, brahmin, only one name arose in the world.

original: tāṃ te pravakṣyāmi/
analyzed: tām te pravakṣyāmi
translated: I will tell you that.

original: p / // /brahmā loke asmin imān vedān vācayati/
analyzed: loke asmin imān vedān vācayati
translated: Brahmā recites these Vedas in this world.

original: brahmā devānāṃ paramatāpasaḥ/
analyzed: brahmā devānām parama tāpasaḥ
translated: Brahmā is the supreme ascetic of the gods.

original: indrasya kauśikasya vedān vācayati sma/
analyzed: indrasya kauśikasya vedān vācayati sma
translated: He recites the Vedas to Indra Kauśika.

original: indraḥ kauśiko araṇemi gautamaṃ vedān vācayati/
analyzed: indraḥ kauśikaḥ gautamam vedān vācayati
translated: Indra Kauśika recites the Vedas to Arunemi Gautama.

original: araṇemi gautamaḥ śvetaketuṃ vedān vācayati/🔽śvetaketuḥ śukaṃ paṇḍitaṃ vedān vācayati/
analyzed: gautamaḥ śvetaketum vedān vācayati  śvetaketuḥ śukam paṇḍitam vedān vācayati
translated: Arunemi Gautama recites the Vedas to Śvetaketu.🔽Śvetaketu recites the Vedas to the learned Śuka.

original: śukaḥ paṇḍitaś ca vedān vibhajati sma/
analyzed: śukaḥ paṇḍitaḥ ca vedān vibhajati sma
translated: The learned Śuka divided the Vedas.

original: tad yathā puṣyo bahvṛcānāṃ paṃktiś chantogānām ekaviṃśatir adhvaryavaḥ/
analyzed: tat yathā puṣyaḥ bahvṛcānām paṃktiḥ chantogānām ekaviṃśatiḥ adhvaryavaḥ
translated: For example, Pūṣya for the Bahvṛcas, Paṅkti for the Chāndogas, Ekavimśa for the Adhvaryus,

original: kratur arthavaṇikānāṃ/
analyzed: kratuḥ arthavaṇikānām
translated: Kratu for the Arthavādinikas.

original: bahvṛcānām ete brāhmaṇāḥ/
analyzed: bahvṛcānām ete brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: These are the Brāhmaṇas of the Bahvṛcas.

original: sarve te vyākhyāyante/
analyzed: sarve te vyākhyāyante
translated: All of them are explained.

original: puṣya eko bhūtvā pañcaviṃśatidhā bhinnaḥ/
analyzed: puṣyaḥ ekaḥ bhūtvā pañcaviṃśatidhā bhinnaḥ
translated: Pūṣya, having become one, is divided into twenty-five parts.

original: tad yathā śuklā valkalā māṇḍavyā iti/
analyzed: tat yathā śuklāḥ valkalāḥ māṇḍavyāḥ iti
translated: For example, Śuklā, Valkalā, Māṇḍavyā.

original: tatra daśa śuklāḥ/
analyzed: tatra daśa śuklāḥ
translated: There, ten are Śuklā.

original: aṣṭau valkalāḥ/
analyzed: aṣṭau valkalāḥ
translated: Eight are Valkalā.

original: sapta māṇḍavyāḥ/
analyzed: sapta māṇḍavyāḥ
translated: Seven are Māṇḍavyā.

original: itīyaṃ brāhmaṇa bahvṛcānāṃ śākhā/
analyzed: iti iyam brāhmaṇa bahvṛcānām śākhā
translated: This is the branch of the Bahvṛcas Brāhmaṇas.

original: puṣya eko bhūtvā pañcaviṃśatidhā bhinnaḥ/
analyzed: puṣyaḥ ekaḥ bhūtvā pañcaviṃśatidhā bhinnaḥ
translated: Pūṣya, having become one, is divided into twenty-five parts.

original: p / // /anumānam api brāhmaṇa pramāṇaṃ chandogānāṃ/
analyzed: api brāhmaṇa pramāṇam chandogānām
translated: Anumāna is also a means of knowledge for the Chāndogas, O Brāhmaṇa.

original: brāhmaṇāḥ sarva ete chandogāḥ/
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ sarve ete chandogāḥ
translated: All these are Chāndogya Brāhmaṇas.

original: paṃktir ety ekā bhūtvā saaśītisahasradhā bhinnā/
analyzed: paṃktiḥ eti ekā bhūtvā sa aśīti sahasradhā bhinnā
translated: Paṅkti, having become one, is divided into eighty-eight thousand parts.

original: tad yathā śīlavalkā araṇemikā laukākṣāḥ kauthumā brahmasamā mahāsamā mahāyāgikāḥ saatyam ugrāḥ samantavedāḥ/
analyzed: tat yathā śīlavalkāḥ araṇemikāḥ laukākṣāḥ kauthumāḥ brahma samāḥ mahā samāḥ mahāyāgikāḥ saatyam ugrāḥ samanta vedāḥ
translated: For example, Śīlavalkā, Araṇemikā, Laukākṣa, Kauṭhūma, Brahma-sama, Mahā-sama, Mahā-yāgika, Satya, Ugra, Samanta-veda.

original: p / // /tatra śīlavalkā viṃśatiḥ/
analyzed: śīlavalkāḥ viṃśatiḥ
translated: There, twenty are Śīlavalkā.

original: araṇemikā viṃśatiḥ/
analyzed: araṇemikā viṃśatiḥ
translated: Twenty are Araṇemikā.

original: laukākṣāś catvāriṃśat/
analyzed: lauka akṣāḥ catvāriṃśat
translated: Forty are Laukākṣa.

original: kauthumānāṃ śataṃ/
analyzed: kauthumānām śatam
translated: There are one hundred Kauṭhūma.

original: brahmasamānāṃ śataṃ/
analyzed: brahma samānām śatam
translated: One hundred of the Brahmasamāna.

original: mahāsamānāṃ pañcaśatāni/🔽mahāyāgikānāṃ śataṃ/
analyzed: mahā samānām pañcaśatāni  mahāyāgikānām śatam
translated: Five hundred of the Mahāsāmā.🔽One hundred of the Mahāyāgī.🔽One hundred of the Satya.

original: saatyam ugrāṇāṃ śataṃ /
analyzed: saatyam ugrāṇām śatam
translated: One hundred of the Ugrā.

original: samantavedānāṃ śataṃ/
analyzed: samantavedānām śatam
translated: One hundred of the Samantaveda.

original: itīyaṃ brāhmaṇachandogānāṃ śākhā/
analyzed: iti iyam brāhmaṇa chandogānām śākhā
translated: Thus this is the branch of the Brahmacchandoga.

original: paṃktir ity ekā bhūtvā saaśīti sahasradhā bhinnā/
analyzed: paṃktiḥ iti ekā bhūtvā sa aśīti sahasradhā bhinnā
translated: Having been one, the Paṅkti has been divided into eighty-eight thousand parts.

original: p / // /anumānam api pramāṇam adhvaryūṇāṃ/
analyzed: api pramāṇam adhvaryūṇām
translated: The inference is also a means of knowledge for the Adhvaryus.

original: ete brāhmaṇā ekaviṃśaty adhvaryavo bhūtvā ekauttaraśatadhā bhinnāḥ/
analyzed: ete brāhmaṇāḥ ekaviṃśatī adhvaryavaḥ bhūtvā ekauttaraśatadhā bhinnāḥ
translated: These Brahmins, having become twenty-one Adhvaryus, are divided into one hundred and one parts.

original: tad yathā kaṭhāḥ kaṃinā vājasaneyino jātukarṇāḥ proṣṭhapadā ṛṣayaḥ/
analyzed: tat yathā kaṭhāḥ kaṃināḥ vājasaneyinaḥ jātukarṇāḥ proṣṭhapadāḥ ṛṣayaḥ
translated: Namely, the Kaṭhas, Kaṇīs, Vājasaneyins, Jātūkarṇas, and Proṣṭhapadās are the sages.

original: tatra daśa kaṭhā daśa kaṇimā ekādaśa vājasaneyinaḥ/
analyzed: tatra daśa kaṭhāḥ daśa kaṇimāḥ ekādaśa vājasaneyinaḥ
translated: There are ten Kaṭhas, ten Kaṇīs, eleven Vājasaneyins,

original: trayodaśa jātukarnāḥ/
analyzed: trayodaśa jātukarnāḥ
translated: thirteen Jātūkarṇas,

original: ṣoḍaśa proṣṭhapadāḥ/
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa proṣṭhapadāḥ
translated: sixteen Proṣṭhapadās,

original: eka catvāriṃśad ṛṣayaḥ/
analyzed: eka catvāriṃśat ṛṣayaḥ
translated: and forty-one sages.

original: itīyaṃ brāhmaṇādhvaryūṇāṃ śākhā/
analyzed: iti iyam brāhmaṇa adhvaryūṇām śākhā
translated: Thus this is the branch of the Brahmin Adhvaryus.

original: ekaviṃśatyadhvaryavo bhūtvā
analyzed: ekaviṃśati adhvaryavaḥ bhūtvā
translated: Having become twenty-one Adhvaryus,

original: ekauttaraśatadhā bhinnāḥ/
analyzed: ekauttaraśatadhā bhinnāḥ
translated: they are divided into one hundred and one parts.

original: p / // /anumānam api brāhmaṇa pramāṇam atharvaṇikānāṃ /
analyzed: api brāhmaṇa pramāṇam atharvaṇikānām
translated: The inference is also a means of knowledge for the Brahmins of the Atharvaṇa.

original: ete mantrāḥ sarve te atharvaṇikāḥ/
analyzed: ete mantrāḥ sarve te atharvaṇikāḥ
translated: All those mantras are of the Atharvaṇa.

original: kratur eko bhūtvā dvidhā bhinnaḥ/
analyzed: kratuḥ ekaḥ bhūtvā dvidhā bhinnaḥ
translated: The sacrifice, having been one, is divided into two.

original: dvidhā bhūtvā caturdhā bhinnaḥ/
analyzed: dvidhā bhūtvā caturdhā bhinnaḥ
translated: Having become two, it is divided into four.

original: caturdhā bhūtvā aṣṭadhā bhinnaḥ/
analyzed: caturdhā bhūtvā aṣṭadhā bhinnaḥ
translated: Having become four, it is divided into eight.

original: aṣṭadhā bhūtvā navadaśadhā bhinnaḥ/
analyzed: aṣṭadhā bhūtvā navadaśadhā bhinnaḥ
translated: Having become eight, it is divided into nine and ten.

original: itīyaṃ brāhmaṇātharvaṇikānāṃ śākhā/
analyzed: iti iyam brāhmaṇa ātharvaṇikānām śākhā
translated: Thus this is the branch of the Brahmins of the Atharvaveda.

original: kratur ekaḥ ṣoḍaśauttaradvādaśaśatadhā bhinnaḥ/
analyzed: kratuḥ ekaḥ ṣoḍaśa auttara dvādaśa śatadhā bhinnaḥ
translated: One sacrifice is divided into one hundred and twenty-six parts.

original: p / // /anumānam api brāhmaṇa pramāṇaṃ pratītya etāni dvādaśabhedaśatāni ṣoḍaśabhedāś ca ye brāhmaṇaiḥ paurāṇaiḥ samyag dṛṣṭāḥ/
analyzed: api brāhmaṇa pramāṇam pratītya etāni dvādaśa bheda śatāni ṣoḍaśa bhedāḥ ca ye brāhmaṇaiḥ paurāṇaiḥ samyak dṛṣṭāḥ
translated: O Brahmin, even inference is a means of knowledge. Relying on this, the Brahmins and the ancient ones have correctly seen these one hundred and twelve divisions and sixteen divisions.

original: chandasi vā vyākaraṇe vā lokāyate vā
analyzed: chandasi vā vyākaraṇe vā lokāyate vā
translated: In the Vedas, grammar, or worldly philosophy,

original: padamīmāṃsāyāṃ vā na caiṣāmūhāpohaḥ prajñāyate/
analyzed: pada mīmāṃsāyām vā na ca eṣām ūha apohaḥ prajñāyate
translated: or in the Mimamsa of words, their derivation is not known.

original: yad uta ekajātyo nāmeti viditvā bandhur bhavitum arhati/
analyzed: yat uta ekajātyaḥ nāma iti viditvā bandhuḥ bhavitum arhati
translated: Having known that it is called of one birth, one should be a friend.

original: tat te vrāhmaṇa bravīmi saṃjñāmātrakam etal lokasya yad uta brāhmaṇa iti vā kṣatriya
analyzed: tat te vrāhmaṇa bravīmi saṃjñā mātrakam etat lokasya yat uta brāhmaṇaḥ iti vā kṣatriya
translated: O Brahmin, I tell you that, this is merely a designation in the world, namely Brahmin, Kshatriya,

original: iti vā vaiśya iti vā śūdra iti vā/
analyzed: iti vā vaiśyaḥ iti vā śūdraḥ iti vā
translated: Vaishya, or Shudra.

original: ekam idaṃ sarvam idam ekaṃ/
analyzed: ekam idam sarvam idam ekam
translated: This is one, this is all one.

original: putrāya me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtiṃ duhitaram utsṛja bhāryāarthāya yāvantaṃ kulaśulkaṃ manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi/
analyzed: putrāya me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtim duhitaram utsṛja bhāryā arthāya yāvantam kula śulkam manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi
translated: Give your daughter Prakṛti to my son Śārdūlakarṇa as a wife, and I will give you as much bride-price as you think proper for your family.

original: p / // /idaṃ punarvacanaṃ śrutvā triśaṅkor mātaṅgarājasya brāhmaṇaḥ puṣkarasārī tuṣṇīṃbhūto madgubhūtaḥ srastaskandho adhomukho niṣpratibhaḥ
analyzed: punarvacanam śrutvā triśaṅkoḥ mātaṅga rājasya brāhmaṇaḥ puṣkarasārī tuṣṇīṃbhūtaḥ madgu bhūtaḥ srasta skandhaḥ adhomukhaḥ niṣpratibhaḥ
translated: Having heard this speech of Triśaṅku, the king of the Mātaṅgas, the brāhmaṇa Puṣkarasārin became silent, dejected, with drooping shoulders, downcast, and without eloquence,

original: pradhyānaparo asthāt/
analyzed: pradhyāna paraḥ asthāt
translated: and remained absorbed in thought.

original: p / // /dadarśa triśaṅkur mātaṅgarājo brāhmaṇaṃ puṣkarasāriṇaṃ tṛṣṇīṃbhūtaṃ madgubhūtaṃ srastaskandham adhomukhaṃ niṣpratibhaṃ pradhyānaparaṃ
analyzed: triśaṅkuḥ mātaṅga rājaḥ brāhmaṇam puṣkarasāriṇam tṛṣṇīṃbhūtam madgu bhūtam srasta skandham adhomukham niṣpratibham pradhyāna param
translated: Triśaṅku, the king of the Mātaṅgas, saw the brāhmaṇa Puṣkarasārin sitting there in silence, dejected, with drooping shoulders, downcast, and without eloquence,

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punar idam abravīt/
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar idam abravīt
translated: and having seen him, he said this:

original: yad api te brāhmaṇa evaṃ syād asadṛśena saha sambandho bhaviṣyatiiti/
analyzed: yat api te brāhmaṇaḥ evam syāt asadṛśena saha sambandhaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Even if you, O brāhmaṇa, were to think that a relationship with an unsuitable person will come about,

original: na punastvayā brāhmaṇaevaṃ draṣṭavyaṃ/
analyzed: na punar tvayā brāhmaṇa evam draṣṭavyam
translated: you should not look at it in this way, O brāhmaṇa.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ/🔽ye pramāṇaśrutiśīlapraññādayo guṇā agyrā
analyzed: kasya hetoḥ  ye pramāṇa śruti śīla praññā ādayaḥ guṇāḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?🔽Those qualities that are foremost in the world, such as being of proper measure, having good hearing, good character, and wisdom,

original: lokasya te mama putrasya śārdūlakarṇasya saṃvidyante/
analyzed: lokasya te mama putrasya śārdūlakarṇasya saṃvidyante
translated: they exist in my son Śārdūlakarṇa.

original: yad api te brāhmaṇa evaṃ syāt ye vājapiyaṃ yajñaṃ yajanti/
analyzed: yat api te brāhmaṇaḥ evam syāt ye vājapiyam yajñam yajanti
translated: And whatever you, Brahmin, might think: Those who perform the Vajapeya sacrifice,

original: aśvamedhaṃ puruṣamedhaṃ śāmyaprāśaṃ nirargaḍaṃ yajñaṃ yajanti /
analyzed: aśvamedham puruṣamedham śāmyaprāśam nirargaḍam yajñam yajanti
translated: the horse sacrifice, the human sacrifice, the Shamyapraash, and the Nirargada sacrifice,

original: sarve te kāyasya bhedātsugatau svargaloke deveṣūpapadyanta iti/
analyzed: sarve te kāyasya bhedāt sugatau svarga loke deveṣu upapadyante iti
translated: all of them, upon the dissolution of the body, are reborn among the gods in the heavenly world.

original: na punarbrāhmaṇa tvayaevaṃ draṣṭavyaṃ/
analyzed: na punar brāhmaṇa tvayā evam draṣṭavyam
translated: But, Brahmin, you should not see it in this way.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ/
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: vājapeyaṃ brāhmaṇa yajñaṃ yajamānā aśvamedhaṃ puruṣamedhaṃ
analyzed: vājapeyam brāhmaṇa yajñam yajamānāḥ aśvamedham puruṣamedham
translated: Brahmin, those who perform the Vajapeya sacrifice, the horse sacrifice, the human sacrifice,

original: śāmyaprāśaṃ nirargaḍaṃ yajñaṃ ca yajamānā bahudhā mantrān pravartayantaḥ prāṇihiṃsāṃ ca pravartayanti/
analyzed: śāmyaprāśam nirargaḍam yajñam ca yajamānāḥ bahudhā mantrān pravartayantaḥ prāṇi hiṃsām ca pravartayanti
translated: the Shamyapraash, and the Nirargada sacrifice, while reciting many mantras, also engage in the killing of living beings.

original: tasmāt te brāhmaṇa bravīmi na hy eṣa mārgaḥ svargāya/
analyzed: tasmāt te brāhmaṇa bravīmi na hi eṣa mārgaḥ svargāya
translated: Therefore, Brahmin, I tell you that this path is not for going to heaven.

original: ahaṃ te brāhmaṇa mārgaṃ svargāya vyākhāmi/ tac chṛṇu/
analyzed: aham te brāhmaṇa mārgam svargāya tat śṛṇu
translated: I, Brahmin, will explain to you the path for going to heaven. Listen to that.

original: p / // /śīlaṃ rakṣeta medhāvī prārthayānaḥ sukhatrayaṃ/
analyzed: rakṣeta medhāvī prārthayānaḥ sukha trayam
translated: The wise one, desiring the three kinds of happiness, should protect his morality.

original: p / // /praśaṃsāṃ vittalābhaṃ ca pretya svarge ca modanaṃ//
analyzed: vitta lābham ca pretya svarge ca modanam
translated: The praise, the gain of wealth, and the joy in heaven after death.

original: p / // /yair brāhmaṇa itaḥ pūrvaṃ vājapeyo yajña iṣṭaḥ/
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ itas pūrvam vājapeyaḥ yajñaḥ iṣṭaḥ
translated: By whom, Brahmin, this Vajapeya sacrifice was performed before,

original: yair aśvamedho yaiḥ puruṣamedho yaiḥ śāmyaprāśo yair nirargaḍo yajña iṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ aśvamedhaḥ yaiḥ puruṣamedhaḥ yaiḥ śāmyaprāśaḥ yaiḥ nirargaḍaḥ yajñaḥ iṣṭaḥ
translated: Those who have performed the horse sacrifice, the human sacrifice, the shamya-eating sacrifice, and the unrestricted sacrifice,

original: parigṛhītas tair nirargalaṃ ca kāmaiḥ kāmaḥ/
analyzed: parigṛhītaḥ taiḥ nirargalam ca kāmaiḥ kāmaḥ
translated: have attained unrestricted desires and enjoyments.

original: ito nākaḥ paryeṣyate/
analyzed: itas nākaḥ paryeṣyate
translated: From here, heaven is sought.

original: ye brāhmaṇa itaḥ paścād vājapeyaṃ yajñaṃ yakṣyanti ye aśvamedhaṃ puruṣamedhaṃ ye śāmyaprāśaṃ nirargaḍaṃ yajñaṃ yakṣyanti te nirarthakaṃ mahāvighātaṃ
analyzed: ye brāhmaṇaḥ itas paścāt vājapeyam yajñam yakṣyanti ye aśvamedham puruṣamedham ye śāmyaprāśam nirargaḍam yajñam yakṣyanti te nirarthakam mahā vighātam
translated: Those Brahmins who will perform the Vajapeya sacrifice after this, those who will perform the horse sacrifice, the human sacrifice, the shamya-eating sacrifice, and the unrestricted sacrifice, they will experience great misfortune and futility.

original: p / // /tasmāt te brāhmana bravīmi ehi tvaṃ mayā sārdhaṃ sambandhaṃ yojayasvā/
analyzed: te brāhmana bravīmi ehi tvam mayā sārdham sambandham yojayasva
translated: Therefore, O Brahmins, I tell you, come and join me in this connection.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ/
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: dharmeṇa hi caṇḍālā ajugupsanīyā bhavanti/ api ca/
analyzed: dharmeṇa hi caṇḍālāḥ a jugupsanīyāḥ bhavanti api ca
translated: For by Dharma, even the untouchables become respectable, and moreover,

original: p / // /śraddhā śīlaṃ tapastyāgaḥ śrutir jñānaṃ dayaiva ca/
analyzed: śīlam tapaḥ tyāgaḥ śrutiḥ jñānam dayā eva ca
translated: Faith, morality, austerity, renunciation, learning, knowledge, and compassion,

original: p / // /darśanaṃ sarvavedānāṃ svargavratapadāni vai//🔽p / // /pramāṇam aṣṭaprakāraṃ svargāya/
analyzed: sarva vedānām svarga vrata padāni vai  aṣṭa prakāram svargāya
translated: Are the very sight of all the Vedas, the steps of the vow for heaven.🔽The eight-fold means is the authority for attaining heaven.

original: tad ebhir aṣṭābhiḥ prakāraiḥ svargagamanam iṣyate/
analyzed: tat ebhiḥ aṣṭābhiḥ prakāraiḥ svarga gamanam iṣyate
translated: By these eight means, going to heaven is accepted.

original: ye prāyeṇa jānanti viśeṣeṇa khalv apy anekair vividhari yajñaiḥ/
analyzed: ye prāyeṇa jānanti viśeṣeṇa khalu api anekaiḥ yajñaiḥ
translated: Those who know this mostly, and especially through many kinds of sacrifices,

original: aṣṭau cemā brāhmaṇa nirdiṣṭā mātṛtulyā bhaginyo loke pravartante/
analyzed: aṣṭau ca imāḥ brāhmaṇa nirdiṣṭāḥ mātṛ tulyāḥ bhaginyaḥ loke pravartante
translated: And these eight are declared by the Brahmins to be like mothers, sisters who are active in the world.

original: tad yathā aditir devānāṃ mātā/
analyzed: tat yathā aditiḥ devānām mātā
translated: Namely, Aditi is the mother of the gods,

original: divit dānavānāṃ/
analyzed: divid dānavānām
translated: Diti of the demons,

original: manur mānavānāṃ/🔽surabhiḥ saurabheyānāṃ/
analyzed: manuḥ mānavānām  surabhiḥ saurabheyānām
translated: Manu of humans,🔽Surabhi of the cows,

original: vinatā suparṇānāṃ/
analyzed: vinatā suparṇānām
translated: Vinata of the birds,

original: kadrur nāgānāṃ/
analyzed: kadruḥ nāgānām
translated: Kadru of the serpents,

original: pṛthivī bhūtānāṃ🔽mātā sarvabījānāṃ/
analyzed: pṛthivī bhūtānām  mātā sarva bījānām
translated: and the earth of all beings.

original: marutāṃ mahāmahaḥ/
analyzed: marutām mahā mahaḥ
translated: The great sacrifice of the Maruts is the mother of all seeds.

original: mahākāśyapaṃ manasā vidanti ṛṣayaḥ/
analyzed: mahākāśyapam manasā vidanti ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The sages know Mahakasyapa in their minds.

original: p / // /atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin brāhmaṇānāṃ saptagotrāṇi vyākhyāsyāmi tāni śrūyantāṃ/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin brāhmaṇānām sapta gotrāṇi vyākhyāsyāmi tāni śrūyantām
translated: Now then, O Pushkarasara, I will explain the seven lineages of the Brahmins. Listen to them.

original: tad yathā gautamā vātsyāḥ kautsāḥ kauśikāḥ kāśyapā vāśiṣṭhā māṇḍavyā ity etāni brāhmaṇa saptagotrāṇi/
analyzed: tat yathā gautamāḥ vātsyāḥ kautsāḥ kauśikāḥ kāśyapāḥ vāśiṣṭhāḥ māṇḍavyāḥ iti etāni brāhmaṇa sapta gotrāṇi
translated: Namely, the Gautamas, the Vatsyas, the Kautsas, the Kaushikas, the Kashyapas, the Vasishthas, and the Mandavyas - these are the seven lineages of the Brahmins.

original: eṣām ekaikaṃ gotraṃ saptadhā bhinnaṃ/
analyzed: eṣām ekaikam gotram saptadhā bhinnam
translated: Each of these lineages is divided into seven.

original: atra ye gautamās te kauthumāste gargās te bharadvājāsta ārṣṭiṣeṇās te vaikhānasās te
analyzed: atra ye gautamāḥ te kauthumāḥ te gargāḥ te bharadvājāḥ te ārṣṭiṣeṇāḥ te vaikhānasāḥ te
translated: Here, those who are Gautamas are also Kaushimas, Gargas, Bharadvajas, Arshtisenas, Vaikhansas,

original: vajrapādāḥ/
analyzed: vajra pādāḥ
translated: and Vajrapa.

original: tatra ye vātsyāsta ātreyās
analyzed: tatra ye vātsyāḥ te ātreyāḥ
translated: Among them, those who are Vatsyas are also Atreyas,

original: te maitreyās te bhārgavās te sāvarṇyā ste salolās te bahujātāḥ/
analyzed: te maitreyāḥ te bhārgavāḥ te sāvarṇyāḥ te salolāḥ te bahu jātāḥ
translated: Maitreyas, Bhargavas, Savarnyas, Salolas, and Bahujatas.

original: tatra ye kautsās te maudgalyāyanās te gauṇāyanās te lāṅgalāste lagnāste daṇḍalagnāste somabhuvāḥvah/
analyzed: tatra ye kautsāḥ te maudgalyāyanāḥ te gauṇāyanāḥ te lāṅgalāḥ te lagnāḥ te daṇḍa lagnāḥ te
translated: Those who are Kautsas are Maudgalyāyanas, they are Gauṇāyanas, they are Lāṅgalas, they are Lagnas, they are Daṇḍalagnas, they are Somabhuvas.

original: tatra ye kauśikās te kātyāyanās te darbhakātyāyanās te valkalinas te pakṣiṇas te laukākṣās te lohitaāyanāḥ lohityāyanāḥ /
analyzed: tatra ye kauśikāḥ te kātyāyanāḥ te darbhakātyāyanāḥ te valkalinaḥ te pakṣiṇaḥ te laukākṣāḥ te lohitaāyanāḥ lohityāyanāḥ
translated: There, those who are Kaushikas are Kātyāyanas, they are Darbha-Kātyāyanas, they are Valkalins, they are Pakshins, they are Laukṣas, they are Lohitāyanas, Lohityāyanas.

original: tatra ye kāśyapās te maṇḍanās te iṣṭās te śauṇḍāyanās te rocaneyās
analyzed: tatra ye kāśyapāḥ te maṇḍanāḥ te iṣṭāḥ te śauṇḍāyanāḥ te rocaneyāḥ
translated: There, those who are Kāśyapas are Maṇḍanas, they are Iṣṭas, they are Śauṇḍāyanas, they are Rochaṇeyas.

original: te anapekṣās te agniveśyāḥ/
analyzed: te anapekṣāḥ te agniveśyāḥ
translated: They are Anapekṣas, they are Agniveśyas.

original: tatra ye vaḥśiṣṭhās te jātukarṇyās te dhānyāyanās te pārāśarās te vyāghranakhās ta āṇḍāyanasta aupamanyavāḥ/
analyzed: tatra ye vaḥśiṣṭhāḥ te jātukarṇyāḥ te dhānyāyanāḥ te pārāśarāḥ te vyāghranakhāḥ te āṇḍāyanaḥ te aupamanyavāḥ
translated: There, those who are Vaḥshiṣṭhas are Jātukarṇyas, they are Dhānyāyanas, they are Pārāśaras, they are Vyāghranakhas, they are Āṇḍāyanas, they are Aupamaṇyavas.

original: tatra ye māṇḍavyās te bhāṇḍāyanās te dhaumrāyaṇās te kātyāyanās te khalv avāhanās te sugandhārāyaṇās te kāpiṣṭhalāyanāḥ/
analyzed: tatra ye māṇḍavyāḥ te bhāṇḍāyanāḥ te dhaumrāyaṇāḥ te kātyāyanāḥ te khalu avāhanāḥ te sugandhārāyaṇāḥ te kāpiṣṭhalāyanāḥ
translated: There, those who are Māṇḍavyas are Bhāṇḍāyanas, they are Dhāumrāyanas, they are Kātyāyanas, they are Khalvāvahanas, they are Sugandhārayanas, they are Kāpiṣṭhalāyanas.

original: p / // /ity etāni brāhmaṇa evam ekonapañcāśad gotrāṇi brāhmaṇaiḥ paurāṇaiḥ samyag dṛṣṭāni chandasi vyākaraṇe padamīmāṃsāyāṃ/
analyzed: etāni brāhmaṇe evam ekonapañcāśat gotrāṇi brāhmaṇaiḥ paurāṇaiḥ samyak dṛṣṭāni chandasi vyākaraṇe pada mīmāṃsāyām
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, these forty-nine gotras of Brahmins have been well seen by ancient Brahmins in the Vedas, grammar, and pada-mimamsa.

original: anyāni ca gotrāṇi vistarato mayā vācitāni/
analyzed: anyāni ca gotrāṇi vistarataḥ mayā vācitāni
translated: And other lineages have been proclaimed by me in detail.

original: tāni anyair na jñāyante/
analyzed: tāni anyaiḥ na jñāyante
translated: They are not known by others.

original: p / // /yad utaikatvam iti viditvā bhavān bandhur bhavitum arhati/
analyzed: uta ekatvam iti viditvā bhavān bandhuḥ bhavitum arhati
translated: Knowing that this is the truth, you should be a friend.

original: tasmāt te brāhmaṇa bravīmi sāmānyaṃ saṃjñāmātrakam idaṃ lokasya yad uta brāhmaṇa iti vā kṣatriya iti vā vaiśya iti vā śūdra iti vā/
analyzed: tasmāt te brāhmaṇa bravīmi sāmānyam saṃjñā mātrakam idam lokasya yat uta brāhmaṇaḥ iti vā kṣatriyaḥ iti vā vaiśyaḥ iti vā śūdraḥ iti vā
translated: Therefore, O Brahmin, I tell you, this is merely a conventional designation of the world, namely Brahmin, or Kshatriya, or Vaishya, or Shudra.

original: ekam idaṃ sarvam idam ekaṃ /
analyzed: ekam idam sarvam idam ekam
translated: This is one, this is all one.

original: pppppputrāya me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtiṃduhitaram utsṛja bhāryāarthāya/
analyzed: me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtiṃduhitaram utsṛja bhāryā arthāya
translated: Give your daughter Prakruti to my son Sharadnakla as a wife.

original: yāvantaṃ kulaśulkaṃ manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi/
analyzed: yāvantam kula śulkam manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi
translated: I will give you as much dowry as you think fit for your family.

original: p / // /idaṃ punarvacanaṃ śrutvā triśaṅkor mātaṅgarājasya brāhmaṇaḥ puṣkarasārī tṛṣṇīṃ bhūto madgubhūtaḥ srastaskandho adhomukho niṣpratibhaḥ
analyzed: punarvacanam śrutvā triśaṅkoḥ mātaṅga rājasya brāhmaṇaḥ puṣkarasārī tṛṣṇīm bhūtaḥ madgu bhūtaḥ srasta skandhaḥ adhomukhaḥ niṣpratibhaḥ  /
translated: Having heard this speech of King Trisanku, the Brahmin Pushkarasari, the son of Varhishada, became silent, dejected, with drooping shoulders, downcast, without eloquence,

original: pradhyānaparaḥ sthito abhūt/
analyzed: pradhyāna paraḥ sthitaḥ abhūt
translated: and remained absorbed in thought.

original: adrākṣīt triśaṅkur mātaṅgarājaḥ puṣkarasāriṇaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ tūṣṇīṃ bhūtaṃ madgubhūtaṃ srastaskandham abhomukhaṃ niṣpratibhaṃ pradhyānaparaṃ sthitaṃ/
analyzed: adrākṣīt triśaṅkuḥ mātaṅga rājaḥ puṣkarasāriṇam brāhmaṇam tūṣṇīm bhūtam madgu bhūtam srasta skandham abhomukham niṣpratibham pradhyāna param sthitam
translated: Triśaṅku, the king of the Mātaṅgas, saw the brahmin Puṣkarasārin sitting silently, like a mute, with drooping shoulders, looking down, without eloquence, absorbed in thought.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punar idam avocat/
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar idam avocat
translated: And having seen him, he said this:

original: p / // /yādṛśaṃ vāpyate bījaṃ tādṛśaṃ labhyate phalaṃ/
analyzed: vāpyate bījam tādṛśam labhyate phalam
translated: Whatever kind of seed is sown, that kind of fruit is obtained.

original: p / // /prajāpater hi caikatve nirviśeṣo bhavaty ataḥ//
analyzed: hi ca ekatve nirviśeṣaḥ bhavati atas
translated: For in the case of Prajāpati, there is no difference when there is oneness.

original: p / // /na caindriyāṇāṃ nānātvaṃ kriyābhedaś ca dṛśyate/
analyzed: ca aindriyāṇām nānātvam kriyā bhedaḥ ca dṛśyate
translated: And the difference in the sense faculties and the difference in actions are not seen.

original: p / // /brāhmaṇe vānyajātau vā naiṣāṃ kiñcid viśiṣyate//
analyzed: vā anya jātau vā na eṣām kiñcid viśiṣyate
translated: There is no difference between a brahmin and another caste.

original: p / // /na hy ātmanaḥ samutkarṣaḥ śreṣṭha tvam iha yujyate/
analyzed: hi ātmanaḥ samutkarṣaḥ śreṣṭha tvam iha yujyate
translated: For the superiority of the self is not proper here.

original: p / // /śukraśoṇitasambhūtaṃ yonito hy ubhayaṃ samaṃ//
analyzed: yonitaḥ hi ubhayam samam
translated: Both are equal, born from semen and blood, from the womb.

original: p / // /cāturvarṇyaṃ pravakṣyāmi paśudharmakathāṃ tava/
analyzed: pravakṣyāmi paśu dharma kathām tava
translated: I will tell you about the four varnas, the story of animal dharma.

original: p / // /bhavet te bhaginī bhāryā naitad brāhmaṇa yujyate//
analyzed: te bhaginī bhāryā na etat brāhmaṇa yujyate
translated: Your sister could be a wife, this is not proper, brahmin.

original: p / // /yadi tāvad ayaṃ loko brahmaṇā janitaḥ svayaṃ/
analyzed: tāvat ayam lokaḥ brahmaṇā janitaḥ svayam
translated: If this world was indeed created by Brahmā himself,

original: p / // /brāhmaṇī brāhmaṇasvasā kṣatriyā kṣatriyasvasā//
analyzed: brāhmaṇa svasā kṣatriyā kṣatriya svasā
translated: The Brahmin woman is the sister of the Brahmin, the Kshatriya woman is the sister of the Kshatriya,

original: p / // /atha vaiśyasya vaiśyā vai śūdrā śūdrasya vā punaḥ/
analyzed: vaiśyasya vaiśyā vai śūdrā śūdrasya vā punar
translated: And the Vaishya woman is for the Vaishya, and the Shudra woman is for the Shudra again.

original: p / // /na bhāryā bhaginī yuktā brahmaṇā janitā yadi//
analyzed: bhāryā bhaginī yuktā brahmaṇā janitā yadi
translated: The sister is not a suitable wife, even if born by Brahma.

original: p / // /na sattvā brahmaṇo jātāḥ kleśajāḥ karmajāstvamī/
analyzed: sattvāḥ brahmaṇaḥ jātāḥ kleśa jāḥ karma jāḥ tu amī
translated: The beings are not born from Brahma, they are born from afflictions and karma.

original: p / // /nīcaiś cauccaiś ca dūśyante sattvā nānāāśrayāḥ pṛthak//🔽p / // /teṣāṃ ca jātisāmānyād brāhmaṇe kṣatriye tathā/
analyzed: ca auccaiḥ ca dūśyante sattvāḥ nānā āśrayāḥ pṛthak  ca jāti sāmānyāt brāhmaṇe kṣatriye tathā
translated: The beings are seen to be of various forms and different abodes, some low and some high.🔽And due to their common birth, the knowledge proceeds equally in the Brahmin, Kshatriya,

original: p / // /atha vaiśye ca śūdre ca samaṃ jñānaṃ pravartate//
analyzed: vaiśye ca śūdre ca samam jñānam pravartate
translated: Vaishya, and Shudra.

original: p / // /ṛgvedo atha yajurvedaḥ sāmavedopy atharvāṇaṃ/
analyzed: atha yajurvedaḥ sāmavedaḥ upi atharvāṇam
translated: The Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sama Veda, and the Atharva Veda,

original: p / // /itihāso nighaṇṭaś ca kutaś chando nirarthakaṃ//
analyzed: nighaṇṭaḥ ca kutas chandaḥ nirarthakam
translated: The Itihasa, the Nirukta, the Chandas, and the Niravaya.

original: p / // /asmākam apy adhyayane maitrī vidyā tathā śikhī/
analyzed: api adhyayane maitrī vidyā tathā śikhī
translated: In our study also, there are the Maitri Vidya, the Shikhi Vidya,

original: p / // /saṃkrāmaṇī prakāmaṇī stambhanī kāmarūpiṇī//
translated: The Sankramani, the Prakamani, the Stambhani, the Kamarupini,

original: p / // /manojavā ca gāndhārī ghorī vidyā vaśaṅkarī/
analyzed: ca gāndhārī ghorī vidyā vaśaṅkarī
translated: The Manojava, the Gandhari, the Ghori Vidya, the Vashankari,

original: p / // /kākavāṇī ca mantraṃ ca /
analyzed: ca mantram ca
translated: The Kakavani, and the Mantra,

original: indrajālaṃ ca bhañjanī//
analyzed: indrajālam ca bhañjanī
translated: And the Indrajala, and the Bhanjani.

original: p / // /asmākam āsīt puruṣā vidyāsvākhyātapaṇḍitāḥ/
analyzed: āsīt puruṣāḥ vidyāsu ākhyāta paṇḍitāḥ
translated: We had men who were renowned scholars in the Vedas.

original: p / // /maṇipuṣpāś ca /
analyzed: ca
translated: We had jewel-flowers.

original: ṛṣayo bhāsvarāś ca maharṣayaḥ//
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ bhāsvarāḥ ca mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: We had shining sages and great sages.

original: p / // /saṃprāptā devatā /
analyzed: devatā
translated: We had attained the gods.

original: ṛddhiṃ kiṃ cikitsāsi vidyayā/
analyzed: ṛddhim kim cikitsāsi vidyayā
translated: What do you treat with medicine, with knowledge?

original: p / // /aśikṣitāś ca caṇḍālā brāhmaṇā vedapāragāḥ//
analyzed: ca caṇḍālāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vedapāragāḥ
translated: We had untaught untouchables, Brahmins who had mastered the Vedas.

original: p / // /kapiñjalādyā janito mantrāṇāṃ pārabhiṃgataḥ/
analyzed: janitaḥ mantrāṇām pārabhiṃgataḥ
translated: We had the parrot and others, who had reached the other shore of mantras.

original: p / // /na hy asau brāhmaṇīputraḥ kiṃ vā brāhmaṇa manyase//
analyzed: hi asau brāhmaṇī putraḥ kim vā brāhmaṇa manyase
translated: He is not the son of a Brahmin woman, what do you think, Brahmin?

original: p / // /niṣādyajanayatkālī putraṃ dvaipāyānaṃ muniṃ/
analyzed: putram dvaipāyānam munim
translated: Kali gave birth to the sage Dvaipayana, the son of a fisherwoman.

original: p / // /ugraṃ tejasvinaṃ bhīṣmaṃ pañcābhijñaṃ mahātapaṃ/
analyzed: tejasvinam bhīṣmam pañca abhijñam mahā tapam
translated: Fierce, energetic, terrible, omniscient, of great austerities.

original: p / // /na hy asau brāhmaṇīputraḥ kiṃ vā brāhmaṇa vakṣyasi//
analyzed: hi asau brāhmaṇī putraḥ kim vā brāhmaṇa vakṣyasi
translated: He is not the son of a Brahmin woman, what will you say, Brahmin?

original: p / // /kṣatriyā reṇukā nāma jajñe rāmaṃ mahāmuniṃ/
analyzed: reṇukā nāma jajñe rāmam mahā munim
translated: The Kshatriya woman named Renu gave birth to the great sage Rama.

original: p / // /paṇḍitaṃ ca vinītaṃ ca sarvaśāstraviśāradaṃ/
analyzed: ca vinītam ca sarva śāstra viśāradam
translated: Learned, humble, skilled in all scriptures.

original: p / // /na hy asau brāhmaṇīputraḥ kiṃ vā brāhmaṇa vakṣyasi//🔽p / // /ye ca te manujā /
analyzed: hi asau brāhmaṇī putraḥ kim vā brāhmaṇa vakṣyasi  ca te manujā
translated: He is not the son of a Brahmin woman, what will you say, Brahmin?

original: āsan tejasā tapasā yutāḥ/
analyzed: āsan tejasā tapasā yutāḥ
translated: And those men who were endowed with energy and austerity,

original: p / // /paṇḍitāś ca vinītāś ca loke ca /
analyzed: ca vinītāḥ ca loke ca
translated: and the wise and the humble in the world.

original: ṛṣisammatāḥ/
analyzed: ṛṣi sammatāḥ
translated: They are approved by the sages.

original: p / // /na hi te brāhmaṇīputrāḥ kiṃ vā brāhmaṇa vakṣyasi//
analyzed: hi te brāhmaṇī putrāḥ kim vā brāhmaṇa vakṣyasi
translated: For they are not the sons of Brahmins, what will you say, O Brahmin?

original: p / // /saṃjñā kṛteyaṃ lokasya brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyās tathā/
analyzed: kṛtā iyam lokasya brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyāḥ tathā
translated: The designation of the world is made thus: Brahmins, Kshatriyas,

original: p / // /vaiśyāx caeva tathā śūdrāḥ saṃjñeyaṃ saṃprakīrtitā//
analyzed: ca eva tathā śūdrāḥ saṃjñā iyam saṃprakīrtitā
translated: and also Vaishyas and Shudras. This designation is proclaimed.

original: p / // /tasmāt te brāhmaṇa bravīmi saṃjñāmātrakam idaṃlokasya yad uta brāhmaṇa iti vā kṣatriya iti vā vaiśya iti vā śūdara iti vā/
analyzed: te brāhmaṇa bravīmi saṃjñā mātrakam idaṃlokasya yat uta brāhmaṇaḥ iti vā kṣatriyaḥ iti vā vaiśyaḥ iti vā śūdaraḥ iti vā
translated: Therefore, O Brahmin, I tell you that this is merely a designation of the world, namely Brahmin, Kshatriya, Vaishya, or Shudra.

original: ekam idaṃ sarvam idam ekaṃ/
analyzed: ekam idam sarvam idam ekam
translated: This is one, this is all one.

original: putrāya me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtiṃ duhitaram anuprayaccha bharyarthāya/
analyzed: putrāya me śārdūlakarṇāya prakṛtim duhitaram anuprayaccha bharyarthāya
translated: Give me your daughter Prakṛti to my son Śārdūlakarṇa as a wife.

original: yāvantaṃ kulaśulkaṃ manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi/
analyzed: yāvantam kula śulkam manyase tāvantam anupradāsyāmi
translated: I will give you as much dowry as you think fit.

original: p / // /idaṃ ca punarvacanaṃ śrutvā triśaṅkor mātaṅgarājasya bbrāhmaṇaḥ puskarasārī triśaṅkuṃ mātaṅgarājam idam avocat/
analyzed: ca punarvacanam śrutvā triśaṅkoḥ mātaṅga rājasya brāhmaṇaḥ puskarasārī triśaṅkum mātaṅga rājam idam avocat
translated: Having heard this speech, the Brahmin Puṣkarasāri said this to Triśaṅku, the king of the Mātaṅgas:

original: kiṃ gotro bhavān/
analyzed: kim gotraḥ bhavān
translated: What is your gotra?

original: āha ātreyagotro asmi/
analyzed: āha ātreya gotraḥ asmi
translated: He said, I am of the Ātreya gotra.

original: hiṃpūrvaḥ/ āha/
analyzed: hiṃpūrvaḥ āha
translated: The one with the syllable 'hi' at the beginning. He said,

original: ātreyaḥ/
analyzed: ātreyaḥ
translated: Ātreya.

original: kiṃcaraṇaḥāha kāleyamaitrāyaṇīyaḥ/
analyzed: kiṃcaraṇaḥ āha kāleyamaitrāyaṇīyaḥ
translated: Kṛṣṇācārya says: Kāleyamitra's son.

original: kati pravarāḥ/
analyzed: kati pravarāḥ
translated: How many Pravaras are there?

original: āha trayaḥ pravarāḥ/
analyzed: āha trayaḥ pravarāḥ
translated: He says: There are three Pravaras.

original: tad yathā vātsyāḥ kautsyā bharadvājāś ca/
analyzed: tat yathā vātsyāḥ kautsyāḥ bharadvājāḥ ca
translated: Namely, Vātsyas, Kautsas, and Bharadvājas.

original: ke bhavantaḥ sabrahmacāriṇaḥ/
analyzed: ke bhavantaḥ sabrahmacāriṇaḥ
translated: Who are your fellow students?

original: chandogāḥ/🔽kati chantogānāṃ
analyzed: chandogāḥ  kati chantogānām
translated: The Chandogas.

original: bhedāḥ/ ṣaṭ/ te katame/ āha/
analyzed: bhedāḥ ṣaṭ te katame āha
translated: How many divisions are there among the Chandogas? Six. Which are they? He says:

original: tad yathā/🔽kauthumāḥ/
analyzed: tat yathā  kauthumāḥ
translated: Namely,🔽Kaushitakas,

original: caarāyaṇīyāḥ/
analyzed: caarāyaṇīyāḥ
translated: Kāleyas,

original: lāṅgalāḥ/
analyzed: lāṅgalāḥ
translated: Lāṅgalas,

original: sauvarcasāḥ/
analyzed: sauvarcasāḥ
translated: Sauvarcasas,

original: kāpiñjaleyāḥ/
analyzed: kāpiñjaleyāḥ
translated: Kāpiñjalas,

original: ārṣṭiṣeṇā iti/
analyzed: ārṣṭiṣeṇāḥ iti
translated: and Ārsheṣṇas.

original: p / // /kiṃ bhavato mātṛjaṃ gotraṃ/ āha/
analyzed: bhavataḥ mātṛ jam gotram āha
translated: What is your mother's gotra? He says:

original: pārāśarīyaṃ/
analyzed: pārāśarīyam
translated: Pārāśarya.

original: paṭhatu bhavān sāvitrīṃ/
analyzed: paṭhatu bhavān sāvitrīm
translated: Recite the Sāvitrī for me.

original: kathaṃ bhavati/
analyzed: katham bhavati
translated: How is it?

original: katyakṣarā sāvitrī/
analyzed: kati akṣarā sāvitrī
translated: How many syllables does the Sāvitrī have?

original: kathigaṇḍā/ katipadā/
analyzed: kathi gaṇḍā kati padā
translated: How many feet, how many words?

original: p / // /caturviṃśatyakṣarā sāvitrī/
analyzed: sāvitrī
translated: The Sāvitrī has twenty-four syllables.

original: trigaṇḍā/
analyzed: tri gaṇḍā
translated: Three feet.

original: aṣṭākṣarapadā/
analyzed: aṣṭa akṣara padā
translated: Eight-syllable words.

original: uccārayatu bhavān sāvitrīṃ/
analyzed: uccārayatu bhavān sāvitrīm
translated: Recite the Sāvitrī for me.

original: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin sotpattikāṃ sāvitrīṃ pravakṣyāmi/
analyzed: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin sa utpattikām sāvitrīm pravakṣyāmi
translated: Now, O Puṣkarasārin, I will explain the Sāvitrī with its origin.

original: tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: p / // /kathayatu bhavān/
analyzed: bhavān
translated: Tell me, sir.

original: p / // /bhūtapūrvaṃ brāhmaṇātīte adhvani vasur nāma ṛṣir bhūva/
analyzed: brāhmaṇa atīte adhvani vasuḥ nāma ṛṣiḥ bhūva
translated: In the past, O Brahmins, in a former time, there was a sage named Vasu.

original: pañcābhijña ugratejā mahānubhāvo dhyānānāṃ lābhī/🔽tena tatra takṣakaduhitā kapilā nāma āsāditā bhāryāarthaṃ/
analyzed: pañca abhijñaḥ ugra tejāḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ dhyānānām lābhī  tena tatra takṣaka duhitā kapilā nāma āsāditā bhāryā artham
translated: He had the five superknowledges, fierce energy, and great power, and had attained the meditations.🔽There he obtained as his wife Takshaka's daughter named Kapila.

original: sa tatra saṃraktacittas tayā kanyayā sārdhaṃ maithunam agacchat/🔽sa ṛṣi ṛddhyā bhraṣṭo dhyānebhyo vañcitaḥ/
analyzed: sa tatra saṃrakta cittaḥ tayā kanyayā sārdham maithunam agacchat  saḥ ṛṣiḥ ṛddhyā bhraṣṭaḥ dhyānebhyaḥ vañcitaḥ
translated: With a mind attached to her, he had sexual intercourse with that maiden.🔽That sage, fallen from his spiritual powers, deprived of the meditations,

original: ṛddhiparihīnaḥ sa vipratisārī ātmano duścaritaṃ vigarhamāṇas tasyāṃ
analyzed: ṛddhi parihīnaḥ sa vipratisārī ātmanaḥ duścaritam vigarhamāṇaḥ tasyām
translated: deprived of his spiritual powers, remorseful, reproaching himself for his misconduct,

original: velāyāṃ sāvitrīṃ bhāṣate sma/ tad yathā/
analyzed: velāyām sāvitrīm bhāṣate sma tat yathā
translated: at that time spoke the Savitri verse. It is as follows.

original: p / // /oṃ bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ/
analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar
translated: Om. Earth, atmosphere, heaven.

original: tat savitur vareṇyaṃ bhargo devasya dhīmahi/
analyzed: tat savituḥ vareṇyam bhargaḥ devasya dhīmahi
translated: We meditate on the excellent glory of that god Savita.

original: dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayāt/
analyzed: dhiyaḥ yaḥ naḥ pracodayāt
translated: May he inspire our thoughts.

original: p / // /iti hi brāhmaṇa ajñānaśodhanārtham imam eva mantraṃ sa brāhmaṇo divārātraṃ japati sma/
analyzed: hi brāhmaṇa ajñāna śodhana artham imam eva mantram sa brāhmaṇaḥ divārātram japati sma
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, that Brahmin, for the sake of purifying his ignorance, recited this very mantra day and night.

original: iyaṃ brāhmaṇānāṃ sāvitrī/
analyzed: iyam brāhmaṇānām sāvitrī
translated: This is the Savitri of the Brahmins.

original: pūrvajaḥ prajāpatiḥ
analyzed: pūrva jaḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: The ancient Prajapati

original: p / // /jaṭilastāpaso bhūtvā gahanaṃ vanam āśritaḥ/
analyzed: bhūtvā gahanam vanam āśritaḥ
translated: Having become an ascetic with matted hair, he resorted to a dense forest.

original: p / // /gambhīrāv abhāse tatra hy ātmārāmas taporataḥ/
analyzed: abhāse tatra hi ātma ārāmaḥ tapaḥ rataḥ
translated: In that deep and clear lake, he, delighting in the self, devoted to austerities,

original: p / // /devasya śreṣṭhakaṃ bhījanam apanābhyo paviṣṭa imaṃmantram ajapat/
analyzed: śreṣṭhakam bhījanam paviṣṭaḥ imaṃmantram ajapat
translated: The king, having entered the inner apartments, recited this mantra: May the Lord, the best of gods, grant me a son.

original: iyaṃ kṣatriyāṇāṃ sāvitrī/
analyzed: iyam kṣatriyāṇām sāvitrī
translated: This is the Savitri for Kshatriyas.

original: p / // /oṃ citraṃ hi vaiśyakanyakā/
analyzed: citram hi vaiśya kanyakā
translated: Om! Wonderful indeed is the maiden of the Vaishya class.

original: atha sā kanyā arthataḥ pravīṇā/
analyzed: atha sā kanyā arthataḥ pravīṇā
translated: Then that maiden, skilled in the meaning,

original: p / // /iyaṃ vaiśyānāṃ sāvitrī/
analyzed: vaiśyānām sāvitrī
translated: This is the Savitri for Vaishyas.

original: om atapaḥ sutapaḥ/
analyzed: om atapaḥ sutapaḥ
translated: Om! Austerity, good austerity.

original: jīvema śaradāṃ śataṃ/
analyzed: jīvema śaradām śatam
translated: May we live a hundred autumns.

original: paśyema śaradāṃ śataṃ/
analyzed: paśyema śaradām śatam
translated: May we see a hundred autumns.

original: iyaṃ śūdrāṇāṃ sāvitrī/
analyzed: iyam śūdrāṇām sāvitrī
translated: This is the Savitri for Shudras.

original: oṃ bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ/
analyzed: om bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar
translated: Om! Earth, atmosphere, heaven.

original: p / // /kāmā hi loke paramāḥ prajānāṃ kleśaprahāṇe bhūtā antarāyāḥ/
analyzed: hi loke paramāḥ prajānām kleśa prahāṇe bhūtāḥ antarāyāḥ
translated: For desires are the highest in the world for beings, obstacles are in the abandonment of suffering.

original: p / // /tasmād bhavantaḥ prajahantu kāmān tato atulaṃ prāpsy atha brahmalokaṃ/
analyzed: bhavantaḥ prajahantu kāmān tatas atulam prāpsi atha brahma lokam
translated: Therefore, you should abandon desires, then you will attain the incomparable world of Brahma.

original: p / // /itīyaṃ brāhmaṇa brahmaṇā sahāpatinā sāvitrī bhāṣitā /
analyzed: brāhmaṇa brahmaṇā sahāpatinā sāvitrī bhāṣitā
translated: Thus, this Savitri was spoken by Brahma, the Lord,

original: pūrvakaiś ca samyak saṃbuddhair abhyanumoditā/
