translated: If it rains here in the last month of summer in Maghā, it rains sixty-four āḍhakas.

original: eṣo varṣaḥ sarvasasyāni sampādayati/
analyzed: eṣaḥ varṣaḥ sarva sasyāni sampādayati
translated: This rain brings forth all crops.

original: mṛgapakṣipaśumanuṣyāṇāṃ caatra garbhā vinaśyanti/
analyzed: mṛga pakṣi paśu manuṣyāṇām ca atra garbhāḥ vinaśyanti
translated: Here the wombs of deer, birds, cattle, and humans are destroyed.

original: janamaraṇaṃ caatra bhaviṣyatiiti/
analyzed: jana maraṇam ca atra bhaviṣyati iti
translated: There will be death of people here.

original: uktaṃ maghāyāṃ/
analyzed: uktam maghāyām
translated: It is said about Maghā.

original: p / // /pūrvaphalgunyāṃ grīṣmāṇāṃ paścime māse yady atra devaḥ pravarṣati catuḥṣaṣṭyāḍhakāni pravarṣati/
analyzed: grīṣmāṇām paścime māse yadi atra devaḥ pravarṣati catuḥṣaṣṭi āḍhakāni pravarṣati
translated: If it rains here in the last month of summer in Pūrvā Phalguni, it rains sixty-four āḍhakas.

original: eṣo varṣaḥ sarvasasyāni sampādayati/🔽tac ca sasyaṃ janayitvā paracakrapīḍitā manuṣyā na sukhenopabhuñjate/
analyzed: eṣaḥ varṣaḥ sarva sasyāni sampādayati  tat ca sasyam janayitvā para cakra pīḍitāḥ manuṣyāḥ na sukhena upabhuñjate
translated: This rain brings forth all crops.🔽And having produced those crops, people afflicted by foreign armies do not enjoy them happily.

original: paśūnāṃ maṇuṣyāṇāṃ caatra garbhāḥ sukhino bhavanti/
analyzed: paśūnām maṇuṣyāṇām ca atra garbhāḥ sukhinaḥ bhavanti
translated: Here the embryos of animals and humans are comfortable.

original: uktaṃ pūrvaphalgunyāṃ/
analyzed: uktam pūrva phalgunyām
translated: It is said about the previous Phalguni.

original: p / // /uttaraphalgunyāṃ grīṣmāṇāṃ paścime māse yady atra devaḥ pravarṣati aśītyāḍhakāni pravarṣati/
analyzed: grīṣmāṇām paścime māse yadi atra devaḥ pravarṣati aśīti āḍhakāni pravarṣati
translated: If it rains here in the last month of summer in the Uttaraphalgunī [constellation], it rains eighty āḍhakas.

original: eṣo varṣaḥ sarvasasyāni ca sampādayati/
analyzed: eṣaḥ varṣaḥ sarva sasyāni ca sampādayati
translated: This rain brings forth all crops.

original: nikṣiptaśastrāś caatra rājāno bhavanti/
analyzed: nikṣipta śastrāḥ ca atra rājānaḥ bhavanti
translated: And here the kings lay down their weapons.

original: brahmakṣatriyayoś ca virodho bhavati/
analyzed: brahma kṣatriyayoḥ ca virodhaḥ bhavati
translated: And there is a conflict between Brahmins and Kṣatriyas.

original: kṣipraṃ ca anītikāḥ prajā vinaśyanti/
analyzed: kṣipram ca anītikāḥ prajāḥ vinaśyanti
translated: And the unrighteous people perish quickly.

original: cauktam uttaraphalgunyāṃ/
analyzed: ca auktam uttaraphalgunyām
translated: It is said about the Uttaraphalgunī.

original: p / // /haste grīṣmāṇāṃ paścime māse yady atra devaḥ pravarṣati ekonapañcāśadāḍhakāni 🔽pravarṣati/
analyzed: grīṣmāṇām paścime māse yadi atra devaḥ pravarṣati ekonapañcāśat āḍhakāni  pravarṣati
translated: If it rains here in the last month of summer in the Hasta [constellation], it rains forty-nine āḍhakas.

original: devaś ca tad yathā parikṣipati/
analyzed: devaḥ ca tat yathā parikṣipati
translated: And the rain falls as if it were scattered.

original: patitāni ca sasyāni janasyārasāgrāṇi anudagrāṇi alpasārāṇy alpodakāni/
analyzed: patitāni ca sasyāni janasya a rasa agrāṇi an udagrāṇi alpa sārāṇi alpa udakāni
translated: And the fallen crops are tasteless, unappetizing, of little essence, and of little water.

original: durbhikṣaś caatra bhaviṣyati/
analyzed: durbhikṣaḥ ca atra bhaviṣyati
translated: And there will be famine here.

original: uktaṃ haste/
analyzed: uktam haste
translated: It has been said for Hasta.

original: p / // /citrāyāṃ grīṣmāṇāṃ paścime māse yady atra devaḥ pravarṣati catuḥṣaṣṭyāḍhakāni pravarṣati/
analyzed: grīṣmāṇām paścime māse yadi atra devaḥ pravarṣati catuḥṣaṣṭi āḍhakāni pravarṣati
translated: If it rains here in the last month of summer in Citrā, it rains sixty-four āḍhakas.

original: sāroparodhas tataḥ paścād varṣaṃ saṃjanayati/
analyzed: sāra uparodhaḥ tatas paścāt varṣam saṃjanayati
translated: Then after that, the rain generates a surplus.

original: nikṣiptaśastrāś ca rājāno bhavanti/
analyzed: nikṣipta śastrāḥ ca rājānaḥ bhavanti
translated: And the kings lay down their weapons.

original: muditāś caatra janapadā bhavanti/
analyzed: muditāḥ ca atra janapadāḥ bhavanti
translated: And the people here become joyful.

original: uktaṃ citrāyāṃ/
analyzed: uktam citrāyām
translated: It has been said for Citrā.

original: p / // /svātyāṃ grīṣmāṇāṃ paścime māse yady atra devaḥ pravarṣati ekaviṃśatyāḍhakāni pravarṣati/
analyzed: grīṣmāṇām paścime māse yadi atra devaḥ pravarṣati ekaviṃśati āḍhakāni pravarṣati
translated: If it rains here in the last month of summer in Svātī, it rains twenty-one āḍhakas.

original: nikṣiptaśastrāś ca rājāno bhavanti/
analyzed: nikṣipta śastrāḥ ca rājānaḥ bhavanti
translated: And the kings lay down their weapons.

original: caurāś caatra balavattarā bhavanti/
analyzed: caurāḥ ca atra balavattarāḥ bhavanti
translated: And the thieves become more powerful here.

original: uktaṃ svātyāṃ/
analyzed: uktam svātyām
translated: It has been said for Svātī.

original: p / // /viśākhāyāṃ grīṣmāṇāṃ paścime māse yady atra devaḥ pravarṣati aśītyāḍhakāni
analyzed: grīṣmāṇām paścime māse yadi atra devaḥ pravarṣati aśīti āḍhakāni
translated: If it rains here in the last month of summer in Viśākhā, it rains eighty āḍhakas.

original: pravarṣati/
analyzed: pravarṣati
translated: It rains.

original: eṣā varṣaḥ sarvasasyāni sampādayati/
analyzed: eṣā varṣaḥ sarva sasyāni sampādayati

analyzed: ghoḥ puṣkarasārin nakṣatra ṛtu varṣādhyāyaḥ
translated: This is the chapter on the asterisms, seasons, and rains, O Puṣkarasārin.

original: rāhugrahe phalavipākaḥ
analyzed: rāhu grahe phala vipākaḥ
translated: The results of an eclipse by Rāhu

original: p / // /amīṣāṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārinn aśṭāviṃśatīnāṃ nakṣatrāṇāṃ rāhugrahe phalavipākaṃ vyākhyāsyāmi/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin a śṭāviṃśatīnām nakṣatrāṇām rāhu grahe phala vipākam vyākhyāsyāmi
translated: O Puṣkarasārin, I will explain the results of an eclipse by Rāhu in these twenty-eight asterisms.

original: p / / //kṛttikāsu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin yadi candragraho bhavati kaliṅgamagadhānām upapīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin yadi candra grahaḥ bhavati kaliṅga magadhānām upapīḍā bhavati
translated: O Puṣkarasārin, if there is a lunar eclipse in Kṛttikā, there is affliction to the people of Kaliṅga and Magadha.

original: yadi rohiṇyāṃ candragraho bhavati prajānām upapīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi rohiṇyām candra grahaḥ bhavati prajānām upapīḍā bhavati
translated: If there is a lunar eclipse in Rohini, there is affliction to the people.

original: yadi mṛgaśirasi candragraho bhavati videhānāṃ janapadānām upapīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi mṛgaśirasi candra grahaḥ bhavati videhānām janapadānām upapīḍā bhavati
translated: If there is a lunar eclipse in Mrigashira, there is affliction to the countries of the Videhas.

original: rājopasevakanāṃ ca/
analyzed: rāja upasevakanām ca
translated: And to those who serve the king.

original: evam ārdrāyāṃ punarvasau puṣye ca vaktavyaṃ/
analyzed: evam ārdrāyām punarvasau puṣye ca vaktavyam
translated: The same should be said for Ardra, Punarvasu, and Pushya.

original: aśleṣāyāṃ yadi candragraho bhavati nāgānāṃ haimavatānāṃ
analyzed: aśleṣāyām yadi candra grahaḥ bhavati nāgānām haimavatānām
translated: If there is a lunar eclipse in Ashlesha, there is affliction to the Nagas of the Himalayas.

original: ca pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: ca pīḍā bhavati
translated: And there is affliction.

original: yadi maghāsu candragraho bhavati gauḍikānām upapīḍā bhavati/🔽yadi pūrvaphalgunyāṃ somo gṛhyate caurāṇām upapīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi maghāsu candra grahaḥ bhavati gauḍikānām upapīḍā bhavati  yadi pūrvaphalgunyām somaḥ gṛhyate caurāṇām upapīḍā bhavati
translated: If there is a lunar eclipse in Magha, there is affliction to the Gaudas.🔽If the moon is eclipsed in Purva Phalguni, there is affliction to thieves.

original: yady uttaraphalgunyāṃ somo gṛhyate avantīnām upapīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi uttaraphalgunyām somaḥ gṛhyate avantīnām upapīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is eclipsed in Uttara Phalguni, there is affliction to the Avantis.

original: yadi hasteṣu somo gṛhyate saurāṣṭrikāṇām upapīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi hasteṣu somaḥ gṛhyate saurāṣṭrikāṇām upapīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is eclipsed in Hasta, there is affliction to the Saurashtrakas.

original: yadi citrāyāṃ somo gṛhyate pakṣiṇāṃ dvipadānāṃ ca pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi citrāyām somaḥ gṛhyate pakṣiṇām dvipadānām ca pīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is eclipsed in Chitra, there is affliction to birds and bipeds.

original: yadi svātyāṃ somo gṛhyate
analyzed: yadi svātyām somaḥ gṛhyate
translated: If the moon is eclipsed in Svati,

original: sarveṣāṃ pravrajyāsamāpannānām upapīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: sarveṣām pravrajyā samāpannānām upapīḍā bhavati
translated: there is affliction to all those who have gone forth.

original: yady anurādhāsu somo gṛhyate vaṇijānām upapīḍā bhavati śākaṭikānāṃ ca/
analyzed: yadi anurādhāsu somaḥ gṛhyate vaṇijānām upapīḍā bhavati śākaṭikānām ca
translated: If the moon is seized in Anurādhā, there is affliction to merchants and to caravan leaders.

original: yadi jyeṣṭhāyāṃ somo gṛhyate dauvālikānāṃ pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi jyeṣṭhāyām somaḥ gṛhyate dauvālikānām pīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is seized in Jyeṣṭhā, there is affliction to those who live in forts.

original: yadi mūle somo gṛhyate adhvagānāṃ pīḍā bhavati/🔽yadi pūrvāṣāḍhāyāṃ somo gṛhyate avantīnāṃ pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi mūle somaḥ gṛhyate adhvagānām pīḍā bhavati  yadi pūrvāṣāḍhāyām somaḥ gṛhyate avantīnām pīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is seized in Mūlā, there is affliction to travelers.🔽If the moon is seized in Pūrvāṣāḍhā, there is affliction to the people of Avanti.

original: yady uttarāṣāḍhāyāṃ somo gṛhyate kāmbojakānāṃ pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi uttarāṣāḍhāyām somaḥ gṛhyate kāmbojakānām pīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is seized in Uttarāṣāḍhā, there is affliction to the people of Kāmboja.

original: bāhlīkānāṃ ca/
analyzed: vāhlīkānām ca
translated: And to the people of Bāhlika.

original: yady abhijiti somo gṛhyate dakṣiṇāpathikānāṃ pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi abhijiti somaḥ gṛhyate dakṣiṇāpathikānām pīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is seized in Abhijit, there is affliction to the people of the southern path.

original: tāmraparṇikānāṃ ca/🔽yadi śravaṇeṣu somo gṛhyate caurāṇāṃ ghātakānāṃ caupapīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: tāmraparṇikānām ca  yadi śravaṇeṣu somaḥ gṛhyate caurāṇām ghātakānām ca aupapīḍā bhavati
translated: And to the people of Tāmraparṇika.🔽If the moon is seized in Śravaṇa, there is affliction to thieves and murderers.

original: yadi dhaniṣṭhāyāṃ somo gṛhyate kurupāñcālanāṃ pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi dhaniṣṭhāyām somaḥ gṛhyate kuru pāñcālanām pīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is seized in Dhaniṣṭhā, there is affliction to the people of Kuru and Pāñcāla.

original: yadi śatabhiṣāyāṃ somo gṛhyate maulikānām ātharvaṇikānāṃ ca pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi śatabhiṣāyām somaḥ gṛhyate maulikānām ātharvaṇikānām ca pīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is seized in Śatabhiṣā, there is affliction to the people of Maula and the Atharvaṇa priests.

original: yadi pūrvabhādrapadāyāṃ somo gṛhyate gāndhikānāṃ yavanakāmbojakānāṃ ca pīḍā
analyzed: yadi pūrvabhādrapadāyām somaḥ gṛhyate gāndhikānām yavana kāmbojakānām ca pīḍā
translated: If the moon is seized in Pūrvabhādrapadā, there is affliction to the people of Gandhāra, Yavana and Kāmboja.

original: bhavati/ yady uttarabhādrapadāyāṃ somo gṛhyate
analyzed: bhavati yadi uttarabhādrapadāyām somaḥ gṛhyate
translated: If the moon is received in Uttarāṣāḍhā,

original: gandharvāṇāṃ pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: gandharvāṇām pīḍā bhavati
translated: there is affliction to the Gandharvas.

original: yadi revatyāṃ somo gṛhyate nāvikānāṃ pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi revatyām somaḥ gṛhyate nāvikānām pīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is received in Revatī, there is affliction to the boatmen.

original: yady aścviṇijānāṃ pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi aścviṇijānām pīḍā bhavati
translated: If in Aśvinī, there is affliction to the Aśvinīs.

original: yadi bharaṇyāṃ somo gṛhyate bharukacchānāṃ pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: yadi bharaṇyām somaḥ gṛhyate bharu kacchānām pīḍā bhavati
translated: If the moon is received in Bharaṇī, there is affliction to the people of Bharukaccha.

original: p / // /evaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārin nakṣatre candragraho bhavati tasya tasya deśasya pīḍā bhavati/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin nakṣatre candra grahaḥ bhavati tasya tasya deśasya pīḍā bhavati
translated: Thus, O Puṣkarasārin, when there is a lunar eclipse in a lunar mansion, there is affliction to that and that country.

original: ity ukto rāhugrahaphalavipākādhyāyaḥ/
analyzed: iti uktaḥ rāhu graha phala vipāka adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the results and consequences of Rahu's eclipse, the twenty-first.

original: nakṣatrakarmanirdeśaḥ
translated: Instruction on the Nakshatra Rituals

original: p / // /pratinakṣatravaṃśaśāstre yathoktaṃ karma tac chṛṇu/
analyzed: yathā uktam karma tat śṛṇu
translated: Listen to the ritual that is said in the treatise on the family of each lunar mansion, as follows.

original: p / // /ucyamānam idaṃ vipra /
analyzed: idam vipra
translated: O Brahmin, listen to this being spoken,

original: ṛṣīṇāṃ vacanaṃ yathā/
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām vacanam yathā
translated: as it is the words of the sages.

original: p / // /ṣaṭtārāṃ kṛttikāṃ vidyād āśrayaṃ tāsu kārayet/
analyzed: kṛttikām vidyāt āśrayam tāsu kārayet
translated: One should know the Kṛttikā lunar mansion with six stars, and perform rites based on them.

original: p / // /agnyādhānaṃ pākayajñaḥ samṛddhiprasavaś ca yaḥ//🔽p / // /sarpirviloḍayet tatra gavāṃ veśma ca kārayet/
analyzed: pākayajñaḥ samṛddhi prasavaḥ ca yaḥ  tatra gavām veśma ca kārayet
translated: The setting up of the sacred fire, the domestic sacrifices, and the production of prosperity.🔽One should churn clarified butter there, and build a house for cows.

original: p / // /ajaiḍakāś ca kretavyā gavāṃ ca vṛṣam utsṛjet//
analyzed: ca kretavyāḥ gavām ca vṛṣam utsṛjet
translated: One should buy goats and sheep, and release a bull for cows.

original: p / // /aśmasāramayaṃ bhāṇḍaṃ sarvam atra tu kārayet/
analyzed: bhāṇḍam sarvam atra tu kārayet
translated: Here one should have all the vessels made of hard stone.

original: p / // /hiraṇyakārakarmaantamiṣv astraṃ caupakārayet//
analyzed: astram ca aupakārayet
translated: Here one should have made the work of goldsmiths, and also the work of arrows and weapons.

original: p / // /metṛko māpayed atra kuṭikāgniniveśanaṃ/
analyzed: māpayet atra kuṭikā agni niveśanam
translated: Here one should have a house built with a kitchen.

original: p / // /pītalohitapuṣpāṇāṃ bījāny atra tu ghāpayet//
analyzed: bījāni atra tu ghāpayet
translated: Here one should have the seeds of yellow and red flowers sown.

original: p / // /gṛhaṃ ca māpayet atra tathā avāsaṃ prakalpayet/
analyzed: ca māpayet atra tathā avāsam prakalpayet
translated: Here one should build a house, and also arrange a dwelling.

original: p / // /navaṃ ca chādayed vastraṃ krayaṇaṃ naatra kārayet//
analyzed: ca chādayet vastram krayaṇam na atra kārayet
translated: Here one should put on new clothes, but one should not buy them.

original: p / // /krūrakarmāṇi sidhyanti yuddhasaṃrodhabandhanam/
analyzed: sidhyanti yuddha saṃrodha bandhanam
translated: Here cruel acts succeed, such as war, obstruction, and bondage.

original: p / // /parapīḍām athātraiva vidvān naiva prayojayet//🔽p / // /śastrāṇi kṣurakarmāṇi sarvāṇy atra tu kārayet/
analyzed: atha atra eva vidvān na eva prayojayet  kṣura karmāṇi sarvāṇi atra tu kārayet
translated: Here a wise man should not employ causing harm to others.🔽Here one should have all the weapons and razor-like implements made.

original: p / // /tejasāni ca bhāṇḍāni kārayec ca krīṇīta ca//
analyzed: ca bhāṇḍāni kārayet ca krīṇīta ca
translated: Here one should have made and buy vessels of metal.

original: p / // /āyuṣyaṃ ca śiraḥsnānāṃ strīṇāṃ viṣkambhaṇāni ca/
analyzed: ca śiraḥsnānām strīṇām viṣkambhaṇāni ca
translated: Here the life-prolonging head-bath, and the repelling of women,

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ced devasya naatra vairaṃ praśāmyati//
analyzed: ced devasya na atra vairam praśāmyati
translated: Here if it rains, the enmity does not subside.

original: p / // /krodhano harṣaṇaḥ śūras tejasvī sāhasapriyaḥ/
translated: Here one is angry, delighted, brave, energetic, and fond of adventure.

original: p / // /āyuṣmāṃś ca yaśasvī ca yajñaśīlo atra jāyate//kṛttikāsu
analyzed: ca yaśasvī ca yajña śīlaḥ atra jāyate kṛttikāsu
translated: One who is born under Krittika is long-lived, famous, and devoted to sacrifices.

original: p / // /sarvaṃ kṛṣipadaṃ karma rohiṇyāṃ saṃprayojayet/🔽p / // /kṣetravastuvihārāṃś ca navaṃ veśma ca kārayet//
analyzed: kṛṣi padam karma rohiṇyām saṃprayojayet  ca navam veśma ca kārayet
translated: Under Rohini, one should undertake all agricultural work.🔽One should build fields, houses, pleasure gardens, and a new home.

original: p / // /prayojayec cakrān vārān dāsāṃś caeva gṛhe paśūn/
analyzed: cakrān vārān dāsān ca eva gṛhe paśūn
translated: One should employ servants, slaves, and animals in the house.

original: p / // /vāpayet sarvabījāni dhruvaṃ vāsāṃsi kārayet//
analyzed: sarva bījāni dhruvam vāsāṃsi kārayet
translated: One should sow all seeds and certainly have clothes made.

original: p / // /ṛṇaṃ na dadyāt tatraeva vairam atra tu vardhate/
analyzed: na dadyāt tatra eva vairam atra tu vardhate
translated: One should not give a loan there, for enmity increases there.

original: p / // /saṃgrāmaṃ ca surāyogaṃ dvayam eva vivarjayet//
analyzed: ca surā yogam dvayam eva vivarjayet
translated: One should avoid both battle and drinking alcohol.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya janma caatra praśasyate/
analyzed: ca devasya janma ca atra praśasyate
translated: The rain of the god and birth are praised here.

original: p / // /sānukrośaḥ kṣamāyuktaḥ strīkāmo bhakṣalolupaḥ/
translated: One who is born under Mrigashira is compassionate, forgiving, lustful for women, greedy for food,

original: p / // /āyuṣmān paśumān dhanyo mahābhogo atra jāyate//rohiṇyāṃ//
analyzed: paśumān dhanyaḥ mahā bhogaḥ atra jāyaterohiṇyām
translated: long-lived, prosperous, fortunate, and greatly enjoying here.

original: p / // /saumyaṃ mṛgaśiro vidyād ṛju tisraś ca tārakāḥ/🔽p / // /mṛdūni yāni karmāṇi tāni sarvāṇi kārayet/
analyzed: mṛgaśiraḥ vidyāt ṛju tisraḥ ca tārakāḥ  yāni karmāṇi tāni sarvāṇi kārayet
translated: One should know Mrigashira to be gentle, with three upright stars.🔽One should have all the soft tasks done.

original: p / // /yāni karmāṇi rohiṇyāṃ tāni sarvāṇi kārayet//
analyzed: karmāṇi rohiṇyām tāni sarvāṇi kārayet
translated: One should have all the tasks done that are done under Rohini.

original: p / // /sakṣīrān vāpayed vṛkṣān bījāni kṣīravanti ca/
analyzed: vāpayet vṛkṣān bījāni kṣīravanti ca
translated: He should plant trees that yield milk, and seeds that are milky.

original: p / // /rājaprāsādavalabhīchatrāṇy api ca kārayet//
analyzed: api ca kārayet
translated: He should also have built royal palaces, terraces, and umbrellas.

original: p / // /sarvakarmakathāḥ kuryāc caryāvāsān na kārayet/🔽p / // /uṣṭrāṃś ca balīvardāṃś ca damayed api kṛṣṭaye//
analyzed: kuryāt caryā vāsān na kārayet  ca balīvardān ca damayet api kṛṣṭaye
translated: He should engage in all kinds of business, but should not engage in dwelling in a hermitage.🔽He should also tame camels and oxen for plowing.

original: p / // /ācchādayen navaṃ vāsaś caalaṅkāraṃ ca kārayet/
analyzed: navam vāsaḥ ca alaṅkāram ca kārayet
translated: He should wear new clothes and have ornaments made.

original: p / // /dvijātīnāṃ tu karmāṇi sarvāṇy evātra kārayet//
analyzed: tu karmāṇi sarvāṇi eva atra kārayet
translated: But he should have all the rites performed by the twice-born castes here.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya suvṛṣṭiṃ caatra nirdiśet/
analyzed: ca devasya su vṛṣṭim ca atra nirdiśet
translated: And he should predict the rain of the god and good rainfall here.

original: p / // /svapnaśīlas tathā trāsī medhāvī sa ca jāyate//
analyzed: tathā trāsī medhāvī sa ca jāyate
translated: And he is born as a dreamer, a protector, and an intelligent one.

original: mṛgaśirasi//
analyzed: mṛgaśirasi
translated: In Mṛgaśiras:

original: p / // /ārdrāyāṃ mṛgayed arthān bhadraṃ karma ca kārayet/
analyzed: mṛgayet arthān bhadram karma ca kārayet
translated: In Ārdrā, one should seek wealth and have auspicious deeds done.

original: p / // /krūrakarmāṇi sidhyanti tāni vidvān vivarjayet//
analyzed: sidhyanti tāni vidvān vivarjayet
translated: Cruel deeds are accomplished, the wise one should avoid them.

original: p / // /udapānaparīkhāṃś ca taḍāgāny atra kārayet/
analyzed: ca taḍāgāni atra kārayet
translated: And here one should have wells, ponds, and tanks dug.

original: prathamāṃ vṛṣṭiṃ vikrīṇīyāc ca naatra gāṃ/
analyzed: prathamām vṛṣṭim vikrīṇīyāt ca naatra gām
translated: And one should sell the first rain, but not a cow here.

original: p / // /tilapīḍāni karmāṇi śauṇḍikānāṃ tathāpaṇaṃ//
analyzed: karmāṇi śauṇḍikānām tathā āpaṇam
translated: And oil-pressing activities, and the shop of liquor sellers,

original: p / // /pīḍayed ikṣudaṇḍāni /
analyzed: ikṣu daṇḍāni
translated: He would press sugarcane stalks.

original: ikṣubījāni vāpayet/
analyzed: ikṣu bījāni vāpayet
translated: He would plant sugarcane seeds.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya vidyād bahuparisravaṃ/
analyzed: ca devasya vidyāt bahu parisravam
translated: And he should know the rain of the god to be a great downpour.

original: p / // /krodhano mṛgayāśīlo māmsakāmo atra jāyate//ārdrāyāṃ//
analyzed: mṛgayā śīlaḥ atra jāyate ārdrāyām
translated: If he is born in Ārdrā, he becomes angry, fond of hunting, and desirous of meat.

original: p / // /punarvasau tu yukte atra kuryād vai vratadhāraṇaṃ/
analyzed: tu yukte atra kuryāt vai vrata dhāraṇam
translated: If it is joined with Punarvasu, one should undertake a vow observance here.

original: p / // /godānaṃ caupanāyanaṃ sarvam atra prasidhyati//
analyzed: caupanāyanam sarvam atra prasidhyati
translated: And the gift of a cow and the initiation ceremony, all are successful here.

original: p / // /prajāyamānāṃ pramadāṃ gṛhītvā gṛham ānayet/
analyzed: pramadām gṛhītvā gṛham ānayet
translated: If one wishes to bring a pregnant woman, one should bring her to the house.

original: p / // /punaḥ punar yadīccheta tatra karmāṇi kārayet//
analyzed: punar yadi iccheta tatra karmāṇi kārayet
translated: If one wishes again and again, one should have the rites performed there.

original: p / // /cikitsanaṃ na kurvīta yadīcchen na parābhavaṃ/
analyzed: na kurvīta yadi icchet na parābhavam
translated: One should not practice medicine if one does not wish defeat.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya janma caatra praśasyate//
analyzed: ca devasya janma ca atra praśasyate
translated: And the rain of the god and birth are praised here.

original: p / // /alīlaś caatra jāyeta strīlolaś caapi mānavaḥ/
analyzed: ca atra jāyeta strī lolaḥ ca api mānavaḥ
translated: And a man is born here without playfulness and also fickle towards women.

original: p / // /citraśīlaś ca naikatrārpitacittaḥ sa / ucyate//
analyzed: ca na ekatra arpita cittaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: And one whose mind is not fixed on one thing is said to have a variegated character.

original: punarvasau//
analyzed: punarvasau
translated: In Punarvasu.

original: p / // /dhanyaṃ yaśasyam āyuṣyaṃ puṣye nityaṃ prayojayet/
analyzed: yaśasyam āyuṣyam puṣye nityam prayojayet
translated: In Puṣya, one should always undertake what is auspicious, brings fame and longevity.

original: p / // /sarveṣāṃ ca dvijātīnāṃ sarvakarmāṇi kārayet//
analyzed: ca dvijātīnām sarva karmāṇi kārayet
translated: And one should have all the rites performed for all the twice-born.

original: p / // /rājāmātyaṃ prayuñjīta śuśrūṣāṃ vinayaṃ caret/
analyzed: prayuñjīta śuśrūṣām vinayam caret
translated: He should employ the king's minister and behave with humility and obedience.

original: p / // /rājānam abhipiñced ca /
analyzed: abhipiñcet ca
translated: He should serve the king.

original: alaṃkuryāt svakāṃ tanu//🔽p / // /śmaśrukarmāṇi kuryāc ca vapanaṃ nakhalomataḥ/
analyzed: alaṃkuryāt svakām tanu  kuryāt ca vapanam nakha lomataḥ
translated: He should adorn his own body.🔽He should perform the rites of shaving the beard and cutting the nails and hair.

original: p / // /purohitaṃ ca kurvīta dhvajaagraṃ ca prakārayet//
analyzed: ca kurvīta dhvaja agram ca prakārayet
translated: He should appoint a priest and set up the flag at the head.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya mandavarṣaṃ samādiśet/
analyzed: ca devasya manda varṣam samādiśet
translated: He should order the timely rain and moderate rain from the god.

original: p / // /na ca rogo na cauraś ca kṣemaṃ caatra sadā bhavet//
analyzed: ca rogaḥ na cauraḥ ca kṣemam ca atra sadā bhavet
translated: There should always be peace here, with no disease or thieves.

original: p / // /puṣyeṇa nityayuktaḥ san sarvakarmāṇi sādhayet/
analyzed: nitya yuktaḥ san sarva karmāṇi sādhayet
translated: Always connected with Pushya, he should accomplish all his tasks.

original: p / // /vaireṇātropanāhaiś ca ye janās tān vivarjayet/
analyzed: ca ye janāḥ tān vivarjayet
translated: Here he should avoid those people who are hostile and spiteful.

original: p / // /āyuṣmāṃś ca yaśasvī ca mahābhogaḥ prajāyate//puṣye//
analyzed: ca yaśasvī ca mahā bhogaḥ prajāyate puṣye
translated: He becomes long-lived, famous, and greatly prosperous. In Pushya.

original: p / // /sidhyate dāruṇaṃ karma /
analyzed: dāruṇam karma
translated: Terrible deeds are accomplished.

original: aśleṣāyāṃ ca kārayet/🔽p / // /kuryād ābharaṇāny atra prākāram upakalpayet//
analyzed: aśleṣāyām ca kārayet  ābharaṇāni atra prākāram upakalpayet
translated: And one should perform them in Ashlesha.🔽Here one should make ornaments and construct a rampart.

original: p / // /dehabandhaṃ nadībandhaṃ sandhikarma ca kārayet/
analyzed: nadī bandham sandhi karma ca kārayet
translated: One should perform the binding of the body, the binding of the river, and the work of joining.

original: p / // /prabhūtadaṃśamaśakaṃ varṣaṃ mandaṃ ca varṣati/
analyzed: varṣam mandam ca varṣati
translated: There are many mosquitoes and flies, and the rain falls moderately.

original: p / // /krodhanaḥ svapnaśīlaś ca kuhakaś caatra jāyate//aśleṣāyāṃ//
analyzed: svapna śīlaḥ ca kuhakaḥ ca atra jāyate aśleṣāyām
translated: One born in Ashlesha is irritable, given to sleep, and deceitful.

original: p / // /maghāsu sarvadhānyāni vāpayet saṃhared api/
analyzed: sarva dhānyāni vāpayet saṃharet api
translated: In Magha, one should sow all grains and also harvest them.

original: p / // /saṃghātakarma kurvīta sumukhaṃ caatra kārayet//
analyzed: kurvīta su mukham ca atra kārayet
translated: One should perform collective work and have a good-natured person here.

original: p / // /koṣṭhaāgārāṇi kurvīta phalaṃ caatra niveśayat/
analyzed: kurvīta phalam ca atra niveśayat
translated: One should build granaries and store fruits here.

original: p / // /sarvadā pitṛdevebhyaḥ śrāddhaṃ caivaatra kārayet//
analyzed: pitṛ devebhyaḥ śrāddham ca eva atra kārayet
translated: One should always perform ancestral rites here for the ancestors and gods.

original: p / // /sasyānāṃ bahulībhāvo yadi devo atra varṣati/
analyzed: bahulībhāvaḥ yadi devaḥ atra varṣati
translated: If the rain god rains here, there is an abundance of crops.

original: p / // /suhṛc ca dvārikaś caeva rasakāmaś ca jāyate/
analyzed: ca dvārikaḥ ca eva rasa kāmaḥ ca jāyate
translated: One born in Purva Phalguni is friendly, door-keeper, and desirous of flavors.

original: p / // /āyuṣmān bahuputraś ca strīkāmo bhaktalolupaḥ//
analyzed: bahu putraḥ ca strī kāmaḥ bhakta lolupaḥ
translated: One is long-lived, has many children, desires women, and is greedy for food.

original: p / // /saṃgrāmaṃ jīyate tatra yadi pūrvaṃ pravartate/
analyzed: jīyate tatra yadi pūrvam pravartate
translated: If a battle is started there, one wins it.

original: p / // /dāruṇāni ca karmāṇi tāni vidvān vivarjayet//maghāsu//
analyzed: ca karmāṇi tāni vidvān vivarjayet maghāsu
translated: One should avoid those terrible deeds, a wise person should avoid them. In Magha.

original: p / // /phalgunīṣu ca pūrvāsu saubhāgyārthāni kārayet/
analyzed: ca pūrvāsu saubhāgya arthāni kārayet
translated: In the eastern Phalguni, one should perform acts for good fortune.

original: p / // /viśeṣād āmalakyādi phalānām upakārayet//
analyzed: āmalaka ādi phalānām upakārayet
translated: In particular, one should have fruits like the Indian gooseberry prepared.

original: p / // /kumārīmaṅgalārthāni snāpanāni ca kārayet/
analyzed: snāpanāni ca kārayet
translated: One should have auspicious bathing ceremonies performed for unmarried girls.

original: p / // /kanyāpravahanārthāya vihāraṃ caeva kārayet//🔽p / // /veśmāni kārayet tatra vaśyavaiśya
analyzed: vihāram ca eva kārayet  kārayet tatra
translated: and for the purpose of carrying the maiden, he should cause a pleasure-house to be erected.

original: m atra prayojayet/
analyzed: m atra prayojayet
translated: He should employ there the Vaishyas who are under his control to build houses.

original: p / // /bhāgaṃ ye caupajīvanti teṣāṃ karma prayojayet//
analyzed: ye ca eva upajīvanti teṣām karma prayojayet
translated: He should employ the work of those who live by wages.

original: p / // /avyaktakeśo akeśaḥ subhagaś caatra jāyate/
analyzed: a keśaḥ subhagaḥ ca atra jāyate
translated: One born here has indistinct hair, is hairless, and is fortunate.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya suvṛṣṭim abhinirdiśet/
analyzed: ca devasya su vṛṣṭim abhinirdiśet
translated: And the rain of the god, he should declare to be a good rainfall.

original: p / // /naṣṭaṃ viddhaṃ kṛtaṃ caapi na tad astiiti nirdiśet//
analyzed: viddham kṛtam ca api na tat asti iti nirdiśet
translated: What is lost, pierced, or done, that does not exist - thus should he declare.

original: pūrvaphalgunyāṃ//
analyzed: pūrva phalgunyām
translated: In Purva Phalguni.

original: p / // /uttarāyāṃ tu phalgunyāṃ sarvakarmāṇi kārayet/
analyzed: tu phalgunyām sarva karmāṇi kārayet
translated: But in Uttara Phalguni, one should perform all rites.

original: p / // /medhāvī darśanīyaś ca yaśasvī caatra jāyate//
analyzed: darśanīyaḥ ca yaśasvī ca atra jāyate
translated: One born here is intelligent, handsome, and famous.

original: p / // /athātra naṣṭaṃ dagdhaṃ vā sarvam astiiti nirdiśet/
analyzed: naṣṭam dagdham vā sarvam asti iti nirdiśet
translated: And here, what is lost or burnt, all exists - thus should he declare.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya vidyāt saṃpadanuttamāṃ//
analyzed: ca devasya vidyāt saṃpad anuttamām
translated: And the rain of the god, he should know to be an excellent prosperity.

original: uttaraphalgunyāṃ//🔽p / // /hastena laghukarmāṇi sarvāṇy eva prayojayet/
analyzed: uttara phalgunyām  laghu karmāṇi sarvāṇi eva prayojayet
translated: In Uttara Phalguni.🔽By Hasta, one should undertake all light rites.

original: p / // /sarveṣāṃ ca dvijātīnāṃ sarvakarmāṇi kārayet//
analyzed: ca dvijātīnām sarva karmāṇi kārayet
translated: And for all the twice-born, one should perform all rites.

original: p / // /hastyārohaṃ mahāmātraṃ puṣkariṇīṃ ca kārayet/
analyzed: mahāmātram puṣkariṇīm ca kārayet
translated: One should make an elephant rider, a great minister, and a pond.

original: p / // /cauryaṃ ca sidhyate tatra tac ca vidvān vivarjayet//
analyzed: ca sidhyate tatra tat ca vidvān vivarjayet
translated: Theft also succeeds there, and the wise one should avoid that.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya varṣā viśrāvaṇī bhavet/
analyzed: ca devasya varṣā viśrāvaṇī bhavet
translated: And the rain of the god should be proclaimed as the rainy season.

original: p / // /athātra jātaṃ jānīyāc chūraṃ cauraṃ vicakṣaṇaṃ/
analyzed: jātam jānīyāt śūram cauram vicakṣaṇam
translated: Then one should know that born here is a hero, a thief, and an expert.

original: p / // /kuśalaṃ sarvavidyāsu /
analyzed: sarva vidyāsu
translated: Skilled in all the arts.

original: ārogaṃ cirajīvinaṃ//haste//
analyzed: ārogam cira jīvinam haste
translated: Healthy and long-lived. In the hand.

original: p / // /citrāyām āhataṃ vastraṃ bhūṣaṇāni ca kārayet/
analyzed: āhatam vastram bhūṣaṇāni ca kārayet
translated: In Chitra, one should make garments and ornaments that are struck.

original: p / // /rājānaṃ bhūṣitaṃ paśyet senāvyūhaṃ ca darśayet//
analyzed: bhūṣitam paśyet senā vyūham ca darśayet
translated: One should see the king adorned and display the array of the army.

original: p / // /hiraṇyaṃ rajataṃ dravyaṃ nagarāṇi ca māpayet/
analyzed: rajatam dravyam nagarāṇi ca māpayet
translated: Gold, silver, and goods, and one should build cities.

original: p / // /alaṅkuryāt tathātmānaṃ gandhamālyavilepanaiḥ//
analyzed: tathā ātmānam gandha mālya vilepanaiḥ
translated: And one should adorn oneself with perfumes, garlands, and ointments.

original: p / // /gaṇakānāṃ ca vidyāṃ ca vādyaṃ nartanagāyanaṃ/
analyzed: ca vidyām ca vādyam nartana gāyanam
translated: And the knowledge of accountants, and music, dancing, and singing.

original: p / // /pūrvikāṃ rūpakārāṃś ca rathakārāṃś ca śikṣayet/
analyzed: rūpakārān ca rathakārān ca śikṣayet
translated: And one should train the former artists, carpenters, and chariot-makers.

original: p / // /citrakarāṃś ca lekhakān pustakarma ca kārayet//
analyzed: ca lekhakān pusta karma ca kārayet
translated: And painters, and writers, and one should do book-work.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya citravarṣaṃ vinirdiśet/
analyzed: ca devasya citra varṣam vinirdiśet
translated: And the rain of the god should be predicted as a variegated rain.

original: p / // /medhāvī darśanīyaś ca citrākṣo bhaktalolupaḥ//
analyzed: darśanīyaḥ ca citra akṣaḥ bhakta lolupaḥ
translated: intelligent, handsome, and has variegated eyes, is greedy for devotion,

original: p / // /mṛduśīlaś ca bhīruś ca calacittaḥ kutūhalī/
analyzed: ca bhīruḥ ca cala cittaḥ kutūhalī
translated: gentle-natured, timid, fickle-minded, and curious.

original: p / // /āyuṣmān subhagaś caeva strīlolaś caatra jāyate//citrāyāṃ//
analyzed: subhagaḥ ca eva strī lolaḥ ca atra jāyate citrāyām
translated: long-lived, fortunate, and lustful for women is born here in Citrā.

original: p / // /svātyāṃ prayojayed yodhān aśvān aśvatarīṃ kharān/🔽p / // /kṣipraṃ gamanīyaṃ bhakṣyaṃ laṅghakān adhvamānikān//
analyzed: prayojayet yodhān aśvān aśvatarīm kharān  gamanīyam bhakṣyam laṅghakān adhvamānikān
translated: in Svāti, one should employ warriors, horses, mules, and donkeys,🔽quickly passable food, and those who can jump long distances.

original: p / // /bherīmṛdaṅgapaṇavān murajān caupanāhayet/
analyzed: murajān ca aupanāhayet
translated: drums, kettledrums, flutes, and conches should be played,

original: p / // /āvāhaṃś ca vivāhaṃś ca sauhṛdyaṃ caatra kārayet//
analyzed: ca vivāhan ca sauhṛdyam ca atra kārayet
translated: and one should perform weddings, marriages, and friendly acts here.

original: p / // /nirvāsanam amitrāṇāṃ svayaṃ na pravased gṛhāt/
analyzed: amitrāṇām svayam na pravaset gṛhāt
translated: banishment of enemies, but one should not oneself leave one's home.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya vātavṛṣṭir abhīkṣṇaśaḥ/
analyzed: ca devasya vāta vṛṣṭiḥ abhīkṣṇaśas
translated: and frequent rainfall and storms by the god,

original: p / // /medhāvī rogabahulaś calacittaś ca jāyate//svātau//🔽p / // /lāṅgalāni viśākhāsu karṣaṇaṃ ca prayojayet/
analyzed: roga bahulaḥ cala cittaḥ ca jāyate svātau  viśākhāsu karṣaṇam ca prayojayet
translated: intelligent, sickly, and fickle-minded is born here in Svāti.🔽in Viśākhā, one should employ ploughs and plowing,

original: p / // /yavagodhūmakarmaantān śamīdhānyaṃ ca varjayet//
analyzed: śamīdhānyam ca varjayet
translated: barley and wheat work, and avoid sesame grains.

original: p / // /śālayas tilamāṣāś ca ye ca vṛkṣāḥ suśākhinaḥ/
analyzed: tila māṣāḥ ca ye ca vṛkṣāḥ su śākhinaḥ
translated: rice, sesame, and beans, and trees with good branches,

original: p / // /ropayet tān viśākhāsu gṛhakarma ca kārayet/
analyzed: tān viśākhāsu gṛhakarma ca kārayet
translated: One should plant them in the Vishakha [lunar mansion], and have household work done.

original: p / // /śiraḥsnānāni kurvīta medhyaṃ prāyaś ca kārayet//
analyzed: kurvīta medhyam prāyas ca kārayet
translated: One should perform head-baths in it, and have purifying rites performed.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya vidyāt kalpaparisravaṃ/
analyzed: ca devasya vidyāt kalpa parisravam
translated: One should know the rain of the god to be the flow of the aeon.

original: p / // /manasvī darśanīyaś ca medhāvī caatra jāyate/
analyzed: darśanīyaḥ ca medhāvī ca atra jāyate
translated: One who is born here becomes intelligent, handsome, and wise.

original: p / // /krodhano alpasutaś caeva durbhago bhaktalolupaḥ//viśākhāsu//
analyzed: alpa sutaḥ ca eva durbhagaḥ bhakta lolupaḥ viśākhāsu
translated: One becomes angry, has few children, is unfortunate, and greedy for food. In the Vishakha [lunar mansion].

original: p / // /anurādhāsu kurvīta mitraiḥ sadbhiś ca saṅgatiṃ/
analyzed: kurvīta mitraiḥ sadbhiḥ ca saṅgatim
translated: One should make friendship with good friends in the Anuratha [lunar mansion].

original: p / // /sarvāṇi mṛdukarmāṇi mādhuryaṃ caatra kārayet//
analyzed: mṛdu karmāṇi mādhuryam ca atra kārayet
translated: All soft rites and sweetness should be performed here.

original: p / // /kṣauraṃ ca kārayet atra śastrakarmāṇi kārayet/
analyzed: ca kārayet atra śastrakarmāṇi kārayet
translated: One should have shaving done here, and have surgical operations performed.

original: p / // /saṃyuktāntaprayogāṃś ca sandhiṃ kuryāc ca nityaśaḥ/
analyzed: ca sandhim kuryāt ca nityaśas
translated: One should always make alliances and employments connected with the end.

original: p / // /naṣṭaṃ paryupataptaṃ vā svalpāyasenayāsaṃvinirdiśet//
analyzed: paryupataptam vā su alpa āyasena ayāsam vinirdiśet
translated: One should prescribe a small iron-based army for what is lost or surrounded.

original: p / // /suhṛnmitrakṛtaś caatra dharmaśīlaś ca jāyate/
analyzed: ca atra dharma śīlaḥ ca jāyate
translated: One who is born here becomes a friend, a friend-maker, and virtuous.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya suvṛṣṭim abhinirdiśet//
analyzed: ca devasya su vṛṣṭim abhinirdiśet
translated: One should predict good rain from the rain of the god.

original: anurādhāyāṃ//
analyzed: anurādhāyām
translated: In the Anuratha [lunar mansion].

original: p / // /jyeṣṭhāyāṃ pūrvakārī syād rājānaṃ caabhiṣiñcayet/
analyzed: pūrva kārī syāt rājānam ca abhiṣiñcayet
translated: On the Jyestha day, he should perform the first rites and consecrate the king.

original: p / // /nagaraṃ nigamaṃ grāmaṃ māpayed ārabheta ca/
analyzed: nigamam grāmam māpayet ārabheta ca
translated: On the Mula day, he should lay out and commence a city, town, or village.

original: p / // /kṣatriyāṇāṃ ca rājñāṃ ca sarvakarmāṇi kārayet//
analyzed: ca rājñām ca sarva karmāṇi kārayet
translated: On the Purva Ashadha day, he should perform all the rites for Kshatriyas and kings.

original: p / // /bhrātṛṇāṃ bhavati jyeṣṭho jyeṣṭāyāṃ yo abhijāyate/
analyzed: bhavati jyeṣṭhaḥ jyeṣṭāyām yaḥ abhijāyate
translated: On the Uttar Ashadha day, the eldest of the brothers is born.

original: p / // /āyuṣmāṃś ca yaśasvī ca vidvatsu ca kutūhalī//
analyzed: ca yaśasvī ca vidvatsu ca kutūhalī
translated: He becomes long-lived, famous, and curious among the learned.

original: p / // /prāsādam ārohec caatra gajam aśvaṃ rathaṃ tathā/
analyzed: ārohet ca atra gajam aśvam ratham tathā
translated: On the Abhijit day, he should ascend a palace, elephant, horse, or chariot.

original: p / // /grāmanigamarāṣṭreṣu sthāpayec chreṣṭhināṃ balaṃ//
analyzed: sthāpayet śreṣṭhinām balam
translated: On the Shravana day, he should establish the strength of the merchants in villages, towns, and countries.

original: p / // /naṣṭaṃ paryupataptaṃ vā kleśenaiveti nirdiśet/
analyzed: paryupataptam vā kleśena eva iti nirdiśet
translated: On the Dhanishtha day, he should declare that what is lost or neglected is only due to hardship.

original: p / // /dāruṇāny atra sidhyanti tāni vidvān vivarjayet/
analyzed: atra sidhyanti tāni vidvān vivarjayet
translated: On the Shatabhisha day, terrible things succeed here; the wise should avoid them.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya suvṛṣṭim abhinirdiśet//
analyzed: ca devasya su vṛṣṭim abhinirdiśet
translated: On the Purva Bhadrapada day, he should predict the god's rain and good rainfall.

original: jyeṣṭhāyāṃ//🔽p / // /mūle tu mūlajātāni mūlakandālukāny api/
analyzed: jyeṣṭhāyām  tu mūla jātāni mūla kandālukāni api
translated: On the Jyestha day,

original: p / // /sūlādyāni ca sarvāṇi bījāny atra prayojayet//
analyzed: ca sarvāṇi bījāni atra prayojayet
translated: On the Mula day, he should employ here all the roots, bulbous roots, and seeds that grow from roots, as well as all the seeds for sowing and so on.

original: p / // /ṛṇaṃ vai yat purāṇaṃ syād artho caasyāgrataḥ sthitaḥ/
analyzed: vai yat purāṇam syāt ca asya agratas sthitaḥ
translated: Whatever old debt there is, and the matter at hand,

original: p / // /mūle siddhartham ārabhyaṃ tathā sarvaṃ varāṅgakaṃ//
analyzed: siddhartham ārabhyam tathā sarvam varāṅgakam
translated: Beginning with the root, the successful purpose, and likewise all the excellent parts,

original: p / // /cikitsitāni yānīha strīṇāṃ dārakakanyayoḥ/
analyzed: yāni iha strīṇām dāraka kanyayoḥ
translated: The medical treatments that are here for women, boys and girls,

original: p / // /nadīṣu snapanaṃ caeva mūle sarvān prayojayet//
analyzed: snapanam ca eva mūle sarvān prayojayet
translated: And bathing in the rivers, one should apply all of them at the root.

original: p / // /dāruṇāny atra sidhyanti maṅgalāni ca kārayet/
analyzed: atra sidhyanti maṅgalāni ca kārayet
translated: Here the terrible things are accomplished, and one should perform the auspicious rites.

original: p / // /kiṇvayogān surāyogān na kuryāc chatrubhiḥ saha//
analyzed: surā yogāt na kuryāt śatrubhiḥ saha
translated: One should not perform the yeast preparations and wine preparations with enemies.

original: p / // /dhanavān bahuputraś ca mūlavān atra jāyate/
analyzed: bahu putraḥ ca mūlavān atra jāyate
translated: Here one is born with wealth and many sons, and with a root.

original: p / // /athātra naṣṭaṃ dagdhaṃ vā naitad astiiti nirdiśet/
analyzed: naṣṭam dagdham vā na etat asti iti nirdiśet
translated: Now if something is lost or burned here, one should declare that it does not exist.

original: p / // /pravarṣaṇaṃ ca devasya suvṛṣṭim abhinirdiśet//mūle//
analyzed: ca devasya su vṛṣṭim abhinirdiśet mūle
translated: And the rain of the god, one should predict a good rainfall. In the root.

original: p / // /āṣāḍhāyāṃ ca pūrvasyāṃ saritaś ca sarāṃsi ca/
analyzed: ca pūrvasyām saritaḥ ca sarāṃsi ca
translated: In the first half of Āṣāḍha, and rivers and lakes,

original: p / // /vāpīkūpaprapāś caeva taḍāgāni ca kārayet//
analyzed: ca eva taḍāgāni ca kārayet
translated: And wells, ponds, and reservoirs, and one should have lotus ponds made.

original: p / // /utpādyāni ca puṣpāṇi tathā mūlaphalāni ca/
analyzed: ca puṣpāṇi tathā mūla phalāni ca

original: dhūyāṇi yuktakarmāṇi caoṣadhīkarmāṇi ca/
analyzed: dhūyāṇi yukta karmāṇi ca oṣadhī karmāṇi ca
translated: One should apply all the rites of herbs and medicinal plants in this.

original: bheṣajyāni sarvāṇy atra prayojayet/
analyzed: bheṣajyāni sarvāṇi atra prayojayet
translated: All medicines should be applied in this.

original: p / // /tatra yajñasamārambhaṃ cāturmāsyaṃ ca kārayet/
analyzed: yajña samārambham cāturmāsyam ca kārayet
translated: There, one should commence a sacrifice and perform the four-monthly rites.

original: athātra naṣṭaṃ dagdhaṃ vā viddhaṃ vā svasti bhaviṣyatiiti vaktavyaṃ/
analyzed: atha atra naṣṭam dagdham vā viddham vā svasti bhaviṣyati iti vaktavyam
translated: Then, if it is lost, burnt, or pierced, it will be well, thus it should be said.

original: p / // /athātra jātakaṃ vidyān maṅgalīyaṃ yaśasvinaṃ/
analyzed: jātakam vidyāt maṅgalīyam yaśasvinam
translated: Then, one should know the birth horoscope to be auspicious and famous.

original: p / // /mahābhogaṃ ca rājānaṃ mahāyoginam īśvaraṃ//
analyzed: ca rājānam mahā yoginam īśvaram
translated: a great king, a great yogi, a lord,

original: p / // /mahādhanaṃ mahābhogaṃ tathā ca mahaduttamaṃ/
analyzed: mahā bhogam tathā ca mahat uttamam
translated: very wealthy, very prosperous, and also very excellent,

original: p / // /kṣatriyaṃ dānaśīlaṃ ca brahmaṇaṃ ca purohitaṃ//iti/
analyzed: dāna śīlam ca ca purohitam iti
translated: a kshatriya, generous and disciplined, and a brahmin priest.

original: p / // /pañca khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin nakṣatrāni dāruṇāni bhavanti/tad yathā/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin nakṣatrāni dāruṇāni bhavanti tat yathā
translated: O Pushkarasārin, there are indeed five terrible constellations. They are:

original: p / // /maghā trīṇi ca pūrvāṇi bharaṇī ceti pañcamī/
analyzed: trīṇi ca pūrvāṇi bharaṇī ca iti pañcamī
translated: Magha, and the three eastern ones, and Bharani as the fifth.

original: p / // /athātra dagdhaṃ naṣṭaṃ vā viddhaṃ vā na bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: dagdham naṣṭam vā viddham vā na bhaviṣyati
translated: If it is burned, lost, or pierced here, it will not be.

original: p / // /iti vaktavyaṃ /
analyzed: vaktavyam
translated: Thus it should be said.

original: ardharātrikāṇi ṣaṭ/
analyzed: ardharātrikāṇi ṣaḍ
translated: There are six constellations that rise at midnight.

original: tad yathā/
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: They are:

original: ārdrā aśleṣā svātī jyeṣṭhā
analyzed: ārdrā aśleṣā svātī jyeṣṭhā
translated: Ardra, Ashlesha, Svati, Jyeshtha,

original: śatabhiṣā bharaṇī ceti/
analyzed: śatabhiṣā bharaṇī ca iti
translated: Shatabhisha, and Bharani.

original: navaṃśāḥ ṣaḍgrāsā dvikṣetrāṇi/
analyzed: nava aṃśāḥ ṣaṣ grāsāḥ dvi kṣetrāṇi
translated: The nine-part [constellations] are six, the two-field [constellations] are three.

original: rohiṇī punarvasur viśākhā ca/
analyzed: rohiṇī punarvasuḥ viśākhā ca
translated: Rohini, Punarvasu, and Vishakha.

original: trīṇī uttarāṇi ceti/
analyzed: trīṇi uttarāṇi ca iti
translated: The three Uttaras [are also two-field constellations].

original: ubhayato vibhāgāni/
analyzed: ubhayatas vibhāgāni
translated: They are divided on both sides.

original: pañcadaśakṣetrāṇi/
analyzed: pañcadaśa kṣetrāṇi
translated: There are fifteen fields.

original: kṛttikā ca maghā mūlā grīṇi pūrvāṇi/
analyzed: kṛttikā ca maghā mūlā grīṇi pūrvāṇi
translated: Krittika, Magha, Mula, and the three eastern ones,

original: imāni ṣaṭ pūrvabhāgināni/
analyzed: imāni ṣaḍ pūrvabhāgināni
translated: these six belong to the eastern part.

original: mṛgaśirā puṣyā hastā citrā anurādhā śravaṇā dhaniṣṭhā revatī
analyzed: mṛgaśirā puṣyā hastā citrā anurādhā śravaṇā dhaniṣṭhā revatī
translated: Mrigashira, Pushya, Hasta, Chitra, Anuradha, Shravana, Dhanishtha, Revati,

original: aśvino ceti/
analyzed: aśvinoḥ ca iti
translated: And the two Ashvins.

original: imāni nava nakṣatrāṇi paścād bhāgīyāni triṃśanmuhūrtayogāni kṣetrāṇi ca/
analyzed: imāni nava nakṣatrāṇi paścāt bhāgīyāni triṃśat muhūrta yogāni kṣetrāṇi ca
translated: These nine constellations are the western ones, each consisting of thirty muhurtas and fields.

original: p / // /api ca brāhmaṇa śubhāś ca muhūrtā bhavanti/
analyzed: ca brāhmaṇa śubhāḥ ca muhūrtāḥ bhavanti
translated: Moreover, O Brahmin, there are auspicious muhurtas,

original: aśubhāś ca muhūrtā bhavanti/
analyzed: aśubhāḥ ca muhūrtāḥ bhavanti
translated: and inauspicious muhurtas,

original: śubhaaśubhāś ca muhūrtā bhavanti/
analyzed: śubha aśubhāḥ ca muhūrtāḥ bhavanti
translated: and both auspicious and inauspicious muhurtas.

original: saṃprayuktanakṣatreṣu sarveṣu yadā śubhamuhūrtasamāpattayo bhavanti tadā śobhanā bhavanti/
analyzed: saṃprayukta nakṣatreṣu sarveṣu yadā śubha muhūrta samāpattayaḥ bhavanti tadā śobhanāḥ bhavanti
translated: When there are only auspicious muhurta conjunctions in all the joined constellations, then they are auspicious.

original: yadā aśubhamuhūrtasamāpattayo bhavanti tadā na śobhanā bhavanti/
analyzed: yadā aśubha muhūrta samāpattayaḥ bhavanti tadā na śobhanāḥ bhavanti
translated: When there are only inauspicious muhurta conjunctions, then they are not auspicious.

original: yadā tu punaḥ śubhāś caaśubhāś ca samāpattayo bhavanti tadā sādhāranā bhavanti/
analyzed: yadā tu punar śubhāḥ ca aśubhāḥ ca samāpattayaḥ bhavanti tadā sādhāranāḥ bhavanti
translated: But when there are both auspicious and inauspicious conjunctions, then they are mixed.

original: rātridivasayor hrāsavṛddhī
analyzed: rātri divasayoḥ hrāsa vṛddhī
translated: The decrease and increase of nights and days

original: p / // /athātra kathaṃ rātridivasānāṃ hrāso vṛddhir vā bhavatiiti tad ucyate/
analyzed: katham rātri divasānām hrāsaḥ vṛddhiḥ vā bhavati iti tat ucyate
translated: Now it is said how the nights and days decrease or increase here.

original: varṣāṇāṃ prathame māse puṣyanakṣatram amāvāsyāṃ bhavati/
analyzed: varṣāṇām prathame māse puṣya nakṣatram amāvāsyām bhavati
translated: In the first month of the rainy season, the new moon occurs under the constellation Pushya.

original: śravaṇā pūrṇamāsyāṃ/🔽aṣṭādaśamuhūrto divaso bhavati/
analyzed: śravaṇā pūrṇamāsyām  aṣṭādaśa muhūrtaḥ divasaḥ bhavati
translated: The full moon occurs under the constellation Shravana.🔽The day consists of eighteen muhurtas.

original: dvādaśamuhūrtā rātriḥ/
analyzed: dvādaśa muhūrtā rātriḥ
translated: The night consists of twelve muhurtas.

original: ṣoḍaśāṅgulakāṣṭhasya madhyāhne ardhāṅgulāyāṃ chāyāyām ādityaḥ parivartate/
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa aṅgula kāṣṭhasya madhyāhne ardha aṅgulāyām chāyāyām ādityaḥ parivartate
translated: At midday, when the shadow of the sixteen-finger-width stick is half a finger-width, the sun turns.

original: āṣāḍhā rātriṃ nayati/
analyzed: āṣāḍhāḥ rātrim nayati
translated: Āṣāḍhā leads the night.

original: mṛgaśirasi ādityo gato bhavati/ varṣāṇāṃ
analyzed: mṛgaśirasi ādityaḥ gataḥ bhavati varṣāṇām
translated: The sun has gone into Mṛgaśiras.

analyzed: dvitīye māse maghā amāvāsyām bhavati bhādrapadā pūrṇamāsyām
translated: In the second month of the rains, Maghā is the new moon, and Bhādrapada is the full moon.

original: saptadaśa muhūrto divaso bhavati/
analyzed: saptadaśa muhūrtaḥ divasaḥ bhavati
translated: The day is seventeen muhūrtas long.

original: trayodaśamuhūrtā rātriḥ/
analyzed: trayodaśa muhūrtā rātriḥ
translated: The night is thirteen muhūrtas long.

analyzed: dvi aṅgulāyām chāyāyām ādityaḥ parivartate

analyzed: śravaṇāḥ rātrim nayati

original: puṣya ādityo gato bhavati/
analyzed: puṣyaḥ ādityaḥ gataḥ bhavati

analyzed: aśvinī pūrṇamāsyām
translated: and Aśvinī is the full moon.

original: uttarāṣāḍhā pūrṇamāsyāṃ/
analyzed: uttarāṣāḍhā pūrṇamāsyām
translated: The full moon is in the Uttarāṣāḍha [lunar mansion].

original: saptadaśamuhūrto divaso bhavati/
analyzed: saptadaśa muhūrtaḥ divasaḥ bhavati
translated: The day is seventeen muhūrtas.

original: trayodaśamuhūrtā rātriḥ/
analyzed: trayodaśa muhūrtā rātriḥ
translated: The night is thirteen muhūrtas.

original: madhyāhne dviaṅgulāyāṃ chāyāyām ādityaḥ parivartate/
analyzed: madhyāhne dvi aṅgulāyām chāyāyām ādityaḥ parivartate
translated: At midday, the sun moves in a shadow of two finger-breadths.

original: jyeṣṭhā rātriṃ nayati/
analyzed: jyeṣṭhā rātrim nayati
translated: The Jyeṣṭhā [lunar mansion] leads the night.

original: puṣya ādityo gato bhavati/
analyzed: puṣyaḥ ādityaḥ gataḥ bhavati
translated: The sun has gone into the Puṣya [lunar mansion].

original: p / // /saṃvatsaram anveṣaṇato muhūrtaviśeṣaṇaiḥ sarvāṇi caetāni nakṣatāṇi
analyzed: anveṣaṇataḥ muhūrta viśeṣaṇaiḥ sarvāṇi ca etāni nakṣatāṇi
translated: All these lunar mansions, in sequence, are to be known by the special muhūrtas.

original: bhāgānubhagenaamāvāsyayaṃ pūrṇamāsyaṃ ca yujyante/
analyzed: bhāga anubhagena amāvāsyayam pūrṇamāsyam ca yujyante
translated: By the unequal part, the new moon and full moon are connected.

original: ūnarātrasya pūrṇarātrasya ca grahītavyaṃ/
analyzed: ūnarātrasya pūrṇarātrasya ca grahītavyam
translated: The incomplete night and the complete night should be taken.

original: tatra tṛtīye varṣe adhiko māso yujyate/
analyzed: tatra tṛtīye varṣe adhikaḥ māsaḥ yujyate
translated: There, in the third year, an extra month is connected.

original: ṣaṇṇāṃ māsānām ahorātrāṇi samāni bhavanti/
analyzed: ṣaṇṇām māsānām ahar rātrāṇi samāni bhavanti
translated: The days and nights of the six months are equal.

original: ataḥ ṣaṇmāsād divaso vadhate/
analyzed: atas ṣaṣ māsāt divasaḥ vadhate
translated: Therefore, after six months, the day decreases.

original: ṣaṇmāsād rātrir vardhate/🔽ṣaṇmāsād divaso māse māse samam eva
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsāt rātriḥ vardhate  ṣaṣ māsāt divasaḥ māse māse samam eva
translated: After six months, the night increases.🔽After six months, the day decreases equally every month.

original: hīyate/ ṣaṇmāsād rātrir māse māse parihīyate/
analyzed: hīyate ṣaṣ māsāt rātriḥ māse māse parihīyate
translated: After six months, the night decreases every month.

original: p / // /ṣaṇmāsād ādityaḥ parivartate/
analyzed: ādityaḥ parivartate
translated: After six months, the sun revolves.

original: uttarāṃ diśaṃ saṃcarati/
analyzed: uttarām diśam saṃcarati
translated: It moves to the northern direction.

original: ṣaṇmāsād dakṣiṇāṃ diśaṃ/
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsāt dakṣiṇām diśam
translated: After six months, to the southern direction.

original: ṣaṇmāsāt samudr
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsāt samudraḥ
translated: After six months, the ocean

original: e udakaparimāṇasya hrāso vṛddhiś ca bhavati/
analyzed: udaka parimāṇasya hrāsaḥ vṛddhiḥ ca bhavati
translated: the amount of water decreases and increases.

original: sūryagatyā candragatyā ca samudraudakavelāabhivṛddhir bhavati/
analyzed: sūrya gatyā candra gatyā ca samudra audaka velā abhivṛddhiḥ bhavati
translated: The rise of the ocean water is due to the movement of the sun and the moon.

original: atra gaṇanāpratijāgaraṇāsmaram ity evam eṣa saṃvatsaro vyākhyāto bhavati/
analyzed: atra gaṇanā pratijāgaraṇa a smaram iti evam eṣa saṃvatsaraḥ vyākhyātaḥ bhavati
translated: Here, the calculation, vigilance, and memory - thus this year is explained.

original: grahaḥ
analyzed: grahaḥ
translated: Graha

original: p / // /candra ādityaḥ śukro bṛhaspatiḥ śanaiścaro aṅgārako budhaś ca/
analyzed: ādityaḥ śukraḥ bṛhaspatiḥ śanaiścaraḥ aṅgārakaḥ budhaḥ ca
translated: The moon, sun, Venus, Jupiter, Saturn, Mars, and Mercury.

original: ime grahāḥ/
analyzed: ime grahāḥ
translated: These are the planets.

original: eṣāṃ grahāṇāṃ bṛhaspatiḥ saṃvatsarasthāyo/
analyzed: eṣām grahāṇām bṛhaspatiḥ saṃvatsara sthāyaḥ
translated: Among these planets, Brihaspati remains in the zodiac for a year.

original: evaṃ śanaiścaro budho aṅgārakaḥ śukraś caime maṇḍalacāriṇaḥ/
analyzed: evam śanaiścaraḥ budhaḥ aṅgārakaḥ śukraḥ ca eme maṇḍala cāriṇaḥ
translated: Similarly, Saturn, Mercury, Mars, and Venus move in the zodiac.

original: nakṣatramaṇḍalaṃ
analyzed: nakṣatra maṇḍalam
translated: The lunar mansion

original: p / // /bharaṇī kṛttikā rohiṇī mṛgaśirā etat sādhāraṇaṃ prathamaṃ maṇḍalaṃ/
analyzed: kṛttikā rohiṇī mṛgaśirāḥ etat sādhāraṇam prathamam maṇḍalam
translated: Bharaṇī, Kṛttikā, Rohiṇī, and Mṛgaśiras - this is the common first zodiac.

original: ārdrā punarvasuḥ puṣyo aśleṣā etat sādhāranaṃ dvitīyaṃ maṇḍalaṃ/
analyzed: ārdrā punarvasuḥ puṣyaḥ aśleṣāḥ etat sādhāranam dvitīyam maṇḍalam
translated: Ārdrā, Punarvasu, Puṣya, and Aśleṣā - this is the common second zodiac.

original: maghā atha phalgunadvayaṃ hasto citrā etat sādhāraṇaṃ tṛtīyaṃ maṇḍalaṃ/
analyzed: maghāḥ atha phalguna dvayam hastaḥ citrāḥ etat sādhāraṇam tṛtīyam maṇḍalam
translated: Magha, the two Phalgunis, Hasta, and Citrā - this is the common third zodiac.

original: svātī viśākhā anurādhā etat sādhāraṇaṃ caturthaṃ maṇḍalaṃ/
analyzed: svātī viśākhā anurādhāḥ etat sādhāraṇam caturtham maṇḍalam
translated: Svāti, Viśākhā, and Anurādhā - this is the common fourth zodiac.

original: jyeṣṭhā mūlāṣāḍhādvayam
analyzed: jyeṣṭhā mūla āṣāḍhā dvayam
translated: Jyeṣṭhā, Mūlā, and the two Āṣāḍhas

original: atra sarvāṇi mahābhāyāni bhavanti/
analyzed: atra sarvāṇi mahā bhāyāni bhavanti
translated: Here all the great fears occur.

original: idaṃ pañcamaṃ maṇḍalaṃ/
analyzed: idam pañcamam maṇḍalam
translated: This is the fifth zodiac.

original: abhijic chravaṇā dhaniṣṭhā śatabiṣā ubhe bhādrapade caitat sādhāraṇaṃ ṣaṣṭhaṃ maṇḍalaṃ/
analyzed: abhijit śravaṇā dhaniṣṭhā śatabiṣāḥ ubhe bhādrapade ca etat sādhāraṇam ṣaṣṭham maṇḍalam
translated: Abhijit, Śravaṇa, Dhaniṣṭhā, Śatabhiṣā, and the two Bhadrapadas - this is the common sixth zodiac.

original: revatī avinī caitat sādhāraṇaṃ saptamaṃ maṇḍalaṃ/
analyzed: revatī avinī ca etat sādhāraṇam saptamam maṇḍalam
translated: Revatī and Aśvinī - this is the common seventh zodiac.

original: saṃvatsaram eteṣu yad yan nakṣatramaṇḍalaṃ pīḍayati tasya tasya janapadasya sattvasya vā pīḍā nirdeṣṭavyā/
analyzed: saṃvatsaram eteṣu yat yat nakṣatra maṇḍalam pīḍayati tasya tasya janapadasya sattvasya vā pīḍā nirdeṣṭavyā
translated: In these, whatever lunar mansion the sun afflicts, the affliction of that country or being should be predicted.

original: p / // /dvādaśamuhūrtāni divase dhruvāṇi dvādaśa rātrau/
analyzed: divase dhruvāṇi dvādaśa rātrau
translated: There are twelve fixed muhūrtas in the day and twelve in the night.

original: ṣaṇmuhūrtāḥ sañcāriṇaḥ/
analyzed: ṣaṣ muhūrtāḥ sañcāriṇaḥ
translated: Six muhūrtas move.

original: katame ṣaṭ/
analyzed: katame ṣaṭ
translated: Which six?

original: nairṛto varuṇo vāyavo bhargo devo raudro vicārī ca/
analyzed: nairṛtaḥ varuṇaḥ vāyavaḥ bhargaḥ devaḥ raudraḥ vicārī ca
translated: Nirṛti, Varuṇa, Vāyu, Bharga, Deva, Raudra, and Vicārin.

original: itīme sañcāriṇaḥ ṣaṭ/
analyzed: iti ime sañcāriṇaḥ ṣaṭ
translated: These are the six moving ones.

original: p / // /athātra śrāvaṇe māse pūrṇe aṣṭādaśamuhūrte divase sūryaudaye ca caturojā nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: śrāvaṇe māse pūrṇe aṣṭādaśa muhūrte divase sūrya odaye ca caturojāḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: Now, when this month of Śrāvaṇa is full, at the rising of the sun in eighteen muhūrtas of the day, there is a muhūrta named Caturojā.

original: rohitasya ca muhūrtasya balasya caantare madhyāhno bhavati/
analyzed: rohitasya ca muhūrtasya balasya ca antare madhyāhnaḥ bhavati
translated: At midday, it is between the muhūrtas of Rohita and Bala.

original: sūryāvatāre tu vicārī nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: sūryāvatāre tu vicārī nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At sunset, there is a muhūrtta named Vicārin.

original: dvādaśamuhūrtāyāṃ rātrāv avatīrṇe sūrye ṣaṣṭhe muhūrte nayamano nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: dvādaśa muhūrtāyām rātrau avatīrṇe sūrye ṣaṣṭhe muhūrte nayamanaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: In the night of twelve muhūrtas, when the sun has set, in the sixth muhūrtta, there is a muhūrta named Nayamana.

original: ātāpāgnir evaṃ nāma muhūrto rātryavasāne bhavati/
analyzed: ātāpa agniḥ evam nāma muhūrtaḥ rātri avasāne bhavati
translated: At the end of the night, there is a muhūrta named Ātāpāgni.

original: bhādrapade
analyzed: bhādrapade
translated: In Bhādrapada

original: māse pūrṇe saptadaśamuhūrte divase sūryaudaye ca caturojā evaṃ nāma muhūrtā bhavati/
analyzed: māse pūrṇe saptadaśa muhūrte divase sūrya audaye ca caturojāḥ evam nāma muhūrtā bhavati
translated: When the month is full, on the seventeenth muhurta of the day, at sunrise, there is a muhurta called Caturoja.

original: madhyāhne abhijito nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: madhyāhne abhijitaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At midday, there is a muhurta called Abhijit.

original: sūryāvatāre raudro nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: sūryāvatāre raudraḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At sunset, there is a muhurta called Raudra.

original: trayodaśamuhūrtāyāṃ rātrāv avatīrṇe sūrye vicārī nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: trayodaśa muhūrtāyām rātrau avatīrṇe sūrye vicārī nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: In a night of thirteen muhurtas, when the sun has set, there is a muhurta called Vicari.

original: ardharātre mahābhayo vāyāvo nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: ardharātre mahābhayaḥ vāyāvaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At midnight, there is a muhurta called Maha-bhaya or Vayava.

original: p / // /rātryavasāne ātapāgnir evaṃ nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: ātapa agniḥ evam nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At the end of the night, there is a muhurta called Atapagni.

original: aśvayuje māse pūrṇe ṣoḍaśamuhūrto divaso bhavati/
analyzed: aśvayuje māse pūrṇe ṣoḍaśa muhūrtaḥ divasaḥ bhavati
translated: In the month of Ashvayuj, when the month is full, the day has sixteen muhurtas.

original: sūryaudaye caturojā nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: sūryaudaye caturojāḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At sunrise, there is a muhurta called Caturoja.

original: samudgatasya ca muhūrtasya abhijitasya caantare madhyāhno bhavati/
analyzed: samudgatasya ca muhūrtasya abhijitasya ca antare madhyāhnaḥ bhavati
translated: Between the muhurtas Samudgata and Abhijit, it is midday.

original: sūryāvatāre bhargo devo nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: sūryāvatāre bhargaḥ devaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At sunset, there is a muhurta called Bharga-deva.

original: p / // /caturdaśamuhūrtāyāṃ rātrāv avatīrṇe sūrye raudro nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: rātrau avatīrṇe sūrye raudraḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: In a night of fourteen muhurtas, when the sun has set, there is a muhurta called Raudra.

original: abhijitasya ca muhūrtasya bhīṣamāṇasya ca muhūrtasya antareṇaardharātraṃ bhavati/
analyzed: abhijitasya ca muhūrtasya bhīṣamāṇasya ca muhūrtasya antareṇa ardharātram bhavati
translated: Between the Abhijit and Bhīṣaṇa muhūrtas, midnight occurs.

original: rātryavasāne ātapāgnir evaṃ nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: rātri avasāne ātapa agniḥ evam nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At the end of the night, there is a muhūrta called Ātapāgni.

original: p / // /kārttike māse pūrṇe divasaḥ samarātrir bhavati/
analyzed: māse pūrṇe divasaḥ sama rātriḥ bhavati
translated: When the month of Kārttika is full, the day and night are equal.

original: pañcadaśamuhūrto divaso bhavati pañcadaśamuhūrto rātriḥ/
analyzed: pañcadaśa muhūrtaḥ divasaḥ bhavati pañcadaśa muhūrtaḥ rātriḥ
translated: The day is fifteen muhūrtas, the night is fifteen muhūrtas.

original: samāne ahorātre sūryaudaye caturojā evaṃ nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: samāne ahar rātre sūrya odaye catur ojāḥ evam nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: When the day and night are equal, at sunrise there is a muhūrta called Caturojā.

original: saṃmukho nāma muhūrto bhavati madhyāhne/
analyzed: saṃmukhaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati madhyāhne
translated: At midday there is a muhūrta called Saṃmukha.

original: santato nāma muhūrtaḥ
analyzed: santataḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ
translated: There is a muhūrta called Santata

original: sūryāvatāre/
analyzed: sūryāvatāre
translated: at sunset.

original: rātrāv avatīrṇamātra sūrye bhrgo devo nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: rātrau avatīrṇa mātra sūrye bhrgaḥ devaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: When the sun has just set at night, there is a muhūrta called Bhrgudeva.

original: ardharātre abhijin muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: ardharātre abhijit muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At midnight there is an Abhijit muhūrta.

original: rātryavasāne ātapāgnir evaṃ nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: rātri avasāne ātapa agniḥ evam nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At the end of the night there is a muhūrta called Ātapāgni.

original: p / // /mārgaśīrṣe māse ca pūrṇe caturdaśamuhūrte divase sūryaudaye caturojā evaṃ nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: māse ca pūrṇe caturdaśa muhūrte divase sūrya audaye caturojāḥ evam nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: When the month of Mārgaśīrṣa is full, with a fourteen muhūrta day, at sunrise there is a muhūrta called Caturojā.

original: viratasya saṃmukhasya ca muhūrtasyaantare madhyāhno bhavati/
analyzed: viratasya saṃmukhasya ca muhūrtasya antare madhyāhnaḥ bhavati
translated: Between the Virata and Saṃmukha muhūrtas, midday occurs.

original: sūryaavatāre varuṇo nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: sūrya avatāre varuṇaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: When the sun enters [the sign] of Capricorn, the period called Varuna occurs.

original: ṣoḍaśamuhūrtāyāṃ rātrāv avatīrṇamātre sūrye saṃtāpanaḥ saṃyamo nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa muhūrtāyām rātrau avatīrṇa mātre sūrye saṃtāpanaḥ saṃyamaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: When the sun has just risen in a night of sixteen muhurtas, the period called Santapana Samyama occurs.

original: rākṣasasyābhijitasya ca muhūrtasyaantare ardharātraṃ
analyzed: rākṣasasya abhijitasya ca muhūrtasya antare ardharātram
translated: Between the periods of Rakshasa and Abhijit, midnight occurs.

original: bhavati/ rātryavasāne ātapāgnir evaṃ nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: bhavati rātri avasāne ātapa agniḥ evam nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At the end of the night, the period called Atapāgni occurs.

original: p / // /pauṣamāse pūrṇe trayodaśamuhūrte divase sūryaudaye caturojā evaṃ nama muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: pūrṇe trayodaśa muhūrte divase sūrya udaye catur ojāḥ evam muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: When the month of Pausha is full, in a day of thirteen muhurtas, at sunrise, the period called Caturoja occurs.

original: madhyāhne virato nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: madhyāhne virataḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At midday, the period called Virata occurs.

original: sūryāvatāre nairṛto nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: sūryāvatāre nairṛtaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: When the sun sets, the period called Nairrita occurs.

original: saptadaśamuhūrtāyāṃ rātrāv avatīrṇamātre sūrye varuṇo nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: saptadaśa muhūrtāyām rātrau avatīrṇa mātre sūrye varuṇaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: When the sun has just risen in a night of seventeen muhurtas, the period called Varuna occurs.

original: ardharātre rākṣaso nāma muhūrto bhavti/
analyzed: ardharātre rākṣasaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At midnight, the period called Rakshasa occurs.

original: rātryavasāne ātapāgnir evaṃ nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: rātri avasāne ātapa agniḥ evam nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At the end of the night, the period called Atapāgni occurs.

original: p / // /māghamāse pūrṇe dvādaśamuhūrte divase sūryaudaye caturojā nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: pūrṇe dvādaśa muhūrte divase sūrya odaye caturojāḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: When the month of Magha is full, in a day of twelve muhurtas, at sunrise, the period called Caturoja occurs.

original: sāvitrasya ca viratasya ca muhūrtasyaantareṇa madhyāhno bhavati/
analyzed: sāvitrasya ca viratasya ca muhūrtasya antareṇa madhyāhnaḥ bhavati
translated: The midday is between the Savitra and Virața muhūrtas.

original: sūryāvatāre vijayo nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: sūryāvatāre vijayaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: At sunset, the muhūrta called Vijaya occurs.

original: aṣṭādaśamuhūrtāyāṃ rātrāv avatīrṇamātre sūrye nairṛto nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa muhūrtāyām rātrau avatīrṇa mātre sūrye nairṛtaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: In an eighteen-muhūrta night, immediately after the sun has set, the muhūrta called Nairṛta occurs.

original: gardabhasya muhūrtasya ca rākṣasasya caantaram ardharātraṃ bhavati/
analyzed: gardabhasya muhūrtasya ca rākṣasasya ca antaram ardha rātram bhavati
translated: Midnight is between the muhūrtas of the donkey and the demon.

original: rātryavasāna
analyzed: rātri avasāna
translated: At the end of the night,

original: ātapāgnir evaṃ nāma muhūrto bhavati/
analyzed: ātapa agniḥ evam nāma muhūrtaḥ bhavati
translated: the muhūrta called Ātapa Agni occurs.

original: p / // /yathā śrāvaṇe tathā māghe/
analyzed: śrāvaṇe tathā māghe

original: p / // /vasavo devatās tatra ghṛtamālyair baliṃ haret/
analyzed: devatāḥ tatra ghṛta mālyaiḥ balim haret
translated: The Vasus are the deities there; one should offer an oblation of ghee and garlands.

original: p / // /anena balikarmeṇa tasmād rogād vimucyate//
analyzed: bali karmeṇa tasmāt rogāt vimucyate
translated: By this offering, one is freed from that illness.

original: p / // /śatabhiṣāutthito vyādhiḥ striyā vā puruṣasya vā/
analyzed: vyādhiḥ striyāḥ vā puruṣasya vā
translated: If an illness arises in Shatabhisha, whether of a woman or a man,

original: p / // /trayodaśadivas tatra tataś caūrdhvaṃ vimucyate//
analyzed: tatra tatas ca ūrdhvam vimucyate
translated: It will last thirteen days, and then one is freed.

original: p / // /varuṇo devatā tatra pāyasena baliṃ haret/
analyzed: devatā tatra pāyasena balim haret
translated: Varuna is the deity there; one should offer an oblation of milk-rice.

original: p / // /anena balikarmeṇa tasmād rogād vimucyate//
analyzed: bali karmeṇa tasmāt rogāt vimucyate
translated: By this offering, one is freed from that illness.

original: p / // /pūrvabhadrautthito vyādhiḥ striyā vā puruṣasya vā/
analyzed: vyādhiḥ striyāḥ vā puruṣasya vā
translated: If an illness arises in Purva Bhadrapada, whether of a woman or a man,

original: p / // /na taṃ vaidyāś cikitsantu ahirbudhnyo atra daivataḥ//
analyzed: tam vaidyāḥ cikitsantu ahirbudhnyaḥ atra daivataḥ
translated: The physicians cannot cure it; here, Ahi Budhnya is the deity.

original: p / // /uttarabhādrajo vyādhiḥ striyā vā puruṣasya vā/
analyzed: vyādhiḥ striyāḥ vā puruṣasya vā
translated: If an illness arises in Uttara Bhadrapada, whether of a woman or a man,

original: p / // /saptarātraṃ bhaved vyādhis tataś caūrdhvaṃ vimucyate//
analyzed: bhavet vyādhiḥ tatas ca ūrdhvam vimucyate
translated: The illness will last seven nights, and then one is freed.

original: p / // / aryamā devatā tatra gandhamālyair baliṃ haret/
analyzed: aryamā devatā tatra gandha mālyaiḥ balim haret
translated: Aryaman is the deity there, one should offer oblations with perfumes and garlands.

original: p / // /anena balikarmeṇa tasmād rogād vimucyate//
analyzed: bali karmeṇa tasmāt rogāt vimucyate
translated: By this rite of oblations, one is freed from that disease.

original: p / // /revatyām utthito vyādhiḥ striyā vā puruṣasya vā/
analyzed: utthitaḥ vyādhiḥ striyāḥ vā puruṣasya vā
translated: If a disease arises in Revati, in a woman or a man,

original: p / // /mṛduko hi bhaved vyādhir aṣṭāviṃśatirātrikaḥ//
analyzed: hi bhavet vyādhiḥ aṣṭāviṃśati rātrikaḥ
translated: That disease will be mild, lasting twenty-eight nights.

original: p / // /pūṣā hi devatā tatra gandhamālyair baliṃ haret/
analyzed: hi devatā tatra gandha mālyaiḥ balim haret
translated: Pūṣan is the deity there, one should offer oblations with perfumes and garlands.

original: p / // /anena balikarmeṇa tasmād rogād vimucyate//
analyzed: bali karmeṇa tasmāt rogāt vimucyate
translated: By this rite of oblations, one is freed from that disease.

original: p / // /aśvinyām utthito vyādhiḥ striyā vā puruṣasya vā/
analyzed: utthitaḥ vyādhiḥ striyāḥ vā puruṣasya vā
translated: If a disease arises in Aśvinī, in a woman or a man,

original: p / // /sāṃkleśiko bhaved vyādhiḥ pañcaviṃśatirātrikaḥ//
analyzed: bhavet vyādhiḥ pañcaviṃśati rātrikaḥ
translated: That disease will be afflictive, lasting twenty-five nights.

original: p / // /gandharvo devatā tatra yāvakena baliṃ haret/ gandharva/
analyzed: devatā tatra yāvakena balim haret gandharva
translated: Gandharva is the deity there, one should offer oblations with barley.

original: p / // /anena balikarmeṇa tasmād rogād vimucyate//
analyzed: bali karmeṇa tasmāt rogāt vimucyate
translated: By this rite of oblations, one is freed from that disease.

original: p / // /bharaṇyām utthito vyādhiḥ striyā vā puruṣasya vā/
analyzed: utthitaḥ vyādhiḥ striyāḥ vā puruṣasya vā
translated: If a disease arises in Bharaṇī, in a woman or a man,

original: p / // /na taṃ vaidyāś cikitsantu yamas tatra tu daivataḥ/
analyzed: tam vaidyāḥ cikitsantu yamaḥ tatra tu daivataḥ
translated: The physicians cannot cure it, Yama is the deity there.

original: p / // /śīlaṃ rakṣatu medhāvī tataḥ svargaṃ gamiṣyati//
analyzed: rakṣatu medhāvī tatas svargam gamiṣyati
translated: The wise one should protect his character, then he will go to heaven.

original: p / // /ayaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārin vyādhisamutthāno nāmaadhyāyaḥ/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin vyādhisamutthānaḥ nāma adhyāyaḥ
translated: This, sir, is the chapter on the origin of diseases, O Puṣkarasāri.

original: bandhananirmokṣaḥ
translated: The Release from Bondage

original: p / // /atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin bandhananirmokṣaṃ nāmaadhyāyaṃ vyākhyāsyāmi/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin bandhananirmokṣam nāma adhyāyam vyākhyāsyāmi
translated: Now then, O Puṣkarasāri, I will explain the chapter called 'The Release from Bondage.'

original: tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: kathayatu bhagavān//
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān
translated: May the Blessed One explain.

original: p / // /kṛttikāsu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin baddho vā ruddho vā trirātreṇa mokṣyatiiti vaktavyaḥ/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin baddhaḥ vā ruddhaḥ vā tri rātreṇa mokṣyati iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: O Puṣkarasāri, one who is bound or imprisoned under the Kṛttikā [lunar mansion] will be released in three nights, so it should be said.

original: rohiṇyāṃ baddho vā ruddho vā trirātreṇa mokṣyatiiti/
analyzed: rohiṇyām baddhaḥ vā ruddhaḥ vā tri rātreṇa mokṣyati iti
translated: One bound or imprisoned under Rohiṇī will be released in three nights.

original: mṛgaśirasi baddho vā ruddho vā ekaviṃśati rātreṇa mokṣyatiiti/
analyzed: mṛgaśirasi baddhaḥ vā ruddhaḥ vā ekaviṃśati rātreṇa mokṣyati iti
translated: One bound or imprisoned under Mṛgaśiras will be released in twenty-one nights.

original: ārdrāyāṃ baddho vā ruddho vā ardhamāsena mokṣyatiiti/
analyzed: ārdrāyām baddhaḥ vā ruddhaḥ vā ardha māsena mokṣyati iti
translated: One bound or imprisoned under Ārdrā will be released in half a month.

original: punarvasau ruddho vā baddho vā saptarātrena/🔽puṣye trirātreṇa/
analyzed: punarvasau ruddhaḥ vā baddhaḥ vā sapta rātrena  puṣye tri rātreṇa
translated: One imprisoned under Punarvasu will be released in seven nights.🔽Under Puṣya, in three nights.

original: aśleṣāyāṃ triṃśadrātreṇa/
analyzed: aśleṣāyām triṃśat rātreṇa
translated: Under Āśleṣā, in thirty nights.

original: maghāsu ṣoḍaśarātreṇa/
analyzed: maghāsu ṣoḍaśa rātreṇa
translated: Under Maghā, in sixteen nights.

original: citrāyāṃ saptarātreṇa/
analyzed: citrāyām sapta rātreṇa
translated: Under Citrā, in seven nights.

original: svātyāṃ daśarātreṇa/
analyzed: svātyām daśarātreṇa
translated: Under Svāti, in ten nights.

original: viśākhāyāṃ ṣaḍviṃśadrātreṇa/
analyzed: viśākhāyām ṣaḍviṃśat rātreṇa
translated: Under Viśākhā, in twenty-six nights.

original: anurādhāyām ekatriṃśad rātreṇa/
analyzed: anurādhāyām ekatriṃśat rātreṇa
translated: Under Anurādhā, in thirty-one nights.

original: jyeṣṭhāyām aṣṭādaśarātreṇa/
analyzed: jyeṣṭhāyām aṣṭādaśa rātreṇa
translated: Under Jyeṣṭhā, in eighteen nights.

original: mūle ṣaṭtriṃśad rātreṇa/🔽pūrvāṣāḍhāyāṃ caturdaśarātreṇa/
analyzed: mūle ṣaṭtriṃśat rātreṇa  pūrvāṣāḍhāyām caturdaśa rātreṇa
translated: At the root, in thirty-six nights.🔽In the first half of Āṣāḍhā, in fourteen nights.

original: uttarāṣāḍhāyāṃ caturdaśarātreṇa/
analyzed: uttarāṣāḍhāyām caturdaśa rātreṇa
translated: In the second half of Āṣāḍhā, in fourteen nights.

original: abhijiti ṣaḍrātreṇa/
analyzed: abhijiti ṣaṣ rātreṇa
translated: In Abhijit, in six nights.

original: śravaṇe dhaniṣṭhāyāṃ śatabhiṣāyāṃ pūrvabhadrapade uttarabhādrapade revatyāṃ
analyzed: śravaṇe dhaniṣṭhāyām śatabhiṣāyām pūrvabhadrapade uttarabhādrapade revatyām
translated: In Śravaṇa, in Dhaniṣṭhā, in Śatabhiṣā, in the first half of Bhadrapadā, in the second half of Bhadrapadā, in Revatī,

original: caturdaśarātreṇa/
analyzed: caturdaśa rātreṇa
translated: in fourteen nights.

original: aśvinyāṃ trirātreṇa/
analyzed: aśvinyām tri rātreṇa
translated: In Aśvinī, in three nights.

original: bharaṇyāṃ baddho vā ruddho vā parikleśam avāpsyatiiti vaktavyaḥ/
analyzed: bharaṇyām baddhaḥ vā ruddhaḥ vā parikleśam avāpsyati iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: In Bharaṇī, if bound or imprisoned, one should say that one will meet with distress.

original: p / // /ayaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārin bandhananirmokṣo nāmaadhyāya/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin bandhananirmokṣaḥ nāma adhyāya
translated: This, sir, is the chapter on liberation from bondage, named The Liberation from Bondage.

original: tilakaadhyāyaḥ
analyzed: tilaka adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Tilaka Chapter

original: p / // /atha boḥ puskarasārin tilakaadhyāyaṃ vyākhyāsyāmi/
analyzed: boḥ puskarasārin tilaka adhyāyam vyākhyāsyāmi
translated: Now, sir, I will explain the Tilaka chapter.

original: tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: kathayatu bhagavān//
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān
translated: May the Blessed One tell it.

original: p / // /mūrdhni tu yasyās tilako asti sūkṣmaḥ snigdho bhavet padmasamānavarṇaḥ/
analyzed: tu yasyāḥ tilakaḥ asti sūkṣmaḥ snigdhaḥ bhavet padma samāna varṇaḥ
translated: On the head of whom there is a subtle, glossy mole, like the color of a lotus,

original: p / // /rājā tu tasyā bhavatiiha bhartā stanaupariṣṭāt pratibimbam āhuḥ//
analyzed: tu tasyāḥ bhavati iha bhartā stana upariṣṭāt pratibimbam āhuḥ
translated: the king is said to be her husband here in this world, and they say that there is a reflection on her breasts.

original: p / // /śīrṣe tu yasyās tilakaalakaḥ syāt sūkṣmo bhaved añjanacūrṇavarṇaḥ/
analyzed: tu yasyāḥ syāt sūkṣmaḥ bhavet añjana cūrṇa varṇaḥ
translated: On the head of whom there is a mole and a curl of hair, subtle, like the color of collyrium powder,🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: p / // /senāpatis tasyā bhaved dhi bhartā stanaantare asyāḥ pratibimbakaṃ syāt//
analyzed: tasyāḥ bhavet hi bhartā stana antare asyāḥ pratibimbakam syāt
translated: The general of her army would be her husband. There would be a reflection in the middle of her breasts.

original: p / // /bhrūvontare asyās tilakaalakaḥ syād duṣcāriṇīṃ tāṃ pramadāṃ vadanti/
analyzed: asyāḥ tilaka alakaḥ syāt duṣcāriṇīm tām pramadām vadanti
translated: Between her eyebrows there would be a mole. They call that woman of bad conduct.

original: p / // /pañcaeva tasyāḥ patayo bhavanti bahvannapānaṃ labhate ca nārī//
analyzed: tasyāḥ patayaḥ bhavanti bahu anna pānam labhate ca nārī
translated: She would have five husbands. The woman would get plenty of food and drink.

original: p / // /gaṇḍasya nāsādikam adhyadeśe bhavec ca bimbaṃ tilakasya yasyāḥ/
analyzed: nāsā ādikam adhyadeśe bhavet ca bimbam tilakasya yasyāḥ
translated: On the cheek, nose, etc., there would be a mole.

original: p / // /tāṃ śokabhājaṃ pramadāṃ vadanti romapradeśe pratibimbam āhuḥ//🔽p / // /karṇe tu yasyās tilakaalakaḥ syād bahuśrutāṃ tāṃ pramadāṃ vadanti/
analyzed: śoka bhājam pramadām vadanti roma pradeśe pratibimbam āhuḥ  tu yasyāḥ syāt bahu śrutām tām pramadām vadanti
translated: They call that woman a bearer of sorrow. A reflection is said to be in the region of the hair.🔽On her ear there would be a mole. They call that woman of much learning.
