original: p / // /bahuśrūtāṃ tāṃ śrutidhāriṇīṃ ca trike tu yasyāḥ pratibimbakaṃ syāt//🔽p / // /yasyauttaroṣṭhe tilakaalakaḥ syāt tāṃ bhinnasatyāṃ pramadāṃ vadanti/
analyzed: tām śruti dhāriṇīm ca trike tu yasyāḥ pratibimbakam syāt  tilakaalakaḥ syāt tām bhinna satyām pramadām vadanti
translated: They call her of much learning and a bearer of the Vedas. There would be a reflection on her forehead.🔽On her upper lip there would be a mole. They call that woman of broken truth.

original: p / // /kṛcchreṇa sā vai labhate hi vṛttim ūrau tu tasyās tilabimbam āhuḥ//
analyzed: sā vai labhate hi vṛttim ūrau tu tasyāḥ tila bimbam āhuḥ
translated: She would get a living with difficulty. They say there is a mole on her thigh.

original: p / // /yasyā adharoṣṭhe tilakaalakaḥ syād duścāriṇīṃ tāṃ pramadāṃ vadanti/
analyzed: adhara uṣṭhe tilaka alakaḥ syāt duścāriṇīm tām pramadām vadanti
translated: The woman whose mole is on the lower lip, they say she is a woman of loose conduct.

original: p / // /miṣṭaannapānaṃ bahu ṛcchate sā tathā hi guhye pratibimbakaṃ syāt//
analyzed: bahu ṛcchate sā tathā hi guhye pratibimbakam syāt
translated: She will obtain much sweet food and drink, for there will be a second mole in her private parts.

original: p / // /cibuke tu yasyās tilakaalakaḥ syād duścāriṇīṃ tāṃ pramadāṃ vadanti/
analyzed: tu yasyāḥ syāt duścāriṇīm tām pramadām vadanti
translated: The woman whose mole is on the chin, they say she is a woman of loose conduct.

original: p / // /miṣṭaannapānaṃ bahu sā labheta guhye dvitīyaṃ pratibimbakaṃ syāt//
analyzed: bahu sā labheta guhye dvitīyam pratibimbakam syāt
translated: She will obtain much sweet food and drink, for there will be a second mole in her private parts.

original: p / // /ayaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasāriṃs tilakaadhyāyo nāmaadhyāyaḥ/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin tilaka adhyāyaḥ nāma adhyāyaḥ
translated: This, sir, is the chapter named 'The Chapter on Moles,' in the Purana.

original: p / // /atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin nakṣatrajanmaguṇaṃ nāmaadhyāyaṃ vyākhyāsyāmi/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin nakṣatrajanmaguṇam nāma adhyāyam vyākhyāsyāmi
translated: Now, sir, I will explain the chapter named 'The Qualities of Birth under the Lunar Mansions.'

original: tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: kathayatu bhavān triśaṅkko/
analyzed: kathayatu bhavān triśaṅkko
translated: Let you, Trisanku, speak.

original: p / // /kṛttikāsu naro jātas tejasvī priyasāhasaḥ/
analyzed: naraḥ jātaḥ tejasvī priya sāhasaḥ
translated: A man born under the Krittika constellation is fiery, fond of adventure,

original: p / // /bhavec chūras tathā caṇḍaḥ priyavādī ca mānavaḥ//
analyzed: chūraḥ tathā caṇḍaḥ priya vādī ca mānavaḥ
translated: and also brave and fierce, and a man who speaks pleasantly.

original: p / // /rohiṇyāṃ puruṣo jāto dhanavān dharmikas tathā/
analyzed: puruṣaḥ jātaḥ dhanavān dharmikaḥ tathā
translated: A man born under Rohini is wealthy and righteous,

original: p / // /vyavasāyī sthiraḥ śūro dhruvaṃ caasya sadā mukhaṃ//
analyzed: sthiraḥ śūraḥ dhruvam ca asya sadā mukham
translated: decisive, steadfast, and brave, and his face is always cheerful.

original: p / // /jāto mṛgaśire yas tu mṛduḥ saumyas tu mānavaḥ/
analyzed: mṛgaśire yaḥ tu mṛduḥ saumyaḥ tu mānavaḥ
translated: One born in Mṛgaśiras is gentle and mild, and is a man of good disposition.

original: p / // /darśanīyo bhavec caasau strīkāntas tu viśeṣataḥ//
analyzed: bhavet ca asau strī kāntaḥ tu viśeṣataḥ
translated: He becomes handsome, and especially dear to women.

original: p / // /ārdrājātas tu hiṃsātmā caṇḍaḥ paramajalpakaḥ/
analyzed: tu hiṃsā ātmā caṇḍaḥ parama jalpakaḥ
translated: One born in Ārdrā is of a violent nature, fierce, and a great talker.

original: p / // /rodrakarmā bhavec caasāv īścaraś ca śatair mahān//
analyzed: bhavet ca asau īścaraḥ ca śataiḥ mahān
translated: He becomes a man of terrible deeds, and is a great lord among hundreds.

original: p / // /jātaḥ punarvasau yas tu hy alolo buddhimān naraḥ/
analyzed: punarvasau yaḥ tu hi alolaḥ buddhimān naraḥ
translated: One born in Punarvasu is restless, but intelligent, and is a man of good disposition.

original: p / // /dharmaśīlo bhavec caasau jātakrodhaś ca mānavaḥ//
analyzed: bhavet ca asau jāta krodhaḥ ca mānavaḥ
translated: He becomes virtuous, but a man of quick temper.

original: p / // /puṣyeṇa puruṣo jātas tejasvī brāhmaṇo bhavet/
analyzed: puruṣaḥ jātaḥ tejasvī brāhmaṇaḥ bhavet
translated: One born in Puṣya becomes a man of great splendor and a brāhmaṇa.

original: p / // /kṣatriyaś ca bhaved rājā vaiśyasūdrau ca pūjitau//
analyzed: ca bhavet rājā vaiśya sūdrau ca pūjitau
translated: He becomes a kṣatriya king, and a vaiśya or śūdra is honored.

original: p / // /śvasanaḥ krodhanaḥ krūro hy aśleṣāsambhavo naraḥ/
translated: A man born in Aśleṣā is a breather, angry, and cruel.

original: p / // /durmanuṣyaś ca caṇḍaś ca /
analyzed: ca caṇḍaḥ ca
translated: He is a bad man and fierce.

original: iti sarvam ihādiśet//🔽p / // /bahuprajñaḥ śrāddhakaro bahubhāgyas tathāeva ca/
analyzed: iti sarvam iha ādiśet  śrāddha karaḥ bahu bhāgyaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Thus everything should be declared here.🔽One born in Maghā becomes very wise, performs śrāddha rites, and is equally very fortunate.

original: p / // /dhanavān dhānyavān bhogī maghāsu puruṣo bhavet//
analyzed: dhānyavān bhogī maghāsu puruṣaḥ bhavet
translated: He becomes wealthy, prosperous, and enjoys pleasures.

original: p / // /pūrvaphālgunījātas tu yaḥ kaścit puruṣo bhavet/
analyzed: tu yaḥ kaścid puruṣaḥ bhavet
translated: One born in the first half of Phalguni will be a man of some sort.

original: p / // /ardham abucchiśīlaś ca gurudārāabhimardakaḥ//
analyzed: ca
translated: He will be half a scholar, of bad conduct, and will oppress the wives of his superiors.

original: p / // /uttarāyāṃ tu phālgunyāṃ jāto bhavati bhogavān/
analyzed: tu phālgunyām jātaḥ bhavati bhogavān
translated: But one born in the latter half of Phalguni will be wealthy.

original: p / // /divyajñānaś ca vijñāne puruṣaḥ subhago bhavet//
analyzed: ca vijñāne puruṣaḥ subhagaḥ bhavet
translated: He will have divine knowledge and be wise, and will be a fortunate man.

original: p / // /haste jātaś ca śuddhaātmā vikrānto mṛdubhojanaḥ/
analyzed: jātaḥ ca śuddha ātmā vikrāntaḥ mṛdu bhojanaḥ
translated: One born in Hasta will be pure-souled, valorous, and will eat mildly.

original: p / // /senāpatyam ca kurute asteyakarmā bhaved asau//
analyzed: ca kurute asteya karmā bhavet asau
translated: He will be a general, and will not steal.

original: p / // /citrāsu jātaś citrāakṣas tathā citrakathākaraḥ/
analyzed: jātaḥ citrāakṣaḥ tathā citra kathā karaḥ
translated: One born in Chitra will have colorful eyes and will tell colorful stories.

original: p / // /darśanīyo bahustrīkaś citraśīlo bhaven naraḥ//
analyzed: bahu strīkaḥ citra śīlaḥ bhavet naraḥ
translated: He will be handsome, have many wives, and will have a colorful character.

original: p / // /svātyāṃ ca puruṣo jāto bandhuś lāghī cicakṣaṇaḥ/
analyzed: ca puruṣaḥ jātaḥ bandhuḥ lāghī cicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: And a man born in Svati will be a relative, quick-witted, and observant.

original: p / // /mṛdukaḥ pānaśauṇḍaś ca mitrakārī vicāravān//
analyzed: pāna śauṇḍaḥ ca mitra kārī vicāravān
translated: He will be mild, fond of drinking, helpful to friends, and thoughtful.

original: p / // /viśākhāsu naro jātas tejasvī dravyavān mahān/
analyzed: naraḥ jātaḥ tejasvī dravyavān mahān
translated: A man born in the Vishakha will be energetic, wealthy, and great.

original: p / // /śūro vikramavān dakṣaḥ subhagaś ca bhaved asau//
analyzed: vikramavān dakṣaḥ subhagaḥ ca bhavet asau
translated: He will be brave, valorous, skillful, and fortunate.

original: p / // /anurādhāudbhavo martyo mitravān saṃgrahī naraḥ/
analyzed: martyaḥ mitravān saṃgrahī naraḥ
translated: A man born in Anuradha will be friendly, sociable, and generous.

original: p / // /śuciś caeva kṛtajñaś ca dharmaātmā ca bhavec ca saḥ//
analyzed: ca eva kṛtajñaḥ ca dharma ātmā ca bhavet ca saḥ
translated: and he will be pure, grateful, and righteous.

original: p / // /jyeṣṭhāsu puruṣo jāto mitravān abhijāyate/
analyzed: puruṣaḥ jātaḥ mitravān abhijāyate
translated: If a man is born in the Jyeshtha constellation, he will be born with friends.

original: p / // /dhanurvedaabhirāmaś ca nārīṣu kurute manaḥ//
analyzed: ca nārīṣu kurute manaḥ
translated: and he will delight in archery, and will set his mind on women.

original: p / // /mūleṣu puruṣo jāto akṛtajñaḥ syād adharmikaḥ/
analyzed: puruṣaḥ jātaḥ akṛtajñaḥ syāt adharmikaḥ
translated: If a man is born in the Mula constellation, he will be ungrateful and unrighteous.

original: p / // /dṛḍho vīro bhavec caasau kilviṣī ca sa mānavaḥ//
analyzed: vīraḥ bhavet ca asau kilviṣī ca sa mānavaḥ
translated: and he will be firm and heroic, but that man will be sinful.

original: p / // /āṣāḍhāsu ca pūrvāsu matsarī calitaindriyaḥ/
analyzed: ca pūrvāsu matsarī calita aindriyaḥ
translated: If a man is born in the eastern Ashdha constellation, he will be envious and fickle-minded.

original: p / // /matsyamāṃsapriyaś caapi ghātakaḥ syāt sa mānavaḥ//🔽p / // /saanukrośaś ca dātā ca vidyāniṣṭhaḥ suhṛjjanaḥ/🔽p / // /viśvadaive naro jāto bhaved api ca niścitaḥ//
analyzed: ca api ghātakaḥ syāt sa mānavaḥ  ca dātā ca vidyā niṣṭhaḥ suhṛd janaḥ  naraḥ jātaḥ bhavet api ca niścitaḥ
translated: and he will love fish meat, and that man will be a killer.

original: p / // /ācāryaḥ śāstrakartā ca viśvāsī ca kriyāparaḥ/🔽p / // /śravaṇe jata /
analyzed: śāstra kartā ca viśvāsī ca kriyā paraḥ  jata
translated: If a man is born in the Vishva constellation, he will certainly be compassionate, generous, devoted to learning, and have good friends.

original: āyuṣmān śrīmāṃś ca puruṣo bhavet//
analyzed: āyuṣmān śrīmān ca puruṣaḥ bhavet
translated: If a man is born in the Shravana constellation, he will be long-lived and prosperous.

original: p / // /anavasthitacittaś ca ccitradravyaś ca mānavaḥ/
analyzed: ca c citra dravyaḥ ca mānavaḥ
translated: and he will be fickle-minded, and a man with colorful possessions.

original: p / // /dhaniṣṭhāsu bhavej jātaḥ puruṣaḥ sarvaśāṅkitaḥ//
analyzed: bhavet jātaḥ puruṣaḥ sarva śāṅkitaḥ
translated: If a man is born in the Dhanishtha constellation, he will be suspicious of everyone.

original: p / // /vāruṇe yadi nakṣatre jāto bhavati mānavaḥ/
analyzed: yadi nakṣatre jātaḥ bhavati mānavaḥ
translated: If a man is born under the constellation Varuna,

original: p / // /paruṣo kveṣaśīlaś ca parivādī ca sarvaśaḥ//
analyzed: kva iṣa śīlaḥ ca parivādī ca sarvaśas
translated: he will be harsh, fickle-minded, and quarrelsome in every way.

original: p / // /jāto bhādrapadāyāṃ tu pūrvasyām iha mānavaḥ/
analyzed: bhādrapadāyām tu pūrvasyām iha mānavaḥ
translated: If a man is born in the first half of Bhadrapada here,

original: p / // /cāritraguṇayuktaś ca kṛtajño mukharas tathā//
analyzed: ca kṛtajñaḥ mukharaḥ tathā
translated: he will be endowed with the quality of character, grateful, and talkative.

original: p / // /uttarasyāṃ naro jāto bhaviṣyati vicakṣaṇaḥ/
analyzed: naraḥ jātaḥ bhaviṣyati vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: If a man is born in the second half, he will be wise,

original: p / // /medhāvī bahv apatyaś ca dharmaśīlo mahādhanaḥ//
analyzed: bahu apatyaḥ ca dharma śīlaḥ mahādhanaḥ
translated: intelligent, have many children, be righteous, and very wealthy.

original: p / // /revatyāṃ puruṣo jāto dharmaātmā jñātisevakaḥ/
analyzed: puruṣaḥ jātaḥ dharma ātmā jñāti sevakaḥ
translated: If a man is born in Revati, he will be righteous, serve his relatives,

original: p / // /daridro alpadhano nityaṃ dāyako naanusūyakaḥ//
analyzed: alpa dhanaḥ nityam dāyakaḥ na anusūyakaḥ
translated: be poor, always have little wealth, be generous, and not envious.

original: p / // /aśvinyāṃ puruṣo jāto bhavay ativicakṣaṇaḥ/
analyzed: puruṣaḥ jātaḥ ati vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: If a man is born in Ashlesha, he will be very wise,

original: p / // /mahājanapriyaś caapi śūraś ca subhagaś ca saḥ//
analyzed: ca api śūraḥ ca subhagaḥ ca saḥ
translated: beloved by the people, brave, and fortunate.

original: p / // /bharaṇyāṃ puruṣo jātaḥ pāpācāro avicakṣaṇaḥ/
analyzed: puruṣaḥ jātaḥ pāpa ācāraḥ avicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: If a man is born in Bharaṇī, he will be of wicked conduct and unwise,

original: p / // /kandarpe dātukāmaś ca parataś caupajīvakaḥ//
analyzed: dātu kāmaḥ ca paratas ca aupajīvakaḥ
translated: desiring to give in love, and dependent on others.

original: p / // /ayaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārinn nakṣatrajanmaguṇo nāmaadhyāyaḥ/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin nakṣatrajanmaguṇaḥ nāmaadhyāyaḥ
translated: This, O Puṣkarasārin, is the chapter named The Qualities of Birth under the Constellations.

original: p / // /paṭha bhos triśaṅko utpātacakraṃ nāmaadhyāyaṃ/
analyzed: bhoḥ triśaṅko utpātacakram nāma adhyāyam
translated: Recite, sir, the chapter called The Wheel of Omens.

original: kathayati ca/
analyzed: kathayati ca
translated: And he says:

original: utpātacakranirdeśaḥ p /
analyzed: u utpāta cakra nirdeśaḥ
translated: The Teaching on the Wheel of Omens

original: aṣṭāviṃśatiparyantakṛtsne nakṣatramaṇḍale/
analyzed: nakṣatra maṇḍale
translated: In the entire twenty-eight-fold lunar mansion circle,

original: divyā vikārā dṛśyante sūryacandragrahādiṣu//
analyzed: vikārāḥ dṛśyante sūrya candra graha ādiṣu
translated: Celestial changes are seen in the sun, moon, planets, and so on.

original: māghasya prathame pakṣe śailo vā pārthivā yadi/🔽dhūmavṛṣṭir hi /
analyzed: prathame pakṣe śailaḥ vā pārthivāḥ yadi  hi
translated: In the first fortnight of Māgha, if there is smoke or rain

original: āditye /
analyzed: āditye
translated: From the sun,

original: udayati pradṛśyate/
analyzed: udayati pradṛśyate
translated: When it rises, it is seen.

original: vidyuto vāatha dṛśyante tadā vidyāj janakṣayaṃ//
analyzed: vā atha dṛśyante tadā vidyāt jana kṣayam
translated: Or if lightning is seen, then one should know there will be destruction of people.

original: aśvinyām arkato dhūmo nirgacchann api chādayet/
analyzed: arkataḥ dhūmaḥ nirgacchan api chādayet
translated: If smoke emerges from Aśvinī towards the sun and covers it,

original: anāvṛṣṭiṃ tadā vidyāt pūrṇavarṣāṇi dvādaśa//
analyzed: tadā vidyāt pūrṇa varṣāṇi dvādaśa
translated: Then one should know there will be a drought for twelve full years.

original: bharaṇyāṃ māghamāse tu pītasūryo atha dṛśyate/
analyzed: māgha māse tu pīta sūryaḥ atha dṛśyate
translated: If the sun is seen to be yellow in the month of Māgha in Bharaṇī,

original: samantād vadhyate rāṣṭraṃ madhye durbhikṣam ādiśet//🔽phālgune kṛttikāyāṃ tu /
analyzed: vadhyate rāṣṭram madhye durbhikṣam ādiśet  kṛttikāyām tu
translated: The country is destroyed all around, and in the middle, famine should be predicted.

original: āditye parikho yadi/
analyzed: āditye parikhaḥ yadi
translated: In the month of Phālguna, if there is a pit in the sun

original: naśyanti karvaṭās tatra yadi devo na varṣati//
analyzed: karvaṭāḥ tatra yadi devaḥ na varṣati
translated: In Kṛttikā, if the gods do not rain, then the marshes there perish.

original: caitramāse yadā puṣye sūrye kṛṣṇāṃ pradṛśyate/
analyzed: yadā puṣye sūrye kṛṣṇām pradṛśyate
translated: When in the month of Caitra, a black [object] is seen in the sun in Puṣya,

original: acirodayakāle tu kṣitipālo avarudhyate//
analyzed: tu kṣitipālaḥ avarudhyate
translated: At the time of sunrise, the king is obstructed.

original: vaiśākhamāse caardrāyām ādityaḥ pratisūryakaḥ/
analyzed: ādityaḥ pratisūryakaḥ
translated: In the month of Vaishakha, if the sun is in conjunction with the asterism Ardra, it is a counter-sun.

original: saṃgrāmaṃ tatra jānīyād ubhau ghātyete pārthivau//
analyzed: tatra jānīyāt ubhau ghātyete pārthivau
translated: One should know that a battle will occur there, and both kings will be killed.

original: gṛhyetāṃ candrasūryau vā jyaiṣṭhe bharaṇijyeṣṭhayoḥ/
analyzed: candra sūryau vā jyaiṣṭhe bharaṇi jyeṣṭhayoḥ
translated: If the moon or the sun is eclipsed in Jyeshtha, in the asterisms Bhadrapada or Jyeshtha,

original: saamātyo vadhyate rājā rāṣṭre durbhikṣam ādiśet//
analyzed: vadhyate rājā rāṣṭre durbhikṣam ādiśet
translated: the king along with his ministers will be killed, and famine should be predicted in the kingdom.

original: āṣāḍhe ca yadāāditye pūrvabhādrapade sthite/
analyzed: ca yadā āditye pūrvabhādrapade sthite
translated: If in the month of Ashadha, the sun is in the asterism Purva-Bhadrapada,

original: sāyāhne dṛśyate atyarthaṃ lohito maṇḍale braṇaḥ//
analyzed: dṛśyate atyartham lohitaḥ maṇḍale braṇaḥ
translated: and a very red spot is seen in the solar disc in the evening,

original: paracakreṇa tadrāṣṭraṃ ṣaṇmāsān pīḍyate tadā/
analyzed: tad rāṣṭram ṣaṣ māsān pīḍyate tadā
translated: then that country will be afflicted by the army of another king for six months.

original: kṣitipālaś ca saamātyaḥ putradāreṇa vadhyate//
analyzed: ca sa amātyaḥ putra dāreṇa vadhyate
translated: And the king along with his ministers will be killed along with his sons and wife.

original: pūrvāyāṃ cauttarāṣāḍhāyām āṣāḍhe gṛhyate śaśī/
analyzed: ca auttarāṣāḍhāyām āṣāḍhe gṛhyate śaśī
translated: If the moon is eclipsed in the east in the asterism Uttara-Ashadha in the month of Ashadha,

original: vidyād durbhikṣakalaha rogāṃś caatra vinirdiśet//
analyzed: durbhikṣa kalaha rogān ca atra vinirdiśet
translated: one should know famine, quarrels and diseases will occur there.

original: māse atha śrāvaṇe mūle candrasūryau na bhāsataḥ/
analyzed: atha śrāvaṇe mūle candra sūryau na bhāsataḥ
translated: If in the month of Shravana, the moon and the sun do not shine in the asterism Mula,

original: sphuliṅgāś caatra dṛśyante vidyād rogabhayaṃ mahat//
analyzed: ca atra dṛśyante vidyāt roga bhayam mahat
translated: and sparks are seen there, one should know great danger of disease.

original: māse aśvayuji gṛhyetāṃ ekapakṣendubhāskaro/p /
analyzed: aśvayuji gṛhyetām
translated: If the moon and the sun are eclipsed in the bright fortnight in the month of Ashvayuj,

original: rājaputrasahasrāṇāṃ tadā jāyeta saṃkṣayaḥ//
analyzed: tadā jāyeta saṃkṣayaḥ
translated: then there will be destruction of thousands of princes.

original: alakṣaṇo niḥprakāśaḥ pūrṇamāsyāṃ tu kārttike/
analyzed: niḥprakāśaḥ pūrṇamāsyām tu kārttike
translated: When the moon is without its mark, or is not visible, or is full in the month of Kārttika,

original: candrasūryāv agnivarṇau raktavarṇe nabhastale//
analyzed: agni varṇau rakta varṇe nabhastale
translated: or when the sun and the moon are of the colour of fire, or the sky is of the colour of blood,

original: ravivad bhāti tadrāṣṭraṃ vinaśyeta punaḥ punaḥ/
analyzed: bhāti tat rāṣṭram vinaśyeta punar punar
translated: that kingdom shines like the sun, but is again and again destroyed.

original: rājñāṃ vidyād dhatānāṃ vai bhūmiḥ pāstyati śoṇitaṃ//
analyzed: vidyāt hatānām vai bhūmiḥ śoṇitam
translated: When the earth drinks the blood of slain kings,

original: bharaṇyāṃ māghamāse tu kṛṣṇo vāyuḥ samutthitaḥ/
analyzed: māgha māse tu kṛṣṇaḥ vāyuḥ samutthitaḥ
translated: if a black wind rises in the month of Māgha, under the asterism of Bharaṇī,

original: chādayec candrasūryau tu śīghraṃ rāṣṭraṃ vinaśyati//
analyzed: candra sūryau tu śīghram rāṣṭram vinaśyati
translated: and covers the sun and the moon, the kingdom is quickly destroyed.

original: māse tu phālgune vāyuḥ pāṃśuvarṣaṃ savidyutaṃ/
analyzed: tu phālgune vāyuḥ pāṃśu varṣam sa vidyutam
translated: If a dusty wind with lightning rises in the month of Phālguna,

original: vadhyante pūrvarājānaḥ pratiṣṭhante tathāapare//
analyzed: pūrva rājānaḥ pratiṣṭhante tathā apare
translated: the former kings are killed and others are established.

original: sahaādityena candre atha yadā kaścid grahaś caret/🔽vāyur vā viṣamo vātii vidyād rājavadhaṃ tadā//
analyzed: candre atha yadā kaścid grahaḥ caret  vā viṣamaḥ vidyāt rāja vadham tadā
translated: If any planet should move together with the sun or the moon,🔽or if a contrary wind blows, then one should know that the king will be killed.

original: aśanyulke tu vaiśākhe /
analyzed: tu vaiśākhe
translated: If a thunderbolt or a meteor rises in the month of Vaiśākha,

original: ādityena sahautthite/
analyzed: ādityena saha autthite
translated: together with the sun,

original: ṣaṇmāsaabhyantareṇaatha rāṣṭre vyasanam ādiśet//
analyzed: rāṣṭre vyasanam ādiśet
translated: then within six months one should predict calamity in the kingdom.

original: jyeṣṭhamāse yadāādityo grahato nirgato bhavet/
analyzed: yadā ādityaḥ grahataḥ nirgataḥ bhavet
translated: If the sun becomes freed from a planet in the month of Jyeṣṭha,

original: ādityasyaupaghātena grahāḥ sarve atha pīḍitāḥ//
analyzed: grahāḥ sarve atha pīḍitāḥ
translated: and all the planets are afflicted by the affliction of the sun,

original: jyeṣṭhe ca pāṃśur varṣeta /
analyzed: ca pāṃśuḥ varṣeta
translated: And dust would fall in Jyaishtha.

original: ādityaḥ pariviṣyate/
analyzed: ādityaḥ pariviṣyate
translated: The sun is surrounded.

original: kṣitipālasahasrāṇāṃ eka /
analyzed: eka
translated: Of thousands of rulers of the earth,

original: ekas tu vadhyate//
analyzed: ekaḥ tu vadhyate
translated: only one is killed.

original: āṣāḍhe vāyavo vānti gacchanto bharaṇīsthitāḥ/
analyzed: vāyavaḥ vānti gacchantaḥ bharaṇī sthitāḥ
translated: In Ashadha, the winds blow, coming from the direction of Bharani,

original: udapānāni śuṣyante sarvaśasyaṃ ca śuṣyati//
analyzed: śuṣyante sarva śasyam ca śuṣyati
translated: the water reservoirs dry up, and all crops dry up.

original: śrāvaṇe vāyavaḥ pītāḥ sadā kṛṣṇaṃ nabhastalaṃ/
analyzed: vāyavaḥ pītāḥ sadā kṛṣṇam nabhastalam
translated: In Shravana, the winds are yellow, and the sky is always dark,

original: bhayaṃ tatra vijānīyāt samantāt samupasthitaṃ//
analyzed: tatra vijānīyāt samantāt samupasthitam
translated: one should know that danger has arisen from all sides.

original: śrāvaṇe varṣate hy agniḥ pūrvabhādrapade divā/
analyzed: varṣate hi agniḥ pūrvabhādrapade divā
translated: In Shravana, fire rains during the day in the first half of Bhadrapada,

original: meghāḥ śabdam utkurvanti rogadurbhikṣam ādiśet//
analyzed: śabdam utkurvanti roga durbhikṣam ādiśet
translated: the clouds make a sound, and one should predict disease and famine.

original: yadā bhādrapade māse nabhaḥ syāc channagarjitaṃ/p /
analyzed: bhādrapade māse nabhaḥ syāt
translated: When in the month of Bhadrapada the sky is covered with thunder,

original: paracakraṃ tadā rāṣṭre harate dhanasañcayaṃ//
analyzed: tadā rāṣṭre harate dhana sañcayam
translated: then an enemy army takes away the wealth and possessions in the country.

original: aśvayuji vātavṛṣṭiḥ syād āgatyauttarāṃ diśaṃ/
analyzed: vāta vṛṣṭiḥ syāt āgatya auttarām diśam
translated: In Ashvayuj, there would be windy rain coming from the northern direction,

original: pātayec caevam āghātaṃ kṛtsnaṃ rāṣṭraṃ vinaśyati//
analyzed: ca evam āghātam kṛtsnam rāṣṭram vinaśyati
translated: and it would bring down destruction, and the entire country is destroyed.

original: kārttike śuklatrayodaśyāṃ yadā candre dhanur bhavet/
analyzed: śukla trayodaśyām yadā candre dhanuḥ bhavet
translated: When on the thirteenth of the bright fortnight of Kartika the moon is in Dhanishtha,

original: samantān naśyate rāṣṭraṃ madhye durbhikṣam ādiśet//
analyzed: naśyate rāṣṭram madhye durbhikṣam ādiśet
translated: the country is destroyed all around, and in the middle one should predict famine.

original: ulkāpātā hy aśanayo māghamāse bhavanti vā/
analyzed: hi aśanayaḥ māgha māse bhavanti vā
translated: Meteors fall and thunderbolts strike in the month of Magha.

original: aśvinyāṃ viṣaye tatra prajā aśvāsena vadhyate//
analyzed: viṣaye tatra prajāḥ aśvāsena vadhyate
translated: In the constellation Ashvini, the people there are killed by a wind disease.

original: māse tu phālgune yatra /🔽āgnivarṣaṃ nabhastalāt/
analyzed: tu phālgune yatra  ā agnivarṣam nabhastalāt
translated: In the month of Phalguna,🔽if a fire-like rain falls from the sky,

original: bhavec chabdas tadākāśe tadrāṣṭraṃ naśyate laghu//
analyzed: chabdaḥ tad ākāśe tad rāṣṭram naśyate laghu
translated: and a sound is heard in the sky, that kingdom is quickly destroyed.

original: svātyāṃ caitre yadā varṣaṃ niruddhaṃ vātavarṣitaṃ/
analyzed: caitre yadā varṣam niruddham vāta varṣitam
translated: If it rains in the constellation Svati in Chaitra, and a wind and rain are obstructed,

original: dṛśyataindradhanuḥ kṣipraṃ nagaraṃ tad vinaśyate//
analyzed: kṣipram nagaram tat vinaśyate
translated: and Indra's rainbow is seen, that city is quickly destroyed.

original: bharaṇyāṃ jyeṣṭhamāse tu śabda /
analyzed: jyeṣṭha māse tu śabda
translated: In the constellation Bharani in the month of Jyeshtha,

original: uttarato bhavet/
analyzed: uttaratas bhavet
translated: a sound will come from the north.

original: pītavarṇaṃ tadākāśaṃ paracakrabhayaṃ bhavet//
analyzed: tad ākāśam para cakra bhayam bhavet
translated: Then the sky will be yellow in color, and there will be danger from a foreign army.

original: āṣāḍhe māsi puṣye atha dṛśyante vyogni vidyutaḥ/
analyzed: māsi puṣye atha dṛśyante vyogni vidyutaḥ
translated: If lightning is seen in the constellation Pushya in the month of Ashadha,

original: satṛṇaudakavṛṣṭibhis tribhāgaṃ mucyate prajā//
analyzed: tri bhāgam mucyate prajā
translated: with rain of grass and water, one-third of the people are saved.

original: śrāvaṇe tu yadā mūle bahu devaḥ pravarṣati/
analyzed: tu yadā mūle bahu devaḥ pravarṣati
translated: If it rains much in the constellation Mula in Shravana,

original: dṛśyataindradhanus tatra kṣatriyāṇāṃ mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: tatra kṣatriyāṇām mahat bhayam
translated: and Indra's rainbow is seen there, there is great danger for the Kshatriyas.

original: māse bhādrapade yatra nirghātaḥ patati kṣitau/
analyzed: bhādrapade yatra nirghātaḥ patati kṣitau
translated: If a whirlwind falls on the ground in the month of Bhadrapada,

original: sukṛcchrā vāyavo vānti mahadrogabhayaṃ tadā//
analyzed: vāyavaḥ vānti mahat roga bhayam tadā
translated: and winds blow with difficulty, there is great danger of disease then.

original: māse bhādrapade puṣye vidigbhyo niścared dhvaniḥ/
translated: In the month of Bhadrapada, when the Pushya constellation is in the south-east direction, a sound will come from the south-west.

original: kṣatriyaḥ kupyate kṣipraṃ vipakṣā tu datā prajā//
analyzed: kupyate kṣipram vipakṣā tu datā prajā
translated: The Kshatriyas will quickly become angry, and the subjects will be afflicted with disease.

original: bharaṇyām aśvayuje śabda upariṣṭād bhaved yadi/
analyzed: aśvayuje śabdaḥ upariṣṭāt bhavet yadi
translated: If a sound occurs above in the Ashvayuja month when the Bharani constellation is in the south-west,

original: satṛṇaṃ cautsṛjet pāṃśuṃ tāpasānāṃ mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: ca utsṛjet pāṃśum tāpasānām mahat bhayam
translated: sand will be scattered with grass, and there will be great fear for the ascetics.

original: kārttike tu yadāārdrāyāṃ śabdaḥ śrayeta bhairavaḥ/
analyzed: tu yadā ārdrāyām śabdaḥ śrayeta bhairavaḥ
translated: If a terrible sound is heard in the Kartika month when the Ardra constellation is in the south-east,

original: catuṣpadaḥ kārṣakāṇāṃ mṛtyuṃ tatra vinirdiśet//
analyzed: kārṣakāṇām mṛtyum tatra vinirdiśet
translated: one should predict death there for the farmers with four legs.

original: mārgaśīrṣe dhaniṣṭhāyāṃ tūryaśabdo ambare bhavet/p /
analyzed: dhaniṣṭhāyām tūrya śabdaḥ ambare
translated: If a sound of musical instruments occurs in the sky in the Margasirsha month when the Dhanishtha constellation is in the south-east,

original: vātāturas tadā rāṣṭre vyādhir bhavati dāruṇaḥ//
analyzed: tadā rāṣṭre vyādhiḥ bhavati dāruṇaḥ
translated: then in the country there will be a terrible disease caused by wind.

original: pauṣamāse yadā svātyāṃ śabdo bhavati bhairavaḥ/🔽abhīkṣṇaṃ vidyud ākāśe paṇḍitānāṃ mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: yadā svātyām śabdaḥ bhavati bhairavaḥ  vidyut ākāśe paṇḍitānām mahat bhayam
translated: If a terrible sound occurs in the Pausha month when the Svati constellation is in the south-east,🔽and lightning frequently flashes in the sky, the wise ones will have great fear.

original: māghe śukle tu nirghāto nityaṃ śāmyed vasundharāṃ/
analyzed: śukle tu nirghātaḥ nityam śāmyet vasundharām
translated: If there is a loud noise in the bright fortnight of Magha when the Purva Ashadha constellation is in the south-east,

original: jānīyāt tṛtīye varṣe sakalaṃ rāṣṭravibhramaṃ//
analyzed: tṛtīye varṣe sakalam rāṣṭra vibhramam
translated: one should know that in the third year there will be confusion in the entire country.

original: jyeṣṭhāyāṃ phālgune māse kṛṣṇavāyuḥ samākulaḥ/
analyzed: phālgune māse kṛṣṇa vāyuḥ samākulaḥ
translated: If in the Jyeshtha month when the Purva Ashadha constellation is in the south-east, a black wind is agitated,

original: abhīkṣṇaṃ kampate bhūmir brahmacāribhayaṃ tadā//
analyzed: kampate bhūmiḥ brahmacāri bhayam tadā
translated: and the earth frequently trembles, then there is fear for the celibate students.

original: pūrvabhādrapadāyāṃ tu caitre kampet kṣitir divā/
analyzed: tu caitre kampet kṣitiḥ divā
translated: If the earth trembles during the day in the month of Chaitra, in the asterism of Purva Bhadrapada,

original: tasmin varṣe ca tadrāṣṭre parasainyān mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: varṣe ca tad rāṣṭre para sainyāt mahat bhayam
translated: then in that year, there is great fear of foreign armies in that country.

original: pūrvāyāṃ ced āṣāḍhāyāṃ rātrau caitre ca niścalet/
analyzed: ced āṣāḍhāyām rātrau caitre ca niścalet
translated: If it trembles at night in the month of Chaitra, in the asterism of Purva Ashadha,

original: asibhir hanyate rājā hanyate ca mahājanaḥ//
analyzed: hanyate rājā hanyate ca mahājanaḥ
translated: then the king is killed by swords and the common people are killed.

original: vaiśākhe kampitā bhūmiḥ kṛṣṇapakṣe hy abhīkṣṇaśaḥ/
analyzed: kampitā bhūmiḥ kṛṣṇa pakṣe hi abhīkṣṇaśas
translated: If the earth trembles frequently in the dark fortnight of the month of Vaishakha,

original: anāvṛṣṭyā tu durbhikṣaṃ māsān ṣaṭ tatra nirdiśet//
analyzed: tu durbhikṣam māsān ṣaṭ tatra nirdiśet
translated: then due to drought, famine should be predicted there for six months.

original: jyeṣṭhe māse bharaṇyāṃ tu divā kamped vasundharā/
translated: If the earth trembles during the day in the month of Jyeshtha, in the asterism of Bharani,

original: vidyād yodhasahasrāṇāṃ mahī pāsyati śoṇitaṃ//
analyzed: yodha sahasrāṇām mahī pāsyati śoṇitam
translated: then one should know that the earth will drink the blood of thousands of warriors.

original: jyeṣṭhe māse yadā mūle rātrau bhūmiḥ prakampate/
analyzed: māse yadā mūle rātrau bhūmiḥ prakampate
translated: If the earth trembles at night in the month of Jyeshtha, in the asterism of Mula,

original: pratyanto vadhyate rājā rāṣṭre baliṃ samādiśet//🔽āṣāḍhe kampate bhūmiḥ puṣyanakṣatrasaṃsthite/
analyzed: vadhyate rājā rāṣṭre balim samādiśet  kampate bhūmiḥ puṣya nakṣatra saṃsthite
translated: then the border king is killed and taxes should be collected in the country.🔽If the earth trembles in the month of Ashadha, in the asterism of Pushya,

original: śasyaṃ vinaśyate tatra kalikarma ca jāyate//
analyzed: vinaśyate tatra kali karma ca jāyate
translated: then the crops are destroyed there and quarrels arise.

original: prakampante yadā caityā /
analyzed: yadā caityā
translated: If the stupas tremble

original: ādrāyāṃ vā maghāsu vā/
analyzed: ādrāyām vā maghāsu vā
translated: in the asterisms of Ashlesha, Magha,

original: jvaleyuḥ prapateyur vā naśyed rāṣṭraṃ tadā laghu//
analyzed: prapateyuḥ vā naśyet rāṣṭram tadā laghu
translated: or if they burn or fall down, then the country is quickly destroyed.

original: caityā yatra prakampante hasanti ca namanti ca/
analyzed: yatra prakampante hasanti ca namanti ca
translated: Where the shrines tremble, laugh, and bow down,

original: sarāṣṭraḥ kṣitipas tatra na cirān nāśam arcchati//
analyzed: kṣitipaḥ tatra na cirāt nāśam arcchati
translated: The king of that country along with his kingdom perishes before long.

original: śrāvaṇe kampate bhūmiḥ pūrvabhādrapadāsthite/p /
analyzed: kampate bhūmiḥ
translated: If the earth trembles in the month of Śrāvaṇa, when the constellation is Hasta,

original: sadā parājito rājā caurarāṣṭre ca vadhyate//
analyzed: parājitaḥ rājā caura rāṣṭre ca vadhyate
translated: The king is always defeated, and the country is destroyed by thieves.

original: kārttike kṣitikampena yadā caityaṃ viśīryate/
analyzed: kṣiti kampena yadā caityam viśīryate
translated: If the earth trembles in the month of Kārttika, and the shrine is destroyed,

original: dvāraṃ vā nagarasyaatha bhūyiṣṭhaṃ naśyate prajā//
analyzed: vā nagarasya atha bhūyiṣṭham naśyate prajā
translated: Or if the gate of the city is destroyed, the people are mostly destroyed.

original: vāme vā kaṣīṇe candroḥ śṛṅge tiṣṭhed bṛhaspatiḥ/
analyzed: vā kaṣīṇe candroḥ śṛṅge tiṣṭhet bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: If Jupiter is in the left horn of the waning moon,

original: mahābhogā vinaśyeyuḥ prakāśāḥ pṛthivīśvarāḥ//
analyzed: vinaśyeyuḥ prakāśāḥ pṛthivīśvarāḥ
translated: The kings who are famous will perish.

original: sūryācandramasoḥ sṛṅge lohitaaṅgo yadā aruhet/
analyzed: sṛṅge lohita aṅgaḥ yadā aruhet
translated: If Mars ascends the horns of the sun and the moon,

original: krūraakṣamantrikāt pīḍāṃ pratyantānāṃ vinirdiśet//
analyzed: pīḍām pratyantānām vinirdiśet
translated: One should predict affliction from cruel ministers to the border countries.

original: śanaiścaro yadā śṛṅge somasyaabhiruhet tadā/
analyzed: yadā śṛṅge somasya abhiruhet tadā
translated: If Saturn ascends the horn of the moon,

original: jñeyaṃ rogabhayaṃ ghoraṃ durbhikṣaṃ caatra nirdiśet//
analyzed: roga bhayam ghoram durbhikṣam ca atra nirdiśet
translated: One should know that there will be terrible fear of disease and famine.

original: rāhuṇā nigṛhītas tu caullkayā hanyate śaśī/
analyzed: nigṛhītaḥ tu caullkayā hanyate śaśī
translated: If the moon is eclipsed by Rāhu, or is struck by a comet,

original: ṣaṇmāsaabhyantarāt tatra rājño vyasanam ādiśet//
analyzed: tatra rājñaḥ vyasanam ādiśet
translated: One should predict misfortune to the king within six months.

original: yasya caivaatha nakṣatre śaśī sūryo vigṛhyate/
analyzed: ca eva atha nakṣatre śaśī sūryaḥ vigṛhyate
translated: And if the moon is seized by Rāhu in the asterism of a person,

original: rāhuṇā kṣitiyo rājyaiḥ saha pīḍām avāpnuyāt//
analyzed: rājyaiḥ saha pīḍām avāpnuyāt
translated: he will suffer along with the kings of the earth.

original: rājño vai caatha nakṣatre candraṃ ketur yadā viśet/
analyzed: vai ca atha nakṣatre candram ketuḥ yadā viśet
translated: If the moon is eclipsed by Ketu in the asterism of the king,

original: pratyantarājabhiḥ sārdhaṃ śastrām ūrcchāṃ vinirdiśet//
analyzed: sārdham śastrām ūrcchām vinirdiśet
translated: one should predict an uprising of weapons along with the frontier kings.

original: candramadhyagataḥ śukraḥ phālgunyātha maghā yadā/
analyzed: śukraḥ phālgunyā atha maghāḥ yadā
translated: If Venus is in the middle of the moon, or if the moon enters Maghā in Phālguna,

original: sarvadhānyāni śuṣyeyus tadā rogaṃ vinirdiśet//
analyzed: śuṣyeyuḥ tadā rogam vinirdiśet
translated: then all grains will dry up, and one should predict a disease then.

original: bṛhaspatiś ca śukraś ca lohitaaṅgaḥ śanaiścaraḥ/
analyzed: ca śukraḥ ca lohitaaṅgaḥ śanaiścaraḥ
translated: If Jupiter, Venus, Mars, and Saturn

original: likhyanti somaśṛṅgasya tadā vidyān mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: somaśṛṅgasya tadā vidyāt mahat bhayam
translated: are seen on the peak of the moon, then one should know of a great danger.

original: dhūmaketur mahābhāgaḥ puṣyam āruhya tiṣṭhati/
analyzed: mahābhāgaḥ puṣyam āruhya tiṣṭhati
translated: If the greatly fortunate comet rises and remains in Puṣya,

original: caturdiśaṃ tadā viṃcyāt paracakraiḥ parābhavaṃ//
analyzed: tadā viṃcyāt para cakraiḥ parābhavam
translated: then one should predict defeat by foreign armies from all directions.

original: maghāyāṃ lohitaaṅgo vā śravaṇe vā bṛhaspatiḥ/
analyzed: lohita aṅgaḥ vā śravaṇe vā bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: If Mars is in Maghā or Jupiter in Śravaṇa,

original: tiṣṭhet saṃvatsaratrīṇi bhayaṃ vidyāt samāgaraṃ//
analyzed: saṃvatsara trīṇi bhayam vidyāt sa māgaram
translated: one should know of a danger from the north for three years.

original: tiṣṭhec chukro atha rohiṇyāṃ jyeṣṭhe māse kathaṃcana/
analyzed: chukraḥ atha rohiṇyām jyeṣṭhe māse kathaṃcana
translated: If Venus somehow remains in Rohiṇī in the month of Jyeṣṭha,

original: vyākuryān niyatam atra kṣatriyāṇāṃ mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: niyatam atra kṣatriyāṇām mahat bhayam
translated: then one should certainly predict a great danger to the Kṣatriyas.

original: viśākhāyāṃ samīpasthau bṛhaspatiśanaiścarau/p /
analyzed: samīpa sthau
translated: If Brihaspati and Shani are in conjunction with Vishakha,

original: somo vā raviṇā sārdhaṃ paracakrabhayaṃ tadā//
analyzed: vā raviṇā sārdham para cakra bhayam tadā
translated: then there is danger from foreign armies, or the Moon with the Sun.

original: kākāḥ śyenāś ca bṛdhrāś ca vaseyuḥ sahitā mudā/
analyzed: śyenāḥ ca bṛdhrāḥ ca vaseyuḥ sahitāḥ mudā
translated: If crows, hawks and vultures live together joyfully,

original: maithunaṃ vāritaṃ veyuḥ paraiḥ saha raṇas tadā//
analyzed: vāritam veyuḥ paraiḥ saha raṇaḥ tadā
translated: then there will be war with enemies, and copulation will be forbidden.

original: śyeno hastinivāse vā /
analyzed: hasti nivāse vā
translated: If a hawk perches on an elephant,

original: abhirohet punaḥ punaḥ/
analyzed: abhirohet punar punar
translated: and mounts it again and again,

original: paracakreṇa yuddhaṃ tu bhavec caapi punaḥ punaḥ/ /
analyzed: yuddham tu bhavet ca api punar punar
translated: then there will be a battle with a foreign army, again and again.

original: kanyā prasūyate yatra caturhastā catustanī/
analyzed: prasūyate yatra catur hastā catu stanī
translated: If a virgin gives birth to a child with four hands and four breasts,

original: strīṇām eva bhavet tatra maraṇaṃ hy atidāruṇaṃ//
analyzed: eva bhavet tatra maraṇam hi ati dāruṇam
translated: then there will be a terrible death of women there.

original: garbhasthā dārakā yatra hasanti ca vadanti ca/
analyzed: dārakāḥ yatra hasanti ca vadanti ca
translated: If children in the womb laugh and talk there,

original: tasya deśasya jānīyād vināśaṃ samupasthitaṃ//
analyzed: deśasya jānīyāt vināśam samupasthitam
translated: one should know that the destruction of that country is imminent.

original: ekapādāṃ stripādāṃś ca caturaṅgāṃs tathāeva ca/
analyzed: stri pādān ca catur aṅgān tathā eva ca
translated: If women give birth to one-legged, three-legged, and four-legged children,

original: nāryo yatra prasūyante rājño vyasanam ādiśet//
analyzed: yatra prasūyante rājñaḥ vyasanam ādiśet
translated: one should predict misfortune for the king.

original: sūyante vikṛtān garbhān santānān bhayavyañjanān/
analyzed: vikṛtān garbhān santānān bhaya vyañjanān
translated: If women in a country give birth to deformed fetuses, offspring indicating danger,

original: pramadā yatra deśe tu rājā tatra vinaśyati//
analyzed: yatra deśe tu rājā tatra vinaśyati
translated: the king will perish there.

original: laghuhastaśīrṣamukhān mānuṣaṃ kāyam aśritān/
analyzed: mānuṣam kāyam aśritān
translated: And men with short hands, heads and faces, and with human bodies,

original: pramadā yatra sūyante rāṣṭraṃ tatra vinaśyati//
analyzed: yatra sūyante rāṣṭram tatra vinaśyati
translated: Where women are born, there the kingdom perishes.

original: kharāś ca mahiṣāś caapi paśavo atha tathāvidhāḥ/
analyzed: ca mahiṣāḥ ca api paśavaḥ atha tathāvidhāḥ
translated: And donkeys and buffaloes and other animals,

original: dvitriśīrṣāḥ prasūyante deśe yatra sa naśyati//
analyzed: prasūyante deśe yatra sa naśyati
translated: With two or three heads, are born there, where the country perishes.

original: śṛgālaśvānamakarahayarūpāś ca mānavāḥ/
analyzed: ca mānavāḥ
translated: And men in the form of jackals, dogs and crocodiles,

original: jāyante yatra deśe tu sa deśo laghu naśyati//
analyzed: yatra deśe tu sa deśaḥ laghu naśyati
translated: Are born in that country, and that country quickly perishes.

original: pādāv ubhau yadā vaiśyā gurviṇī saṃprasūyate/
analyzed: ubhau yadā vaiśyā gurviṇī saṃprasūyate
translated: When a pregnant Vaishya gives birth to both feet,

original: deśasya vilayaṃ brūyāt paracakreṇa dāruṇaṃ//
analyzed: vilayam brūyāt para cakreṇa dāruṇam
translated: One should predict the destruction of the country by a terrible foreign army.

original: pūrvārdhaḥ pakṣinarayor garbho yatra prasūyate/
analyzed: pakṣi narayoḥ garbhaḥ yatra prasūyate
translated: Where a bird or a man gives birth to a half-grown embryo,

original: rājā vā rājāmātyo vā saha deśena naśyati//
analyzed: vā rāja amātyaḥ vā saha deśena naśyati
translated: Either the king or the king's minister perishes along with the country.

original: kumbhāṇḍo jāyate yatra dvisukho atha caturmukhaḥ/p /
analyzed: jāyate yatra dvi sukhaḥ atha
translated: Where a Kumbhanda is born with two or four faces,

original: trinetras trimukho vāapi vidyāt tatra mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: tri mukhaḥ vā api vidyāt tatra mahat bhayam
translated: With three eyes and three faces, one should know great danger there.

original: saukareṇa tu vakreṇa śarīraṃ mānuṣaṃ yadi/
analyzed: tu vakreṇa śarīram mānuṣam yadi
translated: If a human body is born with a crooked pig's face,

original: sūtaṃ caturdiśaṃ rāṣṭraṃ hanyāt tatra na saṃśayaḥ//
analyzed: caturdiśam rāṣṭram hanyāt tatra na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that the kingdom in the four directions will be destroyed.

original: ādityasya tu rūpeṇa mānuṣo yatra jāyate/
analyzed: tu rūpeṇa mānuṣaḥ yatra jāyate
translated: Where a human is born in the form of the sun,

original: vibhramāt sakalaṃ rāṣṭraṃ vināśam upagacchati//
analyzed: sakalam rāṣṭram vināśam upagacchati
translated: through delusion, the entire kingdom meets with destruction.

original: uttānaśāyī bālas tu deśaṃ yatra dvijottamaḥ/
analyzed: bālaḥ tu deśam yatra dvijottamaḥ
translated: A child lying on its back, in a place where an excellent Brahmin is seen,

original: dṛṣṭaḥ pravyāharan vedān kṣipraṃ deśo vinaśyatei//
analyzed: pravyāharan vedān kṣipram deśaḥ vinaśyatei
translated: reciting the Vedas, that country quickly perishes.

original: kukṣiṃ bhitvā yadā bālo garbhān niṣkramate svayaṃ/
analyzed: bhitvā yadā bālaḥ garbhāt niṣkramate svayam
translated: When a child, having pierced its belly, comes out of the womb on its own,

original: atrāṇāṃ mātaraṃ kṛtvā sa deśo naśyate laghu//🔽garbhasthāḥ sūkarā /
analyzed: mātaram kṛtvā sa deśaḥ naśyate laghu  sūkarā
translated: making its mother defenseless, that country is quickly destroyed.

original: uṣṭrāḥ sarpāś ca śakunis tathā/
analyzed: uṣṭrāḥ sarpāḥ ca śakuniḥ tathā
translated: Pigs, camels, snakes, and birds are born from the wombs of women,

original: strīṇāṃ garbhāt prasūyante deśe tu bhayam ādiśet//
analyzed: garbhāt prasūyante deśe tu bhayam ādiśet
translated: in that country one should predict danger.

original: pauruṣaṃ gārdabhaṃ caatha saukaraṃ caardhavigrahaṃ/
analyzed: gārdabham ca atha saukaram ca ardha vigraham
translated: When cows give birth to half-formed creatures, having the form of a man, an ass, or a pig,

original: gāvo yatra prasūyante nirdiśed bhayam āgataṃ//
analyzed: yatra prasūyante nirdiśet bhayam āgatam
translated: one should predict the arrival of danger.

original: nārī gṛhṇāti garbhaṃ vā /
analyzed: gṛhṇāti garbham vā
translated: A woman conceives a fetus,

original: adṛṣṭastanarūpiṇī/
analyzed: adṛṣṭa stana rūpiṇī
translated: which has not seen its mother's breasts,

original: vināśaṃ tasya deśasya sanṛpasya vinirdiśet//
analyzed: tasya deśasya sa nṛpasya vinirdiśet
translated: one should predict the destruction of that country, along with its king.

original: jaṭī dīrghanakho yatra sukṛṣṇaḥ paruṣacchaviḥ/
analyzed: dīrgha nakhaḥ yatra su kṛṣṇaḥ paruṣa chaviḥ
translated: Where a person with matted hair, long nails, very dark, and rough skin,

original: sajano jāyate yatra rāṣṭraṃ sādhipatiṃ dahet//
analyzed: jāyate yatra rāṣṭram sa adhipatim dahet
translated: is born, along with his people, it will burn the country with its ruler.

original: agrīvā dantasahitā jāyante yatra bālakāḥ/
analyzed: danta sahitāḥ jāyante yatra bālakāḥ
translated: Where children are born without necks, along with teeth,

original: śuṣyeta sakalaṃ śasyaṃ janaś ca vilayaṃ vrajet/
analyzed: sakalam śasyam janaḥ ca vilayam vrajet
translated: all crops would wither and people would perish.

original: ekabāhuraśīrṣo atha garbho yatra prasūyate/
analyzed: atha garbhaḥ yatra prasūyate
translated: If a one-armed or headless embryo is born there,

original: svayaṃ kṣubhyeta tadrāṣṭraṃ vinaśyeta na saṃśayaḥ//
analyzed: kṣubhyeta tat rāṣṭram vinaśyeta na saṃśayaḥ
translated: that kingdom would certainly be agitated and destroyed.

original: phale phalaṃ yadā paśyet puṣpe vā puṣpam āśritaṃ/
analyzed: phalam yadā paśyet puṣpe vā puṣpam āśritam
translated: If a fruit is seen on a fruit, or a flower is seen on a flower,

original: garbhāḥ sraveyur nārīṇāṃ yuvarājaś ca vadhyate//
analyzed: sraveyuḥ nārīṇām yuvarājaḥ ca vadhyate
translated: the wombs of women would miscarry and the prince would be killed.

original: akāle pādapā yatra puṣpyanti ca phalanti ca/p /
analyzed: pādapāḥ yatra puṣpyanti ca phalanti
translated: If trees bloom and bear fruit out of season,

original: latā gulmo atha vallī vā deśe tatra bhayaṃ bhavet//
analyzed: gulmaḥ atha vallī vā deśe tatra bhayam bhavet
translated: or creepers, shrubs, or vines in that country, fear would arise there.

original: vṛkṣaupariṣṭāt paśyed vā sravantam ātmaśoṇitam/
analyzed: paśyet vā sravantam ātma śoṇitam
translated: If one sees blood flowing from above a tree,

original: kūjamānaṃ pataṅgaṃ vā tadā vidyān mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: pataṅgam vā tadā vidyāt mahat bhayam
translated: or a crying bird falling, then one should know it is a great danger.

original: vṛkṣāṇāṃ maṇḍapānāṃ vā chāyā na parivartate/
analyzed: maṇḍapānām vā chāyā na parivartate
translated: If the shade of trees or pavilions does not change,

original: caturvarṇabhayaṃ tatra kalikarma ca jāyate//
analyzed: tatra kali karma ca jāyate
translated: then there is danger to the four social classes and quarrels arise there.

original: puṣpyegruḥ pādapā yatra vividhāḥ puṣpajātayaḥ/
analyzed: pādapāḥ yatra vividhāḥ puṣpa jātayaḥ
translated: If various kinds of flowers bloom on trees,

original: kalpavṛkṣaprakṛtayas tato vidyān mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: tatas vidyāt mahat bhayam
translated: with the nature of wish-fulfilling trees, then one should know it is a great danger.

original: anāvartaṃ yadā puṣpaṃ phalaṃ caapi pradṛśyate/
analyzed: yadā puṣpam phalam ca api pradṛśyate
translated: If a flower or fruit is seen without returning,

original: vināśaṃ tasya deśasya durbhikṣaṃ kalahaṃ vadet//
analyzed: tasya deśasya durbhikṣam kalaham vadet
translated: and foretell the destruction of that country, famine and quarrels.

original: sthānāsthānaṃ gatā vṛkṣā dṛśyeyur yatra kutracit/
analyzed: gatāḥ vṛkṣāḥ dṛśyeyuḥ yatra kutracid
translated: If trees, whether standing in their proper place or not, are seen anywhere,

original: pūrvapratiṣṭhitā rājā na cireṇa vicālyate//
analyzed: rājā na cireṇa vicālyate
translated: the king who is already established will soon be displaced.

original: daivaasuraṃ ca saṃgrāmaṃ paśyed adbhutadarśanaṃ/
analyzed: ca saṃgrāmam paśyet adbhuta darśanam
translated: If one sees a battle between gods and demons, of wonderful appearance,

original: śastraṃ mūrcchayate tatra taskaraiś caapi pūrvavat//
analyzed: mūrcchayate tatra taskaraiḥ ca api pūrvavat
translated: weapons will fall there, and thieves will act as before.

original: kampate rudate śāstā gacchan vā yatra dṛśyate/
analyzed: rudate śāstā gacchan vā yatra dṛśyate
translated: If the teacher is seen trembling, weeping, or going somewhere,

original: paracakrāt tadā vidyād atyarthaṃ tatprarājayaṃ//
analyzed: tadā vidyāt atyartham tat prarājayam
translated: one should know that there will be a great defeat from the enemy's army.

original: devatā yatra deśe tu nṛtyanti ca hasanti ca/
analyzed: yatra deśe tu nṛtyanti ca hasanti ca
translated: If the deities dance, laugh,

original: aśrūṇi pātayeyur vā tadā vidyān mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: pātayeyuḥ vā tadā vidyāt mahat bhayam
translated: or shed tears in a country, one should know that there is great danger.

original: devatā yatra krīḍanti jvalanti nimiṣanti vā/
analyzed: yatra krīḍanti jvalanti nimiṣanti vā
translated: If the deities play, shine, or wink,

original: caleyur athavā yatra kṣitipo anyo bhavet tadā//
analyzed: athavā yatra kṣitipaḥ anyaḥ bhavet tadā
translated: or move, then another king will arise.

original: śivaliṅaṃ yadā kamped gagane vāatha dṛśyate/
analyzed: yadā kampet gagane vā atha dṛśyate
translated: If the Śiva-linga trembles or is seen in the sky,

original: nimajjate dharaṇyāṃ vā dhruvaṃ rājavadho bhavet//
analyzed: dharaṇyām vā dhruvam rāja vadhaḥ bhavet
translated: or sinks into the ground, the king will certainly be killed.

original: pratimāḥ parivartante dhūmāyante rudanti ca/
analyzed: parivartante dhūmāyante rudanti ca
translated: If the images turn, smoke, or weep,

original: prasvidyeyuḥ pradhāveyur anyo rājā bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: pradhāveyuḥ anyaḥ rājā bhaviṣyati
translated: they would sweat and run away, thinking, ‘Another will be the king.’

original: acalo vā calet sthānāc calaṃ vāapy acalaṃ bhavet/
analyzed: vā calet sthānāt calam vā api acalam bhavet
translated: Or an immovable object would move from its place, or a moving object would become immovable.

original: amātyo hanti rājānaṃ kalahaṃ caatra nirdiśet//
analyzed: hanti rājānam kalaham ca atra nirdiśet
translated: A minister would kill the king, and in this case, one should predict a quarrel.

original: vamanti rudhiraṃ kanyā namante vā diśo daśa/p /
analyzed: rudhiram kanyāḥ namante vā diśaḥ
translated: If virgins vomit blood or bow to the ten directions,

original: ayuktā vā pravartante kṣatriyāṇāṃ mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: vā pravartante kṣatriyāṇām mahat bhayam
translated: or if they act improperly, there is great danger for the Kshatriyas.

original: varṣate kusumaṃ yatra raktavindum athaapi vā/
analyzed: kusumam yatra rakta vindum atha api vā
translated: If flowers rain there, or if they have red drops,

original: prāṇino vividhān vāapi vidyāc caurabhayaṃ tadā//
analyzed: vividhān vā api vidyāt caura bhayam tadā
translated: or if there are various living beings, one should know that there is danger from thieves at that time.

original: yūpāḥ purāṇā nigamā devaāgārāṇi caitiyāḥ/
analyzed: purāṇāḥ nigamāḥ devaāgārāṇi caitiyāḥ
translated: If ancient sacrificial posts, Vedas, temples, and shrines,

original: nagarāṇy atha dhūmyante kṣipraṃ rājā vinaśyati//
analyzed: atha dhūmyante kṣipram rājā vinaśyati
translated: and cities are seen to be smoking, the king will soon perish.

original: indur vā dīpavṛkso vā dīpo yatra na dīpyate/
analyzed: vā dīpa vṛksaḥ vā dīpaḥ yatra na dīpyate
translated: If the moon, a tree with lamps, or a lamp is not burning there,

original: rājyakāmaḥ kumāro vā kṣubhyed viṭapako api vā//
analyzed: kumāraḥ vā kṣubhyet viṭapakaḥ api vā
translated: a prince who desires the kingdom, or a tree, would be agitated.

original: antaḥpure yadā nīḍāṃ kurvate madhumakṣikāḥ/
analyzed: yadā nīḍām kurvate madhumakṣikāḥ
translated: If honeybees make a nest in the inner apartments,

original: astraṃ vāapi gṛhaṃ dahyād rājño vyasanam ādiśet//
analyzed: gṛham dahyāt rājñaḥ vyasanam ādiśet
translated: or if a weapon or a house is burnt, one should predict misfortune for the king.

original: pated antaḥpure vidyud vṛkṣe vāapy āśrame tathā/
analyzed: antaḥpure vidyut vṛkṣe vā api āśrame tathā
translated: If lightning strikes the inner apartments, or a tree or a hermitage,

original: puri caityacchāyāyāṃ vā rājārthe patitā hi sā//
analyzed: caitya chāyāyām vā rāja arthe patitā hi sā
translated: If a crow falls on the shadow of a shrine or for the sake of the king,

original: prākāre vā ayudhāgāre gopurāsthānakeṣu vā/
analyzed: vā ayudhāgāre gopura āsthānakeṣu vā
translated: on a rampart, in an armoury, or in a gate-tower or audience hall,

original: vāyasaḥ kurute nīḍaṃ saamātyo dhvaṃsate nṛpaḥ//
analyzed: kurute nīḍam sa amātyaḥ dhvaṃsate nṛpaḥ
translated: the king together with his ministers will perish.

original: anāhatebhyas tūryehbhyaḥ svayaṃ śabdo viniścaret/
analyzed: svayam śabdaḥ viniścaret
translated: If a sound issues forth from musical instruments that are not being played,

original: svacakrakṣobhadoṣeṇa sarvaṃ rāṣṭraṃ vilupyate//
analyzed: sarvam rāṣṭram vilupyate
translated: the entire kingdom will be destroyed due to the fault of the disturbance of one's own cycle.

original: māṃsaśoṇitavarṣaṃ vā patrapuṣpaphalāni vā/
analyzed: vā patra puṣpa phalāni vā
translated: If there falls a rain of flesh, blood, leaves, flowers, or fruits,

original: yadābhivarṣet tadvarṣaṃ cakrai rāṣṭraṃ vilupyate//
analyzed: tad varṣam cakraiḥ rāṣṭram vilupyate
translated: that rain will destroy the kingdom with its cycles.

original: madhuphāṇitapuṣpāṇi gandhavarṣāṇy athaapi vā/
analyzed: gandha varṣāṇi atha api vā
translated: If there falls a rain of honey, molasses, flowers, or perfumes,

original: diśo dāhāś ca dṛśyeyur māradurbhikṣalakṣaṇaṃ//
analyzed: dāhāḥ ca dṛśyeyuḥ māra durbhikṣa lakṣaṇam
translated: or if conflagrations are seen in the directions, one should know that it is a sign of famine and misfortune.

original: meghaḥ samantato garjed upavarṣet sacātakaṃ/🔽śoṇitaṃ sakarakaṃ syāt tadā vidyāt parād bhayaṃ//
analyzed: samantataḥ garjet upavarṣet sa cātakam  sa karakam syāt tadā vidyāt parāt bhayam
translated: If a cloud thunders all around and rains together with the chātaka bird,🔽and if there is blood with hail, then one should know that there is danger from the enemy.

original: vidyuc ca patate ghorā karakāṇāṃ ca varṣaṇaṃ/
analyzed: ca patate ghorā karakāṇām ca varṣaṇam
translated: If lightning falls terribly and hail falls,

original: gandharvanagaraṃ caatha dṛṣṭvā vidyān mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: ca atha dṛṣṭvā vidyāt mahat bhayam
translated: and if a gandharva city is seen, one should know that there is great danger.

original: śaśī śoṇitasaṃkāśo madhye kṛṣṇo vivarṇavān/p /
analyzed: śoṇita saṃkāśaḥ madhye kṛṣṇaḥ
translated: The moon is like blood, black in the middle, pale.

original: sāmantakena pīḍyate vidyād rāṣṭre mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: pīḍyate vidyāt rāṣṭre mahat bhayam
translated: If it is afflicted by the neighbouring planets, one should know that there is great danger in the kingdom.

original: pradīpitaagnisaṃkāśo yadā dṛśyeta candramāḥ/
analyzed: yadā dṛśyeta candramāḥ
translated: When the moon is seen to be like a burning fire,

original: gaganaṃ dahyate tatra lokapīḍā jvareṇa ca//
analyzed: dahyate tatra loka pīḍā jvareṇa ca
translated: then the sky is burnt, and the world is afflicted by fever.

original: yadā gairikasaṃkāśaḥ kṣipram evaupaśāmyati/
analyzed: gairika saṃkāśaḥ kṣipram
translated: When it (the moon) is like red chalk, and quickly subsides,

original: varṣaṇasyaāgamo vidyād yadi vāyuḥ pravāyate//
analyzed: vidyāt yadi vāyuḥ pravāyate
translated: one should know that if the wind blows, there will be a coming of rain.

original: sandhyāyāṃ dhūmravarṇāyāṃ dṛśyetenduś ca bhāskaraḥ/
analyzed: dhūmra varṇāyām dṛśyeta induḥ ca bhāskaraḥ
translated: When the evening is smoky, and the moon and the sun are seen,

original: vicchinno brahmarūpeṇa varṣaṃ tatra vinirdiśed//
analyzed: brahma rūpeṇa varṣam tatra vinirdiśet
translated: one should predict rain there in the form of Brahma, when it is interrupted.

original: nāpsu majjati naapy agnau pūrvavac ca na dṛśyate/
analyzed: majjati na api agnau pūrvavat ca na dṛśyate
translated: If it (the moon) does not sink in water, nor is it seen as before in fire,

original: agnir utpatsyate tatra koṣṭhaāgāraṃ daheta saḥ//
analyzed: utpatsyate tatra koṣṭhaāgāram daheta saḥ
translated: fire will arise there, and it will burn the storehouse.

original: dhvajaagre vāyaso yatra lambapakṣo vidhāvate/
analyzed: vāyasaḥ yatra lamba pakṣaḥ vidhāvate
translated: Where a crow with drooping wings flies at the top of a flag,

original: udakaṃ saṃharet kṣipram agnitaḥ sumahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: saṃharet kṣipram agnitaḥ su mahat bhayam
translated: one should quickly collect water, for there is great danger from fire.

original: jalaṃ jājvalyamānaṃ tu matsyo nirdahati svayaṃ/
analyzed: jājvalyamānam tu matsyaḥ nirdahati svayam
translated: When water is burning, a fish itself is burnt.

original: anāvṛṣṭiṃ tadā brūyād durbhikṣaṃ ca mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: tadā brūyāt durbhikṣam ca mahat bhayam
translated: Then one should speak of drought, and great danger of famine.

original: puradvāre yadāāgacchet svayam āraṇyako mṛgaḥ/
analyzed: yadā āgacchet svayam āraṇyakaḥ mṛgaḥ
translated: When a wild deer itself comes to the city gate,

original: cakradvaye api durbhikṣaṃ rāṣṭre rogaṃ ca nirdiśet//
analyzed: api durbhikṣam rāṣṭre rogam ca nirdiśet
translated: in both the wheels, famine and disease in the country should be predicted.

original: triśīrṣaḥ pañcaśīrṣo vā yadā sarpo atha dṛśyate/
analyzed: pañca śīrṣaḥ vā yadā sarpaḥ atha dṛśyate
translated: When a snake with three or five heads is seen,

original: anāvṛṣṭyā tadā vidyāt sarvaśasyaṃ vinaśyati//
analyzed: tadā vidyāt sarva śasyam vinaśyati
translated: then one should know it to be a drought, and all crops will be destroyed.

original: kuśūlo yatra dṛśyeta kampayan tu vasundharāṃ/
analyzed: yatra dṛśyeta kampayan tu vasundharām
translated: Where a threshing floor is seen shaking the earth,

original: koṣṭhaāgārāṇi naśyeyur ye caanye dhanasañcayāḥ/
analyzed: naśyeyuḥ ye ca anye dhana sañcayāḥ
translated: granaries and other stores of wealth will be destroyed.

original: sarpa / udyataśīrṣas tu yudhyate puruṣaiḥ saha/
analyzed: udyata śīrṣaḥ tu yudhyate puruṣaiḥ saha
translated: A snake with its head raised fights with men.

original: cakradvayād rogataś ca vidyāt tatra mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: rogataḥ ca vidyāt tatra mahat bhayam
translated: From both wheels and disease, one should know there is great danger there.

original: bila / ekatra bahavaḥ sarpāḥ supariveṣṭitāḥ/
analyzed: ekatra bahavaḥ sarpāḥ su pariveṣṭitāḥ
translated: In one place, many snakes are well-wrapped in a hole.

original: śastramṛtyuṃ tadā vidyāt kṣatriyāṇāṃ mahadbhayaṃ//
analyzed: tadā vidyāt kṣatriyāṇām mahat bhayam
translated: Then one should know it to be a death by weapons, and great danger to the Kshatriyas.

original: niścaranty avadhānena khaḍgāḥ prajvalitā yadā/
analyzed: avadhānena khaḍgāḥ prajvalitāḥ yadā
translated: When swords, blazing with light, issue forth with care,

original: tatas taṃ na cirāt paśyet saṃgrāmaṃ pratyupasthitaṃ//
analyzed: tam na cirāt paśyet saṃgrāmam pratyupasthitam
translated: then one should soon see that war has arrived.

original: kākaḥ śyenaś ca gṛdhro vā yasya nīyeta mūrdhani/
analyzed: śyenaḥ ca gṛdhraḥ vā yasya nīyeta
translated: If a crow, hawk, or vulture is carried on one's head,

original: ṣaṇmāsaabhyantare rājā mriyate sapurohitaḥ//
analyzed: rājā mriyate sa purohitaḥ
translated: within six months the king dies with his priest.

original: prāsādāś ca prakampante śaraṇāni gṛhāṇi ca/
analyzed: ca prakampante śaraṇāni gṛhāṇi ca
translated: Palaces and abodes and houses tremble,

original: mahābalaṃ ca vadhyeta rāṣṭrasya rājapālakaḥ//
analyzed: ca vadhyeta rāṣṭrasya rāja pālakaḥ
translated: and the protector of the kingdom, the mighty one, would be killed.

original: vajrauddhṛtā diśaḥ sarvāḥ kṛṣṇapakṣe caturdiśaṃ/
analyzed: diśaḥ sarvāḥ kṛṣṇapakṣe caturdiśam
translated: The quarters, as if struck by thunder, would rain blood in all the four directions during the dark fortnight.

original: varṣeyuḥ śoṇitaṃ yatra kṣitipālo atra vadhyate//
analyzed: śoṇitam yatra kṣitipālaḥ atra vadhyate
translated: And the earth would drink the blood of thousands of princes, if the king were to be killed there.

original: sūryasyaudayakāle tu maholkā nipated yadā/
analyzed: tu mahā ulkā nipatet yadā
translated: If a great meteor were to fall at the time of sunrise,

original: rājaputrasahasrāṇāṃ bhūmiḥ pāsyāti śoṇitaṃ//
analyzed: bhūmiḥ pāsyāti śoṇitam
translated: the earth would drink the blood of thousands of princes.

original: vṛkṣāḥ sarpāḥ prakampeyur mucyeyus tvaco vā tathā/
analyzed: sarpāḥ prakampeyuḥ mucyeyuḥ tvacaḥ vā tathā
translated: If trees and serpents were to tremble, or if they were to cast off their skins,

original: sarvasmin eva rāṣṭre tu vidyāc chatrubhayaṃ mahat//
analyzed: eva rāṣṭre tu vidyāt śatru bhayam mahat
translated: one should know that there would be great danger from enemies in the entire kingdom.

original: dine hy ulkāprayuktir vā jvalantī yadi dṛśyate/
analyzed: hi ulkā prayuktiḥ vā jvalantī yadi dṛśyate
translated: If a flaming meteor is seen falling during the day,

original: raktautpādaṃ tadā vidyāt saṃgrāmaṃ bhīmadarśanaṃ//
analyzed: tadā vidyāt saṃgrāmam bhīma darśanam
translated: one should know that there would be a battle of terrible appearance, resulting in bloodshed.

original: asiṃ prajvalitaṃ paśyet tomaraṃ cakram eva ca/
analyzed: prajvalitam paśyet tomaram cakram eva ca
translated: If one sees a sword, a lance, or a discus blazing,

original: vidyāt paśyanti śastrāṇi saṃgrāmaṃ bhīmadarśanaṃ//
analyzed: paśyanti śastrāṇi saṃgrāmam bhīma darśanam
translated: one should know that one sees weapons, indicating a battle of terrible appearance.

original: dīrgham ucchvasate vā aśvaḥ aśrūṇi ca nipātayet/
analyzed: ucchvasate vā aśvaḥ aśrūṇi ca nipātayet
translated: If a horse breathes long, sheds tears,

original: pādena karṣate śīghraṃ yuddhe rājavadho dhruvaṃ//
analyzed: karṣate śīghram yuddhe rāja vadhaḥ dhruvam
translated: and quickly drags with its foot, the king's death in battle is certain.

original: kākaś ced gṛham āruhya hā putra / iti vāśati/
analyzed: ced gṛham āruhya hā putraḥ iti vāśati
translated: If a crow, having mounted a house, cries out Alas, my son!

original: sarvaḥ praṇaśyate deśo nagaragrāmakarvaṭaḥ//
analyzed: praṇaśyate deśaḥ nagara grāma karvaṭaḥ
translated: the whole country, the cities, villages and towns are destroyed.

original: anagnau jāyate dhūmaḥ sthale padmāni vā yadā/
analyzed: jāyate dhūmaḥ sthale padmāni vā yadā
translated: If smoke arises without fire, or if lotuses grow on dry land,

original: vināśaṃ tasya deśasya niyamāc chīghram ādiśet//
analyzed: tasya deśasya niyamāt śīghram ādiśet
translated: one should unhesitatingly predict the destruction of that country soon.

original: āravanti yadā ghoraṃ meghā vṛkamṛgās tathā/
analyzed: yadā ghoram meghāḥ vṛka mṛgāḥ tathā
translated: When the clouds and wolves and deer howl terribly,

original: vināśaṃ tasya deśasya vidyāc chīghram upasthitaṃ//🔽chinnasrotā bhaven nadyaś cirakāravahā / api/
analyzed: tasya deśasya vidyāt śīghram upasthitam  bhavet nadyaḥ cirakāra vahāḥ api
translated: one should know that the destruction of that country is imminent.🔽If the rivers have their currents cut off and flow slowly,

original: gṛhāḥ śūnyodakenaapi śuṣkās tatra bhayaṃ bhavet//
analyzed: śūnya udakena api śuṣkāḥ tatra bhayam bhavet
translated: and the houses are empty even with dry water, there is danger there.

original: pratisrotā yadā nadyo vahanty aprativāritāḥ/
analyzed: yadā nadyaḥ vahanti a prativāritāḥ
translated: When the rivers flow against the current, unchecked,

original: nityodvignā janapadā nirdiśec ca janakṣayaṃ//
analyzed: janapadāḥ nirdiśet ca jana kṣayam
translated: and the people are always anxious, one should predict the destruction of the people.

original: dhanūṃṣy ākṛZyamāṇāni dhūmāyanti jvalanti ca/p /
analyzed: ākṛśyamāṇāni dhūmāyanti jvalanti
translated: When bows, drawn, smoke and blaze,

original: anyad vāapi praharaṇaṃ parebhyo jāyate bhayaṃ//
analyzed: vā api praharaṇam parebhyaḥ jāyate bhayam
translated: or any other weapon, danger arises from the enemies.

original: mayūragrīvasaṃkāśaḥ pariveśo niśākare/
analyzed: pariveśaḥ niśākare
translated: If the halo around the moon is like the neck of a peacock,

original: vidyād rājasahasrāṇāṃ mahī pāsyati śoṇitaṃ//
analyzed: rāja sahasrāṇām mahī pāsyati śoṇitam
translated: one should know that the earth will drink the blood of thousands of kings.

original: narāṇāṃ pramadānāṃ ca ratiharṣo na jāyate/
analyzed: pramadānām ca rati harṣaḥ na jāyate
translated: If there is no joy or delight in men and women,

original: sarvatra śokacintā vā mahat tatra bhayaṃ bhavet//
analyzed: śoka cintā vā mahat tatra bhayam bhavet
translated: and everywhere there is sorrow and anxiety, there is great danger there.

original: ṛṣayaḥ santo deśān prakrameyur yataḥ/🔽nadīṃ bhitvā nikuñjānvā sa deśo naśyate acirāt//
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ santaḥ deśān prakrameyuḥ yatas  bhitvā sa deśaḥ naśyate acirāt
translated: The sages and virtuous people should leave that country from where.🔽If a river or a grove is destroyed, that country will soon be destroyed.

original: yatrauṣadhyaś ca virasā jalaṃ ca parihīyate/
analyzed: ca virasā jalam ca parihīyate
translated: Where the herbs are tasteless and the water is scarce,

original: vidyād deśaṃ tam utsṛṣṭaṃ devatāṛṣisādhubhiḥ//
analyzed: deśam tam utsṛṣṭam devatā ṛṣi sādhubhiḥ
translated: One should know that country to be abandoned by gods, sages and virtuous people.

original: matsyāḥ kūrmāś ca sarpāś ca mriyante yatra jāṅgalāḥ/
analyzed: kūrmāḥ ca sarpāḥ ca mriyante yatra jāṅgalāḥ
translated: Where fish, tortoises and snakes die in the marshy land,

original: dhanaskandhaḥ striyās tatra sapatnair vipralopsyate//
analyzed: striyāḥ tatra sapatnaiḥ vipralopsyate
translated: There the wealth of women will be destroyed by enemies.

original: apūrvāḥ pakṣiṇo yatra sthale vāriṇi / eva vā/
analyzed: pakṣiṇaḥ yatra sthale vāriṇi eva vā
translated: Where new birds are seen on land or in water,

original: dṛśyeyuḥ paracakreṇa dhanaskandho vilopsyate//
analyzed: para cakreṇa dhana skandhaḥ vilopsyate
translated: By the army of enemies, the wealth will be destroyed.

original: mahāpatho yadā kakṣaiḥ prasṛtair apatho bhavet/
analyzed: yadā kakṣaiḥ prasṛtaiḥ apathaḥ bhavet
translated: If the great path becomes impassable due to overgrown bushes,

original: sagrāmakarvaṭaṃ rāṣṭraṃ putreṇa saha naśyate//
analyzed: rāṣṭram putreṇa saha naśyate
translated: Along with villages and forts, the country will be destroyed along with the son.

original: nānotpātacakranirdeśo nāmaadhyāyaḥ/
analyzed: nāma adhyāyaḥ
translated: The chapter named Prediction of Various Omens

original: paṭha bhos triśaṅko puruṣapinyādhyāyaṃ/
analyzed: bhoḥ triśaṅko puruṣapinyā adhyāyam
translated: O Triśaṅku, recite the chapter on human omens.

original: atha kiṃ/
analyzed: atha kim
translated: What then?

original: kathayatu bhagavān/
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān
translated: May the Blessed One speak.

original: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin puruṣapinyādhyāyaṃ vyākhāmi tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin tat śrūyatām
translated: Then, O Puṣkarasārin, I will explain the chapter on human omens. Listen to that.

original: kathayatu bhagavān/
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān
translated: May the Blessed One speak.

original: aṣṭāviṃśatiḥ puṣkarasārin nakṣatrāṇi prakīrtitāni/
analyzed: puṣkarasārin nakṣatrāṇi prakīrtitāni
translated: O Pushkarasārin, the twenty-eight constellations are proclaimed.

original: yāni candrasūryaniḥsṛtāny anuvahanti/🔽tatra sukugṛṣṭyā aṣṭāṅgulapramāṇayā dvādaśākṣagṛṣṭayaḥ svaśarīraṃ p /
analyzed: yāni candra sūrya niḥsṛtāni anuvahanti  tatra su kugṛṣṭyāḥ aṣṭa aṅgula pramāṇayā dvādaśa akṣa gṛṣṭayaḥ sva śarīram
translated: Which are carried by the moon and sun.

original: dairghyeṇa jñātavyaṃ/
analyzed: dairghyeṇa jñātavyam
translated: There, with a good thumb measuring eight finger-widths, one should know one's own body to be twelve finger-widths long.

original: ekākṣagṛṣṭiḥ śīrṣamūrdhni ekapādatalaṃ bhavet/
analyzed: eka akṣa gṛṣṭiḥ śīrṣa mūrdhni eka pāda talam bhavet
translated: One finger-width is the top of the head, one foot sole.

original: caturdaśa gṛṣṭayo nakṣatrāṇāṃ padaṃ yatra saṃdṛśyate/
analyzed: caturdaśa gṛṣṭayaḥ nakṣatrāṇām padam yatra saṃdṛśyate
translated: Fourteen finger-widths is the place of the constellations, where it is seen.

original: tad anyathā na bhavati/
analyzed: tat anyathā na bhavati
translated: It does not happen otherwise.

original: nakṣatre yatra yo jātas tatra
analyzed: nakṣatre yatra yaḥ jātaḥ tatra
translated: In which constellation one is born, there

original: tatra saṃkṛśyate/
analyzed: tatra saṃkṛśyate
translated: there one is destroyed.

original: puruṣapinyaḥ🔽kṛttikāyāṃ hi jātasya mukhe vai caturaṅgulaḥ/
analyzed: u puruṣa pinyaḥ  hi jātasya mukhe vai caturaṅgulaḥ
translated: The human body🔽For one born in Krittika, there is a mole on the face, four finger-widths in size.

original: pinyo dakṣiṇato yasya lomaśaḥ kṛṣṇalohitaḥ//
analyzed: dakṣiṇatas yasya lomaśaḥ kṛṣṇa lohitaḥ
translated: On the right side of which one, hairy, dark red.

original: bhogavān yaśasā yuktaḥ paṇḍito jvalati śriyā/
analyzed: yaśasā yuktaḥ paṇḍitaḥ jvalati śriyā
translated: Endowed with enjoyments, endowed with fame, learned, shines with glory.

original: kṛttikāsv atha jātasya bhavaty etad dhi lakṣaṇaṃ//
analyzed: atha jātasya bhavati etat hi lakṣaṇam
translated: This is the characteristic of one born in Krittika.

original: dṛśyate vraṇa /
analyzed: vraṇa
translated: A wound is seen

original: evāyaṃ yasya vai caturaṅgulaḥ/
analyzed: eva ayam yasya vai catur aṅgulaḥ
translated: just this one, four finger-widths in size.

original: rohiṇyāṃ jātakaḥ so api vidvān dharmarataḥ sadā//
analyzed: jātakaḥ saḥ api vidvān dharma rataḥ sadā
translated: One born in Rohini is also learned, always devoted to dharma.

original: maṇḍito bhogasampanno hrīyuktaś caapi sarvataḥ/
analyzed: bhoga sampannaḥ hrī yuktaḥ ca api sarvatas
translated: Adorned, endowed with enjoyments, and modest in every way.

original: śūro vijayasampanno nityaṃ śatrupramardakaḥ//
analyzed: vijaya sampannaḥ nityam śatru pramardakaḥ
translated: He is a hero, successful in victory, always crushing his enemies.

original: grīvāyām ardhagṛṣṭyā tu dāho yasya pradṛśyate/
analyzed: ardha gṛṣṭyā tu dāhaḥ yasya pradṛśyate
translated: If burning is seen on the neck at half a ghrishti,

original: mṛgaśīrṣe hy asau jātaḥ śūro bhogasamarpitaḥ//
analyzed: hi asau jātaḥ śūraḥ bhoga samarpitaḥ
translated: he is born in Mrigashira, a hero endowed with pleasures.

original: ardhadvitīyagṛṣṭyā tu pinyo vāme hi yasya tu/
analyzed: tu pinyaḥ vāme hi yasya tu
translated: If there is a boil on the left at half two ghrishtis,

original: ārdrāyāṃ krodhano jāto mūrkho gopatikaś ca saḥ//
analyzed: krodhanaḥ jātaḥ mūrkhaḥ gopatikaḥ ca saḥ
translated: he is born in Ardra, angry, foolish, and a cattle-owner.

original: vāme kakṣe vraṇo yasya kṛṣṇaś caeva punarvasau/
analyzed: kakṣe vraṇaḥ yasya kṛṣṇaḥ ca eva punarvasau
translated: If there is a wound on the left armpit and also in Punarvasu,

original: dhanadhānyasamṛddho hi jāyate svalpamedhasaḥ//
analyzed: hi jāyate su alpa medhasaḥ
translated: he is born with wealth and grain, but of little intelligence.

original: tathāeva puṣye jāto asau dṛśyate varalakṣaṇaḥ/🔽cakramadhye ca haste ca sūryaś candro virājate//
analyzed: puṣye jātaḥ asau dṛśyate vara lakṣaṇaḥ  ca haste ca sūryaḥ candraḥ virājate
translated: Likewise, he is seen born in Pushya with excellent marks,🔽with the sun and moon shining in the middle of the wheel and in the hand.

original: ardhapradakṣiṇāvartāḥ keśāḥ sarve hi saṃsthitāḥ/p /
analyzed: keśāḥ sarve hi
translated: All the hair is arranged in a clockwise direction,

original: parimaṇḍalaś ca kāyena jitakleśo api nāyakaḥ//
analyzed: ca kāyena jita kleśaḥ api nāyakaḥ
translated: and the body is round. The leader has conquered afflictions.

original: hṛdaye yasya dāhaḥ syād śleṣāyāṃ kalipriyaḥ/
analyzed: yasya dāhaḥ syāt śleṣāyām kalipriyaḥ
translated: If there is burning in the heart in Shravana, he is a lover of quarrels,

original: duḥśīlo duḥkhasaṃvāso maithunābhir ataś ca saḥ//
analyzed: duḥkha saṃvāsaḥ maithunābhiḥ atas ca saḥ
translated: immoral, difficult to live with, and attached to sexual intercourse.

original: adha / urasi pṛṣṭhe vā yasya vraṇaḥ pradṛśyate/
analyzed: urasi pṛṣṭhe vā yasya vraṇaḥ pradṛśyate
translated: If a wound is seen on the chest or back,

original: maghāyāṃ dhanavān jāto mahāātma dhārmiko naraḥ//
analyzed: dhanavān jātaḥ mahāātma dhārmikaḥ naraḥ
translated: If a person is born in Magha, he becomes wealthy, magnanimous and righteous.

original: nābhyāṃ dakṣiṇavāmābhyāṃ vraṇo yasya pradṛśyate/
analyzed: dakṣiṇa vāmābhyām vraṇaḥ yasya pradṛśyate
translated: If a person is seen to have a wound on the right or left side of the navel,

original: pūrvaphālgunījāto asau matsarī caalpajīvitaḥ//
analyzed: asau matsarī ca alpa jīvitaḥ
translated: he is born in the first part of Phalguna, is envious and has a short life.

original: caturaṅgulato nābhyā yasya pinyaḥ pradṛśyate/
analyzed: nābhyāḥ yasya pinyaḥ pradṛśyate
translated: If a person is seen to have a mole four fingers below the navel,

original: uttaraphālgunījāto bhogaśīlaḥ śrutodyataḥ//
analyzed: bhoga śīlaḥ śruta udyataḥ
translated: he is born in the second part of Phalguna, is addicted to pleasures and is devoted to learning.

original: śroṇyāmalohitaḥ pinyo haste jātasya dṛśyate/
analyzed: pinyaḥ haste jātasya dṛśyate
translated: If a mole is seen on the buttocks, red in color, of a person born in Hasta,

original: cauraḥ śaṭhaś ca māyāvī mandapuṇyo alpamedhasaḥ//
analyzed: śaṭhaḥ ca māyāvī manda puṇyaḥ alpa medhasaḥ
translated: he becomes a thief, deceitful, cunning, of little merit and little intelligence.

original: vyaṃjane yasya pinyas tu dṛśyate niyamenahi/
analyzed: yasya tu dṛśyate niyamena hi
translated: If a mole is seen on the genitals, certainly,

original: citrājātaḥ sa ced rogī nṛtyagītaratas tathā//
analyzed: sa ced rogī nṛtya gīta rataḥ tathā
translated: if he is born in Citra, he becomes sickly and delights in dancing and singing.

original: vyañjane api ca /
analyzed: api ca
translated: And on the genitals.

original: ūrdhve vā pītaḥ pinyaḥpradṛśyate/
analyzed: ūrdhve vā pītaḥ pinyaḥ pradṛśyate
translated: If a mole is seen above, or if it is yellow,

original: jātaḥ svātyām asau lubdho guṇadviṣṭo hy apaṇḍitaḥ//🔽kugṛṣṭyā yasya /
analyzed: svātyām asau lubdhaḥ guṇa dviṣṭaḥ hi apaṇḍitaḥ  yasya
translated: he is born in Svati, is greedy, hates good qualities and is ignorant.🔽If a mole is seen on the thighs,

original: ūrūbhyāṃ pinyo lohita / eva hi/
analyzed: ūrūbhyām pinyaḥ lohitaḥ eva hi
translated: red in color,

original: ākīrṇo naranārībhir viśākhāyāṃ bhaṭo agraṇīḥ//
analyzed: nara nārībhiḥ viśākhāyām bhaṭaḥ agraṇīḥ
translated: he is born in Vishakha, is a leader of soldiers, and is surrounded by men and women.

original: vidvān śūro jitamitro nityaṃ saukhyaparāyaṇaḥ/
analyzed: śūraḥ jita mitraḥ nityam saukhya parāyaṇaḥ
translated: He is learned, brave, has conquered his enemies and is always devoted to happiness.

original: śriyā dhṛtyā ca sampanno acyutaḥ svarupapadyate//
analyzed: dhṛtyā ca sampannaḥ acyutaḥ svar upapadyate
translated: endowed with prosperity and fortitude, he becomes one who does not fall.

original: dvitīyagṛṣṭyām ūrubhyām aṅge yasya pradṛśyate/
analyzed: ūrubhyām aṅge yasya pradṛśyate
translated: If a mole is seen on the thighs in the second house,

original: śīlavān anurādhāyāṃ dharmabhogasamanvitaḥ//
analyzed: anurādhāyām dharma bhoga samanvitaḥ
translated: he is virtuous in Anurādhā, endowed with Dharma and enjoyments.

original: adho yasyaiha caūrubhyāṃ pinyo jyeṣṭhe sa jāyate/
analyzed: yasya iha caūrubhyām pinyaḥ jyeṣṭhe sa jāyate
translated: If a mole is seen below the thighs here in Jyeṣṭhā,

original: alpaayur apriyo duḥkhī duḥśīlaḥ kṛpaṇas tathā//
analyzed: apriyaḥ duḥkhī duḥśīlaḥ kṛpaṇaḥ tathā
translated: he is short-lived, unloved, suffering, of bad conduct, and miserly.

original: jānubhyām ūrdhvataḥ sūkṣmo vraṇo yasyaiha dṛśyate/p /
analyzed: ūrdhvatas sūkṣmaḥ vraṇaḥ yasya eha
translated: If a mole is seen above the knees here,

original: mūlena bhāgyavān jātaḥ svagṛhaṃ nāśayel laghu//
analyzed: bhāgyavān jātaḥ sva gṛham nāśayet laghu
translated: he is born with a small mole, and quickly destroys his own house.

original: pūrvāṣāḍhāsu jātasya pinyaḥ syāj jānumaṇḍale/
analyzed: jātasya pinyaḥ syāt jānu maṇḍale
translated: If a mole is on the knee-joint of one born in the Pūrva-Āṣāḍhā,

original: dāyako dharma /
analyzed: dharma
translated: he is a giver, virtuous,

original: āsaṅgyacyutaḥ svargaparāyaṇaḥ//
analyzed: āsaṅgi acyutaḥ svarga parāyaṇaḥ
translated: attached, not falling, and devoted to heaven.

original: uttarāyām āṣāḍhāyāṃ jātasya tilakas trike/
analyzed: āṣāḍhāyām jātasya tilakaḥ trike
translated: If a mole is seen on the three parts of one born in the Uttarā-Āṣāḍhā,

original: yadi dṛśyet sa medhāvī bhogavān syāj janapriyaḥ//
analyzed: dṛśyet sa medhāvī bhogavān syāt jana priyaḥ
translated: if it is seen, he will be intelligent, wealthy, and loved by the people.

original: dvitīyaḥ pinyo dṛśyeta dhanavān bhogavān sadā/
analyzed: pinyaḥ dṛśyeta dhanavān bhogavān sadā
translated: If a second mole is seen, he is always wealthy and enjoys pleasures,

original: satyapriyas tathārogo acyutaḥ svargaṃ ca gacchati//
analyzed: tathā arogaḥ acyutaḥ svargam ca gacchati
translated: loves truth, is healthy, does not fall, and goes to heaven.

original: dhaniṣṭhāyāṃ ca jaṅghāyāṃ kṛṣṇaḥ pinyaḥ pradṛśyate/
analyzed: ca jaṅghāyām kṛṣṇaḥ pinyaḥ pradṛśyate
translated: If a black mole is seen on the calf of the leg in the Dhaniṣṭhā,

original: krodhano mandarāgaś ca prājño bhogavivarjitaḥ//
analyzed: manda rāgaḥ ca prājñaḥ bhoga vivarjitaḥ
translated: Angry, slow in passion, wise, devoid of enjoyments,

original: dvikugṛṣṭyā ca jaṅghāyāṃ kṛṣṇaḥ pinyaḥ pradṛśyate/
analyzed: ca jaṅghāyām kṛṣṇaḥ pinyaḥ pradṛśyate
translated: And a black mole is seen on the calf of the leg in the two asterisms.

original: mūrkhaḥ śatabhiṣāyāṃ tu mriyate hy adakena saḥ//
analyzed: śatabhiṣāyām tu mriyate hi adakena saḥ
translated: In Śatabhiṣā, he is a fool and dies by drowning.

original: adho jaṅghāṃ kugṛṣṭyā tu pūrvabhādrapade vraṇaḥ/
analyzed: jaṅghām ku gṛṣṭyā tu pūrvabhādrapade vraṇaḥ
translated: Below the calf, in the asterism of Pūrvābhādrapad, there is a wound.

original: paropatāpako mūrkho daridraś caura / ity api//
analyzed: mūrkhaḥ daridraḥ cauraḥ iti api
translated: He is a tormentor of others, a fool, poor, and also a thief.

original: kuguṣṭyā yasya pinyaḥ syāj jāto bhādrapadauttare/
analyzed: yasya pinyaḥ syāt jātaḥ bhādrapada auttare
translated: In the asterism of Uttarābhādrapad, he who has a mole on the calf,

original: dānaśīlaḥ smṛtiprāpto dayāpanno viśāradaḥ//
translated: Is charitable, of good conduct, attains mindfulness, is compassionate, and fearless.

original: ubhayoḥ pādayoḥ sūkṣmaḥ pinyo yasya pradṛśyate/
analyzed: pādayoḥ sūkṣmaḥ pinyaḥ yasya pradṛśyate
translated: He who has a fine mole on both feet,

original: revatyāṃ jāyate nīco nāpitaḥ sa havaty api//
analyzed: jāyate nīcaḥ nāpitaḥ sa havati api
translated: Is born low in Revatī, a barber, and also a thief.

original: aṅguṣṭhavivare pinyo nīlo yasya pradṛśyate/
analyzed: pinyaḥ nīlaḥ yasya pradṛśyate
translated: He who has a blue mole in the space between the thumb and the foot,

original: arogo balavān nityam aśvinyāṃ jāta / eva saḥ//
analyzed: balavān nityam aśvinyām jātaḥ eva saḥ
