translated: Is born in Aśvinī, always healthy and strong.

original: atha pāṇitale pinyo bharaṇyām akṣayaḥ smṛtaḥ/
analyzed: pāṇi tale pinyaḥ bharaṇyām akṣayaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Now, a mole on the palm is said to be inexhaustible in Bharaṇī.

original: vadhyaghātaś ca duḥśīlaḥ syān narakaparāyaṇaḥ//
analyzed: ca duḥśīlaḥ syāt naraka parāyaṇaḥ
translated: He would be a murderer, of bad conduct, and devoted to hell.

original: nakṣatrāṇāṃ padaṃ hy etad yena caryā prajāyate/
analyzed: padam hi etat yena caryā prajāyate
translated: This is the position of the asterisms, by which conduct arises.

original: etad dhi lokaprajñānaṃ loko yatra samāśritaḥ//
analyzed: dhi loka prajñānam lokaḥ yatra samāśritaḥ
translated: For this is the knowledge of the world, on which the world is based.

original: iti pinyādhyāyāḥ//
analyzed: iti pinyādhyāyāḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on Pinda.

original: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin piṭakādhyāyaṃ nāmaadhyāyaṃ vyākhāsyāmi/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin piṭakādhyāyam nāma adhyāyam vyākhāsyāmi
translated: Now, O Pushkarasara, I will explain the chapter named Pitaka-adhyaya.

original: tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: kathayatu bhagavān trisaṅkuḥ/p /
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān
translated: Let the Blessed One Trisanku speak.

original: piṭakādhyāyaḥ
analyzed: u piṭakā adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Pitaka Chapter

original: ataḥ ūrdhvaṃ pravakṣyāmi sarvasthānagataṃ punaḥ/
analyzed: ūrdhvam pravakṣyāmi sarva sthāna gatam punar
translated: From here onwards I will again speak about what is in all places,

original: strīṇāṃ ca puruṣāṇāṃ ca piṭakaṃ sarvakarmakaṃ//
analyzed: ca puruṣāṇām ca piṭakam sarvakarmakam
translated: The pitaka of all actions of women and men,

original: lābhaalābhaṃ sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ jīvitaṃ maraṇaṃ tathā/
analyzed: sukham duḥkham jīvitam maraṇam tathā
translated: Gain and loss, happiness and sorrow, life and death,

original: prājñā yenābhijānanti taṃ ca sarvaṃ nibodhatāṃ//🔽tatrābhighātadagdhā vā tilās tad rūpakā / api/
analyzed: yena abhijānanti tam ca sarvam nibodhatām  vā tilāḥ tat rūpakāḥ api
translated: By which the wise recognize, and that I will tell you all.🔽There, the sesame seeds burned by the blow, or those of that form,

original: visphoṭavarnabhedāś ca piṭakābhihitāḥ smṛtāḥ//
analyzed: ca piṭaka abhihitāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: And the differences in the color of the boils, are known as pitaka.

original: śvetavarṇena piṭako viprāṇāṃ pūjito bhavet/
analyzed: piṭakaḥ viprāṇām pūjitaḥ bhavet
translated: A pitaka of white color would be worshipped by Brahmins.

original: kṣatopamaḥ kṣatriyāṇāṃ vaiśyānāṃ pītakaḥ smṛtaḥ//
analyzed: kṣatriyāṇām vaiśyānām pītakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Similar to an injury for Kshatriyas, and yellow for Vaishyas is remembered.

original: śūdrāṇām asitaḥ śreṣṭho vivarṇo mlecchajātiṣu/
analyzed: asitaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ vivarṇaḥ mleccha jātiṣu
translated: Black is best for Shudras, and discolored for the Mleccha castes.

original: yadā savarṇapiṭako mūrdhni rājā mahān smṛtaḥ/
analyzed: savarṇa piṭakaḥ mūrdhni rājā mahān smṛtaḥ
translated: When a pitaka of one's own color on the head is remembered as a great king,

original: śīrṣe tu dhanadhānyābhyāṃ kāntaye subhagāya ca/
analyzed: tu dhana dhānyābhyām kāntaye subhagāya ca
translated: On the head, for wealth and grains, and for beauty and good fortune.

original: upaghātaṃ bhrūvor vidyāt strīlābho bhrūvasaṅgame//
analyzed: bhrūvoḥ vidyāt strī lābhaḥ
translated: One should know that a swelling on the eyebrows foretells misfortune, and a meeting of the eyebrows, gain of a woman.

original: akṣisthāne tu piṭakaḥkaroti priyadarśanaṃ/🔽akṣibhrūbhāge śokāya gaṇḍe putravadho dhruvaṃ//
analyzed: tu piṭakaḥ karoti priya darśanam  śokāya gaṇḍe putra vadhaḥ dhruvam
translated: If there is a swelling on the eyes, it brings pleasant sights.🔽If there is a swelling on the eyes and eyebrows, it foretells sorrow. On the cheeks, it certainly foretells the death of a son.

original: aśrūpātaḥ dhruvaṃ śokaḥ śravaṇe goṣu nāśakaḥ/🔽karṇapīṭhe vibhūṣāya nāsāvaṃśe tu jātaye//
analyzed: dhruvam śokaḥ śravaṇe goṣu nāśakaḥ  vibhūṣāya nāsā vaṃśe tu jātaye
translated: The falling of tears certainly foretells sorrow. On the ears, it foretells the loss of cattle.🔽On the ear-lobes, for ornament. On the bridge of the nose, for birth.

original: nāsāgaṇḍe putralābhaṃ vastralābhaṃ dhruvaṃ vadet/
analyzed: putra lābham vastra lābham dhruvam vadet
translated: On the nose and cheeks, one should certainly predict the gain of a son and clothes.

original: nāsaagre jātenāpnoti gandhabhogān abhīpsitān//🔽uttaroṣṭhe tathādhare caannapānaṃ śubhaaśubhaṃ/p /
analyzed: jātena āpnoti gandha bhogān abhīpsitān  tathā adhare ca anna pānam
translated: If it appears on the tip of the nose, one obtains the desired enjoyment of scents.🔽On the upper and lower lips, good and bad food and drink.

original: cibuke hanudeśe ca dhanaṃ gāvaḥ satāṃ śriyaḥ//
analyzed: hanu deśe ca dhanam gāvaḥ satām śriyaḥ
translated: On the chin and jaw, wealth, cows, and the prosperity of the good.

original: gale tu dānam āpnoti pānam ābharaṇāni ca/
analyzed: tu dānam āpnoti pānam ābharaṇāni ca
translated: On the throat, one obtains gifts, drinks, and ornaments.

original: śiraḥsandhau ca grīvāyāṃ śiraśchedanam ādiśet//
analyzed: ca grīvāyām śiraḥ chedanam ādiśet
translated: On the junction of the head and neck, one should predict the cutting off of the head.

original: jāto ayaṃ śiraso mūle hanuni ca dhanakṣayaḥ/
analyzed: ayam śirasaḥ mūle hanuni ca dhana kṣayaḥ
translated: If it appears at the root of the head and chin, there is loss of wealth.

original: bhaikṣacaryā bhavet sandhau hṛdaye priyasaṅgamaḥ//
analyzed: bhavet sandhau hṛdaye priya saṅgamaḥ
translated: On the junction, there will be a life of begging. On the heart, union with a beloved.

original: pṛṣṭhe tu duḥkhaśayyāyai /
analyzed: tu duḥkha śayyāyai
translated: On the back, for sleeping in sorrow.

original: annapānakṣayāya ca/
analyzed: anna pāna kṣayāya ca
translated: and for the destruction of food and drink.

original: pārśve tu sukhaśayyāyai stane tu sutajanyatā//
analyzed: tu sukha śayyāyai stane tu suta janya tā
translated: On the sides, for a comfortable sleep; on the breasts, for the birth of a son.

original: jātena śivam āpnoti na caapriyasamāgamaḥ/
analyzed: śivam āpnoti na ca apriya samāgamaḥ
translated: If born, one attains auspiciousness, and there is no meeting with the unpleasant.

original: bāhvoḥ śatruvināśāya yuktaṃ strīlābha / eva ca//
analyzed: śatru vināśāya yuktam strī lābhe eva ca
translated: On the arms, for the destruction of enemies, and also for the acquisition of a wife.

original: dadāty ābharaṇaṃ jātaḥ prabāhvoḥ kurpare kṣudhā/
analyzed: ābharaṇam jātaḥ prabāhvoḥ kurpare kṣudhā
translated: If born, one gives ornaments; on the forearms, hunger;

original: maṇibandhe niyamanamaṃsābhyāṃ harṣa / eva ca//
analyzed: niyamanam aṃsābhyām harṣaḥ eva ca
translated: on the wrist, restraint; on the shoulders, joy.

original: saubhagaṃ dhanalābhaṃca jātaḥ pāṇau dadāti ca/
analyzed: dhana lābham ca jātaḥ pāṇau dadāti ca
translated: If born, one gives in the hand auspiciousness and gain of wealth.

original: puṣpito hy ekadeśe tu daśaneṣu nakheṣu ca//
analyzed: hi eka deśe tu daśaneṣu nakheṣu ca
translated: If blossomed, in one part; on the teeth and nails.

original: jātena hṛdi jānīyād bhrātṛputrasamāgamaṃ/
analyzed: hṛdi jānīyāt bhrātṛ putra samāgamam
translated: If born, one should know in the heart the arrival of a brother's son.

original: jaṭhare somadānāya nābhyāṃ strīlābham ādiśet//
analyzed: soma dānāya nābhyām strī lābham ādiśet
translated: In the belly, for the offering of Soma; at the navel, one should predict the acquisition of a wife.

original: jaghane vyasanaṃ vidyān nārya dauḥśīlyam eva ca/
analyzed: vyasanam vidyāt na ārya dauḥśīlyam eva ca
translated: In the buttocks, one should know misfortune, and also the unchastity of a woman.

original: putrotpattis tu vṛṣaṇe liṅge bhāryā tu śobhanā//🔽pṛṣṭhānte sukhabhāgitvaṃ sphici caapi dhanakṣayaḥ/
analyzed: tu vṛṣaṇe liṅge bhāryā tu śobhanā  sukha bhāgi tvam sphici ca api dhana kṣayaḥ
translated: The birth of a son is in the testicles; on the penis, a beautiful wife.🔽At the end of the back, the experience of happiness; on the buttocks, also the loss of wealth.

original: ūrujātāś ca piṭakā dhanasaubhāgyadāyakāḥ//
analyzed: ca piṭakāḥ dhana saubhāgya dāyakāḥ
translated: And the boils born on the thighs bring wealth and good fortune.

original: jānau śatrubhayaṃ vidyāt tathāeva ca dhanakṣayaṃ/
analyzed: śatru bhayam vidyāt tathā eva ca dhana kṣayam
translated: One should know the danger from enemies on the knee, and also the loss of wealth.

original: jānusaṃdhau vijānīyān meḍhrake hy atha jātakaiḥ/
analyzed: vijānīyāt meḍhrake hi atha jātakaiḥ
translated: One should know that on the knee-joints, and on the penis, if there are moles,

original: vijayaṃ jñānalābhaṃ ca putrajanma vinirdiśet//🔽strīlābhaṃ vakṣasi caeva bhaved anyo nirarthakaḥ/
analyzed: jñāna lābham ca putra janma vinirdiśet  vakṣasi ca eva bhavet anyaḥ nirarthakaḥ
translated: one should predict victory, gain of knowledge, and birth of a son.🔽On the chest, there will be gain of a woman, otherwise it is useless.

original: jaṅghāyāṃ parasevā tu paradeśāt tu bhujyate//
analyzed: para sevā tu para deśāt tu bhujyate
translated: If there is a mole on the calf, one will serve others, and will be supported by another country.

original: maṇibandhe tu piṭako bandhanaṃ nirdiśed dhruvaṃ/p /
analyzed: tu piṭakaḥ bandhanam nirdiśet
translated: If there is a mole on the wrist, it certainly indicates imprisonment.

original: parivādhaṃ sa labhate bandhanaṃ ca na saṃśayaḥ/
analyzed: sa labhate bandhanam ca na saṃśayaḥ
translated: He will certainly obtain obstruction and imprisonment.

original: pārśve gulphe ca jānīyāc chastreṇa maraṇaṃ dhruvaṃ//
analyzed: gulphe ca jānīyāt śastreṇa maraṇam dhruvam
translated: One should know that if there is a mole on the side or ankle, death by weapon is certain.

original: aṅgulīṣu dhruvaṃ śoko vyādhiś caaṅguliparvasu/
analyzed: dhruvam śokaḥ vyādhiḥ ca aṅguli parvasu
translated: If there are moles on the fingers, there will certainly be grief, and if on the joints of the fingers, there will be illness.

original: pravāsaṃ pravasen nityaṃ tathāevauttarapādake//
analyzed: pravaset nityam tathā eva auttarapādake
translated: One will always wander in a foreign land, and likewise on the upper part of the foot.

original: yasya pādatale jātas tathā hastatale api ca/
analyzed: pāda tale jātaḥ tathā hasta tale api ca
translated: If there is a mole on the sole of the foot, and likewise on the palm of the hand,

original: dhanaṃ dhānyaṃ sutā gāvaḥ striyo yānāni caapnuyāt//
analyzed: dhānyam sutāḥ gāvaḥ striyaḥ yānāni ca apnuyāt
translated: one will obtain wealth, grains, sons, cows, women, and vehicles.

original: snigdhaṃ snigdheṣu vijñeyaṃ caleṣu ca calaṃ phalaṃ/
analyzed: snigdheṣu vijñeyam caleṣu ca calam phalam
translated: If there are moles on the smooth parts of the body, the results are smooth, and if on the moving parts, the results are moving.

original: sthānasthe vipulaṃ dadyāt phalaṃ nṛṇāṃ śubhodayaṃ//
analyzed: vipulam dadyāt phalam nṛṇām śubha udayam
translated: If they are located in a stable place, they give abundant results to men, bringing auspicious outcomes.

original: vivarṇo viparītaś ca phalaṃ sarvaṃ prayacchati/
analyzed: viparītaḥ ca phalam sarvam prayacchati
translated: If they are discolored or inverted, they give all results.

original: puṃsāṃ madhye ye snigdhāś ca deśe dakṣiṇataś ca ye/
analyzed: madhye ye snigdhāḥ ca deśe dakṣiṇatas ca ye
translated: Those moles which are soft and situated in the southern part of the body,

original: tathā caabhyantare caeva sthāne tu pratipūjitāḥ//
analyzed: ca abhyantare ca eva sthāne tu pratipūjitāḥ
translated: and those which are situated in the inner parts of the body, are honoured.

original: strīṇāṃ mṛduṣu deśeṣu vaktrān teṣu ca parvataḥ/
analyzed: mṛduṣu deśeṣu vaktrān teṣu ca parvataḥ
translated: And those moles which are situated in the soft parts of the body of women, and those which are on the face and on the mountains,

original: tattvaṃ vijñāya pinyānaṃ sthānaṃ varṇaṃ ca janma ca//
analyzed: vijñāya pinyānam sthānam varṇam ca janma ca
translated: knowing their truth, the place, the colour, and the birth,

original: sthānaasthānaṃ ca matimān vikāraṃ gatim eva ca/
analyzed: ca matimān vikāram gatim eva ca
translated: the wise one should determine the place, the non-place, the change, and the end.

original: ādiśet tu naraḥ paścād yathaevaṃ samudāhṛtaṃ//
analyzed: tu naraḥ paścāt yathā evam samudāhṛtam
translated: A man should then advise as stated.

original: vāmabhāge tu nārīṇāṃ vijñeeyāḥ piṭakāḥ śubhāḥ/
analyzed: tu nārīṇām vijñeeyāḥ piṭakāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: The moles on the left side of women should be known to be auspicious.

original: dakṣiṇe tu manuṣyāṇāṃ bhavanti hy arthasādhakāḥ//
analyzed: tu manuṣyāṇām bhavanti hi artha sādhakāḥ
translated: On the right side of men, they are indeed conducive to the accomplishment of wealth.

original: viparītās tu piṭakā moghās tu bahavaḥ smṛtāḥ/
analyzed: tu piṭakāḥ moghāḥ tu bahavaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: But the moles that are contrary are said to be mostly fruitless.

original: yathoktānaṃ ca sandhisthāḥ sarve viphaladāḥ smṛtāḥ//
analyzed: ca sandhi sthāḥ sarve viphala dāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: And those situated in the joints as described are all remembered to give fruitless results.

original: siddhāḥ dhruvā vraṇā bhidyās tathā sadyaḥkṛtāś ca ye/
analyzed: dhruvāḥ vraṇāḥ bhidyāḥ tathā sadyaḥkṛtāḥ ca ye
translated: The successful, the certain, the wounds, the splits, and those that are done suddenly,

original: dharmakīlasamāś caeva sarve te piṭakāḥ smṛtāḥ//
analyzed: ca eva sarve te piṭakāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: and those that are like Dharma-nails, all those moles are remembered.

original: guṇadoṣāś ca sarveṣāṃ tathāapyanye prakīrttitāḥ/
analyzed: ca sarveṣām prakīrttitāḥ
translated: And the qualities and faults of all of them, and others, are also described.

original: ity āha bhagavāṃs triśaṅkuḥ śiṣyebhyo nityadarśanaṃ//
analyzed: āha bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ śiṣyebhyaḥ nitya darśanam
translated: Thus said the Blessed One, Trisanku, to his disciples, the daily observation.

original: na nakhena na śastreṇa naāyasena kathaṃcana/p /
analyzed: nakhena na śastreṇa na āyasena
translated: Not by nails, not by weapons, not by iron at all,

original: kāñcanena suvarṇena dahed viprāṃś ca bhojayed//
analyzed: suvarṇena dahet viprān ca bhojayet
translated: but by gold, by gold, he should cremate (the body) and feed Brahmins.

original: ayaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārin piṭakādhyāyanāmaadhyāyaḥ/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin piṭaka adhyāya nāma adhyāyaḥ
translated: This, O Pushkarasarin, is the chapter named The Chapter on Pithakas.

original: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin svapnaadhyāyaṃ vyākhyāsyāmi/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin svapna adhyāyam vyākhyāsyāmi
translated: Now, O Pushkarasarin, I will explain the chapter on dreams.

original: tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: atha kiṃ/
analyzed: atha kim
translated: What is it?

original: kathayatu bhagavān/
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān
translated: Let the Blessed One tell.

original: svapnaadhyāyaḥ
analyzed: u svapnaadhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Dreams

original: śubhaaśubhaṃ ca svapnānāṃ yat phalaṃ samudāhṛtaṃ/
analyzed: ca svapnānām yat phalam samudāhṛtam
translated: The auspicious and inauspicious results that are declared of dreams,

original: devatābrāhmaṇau gāvau bahniṃ prajvalitaṃ tathā/
analyzed: gāvau bahnim prajvalitam tathā
translated: Gods, Brahmins, cows, and a blazing fire,

original: yas tu paśyati svapnaante kuṭumbaṃ tasya vardhate//
analyzed: tu paśyati svapna ante kuṭumbam tasya vardhate
translated: One who sees at the end of a dream, his family prospers.

original: yas tu paśyati svapnaante rājānnaṃ kuñjaraṃ hayaṃ/
analyzed: tu paśyati svapna ante rājā annam kuñjaram hayam
translated: One who sees at the end of a dream royal food, an elephant, a horse,

original: suvarṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ caeva kuṭumbaṃ tasya vardhate/
analyzed: vṛṣabham ca eva kuṭumbam tasya vardhate
translated: Gold, and a bull, his family prospers.

original: sārasāṃś ca śukān haṃsān krauñcān śvetāṃś ca pakṣiṇaḥ/
analyzed: ca śukān haṃsān krauñcān śvetān ca pakṣiṇaḥ
translated: Sarasas, parrots, swans, cranes, and white birds,

original: yas tu paśyati svapne vai kuṭumbaṃ tasya vardhate/
analyzed: tu paśyati svapne vai kuṭumbam tasya vardhate
translated: One who sees in a dream, his family prospers.

original: samṛddhāni ca śasyāni navāni surabhīṇi ca/
analyzed: ca śasyāni navāni surabhīṇi ca
translated: And abundant crops, fresh and fragrant,

original: padminīṃ puṣpitāṃ caapi purṇakumbhāṃs tathāeva ca//
analyzed: puṣpitām ca api purṇa kumbhān tathā eva ca
translated: a lotus in full bloom, and also full water-pots,

original: prasannam udakaṃ caeva puṣpāṇi vividhāni ca/
analyzed: udakam ca eva puṣpāṇi vividhāni ca
translated: clear water, and various flowers.

original: yas tu paśyati svapnaante kuṭumbaṃ tasya vardhate//
analyzed: tu paśyati svapna ante kuṭumbam tasya vardhate
translated: He who sees these at the end of a dream, his family prospers.

original: pāṇau pāde atha vā jānau śasterṇa dhanuṣāapi vā/
analyzed: pāde atha vā jānau dhanuṣā api vā
translated: If blows are struck on the hand, foot, knee, or with a weapon or bow,

original: prahārā yasya dīyante tasyaambaro abhivardhate//🔽tārācandramasau sūryaṃ nakṣatrāṇi grahāṃs tathā/
analyzed: yasya dīyante tasya ambaraḥ abhivardhate  sūryam nakṣatrāṇi grahān tathā
translated: his wealth increases.

original: yas tu paśyati svapnaante kuṭumbaṃ tasya vardhate//🔽aśvapṛṣṭhaṃ gajaskandhaṃ yānāni śayanāni ca/
analyzed: tu paśyati svapna ante kuṭumbam tasya vardhate  gaja skandham yānāni śayanāni ca
translated: He who sees at the end of a dream the stars, the moon, the sun, the constellations, and the planets,🔽his family prospers.🔽He who mounts the back of a horse or an elephant, vehicles, and beds, at the end of a dream,

original: yo abhirohati svapnaante mahadaiśvaryam āpnuyāt//
analyzed: abhirohati svapna ante mahat aiśvaryam āpnuyāt
translated: will attain great prosperity.

original: patitaś caaruhed bhūyas tatrasthaś ca vibudhyate/p /
analyzed: caaru hā it bhūyas tatrasthaḥ ca
translated: And if he falls down and mounts again, and awakens while still there,

original: aiśvaryadhanalābhāya naṣṭalābhāya nirdiśet//
analyzed: naṣṭa lābhāya nirdiśet
translated: it should be predicted for the gain of prosperity and wealth, and for the recovery of what was lost.

original: goyutaṃ ca rathaṃ svapne hayaṃ vā yo abhirohati/
analyzed: ca ratham svapne hayam vā yaḥ abhirohati
translated: If one mounts in a dream a chariot yoked with cows or a horse,

original: tatrasthaś ca vibudhyeta /
analyzed: ca vibudhyeta
translated: and awakens while still there,

original: aiśvaryam adhigacchati//
analyzed: aiśvaryam adhigacchati
translated: he attains prosperity.

original: prapātaṃ parvataṃ caeva yo abhirohati mānavaḥ/
analyzed: parvatam ca eva yaḥ abhirohati mānavaḥ
translated: If a man ascends a precipice or a mountain,

original: tatrasthaś ca vibudhyeta /
analyzed: ca vibudhyeta
translated: And while staying there, he should be alert.

original: aiśvaryam adhigacchati//
analyzed: aiśvaryam adhigacchati
translated: He attains lordship.

original: āsane śayane yane śarīre atha gṛhe kṣayaḥ/
analyzed: śayane yane śarīre atha gṛhe kṣayaḥ
translated: If there is destruction in a seat, a bed, a vehicle, the body, or a house,

original: yeṣām ārohaṇaṃ śastaṃ teṣām ārohaṇāt kṣayaḥ/
analyzed: ārohaṇam śastam teṣām ārohaṇāt kṣayaḥ
translated: The ascent of which is recommended, destruction comes from ascending them.

original: yeṣām ārohaṇād doṣās teṣām ārohaṇād guṇāḥ//
analyzed: ārohaṇāt doṣāḥ teṣām ārohaṇāt guṇāḥ
translated: From the ascent of which there are faults, from the ascent of those there are virtues.

original: trisāhasraṃ bhavet kaṇṭhe daśa śīrṣasya chedane/
analyzed: bhavet kaṇṭhe daśa śīrṣasya chedane
translated: There would be three thousand in the throat, ten in cutting off the head.

original: rājyaṃ śatasahasraṃ vā labhate śīrṣabhakṣaṇe//
analyzed: śata sahasram vā labhate śīrṣa bhakṣaṇe
translated: One obtains a kingdom or a hundred thousand by eating the head.

original: śuṣkāṃ nadīṃ hradaṃ vāapi śūnyaāgārapraveśanaṃ/
analyzed: nadīm hradam vā api śūnya āgāra praveśanam
translated: Seeing in a dream a dry river, a dry lake, entering an empty house,

original: śuṣkaudapānaṃ tu labhate svapne dṛṣṭvā dhruvaṃ bhayaṃ//
analyzed: tu labhate svapne dṛṣṭvā dhruvam bhayam
translated: A dry well, one certainly obtains fear.

original: śṛgālaṃ mānuṣaṃ nagnaṃ godhāvṛścikasūkaraṃ/
analyzed: mānuṣam nagnam godhā vṛścika sūkaram
translated: If one sees in a dream a jackal, a human, a naked person, a goat, a scorpion, a pig,

analyzed: atha rājā vā devaḥ pretaḥ atha brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: If a non-human, a king, a god, a ghost, or a brahmin

original: svapne yathā te jalpanti sa tathāartho bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: yathā te jalpanti sa tathāarthaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: speaks to one in a dream, that matter will come to pass as they say.

original: lacuna pūrvavicintitaṃ/
translated: A dream seen at the end of the night is true,🔽as also one seen at the beginning of the night, or one that is remembered,

original: yac caanusmarate dṛṣṭvā yac caapi bahu paśyati//
analyzed: ca anusmarate dṛṣṭvā yat ca api bahu paśyati
translated: or one that is seen after recollecting, or one that is seen after seeing many things.

original: abhyutthito yathā mārge svapnaante pratibudhyate/
analyzed: yathā mārge svapna ante pratibudhyate
translated: Just as one who has risen on the path awakens from a dream,

original: viṣamaṃ vā tathāadhvānaṃ chidraṃ vā pratipadyate//
analyzed: vā tathā adhvānam chidram vā pratipadyate
translated: one may encounter a difficult road or a hole.

original: agniṃ prajvalitaṃ taptaṃ śamitvā tu praśasyate/p /
analyzed: prajvalitam taptam śamitvā tu
translated: But it is praised to extinguish a blazing and burning fire.

original: gṛhāṇāṃ karaṇaṃ śastaṃ bhedanaṃ na praśasyate//🔽nirmalaṃ gaganaṃ śastaṃ sameghaṃ na praśasyate//
analyzed: karaṇam śastam bhedanam na praśasyate  gaganam śastam sa megham na praśasyate
translated: The construction of houses is praised, but their destruction is not praised.🔽A cloudless sky is praised, but a cloudy sky is not praised.

original: prasannam udakaṃ śastaṃ kaluṣaṃ na praśasyate/
analyzed: udakam śastam kaluṣam na praśasyate
translated: Clear water is praised, but muddy water is not praised.

original: adhvānaṃ gamanaṃ śastaṃ na kvacit saṃnivartanaṃ/
analyzed: gamanam śastam na kvacid saṃnivartanam
translated: Traveling on the road is praised, but not turning back anywhere.

original: suvarṇadarśanaṃ śastaṃ dhāraṇaṃ na praśasyate//
analyzed: śastam dhāraṇam na praśasyate
translated: Seeing gold is praised, but wearing it is not praised.

original: māṃsasya darśanaṃ sādhu bhakṣaṇaṃ na praśasyate/
analyzed: darśanam sādhu bhakṣaṇam na praśasyate
translated: The sight of meat is good, but eating it is not commended.

original: madyasya darśanaṃ śastaṃ pānaṃ tu na praśasyate//🔽pṛthivī haritā śastā vivarṇā na praśasyate/
analyzed: darśanam śastam pānam tu na praśasyate  haritā śastā vivarṇā na praśasyate
translated: The sight of liquor is commendable, but drinking it is not praised.🔽A green earth is commendable, a discolored one is not praised.

original: yānasyaārohaṇaṃ śastaṃ patanaṃ na praśasyate//🔽svapneṣu ruditaṃ śastaṃ hasitaṃ na praśasyate/🔽pracchannadarśanaṃ śastaṃ nagnaṃ naiva praśasyate//
analyzed: śastam patanam na praśasyate  ruditam śastam hasitam na praśasyate  śastam nagnam na eva praśasyate
translated: Mounting a vehicle is commendable, falling from it is not praised.🔽In dreams, weeping is commendable, laughing is not praised.🔽Secret seeing is commendable, nakedness is not at all praised.

original: mālyasya darśanaṃ śastaṃ dhāraṇaṃ na praśasyate/🔽gātraṃ vikartitaṃ sādhu prokṣitaṃ na praśasyate//🔽mṛduḥ praśasyate vāto naativātaḥ praśasyate/
analyzed: darśanam śastam dhāraṇam na praśasyate  vikartitam sādhu prokṣitam na praśasyate  praśasyate vātaḥ na ativātaḥ praśasyate
translated: The sight of garlands is commendable, wearing them is not praised.🔽A mutilated body is good, a sprinkled one is not praised.🔽A gentle wind is commendable, not an excessive wind is praised.

original: vyādhito malinaḥ śasto bhūṣito na praśasyate/
analyzed: malinaḥ śastaḥ bhūṣitaḥ na praśasyate
translated: A sick, dirty person is commendable, an adorned one is not praised.

original: parvataārohaṇaṃ śastaṃ na tu tatraavatāraṇaṃ//
analyzed: śastam na tu tatra avatāraṇam
translated: Climbing a mountain is commendable, but not descending there.

original: dhūmrā ghanā dundubhiśaṅkhaśabdo vāto abhravṛṣṭiś ca tathā samantāt/
analyzed: ghanāḥ dundubhi śaṅkha śabdaḥ vātaḥ abhra vṛṣṭiḥ ca tathā samantāt
translated: Smoke, clouds, the sound of drums and conches, wind, and rain from the clouds all around,

original: sarvasthirāṇāṃ ca calaś ca yaḥ syād ye caantare doṣakṛtā vikārāḥ//
analyzed: ca calaḥ ca yaḥ syāt ye ca antare doṣa kṛtāḥ vikārāḥ
translated: And any instability and the disorders caused by internal faults.

original: pūrveṣu rūpeṣu yathāvad iṣṭā rājarṣayo devagaṇāś ca sarve/
analyzed: rūpeṣu yathāvat iṣṭāḥ rājarṣayaḥ deva gaṇāḥ ca sarve
translated: In the former forms, all the royal sages and all the hosts of gods are duly worshipped,

original: yad brāhmaṇagātravikartanaṃ ca /
analyzed: brāhmaṇa gātra vikartanam ca
translated: And the cutting of the body of a Brahmin.

original: etāni sarvāṇy api śobhanāni//
analyzed: etāni sarvāṇi api śobhanāni
translated: All these are also auspicious.

original: yat pūrvarūpeṣu bhavet praśastaṃ duḥsvapnam etāni śamaṃ nayanti/
analyzed: pūrvarūpeṣu bhavet praśastam duḥsvapnam etāni śamam nayanti
translated: Whatever is praised in the former forms, these remove bad dreams.

original: gāvaḥ pradānaṃ dvijapūjanaṃ ca duḥsvapnam etena parijitaṃ syāt//
analyzed: pradānam dvija pūjanam ca duḥsvapnam etena parijitam syāt
translated: Cows, giving gifts, and worshipping Brahmins - by this one would conquer bad dreams.

original: devaṃ ca yaṃ bhaktigato manuṣyas taṃ tu parāṃś caarcayituṃ yateta/p /
analyzed: ca yam bhakti gataḥ manuṣyaḥ tam tu parān
translated: And the man who is devoted to that god should strive to worship him and others.

original: svapnaṃ tu dṛṣṭvā prathame pradoṣe saṃvatsaraante asya vipākam āhuḥ//
analyzed: tu dṛṣṭvā prathame pradoṣe saṃvatsara ante asya vipākam āhuḥ
translated: But if one sees a dream in the first part of the night, they say its result will be at the end of the year.

original: ṣaṇmāsikaṃ yac ca bhaved dvitīye ṣaṭpākṣikaṃ yat tu bhavet tṛtīye/
analyzed: yat ca bhavet dvitīye ṣaṣ pākṣikam yat tu bhavet tṛtīye
translated: What would be in the second part is for six months, and what would be in the third part is for six fortnights,

original: adhyardhamāse taram eva yat syāt phalec caturthe rajanīprabhāte//🔽dvijottame vā tilapātradānaṃ śāntikriyāḥ svastyayanaprayogāḥ/
analyzed: taram eva yat syāt phalet caturthe rajanī prabhāte  vā tila pātra dānam śānti kriyāḥ svastyayana prayogāḥ
translated: And what would be more than that in the last half month would come to fruition in the fourth part of the night.🔽Or the gift of a vessel of sesamum seeds to an excellent Brahmin, peace offerings, the practice of benedictions,

original: pūjā gurūṇāṃ parimiṣṭam annaṃ duḥsvapnam etāni vināśayanti//
analyzed: gurūṇām parimiṣṭam annam duḥsvapnam etāni vināśayanti
translated: The worship of elders, and well-cooked food - these destroy bad dreams.

original: ayaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārin svapnaadhyāyanāmaadhyāyaḥ/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin svapnaadhyāya nāmaadhyāyaḥ
translated: This, sir, is the chapter named On Dreams in the Purusharthasiddhyupadesh.

original: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārinn aparam api svapnaadhyāyaṃ vyākhyāsyāmi/
analyzed: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin aparam api svapna adhyāyam vyākhyāsyāmi
translated: Now, O Puṣkarasārin, I will explain another chapter on dreams.

original: tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: atha kiṃ/
analyzed: atha kim
translated: Then what?

original: kathayatu bhagavāṃs triśaṅkuḥ/
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ
translated: Let the Blessed One Triśaṅku speak.

original: aparaḥ svapnaadhyāyaḥ
analyzed: u aparaḥ svapnaadhyāyaḥ
translated: Another chapter on dreams

original: śubhaaśubhānāṃ svapnānāṃ yat phalaṃ samudāhṛtaṃ/
analyzed: svapnānām yat phalam samudāhṛtam
translated: The results that are declared of auspicious and inauspicious dreams,

original: nimittaṃ yādṛśaṃ yasya śṛṇu vakṣyāmi tatvataḥ//
analyzed: yādṛśam yasya śṛṇu vakṣyāmi
translated: Listen, I will tell you the truth about the kind of omen that is for whom.

original: jāgrato yadi vā trasto divā svapnāni paśyati/
analyzed: yadi vā trastaḥ divā svapnāni paśyati
translated: If one who is awake sees dreams during the day, out of fear,

original: na tu bhayaṃ bhavet tasya jānīyād eva buddhimān//
analyzed: tu bhayam bhavet tasya jānīyāt eva buddhimān
translated: The wise one should know that there is no danger for him.

original: yasya tu yo bhavec chatrur yasya vidheyam icchati/
analyzed: tu yaḥ bhavet śatruḥ yasya vidheyam icchati
translated: But for whom there is an enemy, for whom he desires to be obeyed,

original: svapne tu kalahaṃ dṛṣṭvā kṣipraṃ prītir bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: tu kalaham dṛṣṭvā kṣipram prītiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Having seen a quarrel in a dream, there will soon be affection.

original: rajanyāṃ purime yāme yo adrākṣīt sukhaduḥkhadaṃ/
analyzed: pur ime yāme yaḥ adrākṣīt sukha duḥkha dam
translated: One who sees in the first watch of the night that which brings happiness and sorrow,

original: adhvānaṃ cirakālena tathā hy eṣa nivartate//
analyzed: cira kālena tathā hi eṣa nivartate
translated: The path returns like that after a long time.

original: madhyame bhavate naiva kṣipraṃ bhavati paścime/
analyzed: bhavate na eva kṣipram bhavati paścime
translated: In the middle, it does not happen, it happens quickly in the last.

original: vaivārgaṃ tvaritaṃ dṛṣṭvā strīlābham abhinirdiśet//
analyzed: tvaritam dṛṣṭvā strī lābham abhinirdiśet
translated: Having seen weariness quickly, one should predict the gain of a woman.

original: dṛṣṭvā jalacarān matsyān evaṃ jānīta buddhimān/
analyzed: jalacarān matsyān evam jānīta buddhimān
translated: Having seen aquatic fish, the wise one should know thus:

original: yat kiñcid ārabhiṣyāmi kṣipram eva bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: kiñcid ārabhiṣyāmi kṣipram eva bhaviṣyati
translated: Whatever I undertake will quickly come to pass.

original: campāyāṃ dhṛṣaṇaṃ haste dhṛṣet svapnaantareṣu vā/
analyzed: dhṛṣaṇam haste dhṛṣet svapna antareṣu vā
translated: If in Champa, one sees a man with a sword in his hand, or if he dreams of it,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād varṇam evaṃ bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt varṇam evam bhaviṣyati
translated: having awakened, one should know that such will be the complexion.

original: sarvāṇi khalu pānāni madhurāṇi sukhāni ca/🔽yas tu pibati svapnaante sa ca lābhaiḥ prayujyate//
analyzed: khalu pānāni madhurāṇi sukhāni ca  tu pibati svapna ante sa ca lābhaiḥ prayujyate
translated: All drinks are indeed sweet and pleasant,🔽but he who drinks in a dream is endowed with gain.

original: śvaśṛgālair bhakṣyate atra svapne saṃparivāryate/p /
analyzed: bhakṣyate atra svapne
translated: If in a dream one is surrounded by dogs and jackals who devour him,

original: pratibuddhas tu jānīyāt śatrur eva pramūrcchati//
analyzed: tu jānīyāt śatruḥ eva pramūrcchati
translated: having awakened, one should know that the enemy will indeed be destroyed.

original: upari kākā gṛdhrāś ca dhāvanty upari yānti ca/
analyzed: kākāḥ gṛdhrāḥ ca dhāvanti upari yānti ca
translated: If crows and vultures fly above and around,

original: pratibaddho vijānīyāc chatrur mā vadhayiṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt śatruḥ mā vadhayiṣyati
translated: having awakened, one should know that the enemy will not kill me.

original: yasya paragṛhaśvāno dvāre mūtraṃ prakurvate/
analyzed: para gṛha śvānaḥ dvāre mūtram prakurvate
translated: If the dogs of another's house urinate at the door,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād bhāryā me jāram icchati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt bhāryā me jāram icchati
translated: having awakened, one should know that my wife desires a paramour.

original: ekaś ca dharaṇau pādo dvitīyaḥ śirasi sthitaḥ/
analyzed: ca dharaṇau pādaḥ dvitīyaḥ śirasi sthitaḥ
translated: If one foot is on the ground and the second is on the head,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād rājyalābho bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt rājya lābhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: having awakened, one should know that there will be gain of a kingdom.

original: samudraṃ yadi paśyed vā pātum icchati tajjalaṃ/
analyzed: yadi paśyet vā pātum icchati tat jalam
translated: If one sees the ocean or desires to drink its water,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād rājyalābho bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt rājya lābhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When he awakes, he should know that he will obtain a kingdom.

original: vṛkṣaṃ parvatam āruhya nāgaṃ ca turagaṃ tathā/
analyzed: parvatam āruhya nāgam ca turagam tathā
translated: Having climbed a tree, a mountain, an elephant, or a horse,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād rājyalābho bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt rājya lābhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When he awakes, he should know that he will obtain a kingdom.

original: yas tu svapnaantare paśyet pitṝn yān iha caanyathā/
analyzed: tu svapna antare paśyet pitṝn yān iha ca anyathā
translated: But he who sees in a dream his ancestors or others in a different way,

original: tathā mātā pitā caeva tasya jīvanti te ciraṃ//
analyzed: mātā pitā ca eva tasya jīvanti te ciram
translated: And likewise his mother and father, they live long for him.

original: yas tu svapnaantare paśyet keśaśmaśrūvikartitaṃ/
analyzed: tu svapna antare paśyet keśa śmaśrū vikartitam
translated: But he who sees in a dream his hair and beard trimmed,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād arthasiddhir bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt artha siddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When he awakes, he should know that his objectives will be accomplished.

original: ānanaṃ caudake dṛṣṭvā madhye agnau ca vidhāvitaṃ/
analyzed: ca audake dṛṣṭvā madhye agnau ca vidhāvitam
translated: Having seen his face in water, running in the middle of fire,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād kulavṛddhir bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt kula vṛddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When he awakes, he should know that there will be an increase in his family.

original: dhāvanaṃ laṅghanaṃ caeva grāmāṇāṃ parivartanaṃ/
analyzed: laṅghanam ca eva grāmāṇām parivartanam
translated: Running, jumping, and turning around villages,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād ātmānaṃ śātitam iti//
analyzed: vijānīyāt ātmānam śātitam iti
translated: When he awakes, he should know that he has been shaved.

original: caurāṇām api sāmagrīṃ svapnaante yas tu paśyati/
analyzed: api sāmagrīm svapna ante yaḥ tu paśyati
translated: But he who sees in a dream even the assembly of thieves,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād ātmānaṃ śātitam iti//
analyzed: vijānīyāt ātmānam śātitam iti
translated: When he awakes, he should know that he has been shaved.

original: kṛṣṇasarpagṛhītaṃ tu svapnaante yas tu paśyati/
analyzed: tu svapna ante yaḥ tu paśyati
translated: But he who sees in a dream being seized by a black serpent,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyāc chatrupīḍā bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt śatru pīḍā bhaviṣyati
translated: and having awakened, he should know that there will be affliction to his enemies.

original: kaṭakān karṇikāś caeva haṃsakeyūrakuṇḍalaṃ/p /
analyzed: karṇikāḥ ca eva
translated: If one sees ornaments such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces, armlets, and earrings,

original: yas tu caābharaṇaṃ paśyed bandhuvargo bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: tu ca ābharaṇam paśyet bandhu vargaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: he should know that there will be a group of relatives.

original: kuḍye ca gṛhaprākāre dhāvatīha parasparaṃ/
analyzed: ca gṛha prākāre dhāvati iha parasparam
translated: If one runs on a wall or in a house, or if one runs on a wall or in a house,

original: nāvike dhanasaṃyoge /🔽aṃgate kṣaṇayaṃ khajaḥ//
analyzed: dhana saṃyoge  aṃgate kṣaṇayam khajaḥ
translated: if one sees a boat, there will be a connection with wealth.🔽If one sees a bird pecking at one's body,

original: yas tu svapnaantare paśyec caātmānam agnitāpitaṃ/
analyzed: tu svapna antare paśyet ca ātmānam agni tāpitam
translated: if one sees oneself being heated by fire

original: pratibuddho vijānīyāj jvaraṃ kṣipraṃ bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt jvaram kṣipram bhaviṣyati
translated: and having awakened, he should know that there will soon be a fever.

original: rājānaṃ kupitaṃ dṛṣṭvā /
analyzed: kupitam dṛṣṭvā
translated: If one sees an angry king

original: ātmānaṃ malinīkṛtaṃ/
analyzed: ātmānam malinīkṛtam
translated: and sees oneself defiled,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyāt kuṭumbaṃ tasya naśyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt kuṭumbam tasya naśyati
translated: having awakened, he should know that his family will perish.

original: kāṣṭhabhāraṃ tṛṇaṃ caeva bahubhāram abhīkṣṇaśaḥ/
analyzed: tṛṇam ca eva bahu bhāram abhīkṣṇaśas
translated: If one sees a heavy load of wood or grass

original: ātmanaḥ śiraso dṛṣṭvā guruvyādhir bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: śirasaḥ dṛṣṭvā guru vyādhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: on one's own head, there will be a serious illness.

original: yastu bānarayuktena gacchate pur imāṃ diśaṃ/
analyzed: bānara yuktena gacchate pur imām diśam
translated: If one goes in this direction with a chariot yoked with monkeys,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād rātrir eṣā hy apaścimā//
analyzed: vijānīyāt rātriḥ eṣā hi apaścimā
translated: having awakened, he should know that this is the last night.

original: candrasūryau ca saṃgṛhya pāṇinā parimārjati//
analyzed: ca saṃgṛhya pāṇinā parimārjati
translated: If one touches the moon and sun with one's hand and wipes them,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād āryadharmāgamo hi saḥ//
analyzed: vijānīyāt ārya dharma āgamaḥ hi saḥ
translated: When he awakes, he should know that it is the arrival of the noble Dharma.

original: sumanāṃ vārṣikaṃ kīṃ caeva kumudāny utpalāni ca/
analyzed: vārṣikam kīm ca eva kumudāni utpalāni ca
translated: If one sees in a dream a happy rainy season, and also lilies and lotuses,

original: yastu paśyati svapnaante dakṣiṇīyasamāgamaḥ//
analyzed: paśyati svapna ante dakṣiṇīya samāgamaḥ
translated: If one sees at the end of a dream the meeting with one who is worthy of offerings.

original: brāhmaṇaṃ śramaṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā kṣapaṇaṃ suranāyakaṃ/
analyzed: śramaṇam dṛṣṭvā kṣapaṇam sura nāyakam
translated: Having seen a brahmin, an ascetic, a naked ascetic, or a lord of the gods,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād yakṣā me hy anukampakāḥ//
analyzed: vijānīyāt yakṣāḥ me hi anukampakāḥ
translated: When he awakes, he should know that the yakshas have compassion for him.

original: rudhireṇa villiptasya snātvā caivaātmalohitaiḥ/
analyzed: snātvā ca eva ātma lohitaiḥ
translated: If one is smeared with blood, and bathes in one's own blood,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād aiśvaryādhisamāgamaḥ//🔽mudgamāṣayavāṃś caeva dhānyaṃ jvalanadarśanaṃ/
analyzed: vijānīyāt aiśvarya ādhi samāgamaḥ  ca eva dhānyam jvalana darśanam
translated: When he awakes, he should know that he will attain great prosperity.🔽If one sees in a dream mung beans, black gram, barley, and grain, and a blazing fire,

original: yas tu svapnaantare paśyet subhikṣaṃ tatra nirdiśet//
analyzed: tu svapna antare paśyet subhikṣam tatra nirdiśet
translated: One should predict an abundance of food there.

original: suvarṇaṃ ca tathā rūpyaṃ muktāhāraṃ tathāiva ca/
analyzed: ca tathā rūpyam muktā hāram tathā iva ca
translated: If one sees in a dream gold, silver, and also a pearl necklace,

original: yas tu svapnaantare paśyan nidhiṃ tatra vinirdiśet//
analyzed: tu svapna antare paśyan nidhim tatra vinirdiśet
translated: One should predict a treasure there.

original: bandhanaṃ bahu dṛṣṭvā tu chedanaṃ kuṭṭanaṃ tathā/
analyzed: bahu dṛṣṭvā tu chedanam kuṭṭanam tathā
translated: If one sees in a dream many bonds, and also cutting and beating,

original: pratibuddho vijānīyād arthasiddhir bhaviṣyati//
analyzed: vijānīyāt artha siddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When he awakes, he should know that he will attain his goal.

original: ayaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārinn aparaḥ svapnaadhyāyaḥ/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin aparaḥ svapnaadhyāyaḥ
translated: This, O Puṣkarasārin, is another chapter on dreams.

original: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin māsaparīkṣānāmaadhyāyaṃ vyākhyāsyāmi/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin māsa parīkṣā nāma adhyāyam vyākhyāsyāmi
translated: Now, O Puṣkarasārin, I will explain the chapter named the Examination of the Months.

original: tac chūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: kathayatu bhagavāṃs triśaṅkuḥ//E
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān
translated: Let the Blessed Triśaṅku tell it.

original: māsaparīkṣā p /
analyzed: u māsa parīkṣā
translated: Examination of the Months

original: yadi phālgune māse nirghoṣa upari bhavet manuṣyāṇāṃ maraṇaṃ codayati/
analyzed: phālgune māse nirghoṣaḥ upari bhavet manuṣyāṇām maraṇam codayati
translated: If there is a whirlwind in the month of Phālguna, it foretells death for humans.

original: navacandro lohitaābhāso dṛśyate/
analyzed: nava candraḥ lohita ābhāsaḥ dṛśyate
translated: The new moon is seen with a reddish glow.

original: sarvasasyaanutpattiṃ codayati/
analyzed: sarva sasya anutpattim codayati
translated: It foretells the non-appearance of all crops.

original: yadi devo garjati prathamaṃ mahāsasyāni bhavanti/
analyzed: yadi devaḥ garjati prathamam mahā sasyāni bhavanti
translated: If the god thunders, the great crops will be in the beginning.

original: paścimasasyaṃ na bhavet/
analyzed: paścima sasyam na bhavet
translated: The later crops will not be.

original: kalahaṃ codayati/
analyzed: kalaham codayati
translated: It foretells quarrels.

original: yadi caitre māse devo garjati tadā sarvasasyasamutpattiṃ codayati/
analyzed: caitre māse devaḥ garjati tadā sarva sasya samutpattim codayati
translated: If the god thunders in the month of Caitra, it foretells the appearance of all crops.

original: yadi candragraho bhavati mahān sannipāto bhavati/
analyzed: yadi candra grahaḥ bhavati mahān sannipātaḥ bhavati
translated: If there is a lunar eclipse, there will be a great gathering.

original: śūnyāni grāmakṣetrāṇi bhaviṣyanti/
analyzed: śūnyāni grāma kṣetrāṇi bhaviṣyanti
translated: The villages and fields will be empty.

original: yadi nīhāraṃ bhūmiṃ chādayati subhikṣaṃ codayati/🔽yadi vaiśākhe māse devo garjati subhikṣaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi nīhāram bhūmim chādayati subhikṣam codayati  vaiśākhe māse devaḥ garjati subhikṣam codayati
translated: If dew covers the ground, it foretells an abundance of food.🔽If the god thunders in the month of Vaiśākha, it foretells an abundance of food.

original: yadi pūrve paścime śaṅkhe candragraho bhavati kṣemaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi pūrve paścime śaṅkhe candra grahaḥ bhavati kṣemam codayati
translated: If there is a lunar eclipse in the east or west, it foretells peace.

original: yadi caulkāpāto bhavati yasmiṃś ca janapade nipatati tatra deśe pradhānapuruṣasya vināśo bhavati/
analyzed: yadi ca aulkā pātaḥ bhavati yasmin ca janapade nipatati tatra deśe pradhānapuruṣasya vināśaḥ bhavati
translated: And if a meteor falls, in the country where it falls there is destruction of the chief man of that country.

original: yadi bhūmicālo bhavati subhikṣaṃ codayati/🔽yadi jeyṣṭhe māse devo garjati rogaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi bhūmicālaḥ bhavati subhikṣam codayati  jeyṣṭhe māse devaḥ garjati rogam codayati
translated: If there is an earthquake, it foretells a famine.🔽If it thunders in the month of Jyeṣṭha, it foretells a disease.

original: yadi sūryagraho bhavati manuṣyāṇāṃ vināśaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi sūrya grahaḥ bhavati manuṣyāṇām vināśam codayati
translated: If there is a solar eclipse, it foretells the destruction of men.

original: pūrve paścime vā śaṅkhe yadi candrasya sūryasya kiñcin nimittaṃ lakṣyate tadā kṣemaṃ codayati/
analyzed: pūrve paścime vā śaṅkhe yadi candrasya sūryasya kiñcid nimittam lakṣyate tadā kṣemam codayati
translated: If any sign of the moon or sun is seen in the east or west, then it foretells peace.

original: yadi madhyarātrau candragraho bhavati manuṣyāṇām anyonyaghātaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi madhyarātrau candra grahaḥ bhavati manuṣyāṇām anyonya ghātam codayati
translated: If there is a lunar eclipse at midnight, it foretells mutual harm to men.

original: yadi caupari nirghoṣo bhavati adhyakṣapuruṣasya pīḍāṃ codayati/🔽paracakrāgamaṃ
analyzed: yadi ca aupari nirghoṣaḥ bhavati adhyakṣa puruṣasya pīḍām codayati  para cakra āgamam
translated: And if there is a noise above, it foretells affliction to the chief man.

original: ceti/
analyzed: ca iti
translated: And the invasion of foreign armies.

original: āṣāḍhe māse yadi sūryagraho ruciraābhāso bhavati subhikṣaṃ codayati/🔽yadi candragraho bhavati rogaṃ codayati/
analyzed: māse yadi sūrya grahaḥ rucira ābhāsaḥ bhavati subhikṣam codayati  yadi candra grahaḥ bhavati rogam codayati
translated: In the month of Āṣāḍha, if there is a solar eclipse with a beautiful appearance, it foretells a good harvest.🔽If there is a lunar eclipse, it foretells a disease.

original: yadi vidyun niścarati kalpāṇaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi vidyut niścarati kalpāṇam codayati
translated: If lightning flashes, it foretells good fortune.

original: yadi nīhāraṃ bhūmiṃ chādayati/
analyzed: yadi nīhāram bhūmim chādayati
translated: If dew covers the ground,

original: śrāvaṇamāse yadi sūryagraho bhavati rājyaṃ parivartate/
analyzed: yadi sūrya grahaḥ bhavati rājyam parivartate
translated: If there is a solar eclipse in the month of Śrāvaṇa, there will be a change of government.

original: yadi candragraho bhavati prathame māse durbhikṣaṃ codayati/🔽śarabhaiḥ śobhanaśasyanāśo bhaviṣyati/
analyzed: yadi candra grahaḥ bhavati prathame māse durbhikṣam codayati  śarabhaiḥ śobhana śasya nāśaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If there is a lunar eclipse in the first month, it foretells famine.🔽If there is an eclipse of the stars, it foretells the destruction of good crops by wild animals.

original: yadi p / tārakā yatra deśe patanti tatra yuddhaṃ codayati/🔽yadi caatiśayaṃ bhūmicālo bhavati rogaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi tārakāḥ yatra deśe patanti tatra yuddham codayati  yadi ca atiśayam bhūmicālaḥ bhavati rogam codayati
translated: If the stars fall in a certain place, it foretells war there.🔽If there is an earthquake, it foretells disease.

original: yadi nirghoṣo bhavati tatra gṛhe yo gṛhasvāmī bhavati tasya vināśaṃ codayati/🔽atra ca māse abhinavaṃ prāvaraṇaṃ na prāvaritavyaṃ/
analyzed: yadi nirghoṣaḥ bhavati tatra gṛhe yaḥ gṛha svāmī bhavati tasya vināśam codayati  atra ca māse abhinavam prāvaraṇam na prāvaritavyam
translated: If there is a loud noise, it foretells the destruction of the householder who is the master of the house.🔽And in this month, new clothes should not be worn.

original: āvāho vivāho na kartavyaḥ/
analyzed: āvāhaḥ vivāhaḥ na kartavyaḥ
translated: Marriage and wedding should not be performed.

original: paribhūto bhavati/
analyzed: paribhūtaḥ bhavati
translated: One will be humiliated.

original: yady aśvayuje māse devo garjati manuṣyāṇāṃ vināśanaṃ codayati/
analyzed: aśvayuje māse devaḥ garjati manuṣyāṇām vināśanam codayati
translated: If it thunders in the month of Āśvayuja, it foretells the destruction of men.

original: yadi sūryauparāgo bhavati mahāpuruṣavināśaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi sūrya auparāgaḥ bhavati mahā puruṣa vināśam codayati
translated: If there is a solar eclipse, it foretells the destruction of a great man.

original: yadi pūrve yāme candrasya nimittaṃ dṛśyate subhikṣaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi pūrve yāme candrasya nimittam dṛśyate subhikṣam codayati
translated: If the lunar phenomenon is seen in the first watch, it foretells plenty.

original: yadi bhūmicālo bhavati ākulaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi bhūmicālaḥ bhavati ākulam codayati
translated: If there is an earthquake, it foretells trouble.

original: pararājā deśaṃ haniṣyati/
analyzed: para rājā deśam haniṣyati
translated: The king of another country will destroy the country.

original: tatra ca manuṣyā anyonyaṃ vadhayiṣyantiiti codayati/
analyzed: tatra ca manuṣyāḥ anyonyam vadhayiṣyanti iti codayati
translated: And there, men will kill each other. This is the accusation.

original: yadi kārttike māse devo varṣati mahadākulaṃ codayati/
analyzed: kārttike māse devaḥ varṣati mahat ākulam codayati
translated: If it rains in the month of Kārttika, there will be great confusion. This is the accusation.

original: prāṇakāś ca dhānyaṃ khādiṣyanti/
analyzed: prāṇakāḥ ca dhānyam khādiṣyanti
translated: And insects will eat the crops.

original: yady ekaantarūpaṃ vāto vāti tatra ca manuṣyā jalena vibhramiṣyanti/
analyzed: yadi eka anta rūpam vātaḥ vāti tatra ca manuṣyāḥ jalena vibhramiṣyanti
translated: If the wind blows in one direction, and there, men will be confused by water.

original: mahāātmanaḥ puruṣasya vināśaṃ codayati/
analyzed: mahāātmanaḥ puruṣasya vināśam codayati
translated: He accuses of the destruction of a great being.

original: yadi pūrve yāme utpāto bhavati mahāvarṣaṃ bhavati/
analyzed: yadi pūrve yāme utpātaḥ bhavati mahā varṣam bhavati
translated: If there is an omen in the first watch, there will be heavy rain.

original: mahāpuruṣasya ca maraṇaṃ bhavati/
analyzed: mahāpuruṣasya ca maraṇam bhavati
translated: And there will be the death of a great man.

original: yadi nirghoṣo bhavati rogaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi nirghoṣaḥ bhavati rogam codayati
translated: If there is a loud noise, he accuses of disease.

original: yadi mārgaśīrṣe māsi devo garjati śasyavināśo bhavati/
analyzed: mārgaśīrṣe māsi devaḥ garjati śasya vināśaḥ bhavati
translated: If it thunders in the month of Mārgaśīrṣa, there will be destruction of crops.

original: anyaś ca tatra svāmī bhavati/🔽yadi caākāśe nirghoṣo bhavati yat pūrvabhāgīyā manuṣyās teṣām āmayaṃ codayati/🔽yadi bhūmicālo bhavati yas tatra janapade pradhānapuruṣo sa vadhān mokṣyati/
analyzed: anyaḥ ca tatra svāmī bhavati  yadi ca ākāśe nirghoṣaḥ bhavati yat pūrvabhāgīyāḥ manuṣyāḥ teṣām āmayam codayati  yadi bhūmicālaḥ bhavati yaḥ tatra janapade sa vadhāt mokṣyati
translated: And another will be the lord there.🔽If there is a loud noise in the sky, he accuses of the disease of those people who are in the eastern part.🔽If there is an earthquake, the chief man in that country will be released from death.

original: yadi pauṣe māse devo garjati prathame yāme janapadanāśo bhavati/
analyzed: pauṣe māse devaḥ garjati prathame yāme janapada nāśaḥ bhavati
translated: If it thunders in the month of Pauṣa in the first watch, there will be destruction of the country.

original: dvitīye mahāātmanaḥ puruṣasya bandhanaṃ codayati/
analyzed: dvitīye mahāātmanaḥ puruṣasya bandhanam codayati
translated: In the second, it predicts the bondage of the great soul, the man.

original: prathame yāme ca yadi candrauparāgo bhavati lohitavarṇaś ca dṛśyate udakaāgamaṃ codayati/
analyzed: prathame yāme ca yadi candra auparāgaḥ bhavati lohita varṇaḥ ca dṛśyate udaka āgamam codayati
translated: If there is a lunar eclipse in the first watch and the moon is seen to be red in color, it predicts the arrival of water.

original: mahāātmamanuṣyaṃ codayati/
analyzed: mahāātma manuṣyam codayati
translated: It predicts a great soul, a man.

original: yadi sūryagraho bhavati śuddhapuruṣaṇāṃ raṇaṃ/
analyzed: yadi sūrya grahaḥ bhavati śuddha puruṣaṇām
translated: If there is a solar eclipse, it predicts a battle of pure men.

original: yadi tārakāḥ patantyo vidṛśyante tatra janapade ākulaṃ codayati/🔽yaty ākāśe nirghoṣo bhavati manuṣyāṇāṃ maraṇaṃ codayati/
analyzed: yadi tārakāḥ patantyaḥ vidṛśyante tatra janapade ākulam codayati  yati ākāśe nirghoṣaḥ bhavati manuṣyāṇām maraṇam codayati
translated: If falling stars are seen, it predicts turmoil in that country.🔽If there is a sound in the sky, it predicts the death of men.

original: yadi dvitīye nirghoṣo bhavati amnuṣyāś caurair hanyante/
analyzed: yadi dvitīye nirghoṣaḥ bhavati amnuṣyāḥ cauraiḥ hanyante
translated: If the sound is in the second [watch], non-human beings will be killed by thieves.

original: yady atraiva māse tārakā utsṛṣṭā na candro dṛsyate sasyaṃ saṃcodayati/
analyzed: yadi atra eva māse tārakāḥ utsṛṣṭāḥ na candraḥ sasyam saṃcodayati
translated: If the stars are released in this very month and the moon is not seen, it predicts the harvest.

original: yadi bhūmicālo bhavati mahāmanuṣyasya maraṇaṃ bhavati/
analyzed: yadi bhūmicālaḥ bhavati mahā manuṣyasya maraṇam bhavati
translated: If there is an earthquake, it predicts the death of a great man.

original: atraiva māse devasthānaṃ kartavyaṃ/
analyzed: atra eva māse devasthānam kartavyam
translated: In this very month, a temple should be built.

original: vṛkṣā ropayitavyāḥ/
analyzed: vṛkṣāḥ ropayitavyāḥ
translated: Trees should be planted.

original: sūlavāstu pratiṣṭhāpayitavyaṃ/
analyzed: sūlavāstu pratiṣṭhāpayitavyam
translated: A sacrificial post should be erected.

original: ayaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārin māsaparīkṣānāmaadhyāyaḥ/p /
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin
translated: This, O Puṣkarasārin, is the chapter named The Examination of the Months.

original: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin khañjarīṭakajñānaṃnāmaadhyāyaṃ vyākhyāsyāmi/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin khañjarīṭakajñānam nāma adhyāyam vyākhyāsyāmi
translated: Now, O Puṣkarasārin, I will explain the chapter named the Knowledge of the Khakharita.

original: tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: atha kiṃ/
analyzed: atha kim
translated: What then?

original: kathayatu bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ//mchecked
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ
translated: Let the Blessed One Triśaṅku speak.

original: khañjarīṭakajñānaṃ
analyzed: khañjarīṭaka jñānam
translated: The Knowledge of the Khakharita

original: khañjarīṭakaśāstraṃ vai parvate gandhamādane/
analyzed: vai parvate gandhamādane
translated: The Khakharita treatise is seen on the Gandhamādana mountain.

original: kucarair dṛśyate saumyakucarasya mahābhayaṃ//
analyzed: dṛśyate saumya kucarasya mahā bhayam
translated: When seen by the moving ones, there is great fear for the moving ones.

original: yāni tāni nimittāni darśayet khañjarīṭakaḥ/
analyzed: tāni nimittāni darśayet khañjarīṭakaḥ
translated: The signs that the Khakharita would show,

original: pracarato bhaved dṛṣṭvā pañcauttarapado dvijaḥ//
analyzed: bhavet dṛṣṭvā pañca auttarapadaḥ dvijaḥ
translated: when seen while moving, would be five, with the next word, for the twice-born.

original: tatra sarve pravarteyur yatra yeṣu bhaved bhavet/🔽śādvale bahucelatvaṃ gomayeṣu prabandhatā//
analyzed: sarve pravarteyuḥ yatra yeṣu bhavet bhavet  bahu cela tvam gomayeṣu prabandha tā
translated: There all should engage, where and in which there would be.🔽In the green grass, there would be many clothes; in the cow dung, continuity.

original: kañcāre bahucelatvaṃ kardame bahubhakṣatā/
analyzed: bahu cela tvam kardame bahu bhakṣa tā
translated: In the dust, there would be many clothes; in the mud, much eating.

original: kṛkare svalpacelatvaṃ purīṣe tu dṛśaṃ śravaḥ//
analyzed: su alpa cela tvam purīṣe tu dṛśam śravaḥ
translated: In the cricket, there would be few clothes; in the feces, one should hear the sight.

original: bhasme vivādam aphalaṃ vālukāyāṃ tu saṃbhramaḥ/
analyzed: vivādam aphalam vālukāyām tu saṃbhramaḥ
translated: In the ashes, fruitless dispute; in the sand, confusion.

original: devadvāre tu sammānaṃ padmeṣu bahuvittatā/
analyzed: tu sammānam padmeṣu bahu vitta tā
translated: In the Devadāru, honor; in the lotuses, much wealth.

original: phale arthaanuguṇaṃ proktaṃ puṣpeṣu priyasaṃamaḥ//
analyzed: artha anuguṇam proktam puṣpeṣu priya saṃamaḥ
translated: In the fruit, benefit is said to be in accordance with the wealth; in the flowers, much affection.

original: bhayaṃ prākāraśṛṅgeṣu kaṭakeṣv aridarśanaṃ/
analyzed: prākāra śṛṅgeṣu kaṭakeṣu ari darśanam
translated: Fear on the tops of walls and ramparts, seeing enemies in the fortifications,

original: pakṣayā carate vyādhiḥ patito mṛtyum ādiśet//
analyzed: carate vyādhiḥ patitaḥ mṛtyum ādiśet
translated: and disease moves in the oblique direction. If fallen, one should predict death.

original: sugandhatailabhūtāni methune nidhidarśanaṃ/
analyzed: methune nidhi darśanam
translated: Smelling fragrant oil, having intercourse, seeing a treasure,

original: vṛkṣaagre vidyate pānaṃ gṛheṣv atha / / / lasaḥ//
analyzed: vidyate pānam gṛheṣu atha lasaḥ
translated: drinking on the top of a tree, and in the house, there is a lasa.

original: deśabhaṅgaḥ pravāde ca bandhanaṃ vigrahīkṛte/
analyzed: pravāde ca bandhanam vigrahīkṛte
translated: Destruction of the country, and in rumors, imprisonment, when engaged in battle,

original: amṛtaṃ ca sthitaṃ dṛṣṭvā /
analyzed: ca sthitam dṛṣṭvā
translated: and seeing immortality established,

original: odanaṃ naatra saṃśayaḥ//
analyzed: odanam na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: there is rice, there is no doubt.

original: gavāṃ pṛṣṭhe dhruvaṃ siddhir aśvapṛṣṭhe dhruvaṃ jayaḥ/
analyzed: pṛṣṭhe dhruvam siddhiḥ aśva pṛṣṭhe dhruvam jayaḥ
translated: On the back of cows, success is certain, on the back of horses, victory is certain,

original: avikānām ajānāṃ ca pṛṣṭhe sarvatra śasyate//
analyzed: ajānām ca pṛṣṭhe sarvatra śasyate
translated: on the back of goats and sheep, it is praised everywhere.

original: uṣṭrapṛṣṭhe ghruvaṃ kleśaḥ śvānapṛṣṭhe ca vidravaḥ/p /
analyzed: ghruvam kleśaḥ śvāna pṛṣṭhe ca
translated: On the back of camels, there is certainly hardship, on the back of dogs, there is flight,

original: pṛṣṭhe ca gardabhasyaiha maraṇaṃ naatra saṃśayaḥ//
analyzed: ca gardabhasya iha maraṇam na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: and on the back of donkeys here, death is certain, there is no doubt.

original: kīle tu maraṇaṃ vidyād yūpaagre ca na saṃśayaḥ/🔽kumbhasthāne śmaśāne vā mṛto vā yatra dṛśyate//
analyzed: tu maraṇam vidyāt yūpa agre ca na saṃśayaḥ  śmaśāne vā mṛtaḥ vā yatra dṛśyate
translated: One should know death on a spike, and on the top of a sacrificial post, there is no doubt.🔽Where one is seen dead, in a place of pots or a cremation ground,

original: antarīkṣe praḍīnaṃ tu /
analyzed: praḍīnam tu
translated: if seen flying in the sky,

original: aphalaṃ tu vinirdiśet/
analyzed: aphalam tu vinirdiśet
translated: it should be declared fruitless.

original: dṛṣṭvā samāgataṃ vāsaṃ prahṛṣṭaṃ khañjarīṭakaṃ/
analyzed: samāgatam vāsam prahṛṣṭam khañjarīṭakam
translated: Having seen a happy Khāñjarīṭaka bird arriving,

original: yathāsthānaṃaṃ yathāvarṇaṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ vinirdiśet//
analyzed: yathāvarṇam manuṣyāṇām vinirdiśet
translated: should be indicated according to the place and color of the human beings.

original: viṣame svalpakakṣeṣu prasaktaḥ kalaho bhavet/
analyzed: su alpa kakṣeṣu prasaktaḥ kalahaḥ bhavet
translated: In uneven and small enclosures, there will be quarrels.

original: sameṣu samake kṣetre samān varṇān vinirdiśet/
analyzed: samake kṣetre samān varṇān vinirdiśet
translated: In even and equal fields, one should indicate people of equal castes.

original: nadyāṃ tu śailavāhinyāṃ pravāsam abhinirdiśet//
analyzed: tu śailavāhinyām pravāsam abhinirdiśet
translated: But in a river flowing from a mountain, one should indicate a journey.

original: kāṣṭheṣu nātikā cintā tathāasthiṣu dhanakṣayaḥ/
analyzed: na atikā cintā tathā asthiṣu dhana kṣayaḥ
translated: In wood, there is no great worry, and in bones, there is loss of wealth.

original: yāṃ diśaṃ samudāgacchat pañcauttarapadaḥ khagaḥ/
analyzed: diśam samudāgacchat pañca auttarapadaḥ khagaḥ
translated: In whatever direction the bird with five letters comes,

original: tāṃ diśaṃ gamanaṃ vidyād yathā tasya tathā punaḥ//
analyzed: diśam gamanam vidyāt yathā tasya tathā punar
translated: one should know that direction to be the direction of his journey, just as it is for him.

original: kīṭā vāatha pataṅgā vā bhayaṃ yad iha dṛśyate/
analyzed: pataṅgāḥ vā bhayam yat iha dṛśyate
translated: If insects or moths are seen here, which is a cause of fear,

original: pracurāapi yadā jñeyā narasyaasthīni nirdiśet//
analyzed: yadā jñeyā narasya asthīni nirdiśet
translated: then one should know them to be abundant, and indicate them as a man's bones.

original: apāṃ samīpe gajamastake vā sūryaudaye brāhmaṇasannidhau vā/
analyzed: samīpe gajamastake vā sūrya udaye brāhmaṇa sannidhau vā
translated: Near water, on an elephant's head, at sunrise, in the presence of a Brahmin,

original: mukhya prakāśe apy ahimastake vā yaḥ paśyate khañjanakaṃ sa dhanyaḥ//
analyzed: prakāśe api ahi mastake vā yaḥ paśyate khañjanakam sa dhanyaḥ
translated: in the light of the main star, or on a snake's head, he who sees a khamjana is blessed.

original: mātaṅgarājo matimāṃs triśaṅkuḥ provāca tattvaṃ kañjanaṃ ca śāstraṃ/
analyzed: matimān triśaṅkuḥ provāca tattvam kañjanam ca śāstram
translated: The wise king of the Matangas, Trisanku, spoke the truth about the khamjana bird and the scriptures.

original: snigdhe sarukṣe viṣame same ca ādeśa yad doṣaguṇair yathoktaiḥ/
analyzed: sa rukṣe viṣame same ca yat doṣa guṇaiḥ yathā uktaiḥ
translated: In the smooth, the rough, the uneven, and the even, the direction is indicated by the faults and qualities as stated.

original: tamādiśet tatra samīkṣya vidvān śubhaaśubhaṃ tatphalam ādiśec ca//
analyzed: tatra samīkṣya vidvān śubha aśubham tad phalam ādiśet ca
translated: The learned one, having examined it there, should indicate whether it is auspicious or inauspicious, and also indicate its result.

original: ayaṃ bhoḥ puṣkarasārin khañjarīṭakajñānaṃ nāmaadhyāyaḥ/
analyzed: bhoḥ puṣkarasārin khañjarīṭakajñānam nāma adhyāyaḥ
translated: This, O Pushkarasara, is the chapter named the Knowledge of the Khangarota.

original: atha khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin śivārutaṃ nāmaadhyāyaṃvyākhyāsyāmi/
analyzed: khalu bhoḥ puṣkarasārin śivārutam nāma adhyāyam vyākhyāsyāmi
translated: Now then, O Pushkarasara, I will explain the chapter named the Howling of Jackals.

original: tac chrūyatāṃ/
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: atha kiṃ/
analyzed: atha kim
translated: What is it, sir?

original: kathayatu bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ/🔽namaḥ sarveṣām āryāṇāṃ/
analyzed: kathayatu bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ  sarveṣām āryāṇām
translated: Let the Blessed One Trisanku speak.🔽Homage to all the noble ones.

original: namaḥ sarveṣāṃ satyavādināṃ/
analyzed: namaḥ sarveṣām satya vādinām
translated: Homage to all the truthful ones.

original: teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ tapasā vīryeṇa ca imaṃ śivārutaṃ nāmaadhyāyaṃ vyākhāmi/
analyzed: teṣām sarveṣām tapasā vīryeṇa ca imam śivārutam nāmaadhyāyam vyākhāmi
translated: By the austerity and heroism of all of them, I will explain this chapter named the Howling of Jackals.

original: ity āha bhagavāṃs triśaṅkuḥ/
analyzed: āha bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One Trisanku.

original: śāṇḍilyam idam abravīt/
analyzed: śāṇḍilyam idam abravīt
translated: He said this to Shandilya:

original: yādṛśaṃ ca yathā vāśet teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ vāśān śṛṇotha me/
analyzed: yādṛśam ca yathā vāśet teṣām sarveṣām vāśān śṛṇotha me
translated: Listen to the howls of all of them, of whatever kind and manner they howl.

original: pūrvasyāṃ diśi yadi vāśet śivā pūrvamukhaṃ sthitvā trīn vārān vāśed vṛddhiṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: pūrvasyām diśi yadi vā āśet śivā pūrva mukham sthitvā trīn vārān vā āśet vṛddhim nivedayati
translated: If it howls in the eastern direction, a jackal sitting facing east and howling three times indicates increase.

original: caturo vārān yadi vāśed atra maṅgalaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: caturaḥ vārān yadi vā āśet atra maṅgalam nivedayati
translated: If it howls four times, it indicates good fortune here.

original: pañca vārān vāśed varṣāṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: pañca vārān vā āśet varṣām nivedayati
translated: If it howls five times, it indicates rain.

original: ṣaḍvārān vāśet paracakrabhayaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: ṣaṣ vārān vā āśet para cakra bhayam nivedayati
translated: If it howls six times, it indicates the fear of a foreign invasion.

original: saptavārān vāśed bandhanaṃ
analyzed: sapta vārān vā āśet bandhanam
translated: One should howl seven times for bondage.

original: nivedayati/🔽aṣṭa vārān vāśet priyasamāgamaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: nivedayati  aṣṭa vārān vā āśet priya samāgamam nivedayati
translated: If it howls seven times, it announces a binding.🔽It announces a meeting with a loved one.

original: abhīkṣṇaṃ vāśet paracakrabhayaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: abhīkṣṇam vā āśet para cakra bhayam nivedayati
translated: If it howls frequently, it announces danger from an enemy army.

original: ity āha bhagavāṃs triśaṅkuḥ/
analyzed: iti āha bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ
translated: Thus spoke Lord Trisanku.

original: dakṣiṇāyāṃ dakṣiṇamukhaṃ sthitvā trivārān vāśed atṛ atṛ' kurute maraṇaṃ tatra nivedayati/
analyzed: dakṣiṇa mukham sthitvā tri vārān vāśet atṛ atṛ kurute maraṇam tatra nivedayati
translated: If it howls three times while standing facing south in the southern direction, it announces death there.

original: caturo vārān vāśati dakṣiṇamukhaṃ sthitvā dakṣiṇāyā eva diśāyāḥ priyasamāgamaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: caturaḥ vārān vāśati dakṣiṇa mukham sthitvā dakṣiṇāyāḥ eva diśāyāḥ priya samāgamam nivedayati
translated: If it howls four times while standing facing south, it announces a meeting with a loved one in the southern direction alone.

original: arthalābhaṃ ca nivedayati/
analyzed: artha lābham ca nivedayati
translated: It announces the gain of wealth.

original: pañcavārān vāśed arthaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: pañca vārān vā āśet artham nivedayati
translated: If it howls five times, it announces wealth.

original: ṣaḍvārān vāśet siddhiṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: ṣaṣ vārān vā āśet siddhim nivedayati
translated: If it howls six times, it announces success.

original: saptavārān vāśed vivādakalahaṃ nivedayati/🔽aṣṭavārān vāśed bhayaṃ
analyzed: sapta vārān vā āśet vivāda kalaham nivedayati  aṣṭa vārān vā āśet bhayam
translated: If it howls seven times, it announces a dispute and quarrel.

original: nivedayati/
analyzed: nivedayati
translated: If it howls eight times, it announces danger.

original: abhīkṣṇaṃ vāśed ākulaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: abhīkṣṇam vā āśet ākulam nivedayati
translated: It announces confusion if it howls frequently.

original: ety āha bhagavāṃs triśaṅkuḥ/
analyzed: eti āha bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ
translated: Thus spoke Lord Trisanku.

original: paścimāyāṃ paścimaabhimukhaṃ sthitvā śivā trivārān vāśati maraṇaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: paścima abhimukham sthitvā śivā tri vārān vāśati maraṇam nivedayati
translated: If it howls three times while standing facing west in the western direction, it announces death.

original: caturvārān vāśati bandhanaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: catur vārān vāśati bandhanam nivedayati
translated: If it howls four times, it announces a binding.

original: pañcavārān vāśati varṣaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: pañca vārān vāśati varṣam nivedayati
translated: If it howls five times, it announces rain.

original: ṣaḍvārān vāśati annapānaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: ṣaṣ vārān vāśati anna pānam nivedayati
translated: If it howls six times, it announces food and drink.

original: saptavārān vāśati maithunaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: sapta vārān vāśati maithunam nivedayati
translated: If it howls seven times, it announces sexual intercourse.

original: aṣṭavārān vāśati arthasiddhiṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: aṣṭa vārān vāśati artha siddhim nivedayati
translated: If it howls eight times, it announces the accomplishment of one's goals.

original: abhīkṣṇaṃ vāśati mahāmeghaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: abhīkṣṇam vāśati mahā megham nivedayati
translated: If it howls continuously, it announces a great storm.

original: ity āha bhagavāṃs triśaṅkuḥ/
analyzed: iti āha bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ
translated: Thus has said the Blessed One, Trisanku.

original: uttarasyāṃ diśi uttaraabhimukhaṃ sthitvā trivārān vāśati puruṣasya prasthitasya nirarthakaṃ gamanaṃ bhavati/
analyzed: diśi uttara abhimukham sthitvā tri vārān vāśati puruṣasya prasthitasya nirarthakam gamanam bhavati
translated: In the northern direction, standing facing north, if it howls three times, for a man who has set out, the journey will be fruitless.

original: caturvārān vāśati rājapratibhayaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: catur vārān vāśati rāja pratibhayam nivedayati
translated: If it howls four times, it announces danger from the king.

original: pañcavārān śāśati vivādaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: pañca vārān śāśati vivādam nivedayati
translated: If it howls five times, it announces a dispute.

original: ṣaḍvārān vāśati kuśalaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: ṣaṣ vārān vāśati kuśalam nivedayati
translated: If it howls six times, it announces good fortune.

original: saptavārān vāśati varṣāṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: sapta vārān vāśati varṣām nivedayati
translated: If it howls seven times, it announces rain.

original: aṣṭavārān vāśati rājakuladaṇḍaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: aṣṭa vārān vāśati rāja kula daṇḍam nivedayati
translated: If it howls eight times, it announces punishment from the royal family.

original: p /abhīkṣṇaṃ vāśati
analyzed: vāśati
translated: If it howls continuously,

original: yakṣarākṣasapiśācakumbhāṇḍabhayaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: yakṣa rākṣasa piśāca kumbhāṇḍa bhayam nivedayati
translated: it announces danger from yakshas, rakshasas, pishachas, and kumbhandas.

original: ity āha bhagavāṃs triśaṅkuḥ/
analyzed: iti āha bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ
translated: Thus has said the Blessed One, Trisanku.

original: diśi vidiśi caeva giriprāgbhāreṣu śikhareṣu nirdeśaṃ taṃ ca śṛṇotha me/
analyzed: vidiśi ca eva giri prāgbhāreṣu śikhareṣu nirdeśam tam ca me
translated: And in all directions, in the mountains, on the peaks, listen to that instruction from me.

original: amūṃ tuṣyet pipāsārtā vidyāsiddhyai tathāeva ca''/
analyzed: amūm tuṣyet pipāsā ārtā vidyā siddhyai tathā eva ca
translated: But if she is satisfied, thirsty, for the sake of attaining knowledge, and so on.

original: vidyālambhaṃ dhanalambhaṃ nirdiśec ca vicakṣaṇaḥ/
analyzed: dhana lambham nirdiśet ca vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The wise one should indicate the attainment of knowledge and the attainment of wealth.

original: tīrthaākāravṛkṣamūle vāśatī yadi dṛśyate//
analyzed: vāśatī yadi dṛśyate
translated: If she is seen crying at the foot of a tree shaped like a sacred place,

original: sarvatra siddhiṃ nirdiśet/
analyzed: siddhim nirdiśet
translated: she should indicate success everywhere.

original: na ca śṛgālabhaye śivā vā
analyzed: na ca śṛgāla bhaye śivā vā
translated: And one should not be afraid of jackals, nor should one be afraid of jackals.

original: me sameti apramattena smṛtimatā pūjayitavyā śivā nityaṃ/
analyzed: me sameti apramattena smṛtimatā pūjayitavyā śivā nityam
translated: One should always worship Shiva with mindfulness and memory.

original: gandhapuṣpaupahāreṇa śuśrūṣā kartavyā/
analyzed: gandha puṣpa opahāreṇa śuśrūṣā kartavyā
translated: Service should be done with the offering of incense and flowers.

original: evam arcāyamānā /
analyzed: evam arcāyamānā
translated: When worshipped in this way,

original: sarvasiddhiṃ nivedayiṣyati/
analyzed: sarva siddhim nivedayiṣyati
translated: she will indicate all accomplishments.

original: evaṃ sarve arthās tasya sidhyanti triśaṅkor vacanaṃ yathā'' /🔽krauṣṭriko yadi vāśati arthalambhaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: evam sarve arthāḥ tasya sidhyanti triśaṅkoḥ vacanam yathā  krauṣṭrikaḥ yadi vāśati artha lambham nivedayati
translated: In this way, all his goals are accomplished, just as in the words of Trishanku.🔽If a jackal howls, it indicates the gain of wealth.

original: adhomukho yadi vāśati nidhānaṃ tatra🔽nivedayati/🔽ūrdhvamukho yadi vāśati varṣāṃ tatra nivedayati/
analyzed: adhomukhaḥ yadi vāśati nidhānam tatra  nivedayati  ūrdhva mukhaḥ yadi vāśati varṣām tatra nivedayati
translated: If it howls with its face down, it indicates a treasure there.🔽If it howls with its face up, it indicates rain there.

original: dvipathe yadi vāśati pūrvamukhaṃ sthitvā arthalābhaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: dvipathe yadi vāśati pūrva mukham sthitvā artha lābham nivedayati
translated: If it howls at a crossroads, standing with its face east, it indicates the gain of wealth.

original: dakṣiṇaabhimukho yadi vāśati yathā priyasamāgamanaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: dakṣiṇa abhimukhaḥ yadi vāśati yathā priya samāgamanam nivedayati
translated: If it howls facing south, it announces the arrival of a beloved person.

original: dvipathe paścimaabhimukho yadi vāśati kalahaṃ vivādaṃ vigrahaṃ maraṇaṃ ca nivedayati/🔽kūpakaṇṭhake yadi vāśati arthaṃ tatra nivedayati/
analyzed: dvipathe paścima abhimukhaḥ yadi vāśati kalaham vivādam vigraham maraṇam ca nivedayati  kūpa kaṇṭhake yadi vāśati artham tatra nivedayati
translated: If it howls facing west at a crossroads, it announces quarrels, disputes, battles, and death.🔽If it howls at the edge of a well, it announces wealth there.

original: śādvale yadi vāśati arthasiddhiṃ🔽nivedayati/
analyzed: śādvale yadi vāśati artha siddhim  nivedayati
translated: If it howls in a grassy meadow, it announces the accomplishment of one's goals.

original: atimṛdukaṃ yadi vāśati vyādhikaṃ tatra nivedayati/
analyzed: ati mṛdukam yadi vāśati vyādhikam tatra nivedayati
translated: If it howls very softly, it announces sickness there.

original: gītahāreṇa yadi vāśati artham anarthaṃ ca nivedayati/
analyzed: gīta hāreṇa yadi vāśati artham anartham ca nivedayati
translated: If it howls with a melody, it announces both wealth and misfortune.

original: tribhir vārair arthaṃ caturbhir anarthaṃ pañcabhiḥ priyasamāgamaṃ ṣaḍbhir bhojanaṃ saptabhir bhayam aṣṭabhir vigrahaṃ vivādaṃ ca/
analyzed: tribhiḥ vāraiḥ artham caturbhiḥ anartham pañcabhiḥ priya samāgamam ṣaḍbhiḥ bhojanam saptabhiḥ bhayam aṣṭabhiḥ vigraham vivādam ca
translated: With three [howls], it announces wealth; with four, misfortune; with five, the arrival of a beloved person; with six, food; with seven, fear; with eight, battles and disputes.

original: ity āha bhagavāṃs trisaṅkuḥ/
analyzed: iti āha bhagavān trisaṅkuḥ
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One, Trisanku.

original: atha bhūyaḥ pravakṣyāmi anupūrvaṃ śṛṇotha me'' /
analyzed: bhūyas pravakṣyāmi anupūrvam me
translated: Now I shall speak further, listen to me in order.

original: nānāāhāre yadi vāśati mārge saṃsthitasyaapi sarvaṃ vakṣyāmi taṃ śṛṇotha me/
analyzed: nānā āhāre yadi vāśati mārge saṃsthitasya api sarvam vakṣyāmi tam śṛṇotha me
translated: If it howls with various sounds, while standing on the road, I shall tell all about it, listen to me.

original: saṃprasthitasya puruṣasya śivā vāśati vā yā pūrvamukhaṃ sthitvā kṣipragamanam arthasiddhiṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: saṃprasthitasya puruṣasya śivā vāśati vā yā pūrva mukham sthitvā kṣipra gamanam artha siddhim nivedayati
translated: If a jackal howls to the east of a man who has set out on a journey, it indicates a swift journey and success in his purpose.

original: atha dakṣiṇamukhaṃ vāśati yā arthasiddhiṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇa mukham vāśati yā artha siddhim nivedayati
translated: If it howls to the south, it indicates success in his purpose.

original: pañcān mukhaṃ vāśati bhayaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: pañcāt mukham vāśati bhayam nivedayati
translated: If it howls to the west, it indicates fear.

original: athauttaramukhaṃ
analyzed: atha auttaramukham
translated: If it howls to the north,

original: vāśati arthalābhaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: vāśati artha lābham nivedayati
translated: it indicates gain of wealth.

original: atha saṃprasthitasya vāśati yā purataḥ sthitvā upakleśaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: atha saṃprasthitasya vāśati yā puratas sthitvā upakleśam nivedayati
translated: If it howls in front of him who has set out on a journey, it indicates minor troubles.

original: atha dakṣiṇe vāśati yadi dakṣiṇamukhā eva diśaḥ p /
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇe vāśati yadi dakṣiṇa mukhāḥ eva diśaḥ
translated: If it howls to the south, if the directions are indeed to the south,

original: karmasiddhiṃ ca nivedayati/
analyzed: karma siddhim ca nivedayati
translated: it indicates success in his work.

original: paścimato yadi vāśati caurato ahitam asya duḥkhadaurmanasyaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: paścimatas yadi vāśati caurataḥ ahitam asya duḥkha daurmanasyam nivedayati
translated: If it howls to the west, it indicates danger from thieves and suffering and mental anguish for him.

original: atha mārge vrajato dakṣiṇato vāśati mahāvyādhim anarthaṃ caurā muṣanti tan nivedayati/ glānasya
analyzed: atha mārge vrajataḥ dakṣiṇatas vāśati mahā vyādhim anartham caurāḥ muṣanti tat nivedayati glānasya
translated: If it howls to the south while traveling on the road, it indicates a great illness, misfortune, and robbery by thieves. It indicates that.

original: yadi vāśati dakṣiṇamukhaṃ /
analyzed: yadi vāśati dakṣiṇa mukham
translated: If it howls to the south of one who is sick,

original: na sa cikitsituṃ śakyo mṛtyudūtena coditaḥ''/
analyzed: na sa cikitsitum śakyaḥ mṛtyu dūtena coditaḥ
translated: he cannot be cured, urged on by the messenger of death.

original: glānasya yadi vāśati uttaramukhaṃ sthitvā ārogyadhanalābhaṃ ca nivedayati/
analyzed: glānasya yadi vāśati uttara mukham sthitvā ārogya dhana lābham ca nivedayati
translated: If it howls to the north while standing, it announces recovery and gain of wealth.

original: atha mūrdhnā vāśati yā upakreśaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: atha mūrdhnā vāśati yā upakreśam nivedayati
translated: If it howls with its head, it announces a lawsuit.

original: atha paścimamukhaṃ sthitvā yā anyonyaṃ vyāharate yamaśāsanaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: atha paścima mukham sthitvā yā anyonyam vyāharate yama śāsanam nivedayati
translated: If it howls while standing to the west, it announces mutual conflict. It announces the punishment of Yama.

original: nānāāhāre yadi vāśati /
analyzed: na anā āhāre yadi vāśati
translated: If it howls at various foods,

original: yā saṃkṣobhaṃ nivedayati/
analyzed: yā saṃkṣobham nivedayati
translated: it announces a quarrel.

original: ity āha bhagavāṃs triśaṅkuḥ/
analyzed: iti āha bhagavān triśaṅkuḥ
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One, Trisanku.

original: śivā purataḥ puruṣasya mārgaprayātasya yadi vāśati /
analyzed: puratas puruṣasya mārga prayātasya yadi vāśati
translated: If a jackal howls in front of a man who has set out on a journey,

original: yā agrataḥ kṣemamārgaṃ vijñāpayati/
analyzed: yāḥ agratas kṣema mārgam vijñāpayati
translated: it announces a safe path ahead.

original: arthasiddhiṃ nivedayati/🔽mārgaṃ vrajato asya śivā vāmenaāgatya gacchate dakṣiṇamukhaṃ kṣemamārgaṃ vijānīyād arthasiddhiṃ ca nivedayati/
analyzed: artha siddhim nivedayati  mārgam vrajataḥ asya śivā vāmena āgatya gacchate dakṣiṇa mukham kṣema mārgam vijānīyāt artha siddhim ca nivedayati
translated: It announces the attainment of one's goal.🔽If a jackal comes from the left and goes to the right while he is traveling on the path, one should know it is a safe path and it announces the attainment of one's goal.

original: mārge vrajataḥ puruṣasya śivā vāmenaāgatya puratā vāśati yā tathā sabhayaṃ mārgaṃ vijñāpayati/
analyzed: mārge vrajataḥ puruṣasya śivā vāmena āgatya puratā vāśati yā tathā sa bhayam mārgam vijñāpayati
translated: If a jackal comes from the left and howls in front of a man who is traveling on the path, it announces such a dangerous path.

original: nivarteta vicakṣaṇaḥ/
analyzed: nivarteta vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The wise one should turn back.
